Reviews.Title: “Awesome views, but fell short with the reservation”
Reviews.Author: jdh7931
Reviews.Content: We traveled with a party of 8 to celebrate two couple's 50th Wedding Anniversaries. We booked our 2 bedroom condos in July of 2011. When we arrived at the awesome location, we were told that they had only one 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit that met our requirements. As a result our party of four gave the beautifully appointed 2 bedroom, 2 bath premier unit with king/queen beds to the couples that were celebrating their anniversaries. After quite a bit of unpleasant exchanges at the front desk, the remainder of us were put in two 1 bedroom units. The following day we met up with Jeremiah at the front desk who could not have been more accomodating. He offered us several options for getting the remaining couples into a 2 bedroom unit. We opted to wait two days to be placed in a 2 br premier unit and finish out the rest of our time together as planned. Now for the good part. Awesome views from the entire unit, The pool area and beach as well as the grounds were beautiful. Staff and housekeeping were awesome and friendly. We met a charming 88 year old resident named Peggy who took us to the Mahana Herb Garden to pick some fresh herbs. We were mesmerized by views from our lanais of the whales, turtles, dolphins and rainbows; and enjoyed the relaxing, quiet atmosphere of the Mahana. If it had not been for the aggravating situation with the reservation, I would definately return; but it seems there is no way to confirm, as we did by calling about a week prior to our visit, that the reservation was in place only to be told that there was no way to predict what units we would be placed in. However, I doubt there is a resort on Kaanapali that can compare to the stunning views from Mahana's 2 bedroom corner units.

Reviews.Title: “The view is to die for!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jturner48
Reviews.Content: It is all about the view at this beachside condo. We had stayed at the Hyatt and the Grand Wailea in previous years and decided to try something different this year. We were really happy that we did make the change. We stayed on the sixth floor overlooking the ocean with a 180 degree view of the ocean.. literally 50 yards from the water. The condo unit was well appointed and had been recently upgraded. We did have a couple of problems with the bathroom in that it had broken towel racks, non-dranining sink, etc. The maid service was good, but they forgot kitchen and bathroom towels twice. The view made up for these shortcomings though. Would definitely recommend to anyone who is looking for a place with an ocean view

Reviews.Title: “Mahana 307”
Reviews.Author: Puma P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana in March 2012 in condo 307. As soon as you walk in, if feels like home. Ok, not like our home but like the home we would want. Well appointed and beautiful. The first thing to catch your eye are the 3 large windows overlooking the ocean. Walking out to the lanai (patio), you notice the islands of Lana'i and Molokai. Scanning the ocean, you will most likely see whales if visiting Nov through April as we were. The living room had two very comfortable swivel chairs (good for watching the TV or the whales) and a nice couch. The TV was huge and has lots of available channels. There is the nice dining room table before you get to the wonderful, updated, fully stocked kitchen. The bedroom is spacious and the king sized bed was very comfortable. Beach towels, coolers and everything else you may want or need readily available. We typically cooked breakfast in the condo and ate it on the lanai. It was wonderful. Parking was easy although it was crowded, we always found a spot. We also went snorkeling several times, going about 200 yards up or down the beach to find a sandy spot to get into the water. There is a lot of coral around so you have to be careful but it was fun. There were surfers the last two days as the waves picked up to 2-3 feet. Still very easy snorkeling. Black Rock is about a 1 mile walk to the south. The locations is excellent with lots of activities to do nearby. Driving north 15 minutes gets you to other nice beaches. Continuing north gives you a winding road to get to the north shore areas and several nice geocaches. If you go south, about 10 minutes away is the tourist town of Lahaina. Make sure to find out where the free parking lot is in town. We used the free lot each day without any issues. Discounted activities such as submarine rides (nice and you can save money and buy tickets for $35 around town) and whale watching are available plus some nice places to eat. We liked the Cool Cat Cafe and the Lahaina Pizza Company. The Warren & Annabelle Magic show in Lahaina is very funny. We did just the show and not the dinner and show combo. We arrived at 8:30 p.m. and they put us in the lounge for an hour (gives them a chance to make more money on the drinks). When the show finally started, we had a great time although it didn't end until close to midnight. Dress warmly as the theater is very well air-conditioned (i.e. COLD). We also did the snorkel cruise to Molokini which was quite excellent. Driving to Iao valley (so-so, 1 hour) and to the Haleakala National Park (2 hours) took a bit of time but we enjoyed it. As the condo wasn't available for the entire length of our visit, we also stayed a few days in Kihei. That is an excellent way to visit that portion of the island without a lot of extra driving before heading up to north. Gas prices were about $1 more than the mainland.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, beautiful place - Bad front desk experience (Karen)”
Reviews.Author: A B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Mahana for the second year in a row. The hotel is expertly maintained. The room was perfect, beautifully decorated. The kitchen was amazing and the view is spectacular. The beaches are perfect! We visited in February and whales put on a show nearly all day long. We ate almost every dinner on the lanai. The BBQ's are cleaned daily and a great way to cook the local fish we picked up everyday. We also enjoyed meeting different guests while our dinners cooked. All in all it was a great place to stay. For the second year in a row we had to deal with Karen at the front desk. With no one else around I stood at the desk to ask a question. Karen was "busy" organizing papers. Moving things around on the desk and ignored me. She finally looked up and said. "What do you want", she was curt, rude and her attitude was maddening. After my experience I spoke to some other guests and owners, who informed me she has been at the Mahana for 30 years. She is always like that. ..... How she still has a job? How do the owners not call for her resignation? Is everyone afraid of her? She did not treat her co-workers with respect either. Please Karen - retire. It is time. Find that aloha spirit you so desperately need and use it somewhere else. I spent a lot of money to enjoy my Hawaiian vacation. I have a very hard time understanding how you have a job, given your obvious hate for everyone around you. Bottom line - The Mahana is hands down the best location in Kaanapali. Mahana management - Please get rid of Karen. I bet you will see in a overall attitude improvement of all the staff that she abuses once she leaves.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous location, wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HItesh_Bansal
Reviews.Content: This was one of our stops for our honeymoon and it was beautiful! We got a room on the ground floor which opened to a great beach! Service was great too. the room was fully equipped with a kitchenette, washer, dryer and all of it! Bathroom could have been bigger and better but waking up to a non crowded beach, ocean sounds and waves made up for it! Hotel staff was always courteous and efficient. All in all, great hotel and a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy hotel with lumpy bed”
Reviews.Author: DocRenee
Reviews.Content: Dumpy hotel with lumpy bed. No services and staff unhelpful. On a beautiful beach, but no beach chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view and great location”
Reviews.Author: Jikaal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were a little leery about booking a hotel based on internet reviews. It seemed this particular Condo has two types of units, one is managed by the owners, the other a professional management company. Based on reviews we read on line, we went with the professionally managed unit. We also requested a recently renovated unit, which included granite counter tops, newer appliances, and in general a renovated bathroom and common areas. We were not disappointed. We were in room 508, and it was fabulous. The view was incredible and we could watch whales play right outside our unit. We had maid service daily, and Susie did a great job. We also had coffee replaced daily. The unit had a washer and dryer which was great, we were able to bring less clothes, and therefore less luggage. The location is also wonderful with access to the boardwalk where we spent a couple of nights at Duke's, enjoying Happy Hour and good food. There was a grocery store nearby, however the Safeway in Lahaina had better prices. We were also able to make arrangements for activities through the Local Expedia Expert, Susan. She was available in our lobby daily and she arranged our trip to Hana, our sunset dinner cruise, and a show which included dinner at Ruth Chris. We had a great vacation, and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach as you can get”
Reviews.Author: Trader53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mahana Feb 12-28, 2012 and enjoyed it very much. Like everyone has mentioned you are very close to the beach and the views are amazing. We had stayed on the 10th floor and our unit had everything we could want. It was very modern and must have been recently remodelled with the granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, washer/dryer etc. The staff at the front desk was very courteous and helpful as was Susan at the conciege desk. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance if you want as there are none on the Mahana property. Dukes is about a 2 minute walk south, the Ka'anapali Shores (sister resort to the Mahana where you get a 10% discount) has a restaurant about a 5 minute walk to the north to name a couple. The Time Supermarket is about 3 blocks away (short walk) and has everything that you would expect from a large grocery store. Even a wide selection of beer, wine and hard liquor. Also things for quick meals like rotisserie chicken, sandwiches and salads which we enjoyed as it was just the 2 of us and we didn't want to do a lot of cooking. The Pizza Paradiso is in the adjoining strip mall which had great pizza, also Subway, Java Jazz (live entertainment) to name a few others. We went to the Old Lahaina Luau as well as a couple of tours. The sunset dinner cruise (2 hours) and the Molokini crater and Lanai snorkeling tour (7 hours) which were all excellent. The tours were through Pacific Whale foundation and I would highly recommend each one as well as the Luau. We drove around the island quite a bit and explored a lot of the beaches on the west side from Big Beach to Honolua Bay. We didn't drive the Road to Hana as over 600 curves and 50 narrow bridges in 50 miles and then turning around and doing it all again didn't seem like a great way to spend a day to us. A lot of people we talked to really enjoyed the Hana trip as well as the drive to the top of Haleakela to see the sunrise. I went snorkeling every day as there was lots to see right in front of the Mahana. We had walked along the beach to Black rock (where the Sheraton is) and beyond, nearly to Whaler's Village, a few times as the beach is perfect for walking. I saw at least 1 sea turtle 14 out of 16 days as well as numerous fish and rays. We even saw some sea turtles on our beach walk about 10 feet from shore as well as a few Hawaiian Monk seals that had come on shore to sleep. You can't really walk a long way north along the beach from the Mahana, maybe 10 minutes, as it gets too rocky. The walk to Black Rock from the Mahana must be close to a mile so a few times we just drove the car to Kahakili park which is about half way and went to the beach there. That was my favourite spot to snorkel and you didn't have to walk all the way. To get to Kahakili park from the main road you turn right on Kai Ala road which is the second set of traffic lights after you have left the Mahana and are travelling towards Lahaina on the highway. About a 5 minute drive and they have showers, washrooms, big parking lot and picnic areas as well. We drove into Lahaina quite a few times, about 4 miles south of the Mahana, and enjoyed it. Lots of shopping and restaurants on Front street. A fun and safe place. Parking can he hard to get sometimes but there is a large free parking lot at the far south end of Front Street near the school. Overall we really enjoyed Maui and staying at the Mahana was definitely the right choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Beachfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelover64
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed staying in this fully equipped beach front hotel. We stayed in many beach front hotels before but never felt so close to the water. The view was magnificent and it was so convenient to access to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Property”
Reviews.Author: The_Walrus2
Reviews.Content: We were here for 10 days in early February. All units face the ocean. Pleasantly surprised by an upgrade to a deluxe two bedroom suite which was spectacular. It was nice to know that you were coming home to a comfortable place after long days of sightseeing. One problem though is that Aston does not have control over all the units in the complex. Many are owner managed so there is a lack of consistency in enforcing some of the policies such as it being non-smoking. Someone in a unit adjacent to us was smoking cigars every evening on their lanai. The smoke invariably wafted onto our lanai and was sucked by our air-conditioning into our living room and bedroom. Not very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views ideal for watching the whales .”
Reviews.Author: loftladderman
Reviews.Content: Wonderful apartment on the 12th floor,well fitted out with everything you need.Fantastic ocean view rooms on the beach. Housekeeping could have been better,only did the very basics everyday like empty the bins and replace washing powder and towels.No cleaning done. We had to vacate the apartment one night at 1.30 am in our block as the alarms went off ,there was no member of staff to be seen and people just gathered in the car park wondering what was happening ,just as well it was a false alarm. Check out was a nightmare ,we had been charged an extra night then for some unknown reason our deposit did'nt get taken off ,the lad on the front desk was not very helpful .This incident has put us off returning a shame really as we enjoyed our stay with the fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay, amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: JMBJDC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first two weeks of Feb 2012 at the Mahana and it is a wonderful place to stay. This was our first trip to Maui and the staying at the Mahana made the trip very special. We stayed in a premium 1 bedroom unit on the 9th floor and the views were simply spectacular. Feburary is prime humpback whale season, and it is not a question of if you will see humpacks from your unit, its how many will you see in an hour. Sometimes we would be watching a half dozen whales in every direction. The building sits so close to the water, perhaps 25 yards, and unlike more modern buildings every unit has a front row seat with the same view. Its only a question of what floor you will see the whale show from at this time of year. The condo we stayed in, unit 914, was very comfortable, with a good bed, tastefully furnished and the kitchen was well stocked and had good appliances. Resturants are very expensive in Maui, so it was great to have a kitchen where we could eat in, and there is no resturant on Maui with that view. This place is also so private, very unusual for a beach resort area. We booked through Aston, so we had daily maid service. The staff is very helpful and kind. Thanks to all of them for being so nice. They offer a one hour presentation in the morning for your first day giving you an overview of the island, and things to see and do, since we had never been to Maui before it was very helpful. There is a grocery store near the driveway entrance to the building, but better yet, about two blocks down the road is a place called the Fish Market. It is primarily a fresh fish store, but also has carry out items as well. Their fish was the best. They claim the fish is caught either the night before or that morning, and the fish is so fresh that it is very hard being back in Mich and contending with what they claim is fresh fish here. The also have seafood gumbo and chowder that are outstanding. We went on line and found a Mama's Fish House reciepe for the mahi mahi- my my was it good! There is a reef directly in front of the Mahana so there is no swiming directly in front. However, there is swimming and snorkeling right off the ends of the building. With a reef right in front, we saw giant sea turtles when we looked down from our balcony! Also because there isn't any beach activity right in front the units are very quiet during the day. The pool and hot tub area is very nice, and it looks like its been updated, but it is a smaller pool, by today's standards, probably 1970s 1980s vintage. The Mahana also has gate access to the Kannapali boardwalk. Be sure to get the code from the front desk. You can walk all the way to the Hyatt on far end of the Whalers Village area on the boardwalk. We heard its about 4.5 miles from end to end. Its a great way to see the area, and lots of resturants and shops along the way if your interested. We did all the first time on Maui must do's, the road to Hana, ate at Mama's Fish House, saw the crater, drove around most of the island seeing the beaches. The road to Hana is a must do, as is Mama's, but bring lots of money for Mama's. The driving on the road to Hana was not as bad as they say, but its about a 10 hour trip round trip with very few stops. On our next trip we will stay in Hana for a night or two. We went back a second time to see the Gardens on the Road to Hana and to eat a Mama's. The Gardens are wonderful, lunch at Mama's was to die for, and well worth a seperate trip. My husband and I agree the crater was our least favorite. Very cold even mid day on a sunny day and very windy. The best were the boat trips for sunset, whale watching, eating, and snorkeling or any combination thereof. We highly recommend the Alli Nui and the Hula Girl for all of the boat trips, both are pricey but well worth it. I have never snorkled before and I am not much of a swimmer, and the folks from Alli Nui, got me in the water and snorkeling like a pro. And I am 58. What fun. I would recommend getting a premium room and request a higher floor and try to go in Feb or March as those are prime months for the humpbacks. Thanks to the folks at the Mahana, for such a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best view!”
Reviews.Author: jmarie1022
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a portion of my honeymoon. As many have mentioned, the view is outstanding - full ocean front. This is the major selling point for the property. The sound of the ocean was so relaxing and I enjoyed morning tea (and evening wine) on the balcony every day. The condo itself was very comfortable. If you like the idea of a more low-key vacation, this is a great spot. You're not going to get all of the amenities of a resort i.e. room service, restaurant on site, etc, but the condo was cleaned daily and additional soap, laundry detergent, towels etc were readily available. There's a shopping center right across the street that has a supermarket as well as a few restaurants, nail salon and shops. We didn't do any cooking but it was very convenient to stop at the store for snacks and drinks, and it was nice to pick up lunch and eat it back at the condo rather than dining out every single meal. The pool was nice - not too crowded - but the way the building is set up means that for a good portion of the day, the pool area is in the building's shadow. Directly outside the hotel is a coral reef, so if you want to swim you need to walk down one building in either direction - not exactly a hardship. The concierge (Lynn from Expedia) was extremely helpful in booking our dinner reservations and excursions. It was a little bit of a drive to get into downtown Lahaina - we drove there a few nights and took a taxi a few times as well. Also took advantage of Duke's restaurant/bar in the resort next door - very convenient when we didn't feel like getting in the car. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “View and privacy is great”
Reviews.Author: Eustatia
Reviews.Content: You have a great privacy in your room even when you're on your balcony. You can be naked and none can see you. Only ocasional coast guard helicopeter flies by, pretty cool sight...for me that is. You are right on the water, hearing the waves breaking on shore and palms in front of your room making its soothing sound. Very convenient to the grocery store, it is a walking distance so you can cook your meals in your unit. Nice walk along the beach and nice swimming areas (not right in front of the hotel - too rocky). Whenever I stay there (5-6 times) I never hear or see anybody, makes me feel like I am all alone (which is a good thing).

Reviews.Title: “smart condo, good position”
Reviews.Author: MushroomTraveller
Reviews.Content: Very smart well appointed 1 bed condo all the normal equipment, separate kitchen and inc washer/drier. Ours was on floor 11 (out of 12) so great view over the ocean for miles... Spotted whales and a turtle from the lani. BBQâ€™s on the ground floor were gleaming always looked they had just been installed! The condo building is an unattractive concrete block, but hey youâ€™re on the inside so whatâ€™s it matter! The big advantage with this block is that it is square on to the ocean, not built at an angle as most of them seem to be in this area, so you are looking straight out to sea - views and sunsets are great. On the beach you have to walk 100 yards or so left or right to reach a swimming spot (left is better) as there are rocks directly outside the resort. Thereâ€™s also a reasonably sized pool but so close to the sea we never used it. Nearest supermarket is Times just across the road â€“ you can walk but the road is busy. Great restaurant next door Dukes â€“ busy (reserve a table for the same evening it saves the waiting) and a little expensive but mostly worth it. Some tables outside otherwise undercover â€“ if when you book you ask for a table outside or on the edge of the covered area (quieter) the staff do try to get you one there. Like: smart condo, views, Dukes. Dislike: sea rocks, ugly block.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Masterpiece”
Reviews.Author: Sunndogg
Reviews.Content: We spent January 22-February 1 at the Mahana and found it to be a perfect spot for our vacation. The location is absolutely perfect and the lanai and full length windows in the living room afforded outsanding views of the ocean, the neighboring islands of Molokai and Lanai and the scores of whales which were present day in and day out. Our unit was updated and well appointed with everything we could have wanted. The daily maid service was thorough and replenished our coffee, laundry soap and dishwashing detergent. We purchased groceries and ate many meals on the lanai. I enjoyed the use of the grills and was always pleased with how clean they were. I could learn a thing or two from the gentleman who cleans them each and every morning. We really enjoyed the access to the beach walk and each morning walked down to Whaler's Village and back. We had breakfast at the Castaway Cafe and Duke's (dinner there as well) when we wanted to eat out, but not jump into the car. We enjoyed our snorkeling trip to Lanai on Trilogy and our show at Warren and Annabell's, as well as a drive to the top of Haleakala. With Lahina only 15 minutes away, we made several stops for shopping, food/drinks and just hanging out (stay away from Cruise Ship days (Wed. Thurs) unless you enjoy the additional 3000+ people. We took advantage of the pool, spa, and lounge chairs and never wanted for anything. We will absolutely come back the next time we visit Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Our Long-Standing Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Oaks62
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Mahana eight times since 1995. We went for our 30th anniversary this year, as we did for our 25th. We keep going back because, obviously, we love it. What's great about it? Start with the obvious - the location and view. You could stand or sit all day transfixed by the beautiful Hawaiian water, the people walking by below, the whales breaching within easy binocular range (and sometimes in naked-eye range), the islands of Lanai and Molokai flanking the channel, the nighttime moon on the water...you get the picture. The only "downside" â€“ depending on your viewpoint â€“ is that it's not a full-service resort. It's a very nice, quiet, well-maintained 1975 condo tower in a world-class location, with every room oceanfront and good management (including daily maid service), but if you want drinks brought to you on the beach, luaus, on-premises dining, bands playing and other full-service amenities, you'd have to look elsewhere. I like the easy-going atmosphere here. There's a small coffee-and-snacks counter on the first floor and many good options for take-out food nearby, including the Honokowai Okazuya and the Ono Kau Kau Chinese and Mixed Plate, both on the Lower Honoapi'ilani Highway. For dine-in, there's a Duke's at the new resort next door. There's a good breakfast place called Java Jazz across the highway and, of course, your condo will have its own kitchen. We have always reserved through Royal Hawaii, the agency at www.themahana.com. I've looked at other options but have found Royal Hawaii has better rates than Aston's website and pretty close to VRBO's, especially when you figure in Aston's daily maid service, no cleaning fee, etc. And Royal Hawaii's cancellation policy is very forgiving by Hawaii standards: a $100 nonrefundable deposit is all that's at risk as long as you cancel more than four days ahead. VRBO, of course, does let you know exactly which unit you will have, while with Royal Hawaii/Aston you're playing the availability lottery. I always request a high floor (8 or above), and I usually get one, but not this time. The one we had, though, #417, was beautiful and I have absolutely zero complaints about it. The Royal Hawaii website can seem a bit confusing at first, but I've come to like all the different options they offer, especially if you book well in advance. I was able to grab a rate of $268 for our 1BR 1BA unit, after factoring in a 5th-night-free promo on our 5-night stay. After taxes and a $10 daily amenity fee (an annoying recent addition by Aston), the cost came to about $313 a night - not cheap, but not bad for this location and quality in high season. (The rates go down in spring and fall.) So I definitely recommend the Mahana - one of our favorite places anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Condo! Beautiful Beach!!”
Reviews.Author: Mahalo-MO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for 8 days in Jan. 2012. We stayed on the 10th floor in an ocean front studio. Our room was clean and we had a regular bed, I understand some of the studio rooms only have a Murphy bed. The view was absolutely fantastic. We saw lots of whales from our lani. The floor to ceiling glass is wonderful. The room had everything you need: washer/dryer, stove, microwave, dishes, coffee pot, toaster, TV, VCR, books, stereo, plenty of closet and drawer space. Everyone on staff is extremely helpful. Susan Ramos the concierge is very knowledgeable about Maui. The front desk staff is pleasant. There isn't a restaurant on site, but they do have a snack bar operated by Justin (who was very nice) which is open from 7 to 5. You can get a few breakfast items, hamburger, hotdogs or sandwiches and snack items. The Dukes restaurant next door was excellent, but expensive. Parking was ample and we had maid service daily. The little strip mall across the street with the Times grocery store was very convenient. There is a couple of restaurants and a Subway there. The beach is beautiful and you can walk a long way on it. There is also a beach walk that takes you around through the many condos along Kaanapali Beach and will take you close to the beach area periodically along the way. The sunsets were fabulous. What impressed us was how quiet it was there. You didn't hear hardly any noise from any of the other rooms. Our room was away from the construction, so when you schedule you might see if you can stay away from the construction side. Our stay was excellent and we would stay at the Mahana again when go back.

Reviews.Title: “JAN 2012 STAY AT MAHANA”
Reviews.Author: JSECanada
Reviews.Content: This condo bldg is directly on ocean edge....Million dollar view with floor to ceiling windows (all ocean front units) Construction going on next door(should be told in advance or discount in lieu) Ask if unit has been updated!! Only complaint...wish room # was assigned before arrival...We unfortunately had to move shortly after arriving....It was more updated but they wanted us to move again near end of vacation due to misunderstanding on check-in... Found condo pricey especially since lack of services ie no bell hops...Had to carry own luggage & groceries...Arrived at 10pm after very long flight...took too long to get checked-in It pays to rent car to see island sites...took excursions with Pacifice Whale Foundation (animal and environmentally friendly) Best ever crew...Met some wonderful people on excursions...Big Hi to Dennis & Diane from Minnisota...

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Front Whale Watching”
Reviews.Author: Jim K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 days and we throughly enjoyed ourselves. The staff here were very friendly and helpful when needed. We rented a deluxe studio and our room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. Having a washer and dryer in the room made it even more convenient. The grounds and facilities were well maintained and inviting. We really enjoyed sitting out on the balcany and watching the Humpback whales. We've all ready recommended staying here to our son.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel/Condo! 180 degrees of ocean front beauty!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaGuest808
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for a weekend and we absolutely loved it! We were originally booked into a studio but were upgraded to a gorgeous 1-bedroom suite. We gasped the moment we walked into our room as we noticed the most amazing ocean view we have ever seen from a hotel room. The ocean was literally 25 feet away from the hotel! Incredible! Surprised the hotel hasn't fallen into the ocean yet! *knock on wood*. The only issues I had was that our phone and A/C wasn't working properly. The hotel itself is also lacking in toiletries... We needed to drive out to a store to purchase a toothbrush which was a bit inconvenient. The pool at the property is quite large but we didn't use it because the ocean was right there! There are grills available for you to cook your own food as well! TIPS: Remember to pack all essential toiletries and purchase some groceries before you check into hotel. Due to limited space the hotel does not store luggage upon early arrival; check in time is at 3pm. No valet or bell services but parking lot is right in front of hotel so nothing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: drofproduct
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean front studio on the 10th floor that was clean, and well maintained. You can not get a better view or better location. Lying in bed we can see the Humpback whales breaching and the sea turtles feeding on the coral reef right outside our Lanai. The sunsets were fantastic. The staff is so friendly and accommodating, especially Susan at the activities desk. This was a dream vacation and I would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Maloneys10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for 2 weeks in Jan 2012 and here are highlights of what we liked: -clean rooms (and a nice room with full kitchen) -beautiful groomed shrubs, flowers, lawn etc. -helpful staff -amazing views from each unit -saw lots of whales breaching from our balcony -fun 'land' curling on ocean front -tennis courts in good shape and rackets/balls/court time are provided for free -situated on nicest beach in Maui and close to all great snorkelling beaches in Kaanapali -beach sand out front is the softest you could imagine -each unit had a DVD player (in Sony playstation) -free movies with a huge selection including new DVDs -expedia tour expert on site -poolside snack bar with reasonable prices -beach towels provided -free event tickets for the Kapalua PGA given to us at check in Here is what I did not like: -charges $0.75 per phone call from the land line -beach immediately out front had lots of coral and were not great snorkel/swim beaches (don't go out without rash gaurd and aqua socks/booties). Within a couple hundred metres on euther side of the property, the swimming was good. -no recycling on site for paper products (not that I could see) -pullout couch was great for kids but was not great for adults - (in the Mahana's defense, I did not complain or request a new mattress or cover etc). The positive far outweigh the negative at the Mahana. We stayed twice at the Maui Kai next door and the Mahana is slightly more expensive than the Maui Kai and it was worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: mgsinger
Reviews.Content: We spent the first week of January in room 404. This is a terrific condo. Beautifully decorated and maintained. A full picture window of the ocean with views from Lanai to Molokai. The first thing every morning I would open the curtains for the view and open the door to the balcony to hear the ocean. A great room for watching the surfers and the people walking the beach and for whale watching. You can walk to Duke's Restaurant for sunset dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay, especially for families!”
Reviews.Author: aussieallisons6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mahana for five days with family of six in a two bedroom apartment with fully equipped kitchen. Had a great time, handy location, supermarket across the street means you don't have to eat out all the time which is great with a large family. Saw turtles and whales from our balcony. Great pool, spa, staff, everything. Would definitely stay again. Close to heaps of activities - we went biking down the volcano, snorkeling at Molokini, sunset dinner cruise, hired paddle boards and went shopping in Lahaina in our five days. PS also has washing machine and dryer which is also great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Dream”
Reviews.Author: Joanne069
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Aston Mahana over Christmas break 2011 with my family. We stayed in Room #419 and the accomodations were wonderful. The kitchen had upgraded appliances and countertops. The furnishings were clean and comfortable. The room level was perfect for my family. I was able to keep a watchful eye on my two teenage boys, as they snorkeled in front of the complex. We could also see the whales and sea turtles from our lanai. The views from inside the condo was just as impressive, since each unit have floor to ceiling windows. The pool was small, but never crowded. Susan at the Expedia desk was very helpful booking our zipline and sail/snorkel excursions. The grocery store was very close by, and the pizza place across the street was a nice plus with good food. I paid the extra fee to have coffee, a daily paper, dvd's for my boys, use of the room safe, laundry soap, etc. I thought it wasn't an outragous fee for these services. The parking was free and ample. There was only one day where I believe the maid might have forgotten about us, however, I called the front desk and they sent someone right away to change out the towels, and throw away our trash. If you are looking for a five star property with bell-hops, down comfortors, and mints on your pillows....this is not the place. If you like to watch ample amount of tourist surfing, sun bathing, and playing in the water...this is not the place. However, if you are on vacation to enjoy the views and sound of the ocean- while feeling comfortable in your surroundings.....the Mahana is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “It was a beautiful condo with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Bobbydogg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days at the end of December . There was a short delay checking into our room, but after that everything went just great. The rooms are great with an excellent view, nice pool and spa and the beach was perfect. The concierge was a tremendous help also.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Matt S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Mahana. We had a beautiful view from the 11th floor and saw a pair of seat turtles in the water from our balcony each morning. The room was clean, had a full kitchen and washer and dryer, as well as many other helpful amenities. The front desk staff was very friendly as well. Unfortunately, I can't say the bed was the most comfortable we have ever come across - they gave us a murphy bed even though we told them it was our honeymoon and would prefer a normal bed. If you are looking for a nice pool, the one here is pretty small, but the huge one at the hotel next door is easy enough to sneak in to. The grocery store across the street was a huge plus as well - a great place to stock up on cereal for morning breakfasts on the balcony or sunset beers. We would highly recommend staying here though you will need to rent a car if you plan on seeing the rest of the island as there isn't much within walking distance. The beach the hotel is on is not the most swimmer friendly as it is extremely rocky - so you will either need water shoes or a car to go elsewhere. Bottom line: great value, very nice and well-kept rooms, friendly staff, beautiful view from the balcony and we highly recommend. Just make sure to rent a car or you will get bored pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, unbeatable views, clean, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Primespinister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for 8 days for our honeymoon around new years 2012. The Mahana is a condominium property that owners rent out through Aston, the building management company. The Aston staff was all very helpful and friendly. In most ways, this condo is exactly like a resort hotel. The maid service was excellent, rooms were very clean, coffee was replaced, bath products were replaced, laundry and dish soap was provided. Our maid even ran the dishwasher for us when it was full one day. The maid would also phone us in the afternoons just to make sure that we didn't need anything else for our room. I've never seen that at a hotel before. The location of the Mahana is right in the heart of North Ka'anapali beach. The beach right in front of the building is great, but shaded by the building. There is also a coral reef there, so there is no swimming immediately in front of the building, but 100 yards in either direction leads to swimming areas. Lots of people snorkel and surf out in front of the buildings though. We could see sea turtles and fish from out balcony every day. I'm sure it's great if you like snorkeling. On your first morning at the Mahana, Susan (who works for Expedia) provides an information session/sales pitch for different excursions that you can sign up for during the week. Many of them are expensive, and her recommendations are not always consistent with those on Tripadvisor, so perhaps you can decide who you trust more. We didn't sign up for any of her excursions because we had already booked the Trilogy boat cruise to Lana'i and the Old Lahaina Luau. Both were great excursions. We also had a rental car, so we drove the road to Hana and the Haleakala crater ourselves (both highly recommended, but on separate days. The road to Hana takes about 10 hours round trip if you stop at several spots along the way). The Mahana has a nice pool and hot tub, dvd rentals, and towel service (included in your $10 per day resort fee). The $10 per day fee is annoying, but most resorts are charging it now. It's just a bit deceiving that it's not included in the initial price, so it makes you think that you're getting a better deal on your trip than you actually are. Rooms are clean, and updated. Ours had granite counter tops, an over the range microwave, dishwasher, stove, fridge, washer and dryer, coffee maker, toaster, and all of the cutlery and dishes that you would need (even champagne flutes!) The balcony (called a lanai in Hawaii) have spectacular views, and a nice table and chairs to sit at. We had breakfast outside every day. You can see the islands of Lana'i and Moloka'i from the balcony. The beach was long and great for walking on. We walked down to Black Rock (a volcanic rock that sticks out into the water and cuts Ka'anapali beach into the main and North beaches) several times. This takes about 30 minutes each way. We also walked beyond this along the boardwalk to Whalers village outdoor shopping mall. It's got some nice stores, and some high end shops. Also some restaurants. The walk from the Mahana to Whalers village is about 45 minutes each way. There is also a bus that picks you up at the roundabout in front of the pink hotel next door. It's $1 for a trip to Whalers Village, then another $1 to continue on to Lahaina. We spent several days wandering around in Lahaina. It's a great little town with tons of shopping and great restaurants. Far and away, our preferred restaurant was right next door at Duke's Beach House (at the Honua Kai resort). It's right on the beach, mostly outdoor dining lit by torches, with amazing sunset views, and excellent food. They have happy hour from 3-5 too, so drinks are a little cheaper then. They also have a taster menu served between 4:45 and 5:45 every day. It was $25 and included 3 courses. We really enjoyed this meal. Overall, we had an excellent time at the Mahana. We didn't spent a whole lot of our vacation at the resort, but it served its purpose and we were very happy with everything about it. It's also generally much cheaper than nearby places such as the Honua Kai or the Sheraton. Those places have nicer pools, maybe a few more amenities, and a larger property, but I don't think they're much fancier. Save your money and go for a swim in the Honua Kai pool if you really want. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the views”
Reviews.Author: sunny626
Reviews.Content: We rented a unit through a owner on VRBO on the 11th floor. We stayed for our honeymoon in June 2008. The receptionist was friendly. The room was big and comfortable. There were some minor issues such as dead bugs in the room and missing curtains but othere than that, the unit fitted out needs very well. Also, once we told the owner about this, they apologized and stated that they hadn't been there a while and were going there to check the unit out. There was a small kitchen and washer and dryer that we used fairly often on our stay. All of the units in the hotel faced the waters and the views from our lanai were amazing. There was a pool and hot tub that my husband used. It was the off-season so there wasn't too many people around and it was very quiet on our floor. I think we only saw one other couple get off on the same floor we did one day that we were there. There had been construction going on at the time but we weren't bothered by the noise at all. It was a nice hotel and we had a wonderful vacation. We're looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: angepange5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2011 in a premium studio suite on the 8th floor. Requested a high floor in advance after reading tripadvisor reviews, was a bit nervous about what we would get beforehand, but overall was pleased with the room - amazing view. We were thinking about whether or not we should pay extra for the premium suite before the trip, but decided not to and ended up getting one, which was nice :) My only complaint about the room - the bed wasn't that comfortable. The mattress was quite...soft - e.g. If I sat at one end of the bed, it would sink/slant towards the ground, and I'm about 120lb. It seemed to us that the daytime hotel receptionist could have used some help, things ran very slow when she was there. The evening receptionist (Garrett) was great - friendly, easygoing and very helpful. The hotel concierge (Susan) was also great - very cheerful and helpful with planning activities. She gives a talk the morning after you check in with complimentary continental breakfast. Amenities were decent, there is free parking and an outdoor tennis court. In room kitchenette and washer/dryer. Location is good, the hotel is walking distance to a supermarket, farmers market and some local restaurants. Our experience would have been improved with 1) More comfortable bed 2) More efficient hotel check-in 3) Improved house-keeping - I agree with other comments about not replacing the bath products, etc. They did come everyday though. Overall, we had a nice vacation and stay at the Aston Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “My future home for Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Keizan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mahana in early December (7 Dec - 10 Dec) and wish I could have stayed longer. I stayed in a studio suite (802) and was thoroughly impressed with the view. All rooms at this property are FULL ocean view. The balcony was a good size and had a table with chairs to enjoy the breeze and relaxing sounds of the ocean. It was even equipped with a screen door, so that you may enjoy the breeze inside the suite and not worry about little visitors (birds) getting in - not that there was a problem with them. The front desk staff was pleasant and accommodating and housekeeping was very effiicient. I attended the morning meeting with the Expedia Local Expert and upon my return to the room, I was surprised to see quickly it was tidied up. Unfortunately, they do not have a bell staff or storage room to hold bags - so if you have a red eye flight home, you might want to see if you can keep the room at a day use rate. The property is located a short walk from a bus stop, so shopping is accessible, but be advised - the bus does not run after 8pm. There is even a grocery store a short walk from the property so that you may cook in your room if you chose to. You might want a car if you plan to go to a luau or an evening cruise. The only issues I had with the property were minor - construction going on (removal of planters from front of building), internet issues (good thing I had Clear Wireless with a great signal), and the aforementioned lack of storage to hold baggage. When I next visit Maui, I will definitely stay at the Mahana again - no doubts about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay - Not great!”
Reviews.Author: hatsbykay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana 7 nights (12/17 - 12/24) and enjoyed it very much. However the house keeping could have been better. They were to provide coffee, filters and bath products during the entire stay. The last 3 days there was no coffee, filters, bath products and they did not even make the bed. I did complain to the desk staff who seemed indifferent to the complaint. However, the above items did eventually show up. When checking out, the desk person was pleasant but did not ask if we enjoyed our stay and if everything was ok. Perhaps they knew that all was not well. We had a premium studio and it was very nice. We even saw whales and sea turtles from the Lani. There is no restaurant on the premises but many places to eat just a very short distance away. We would go back for the views.

Reviews.Title: “Trust trip advisor!”
Reviews.Author: jimbomania
Reviews.Content: Every room has an ocean view these are condo type living and I felt like upper class staying here. Great waking up hearing thee oceans crash. We got free upgrade our r, had jacuzzi on

Reviews.Title: “The full ocean view can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: sjw125
Reviews.Content: Most hotels on the ocean are built in a V-shape, so that every room has a partial ocean view and they can cram the maximum number of rooms on their limited oceanfront footage. The Aston Mahana is built square to the ocean. Every room has a full-on ocean front location. You could toss a rock from your lanai into the ocean. This has other benefits as well. There is no early-morning rush to reserve one of the too few pool chairs. This last two weeks, there was never a day when all the chairs were taken. This is not like a hotel. There is no restaurant on the property, just a small snack stand. Maid service is limited. Still, we love it. It never feels crowded. It's solidly built. You never hear the people above you or next to you, except for the occasional shout of "Whales!" from someone on their lanai. We think it's perfect for couples or a family with older kids. It doesn't have the huge pool for the little kids that other regular hotels in the price range have.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: wats_up
Reviews.Content: We were in studio room 1002 for 10 days, Dec. 6-16 and absolutely loved our room and the Mahana. The room was clean and very tastefully decorated and had everything we could possibly need. Having a dishwasher and washer/dryer was a big plus. We enjoyed our morning coffee on the lanai each morning and also watched almost every sunset from the same spot. Some afternoons were spent watching the turtles float by, the spinner dolphins playing, and the whales surfacing and spouting right in front of the hotel. On the 10th floor and with the hotel only a few feet from the ocean, we had the most incredible view of nature at its best. As for the hotel, the staff were helpful and courteous and addressed any concerns immediately. We loved being able to BBQ steaks and ribs occasionally on the poolside grills, select DVD's (free) to watch for an early night in, get a quick coffee at the little lobby shop on our way out for the day, and enjoy the paper left at our front door very early each morning. There was always plenty of parking, never had to wait for the elevator, the pool area and hot tub were clean and never crowded. Bottom line is - we loved this place. As soon as you see the view from your lanai (and EVERYONE has one), you will think you died and went to heaven. We will be going back and will ask to stay in that same room. It was perfect for our needs and made for a perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: garyr59
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio for Dec 9 - 17. We left after 3 days for a better propery. At check in, the front desk clerk, kept reminding us that the real staff were having their Xmas party and that she was from another property. Everything she did looked like it was done with so much effort. The room they gave us was filthy. Fingerprint and handprints all over the patio door. What appeared to be food splatter on the door. The patio was dirty. There was a stain of some kind on the bed sheet. The room smelled musty. Furniture dated and worn. We went back down to request a room change. Again the attitude from the clerk. After the "oh you are so much bother" looks and immense effort by the less then professional clerk, we were assigned another studio. At least this one was clean. Bed was not comfortable, needs to be replaced. The only good thing I can say is the property is right on the beach. However the pool and hot tub (8 - 10 person) are dinky. After our important introductory experience with front desk and the room, we wanted to leave asap

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location but ask some questions in advance”
Reviews.Author: Bearwife
Reviews.Content: Booked here for 6 days as a big present for my spouse. It is hard to beat the incredible ocean front view, gorgeous local landscaping, and easy access to snorkeling and swimming parts of the spectacular beach. There are charming touches including the very nice coffee and sandwich stand near the hot tub/ pool entrance, the comfortable lawn chairs lined up facing the beach under the trees, and the unlimited DVD rental machine near the lobby. Our unit was also very comfortable, clean, and fully equipped. But -- though this reservation was made months in advance, we were initially assigned to a floor so low any passerby could look in on us, and highest available unit was still quite low. If you book well in advance, make sure to get a HIGH room reservation to really get the benefit of the view. My second ding is that there was loud messy construction all week long when we were there, though thankfully not on the weekend, and there was NO advance notice about that, even at checkin. Ask about that, too, when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Essence of Maui”
Reviews.Author: LJOHN01
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Aston Mahana. We got upgraded to a one bedroom fully updated suite w granie countertops and clean appliances. The room really was pleasant and welcoming but the star of the place is def the view. It felt as though you were standing on top of the ocean, it was breathtakin and def the highlight of every morning to wake up to blue waves nd fall asleep every night to the crashing waves. The room also came with a washer and dryer that def helped us out. Garret, was th most helpful and pleasant employee and really helped us map out our days. The hot tub was small but pleasant however the pool was okay. There are bbq grills there if you want to grill by the sunset. The beach, pool and spa were fabulous places to watch the sunset. The mahana was centrally located, we spent nights in lahaina which was a 10 min easy drive and also drove out to hana so would def recommend it. We stayed at the marriot in kauai after but still have fond memories of the aston as it was more personable and charming.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Hawaii and Awesome Place to Stay at Aston Mahana”
Reviews.Author: hclews
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed 6 nights in mid-November and we wished we could of stayed longer and still talk about our great stay. We got in after dark and received a free upgrad from a studio to a 1 bedroom suite on the top floor (1212) due to no more studios were available. View and whole area is just awesome. We felt that staying in this room was like living a luxurious lifestyle. The room did have was equipped with enough to survive. Cleaning was missed one day but not a big deal--our room was more of a home-base, not someplace we hung out in for any extended period except coffee and breakfast in the morning. We were happy to attend orientation in the morning and have breakfast provided since we did not have a chance to get groceries the night before. We booked several activities with Susan, the Concierge. We read lots of great comments on how great she is and yes, she is really good at what she does. We rented snorkeling gear and drove around the island to visit the sites that were most recommended. Believe it or not, the coral in front of the Mahana was the best. We saw lots of turtles from our balcony and several while snorkeling in front of Condo. You do have to walk down the beach to get in the water but the reef goes out for a long way. AND it wasn't crowded. The pool and hot tub looked nice but why swim or sunbath when there is the ocean and nice beaches around so we did not use. We went with Dukes next door and it was nice. Happy hour is recommended. We went to the Maui Brewery to watch football and taste the local brews. Drove the road almost to Hana to view the great waterfalls. I did a lot of research on this condo, surrounding areas, and all of our expectations were exceeded. Totally recommend this place if you are aware that no restaurant is on site. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, great staff, gorgeous views”
Reviews.Author: PamInCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I just spent 8 days at the Aston Mahana at kaanapali and had an amazingly wonderful time. Received a FREE UPGRADE from a studio to a 1 bedroom suite. Could not believe how beautiful the decor was. Nice and clean. Courteous staff all around. A little hard to find but a real treasure. DO NOT HESITATE to book a room here. Great amenities. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Romance in Maui”
Reviews.Author: hisblondiegirl
Reviews.Content: We had a one room suite on an upper floor. Very nice rooms and furnishings. Spectacular view. The full kitchen was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad not great !”
Reviews.Author: Allan N
Reviews.Content: Overall, nice view, decent service, but cleanliness of rooms not great. And we are not fussy people.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of these 2 things, especially while booking through priceline”
Reviews.Author: Shashikant K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good in general. Here are 2 tips: - Priceline falsely advertises a room-type for this hotel with the lowest price. The 2nd room type is called 'studio ocean front' which costs more. This gives an impression that the 1st room-type is not ocean front, and so people pay more for the ocean front view. When we went to the hotel, they told us that priceline fooled us because *ALL* rooms are ocean front. So be aware of how priceline fools its customers and select the 1st option while booking this (and potentially other) hotels. - The rooms are privately owned. They have a policy that if the owner comes, you get booted out. That's what happened with us. We were assigned a room on the 5th floor, and we did not specifically ask for a room on higher floors when we booked through priceline (there was no such option available). So when we arrived, we came to know that the owner of room 502 has booted us out, and the only 1 room available is 103 on the 1st floor with a lesser ocean view due to the hedge. It also had lower quality bed and furniture. So basically - call up the hotel in advance and make sure they reserve the room (or room type) you want.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway for two!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in mid November 2011, prior to moving onto Kaui and I enjoyed the 1 bedroom condo (room 417) so much that I wished for a few more days, especially since the last day was the best weather day. But even with the cloudy weather, our trip was unspoiled due to the wonderful experience we had with these accommodations! We slept in everyday (so quiet there - no sounds but the ocean coming through our walls), had a room cooked breakfast every morning on the lanai, and used the downstairs bbq for some fresh fish. The spa was uncrowded, the beach in front of our room was secluded, we people watched every morning and early evening from the lanai (and saw sea turtles and dolphins too). We did a little snorkeling in front of our room, but the walk to Black Rock for snorkeling is worth it! I especially was happy with the service we got from the Executive Housekeeping Manager (Susan) - she assisted me with getting back an entire drawer of clothing I left (my fault, and I was ready to write it off) - which included souvenirs, and items I could never replace from past trips and events.....I would definitely recommend a condo at the Aston Mahana - especially for couples looking to get away from it all - we have been married for 12 years, travel a ton, and this felt like a second honeymoon.....

Reviews.Title: “The right side go Black Rock...”
Reviews.Author: Eagles1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 14 nights in early November 2011, and coming from the UK (18 hour flight if you don't stopover!) researched pretty thoroughly where to stay. I'm so glad we chose the Mahana, it lived up to all expectations...and then some! Perfectly located right on the beach with amazing views. We saw whales, dolphins and turtles on different days all from the balcony in the morning with breakfast! The kitchen was well stocked, washer,dryer, dishwasher etc all v helpful. The one thing I was concerned about before the trip was that there was no beach to swim in directly in front of the Mahana. Literally turn left or right and walk 100 metres max and swim away! In fact actually having reef outside the hotel enabled more wildlife and less people to view from the balcony which was a blessing in disguise. Didn't use the pool at all as we were too busy exploring the island, snorkelling etc and when we did encounter the staff they were very helpful. No restaurant onsite but Dukes next door at Honua Kai is excellent both for food and a cocktail. The Organic Farmers Market store down the road is great for fruit, granola, homemade guacamole etc.....and weirdly a lot cheaper for certain things than Times store across the road (e.g. bottles of mineral water). The walk to Black Rock takes about 20-25 minutes and the path goes alongside the beach then through the gardens of a couple of resorts. We nearly booked at Whalers or Kaanapali Beach Hotel and are glad we didn't. There is a lot of construction going on there (at Whalers mainly I think), and whilst the beach is beautiful, you do notice a change in vibe that side of Black Rock. Maybe it was just the couple of times we went but people seem less friendly and more interested in pouting and doing press-ups on the beach! We're both in our 30's and keep ourselves in quite good shape, but come on people you're on holiday....relax and smile and Aloha! Final thing, Napili beach just up the coast is BEAUTIFUL and the Gazebo there is highly recommended! Lunch there is great, and breakfast too although you queue for a while unless you get there around 7am (we turned up at 9am along with the rest of Maui on our visit). Staff are very friendly too. Will definitely return to Maui and Mahana for all the above.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Amazing Views, A Great Choice for a longer Stay”
Reviews.Author: windsova
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for 1 week for the first part of our honeymoon. Note that each hotel room is individually owned so the decor really varies from room to room. We booked a 1 bedroom premium suite and when we first checked in, they gave us room 407 - which was decorated really badly and there was a mirror above the bed.... so we immediately ran downstairs and got another room which was 508 and it was much better. The rooms are HUGE and the balcony is just amazing. We had breakfast on our almost everyday. There a grocery store within walking distance and we stocked up on snacks and beverages while we were there and made use of the full kitchen. The hotel is on the calmer side of Lahaina/Ka'anapli. It's in the "time share" area so no major chains like the sheraton or hyatt but they are really close. There is coral reef right outside of the hotel so you have to walk at least 5 minutes to hit the white sandy beaches. I recommend walking to the Sheraton as the snorkeling and the beach are just amazing! Susan Ramos - the Expedia concierge was really helpful and she booked all our trips for us! I would recommend you book through her. Ih Lahaina you'll see the same activities priced at a deep discount, it's because they are time shares - be warned! I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for peace, quite and relaxation OR if you don't plan on staying in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha 2011”
Reviews.Author: weigela
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 bdrm dlx for 4 nights and were upgraded to a 2 bdrm dlx corner condo. It was lovely and very spacious, with a wonderful view that included both Moloka'i and Lana'i. The kitchen was fully equipped and there are grills in the pool area. Times grocery store is close by. There is a beachwalk that runs from the Aston to Whalers Village. The front desk staff were generally friendly, especially Garrett, and helpful. Housekeeping was spotty. The condo is located in an area composed of resort hotels and condos, and addresses are indicated by name as opposed to street number. We actually passed the entrance to the complex because the sign simply read "Mahana" and we were not sure that this was the Aston. The Honoapi'ilani Hwy is quite busy and on our way back to the airport on a Sat morning we sat in traffic between the Aston and Lahaina - the airport is about an hour away. We also felt that we spent too much time driving; we spent a day at the Iao Valley State Park and then to Wailea; another whole day at Haleakala (about a 2 hour drive to the top). The surf was too rough for swimming or snorkelling the day we opted to go to the beach. We needed more time to both relax and explore Maui at a leisurely pace.

Reviews.Title: “Very good lower cost place”
Reviews.Author: bottlerocketsci
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel/condo to stay if you want to try to save a few bucks. Every room has an ocean view. The room we stayed was a studio unit. The place could have used a little updating, but nothing was terribly worn. Be able to cook in your unit definitely is nice in Kaanapali. It is really a condo building, but we checked in and out just like a hotel. The staff was friendly and the concierge hooked us up with some very nice snorkeling and surfing packages. If you want a posh hotel, this isn't it. But if you are on a budget and want a nice clean comfortable place, this is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “ALOHA MAHANA”
Reviews.Author: OregonGirl78
Reviews.Content: Our trip was October 23rd 2011-November 2nd. We asked for a higher room and was terribly disapointed to find out we were on the 4th floor right by the elevator. The room was not updated at all and the bed was horrible. I went down to complain and the guy was a jerk about it. Phoned my travel agent and she told me to ask for a manager so returned to the check in desk again. Karen was kind and took care of us. Moved us to a premium room on the 7th floor. Was much better and updated. The beds could be newer. Not a big comfy bed at all. The view is awesome. Lots of parking at all times. Their beach out front is off limits to any kind of water sport and swimming. Nothing but coral. You have to walk a bit to find that nice spot but that was worth it as the views were amazing. Nice patios but furniture was outdated. Would I stay there again? Probably Thanks so much Karen for taking care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, good waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Ting-yi Y
Reviews.Content: Great place, nice hotel. I would definitely want to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana Room 307 is a great value with a great view”
Reviews.Author: Ashley R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our honeymoon at the Mahana in privately owned condo #307. We were thrilled with the clean, well appointed condo, and the view couldn't be beat. The sound of the surf is quite loud during the night, so bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper, but we didn't mind the constant waves during our stay. While we were at the condo, the neighbors above our condo were apparently doing some sort of remodeling which meant a pretty steady stream of furniture being scraped across floors and nails being pounded into walls. This was certainly not the fault of the owners of 307, but it did put a damper on some of our quieter moments in the condo. The spa was also being repaired for a few of the nights we stayed. When you have the ocean at your fingertips, the spa isn't an absolute necessity, but after a long day of snorkeling, a relaxing dip in the spa would have just hit the spot. We enjoyed having the beach access, even though it is a little walk either North or South to get to the swimming beaches. We also made use of the Maui Revealed book that is part of the collection left at the condo. I would recommend this condo to a friend without hesitation. This is a place to come if you want to cook most of your own meals and enjoy a cocktail on your lanai, and during whale season I imagine you could take full advantage of the binoculars and telescope that reside in the condo!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Marj D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent our 30th Anniversary at the Mahana and had a great time. We originally stayed at the Mahana 32 years ago on our very first vacation together and I must say that the property was just as nice as we remembered. We stayed in unit 1118 in a one bedroom unit that had absolutely everything we needed. The kitchen was fully equiped, it even had a kettle, which is something I don't often see in rental condo units. It also had beach chairs which really came in handy. We always left the patio doors open at night so we could hear the waves (and yes, they are pretty loud). My only critique on the unit was that the bed was a bit on the soft side, but that's really personal preference, isn't it? My only critique on the property itself is that the pool is very small, but with Kaanapali Beach right there, who really needs the pool? One of the best things is the bbq area. There are 4 huge bbq's poolside, but tucked away so the wind (ever present in Kaanapali) doesn't blow out the flame. The bbq area has a sink with paper towels and countertop area so you can wipe off your plates/utensils before going back to your room. And the bbq's were in pristine condition every day...I wish mine at home was that clean. We had a couple of meals out and if I were to recommend anything, it would be Buzz's Wharf which is located on the highway on the turn-off to Kihei. The prawns are awesome, the best I've ever had. We also did sunset at Haeleakala and that was spectacular. Well worth going to. We had a wonderful time and look forward to going again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a privately owned condos, average for a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: justoneraj
Reviews.Content: I will caveat this review and say that, before we went here we did not realize these were condos with private owners, not a typical hotel. The rooms have great views, and having the refrigerator, microwave, and Washer Dryer was super useful. The rooms were clean though they looked a little outdated. The thing that bugged us is that as soon as we checked in, we were asked to pay a $10 daily amenities fee. This included refilling of coffee packets in the morning, a daily newspaper, and use of the Safe. We always use the hotel safe when we travel, and asking for an addiitonal fee to do so was very unexpected. At a typical hotel, these would all be included in the daily charge. We will likely not stay here again. Other than that, everything was perfectly average, not bad, not great. P.S. If you are looking for a romantic hotel this is not it. If you are coming with family and want to cook clean in duirng your stay in Maui, it's not a bad option.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: Kmryan1985
Reviews.Content: Our condo on the 4th floor had a spectacular view, was extremely quiet, spacious, beautifully decorated and outrageously comfortable. The second we stepped into the doorway we were swept off our feet by one of the most breathtaking views. Having a full kitchen was great for us as we like to cook and enjoyed shopping at the local grocery stores. The washer and dryer in the room just about brought us to tears we were so excited as we were staying in Hawaii for 2 weeks and desperately needed clean clothes (they provided one loads worth of powdered Tide). Pool area was nice, there are gas bbqs right there for grilling too (no tools provided, so you better hope your condo came with some). Pool towels were hard to come by... Never saw any clean new ones out for guests, just heaps of used ones. The very best part of this entire facility... The coral reef. It's huge and it's right off the beach. Ten feet off the shore I stuck my face in the water and saw an angel fish, yellow tangs, some big bright blue ones and lots more. It was incredible. Go to dive shop and either buy or rent some gear, and don't forget the underwater camera. The fish are waiting for you :)

Reviews.Title: “Great laidback time in a fabulous setting”
Reviews.Author: amilkPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for the second half of our honeymoon, and I must admit, after spending the first five days at the Four Seasons, I wasnâ€™t at all eager to leave. However, once the culture shock wore off, we were very pleased with our time here. We were upgraded without even having to ask from a studio to a one bedroom (605), which was just lovely and also had a second bath. The kitchen had updated appliances and granite, and the bedroom had a very comfortable mattress. We never had any problem getting internet in this room. The patio over looking the ocean almost made you feel as if you were on a cruise ship, since as others have mentioned, there isnâ€™t a swimmable beach in front. All you see is ocean. However, a short walk to the right (or left if you prefer), and the beach is just lovely. Beautiful clear water and soft sand. There are plenty of restaurants within short distance, although unfortunately, we did not go to Dukeâ€™s until the day before we left, as Iâ€™m sure we would have returned again. Great fish tacos and decadent Hula Pie. We utilized the free DVD rental machine downstairs, which was a nice bonus feature. Never used the pool, hot tub, and grills, but other guests seemed to be enjoying them. My only complaint would be somewhat spotty maid service, as there was at least one day when the room was not refreshed, but otherwise, we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Maui at it's Best”
Reviews.Author: Patricia H
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Aston Mahana at Kaanapali this past week Oct 18-21, 2011. We stayed in a studio condo unit - it was very nice. Unit #913. Everything in the unit was clean and in perfect working order. The staff was very friendly. Garrett the night desk clerk was very helpful when we needed to send a fax. The concierge Lyn booked several activities for us. Each one she recommended was exactly as she said it would be. The Beach walk ajacent to the property allowed us lovely walks along the shore without sand in the shoes. We had a wonderful trip. The Mahana was really great.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at a budget”
Reviews.Author: ALJeff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana for the first half of our trip. Since the location of this resort is in the busier area of Lahaina, we decided to keep the R&R towards the end. The great thing about the Mahana is how genuine and nice the staff is at the resort. Our flight from our hometown was cancelled at the last minute, and we would not be able to fly out until the next day. Since we'd be losing a day, I immediately called the resort to inform them. However, they said we would still be charged for the 4th night. When we finally arrived at the resort the following day, the front-desk personnel informed us they would waive our first night. This is a gesture that they didn't have to do since American Airlines was fully responsible for the cancellation. It's refreshing to know they were kind enough to just charge us for our 3 night stay instead of the original 4 nights. Also, we were upgraded to a 2-bedroom suite since our original booked 1-bedroom was booked. It was nice to have a lot more space. The nice thing about this unit was the new kitchen and the fantastic view. The appliances were upgraded within the past few years. However, they have major issues with bugs all over the unit. We were not able to leave out any pastries or anything since we were afraid of all of it being attacked by unwanted bugs. The cons of the unit: The smell of old and mildew was very apparent in the second bedroom. The A/C unit was leaking water and gave a musty smell. Although the kitchen was updated, the furniture, paint and carpet all need to be thrown out. The beds were incredibly uncomfortable and hard as a rock. However, I am spoiled at home since we have a Tempur-pedic mattress. However, it would have been nice to have a softer mattress. The most odd thing about the unit were the incessant amount of mirrors. It was wall-to-wall mirrors in the unit with some pink walls and pink carpet. I would've spend the bulk of their budget on painting the walls a neutral color and maybe installing laminate flooring. This would be much easier to clean. As for the beach, this side of the island was incredibly windy in October. There was nothing pleasant about being pelted with sand. However, it was nice that the owners provided beach chairs and boogie boards for their guests to use. Overall, this was a decent resort for the price. Is it 5-star? No way but it's clean and convenient. The best thing about staying in a condo was cooking our own meals and knowing what ingredients go in it, along with saving money. Although Safeway was pretty pricey, it was cheaper than eating out every single meal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: Lezahp
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Aston Mahana in celebration of our 30th wedding anniversary. The entire staff was helpful and courteous. From check in by Garrett and check out by Karen, we felt welcomed. The concierge Susan was great in helping us plan activities. She made sure we did all of the 'must dos' when in Maui! Â Our room was on the 12th floor (top floor) of the resort so we had an awesome view of the ocean! The floor to ceiling windows in the living room and bedroom made it possible to see the ocean from either room in the suite. The linai provided the excellent spot to view sunsets, the ocean, the full moon and stars and/or relax in private. Â Would highly recommend staying at the Mahana if you want to visit Maui. Nice pool area with easy access to walk along beautiful Kaanapali beach! Great eating places in walking distance of the resort. For those that want to stay in shape while on vacation there is a boardwalk behind the resort that runs along the beachfront for about 5 miles. The only 'negative' we had is that there is no fitness center on site and to use the one at their sister resort next door you have to pay a daily or weekly fee. We think that fee should be included in the $10 per day per room amenities fee that is charged when you stay at the resort. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “How staying in paradise should be”
Reviews.Author: Dwight G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in a premium studio - which was more than enough space to feel very comfortable. Waking up to the sounds of crashing waves and a picture perfect view of the ocean, preparing meals from a very well equipped kitchen while still being able to gaze out on the ocean, strolling the beautiful beach just steps away with very good snorkeling within a very short walk (200 yards to the left of beach entry), watching the sunset over the corner of Lanai, gazing at the stars from the patio, falling asleep to the crashing waves, and then waking up and doing it all over again and again - I wish I never had to leave! It is truly how I pictured staying in paradise should be, and it is one of the closest places you'll ever get with a truly full unobstructed ocean view just steps away from any room.
