We've stayed at several other very nice (and more expensive) locations with ocean front and ocean view rooms, and none of them come remotely close to what Mahana provides. The staff was quite friendly and very accommodating and the location provides easy walking access to almost any place along Kaanapali beach. Having a washer/dryer in the room makes it really nice both not to have to have a bunch of dirty laundry around and allows you to bring less "stuff" since you can just "rinse and reuse". The beach directly in front of the condo is not really good for lying on (unless you want to get wet) and you can't snorkel or swim out from there due to a rocky reef, but a short walk less than 200 yards to the left brings you to a nice beach to hang out on with great snorkeling, especially if you snorkel back to in front of the condo beyond where the waves are crashing - the ocean is crystal clear with a beautiful carpet of coral below. There are lots of fish as well even if you don't swim back that far - but you do need to swim out a little bit to get beyond the crashing waves. It's well worth it and the water still isn't very deep. For those of you who just *have* to have your connection to the real world, the internet connection from the balcony works really well (less so in the room), and they are also working on installing modems in every room. But chances are as you sit on the balcony looking out on the ocean, spotting an occasional turtle and watching surfers try to get the most out of relatively small waves as the sun dips below the horizon, you'll forget all about the "real" world, as you should.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent condo choice”
Reviews.Author: Rob S
Reviews.Content: We rented a 1 bedroom 1 bath condo at the Aston Mahana. I think the premium upgrade is the way to go. Our unit 914 was really nice with all the modern conveniences you could want. Looking at pictures of the Mahana some of the non-upgraded rooms didn't look nearly as nice as the upgraded units. When we first entered the condo and saw the view and the modern upgrades we loved it. What a view. Amazing is all I can say. Two of the people working at the check-in area were really nice and really helpful. Karen and Garrett were so nice to us and made us feel at home. The other people working there we really didn't have much interaction with them, so I can't really comment on them. I will definitely recommend the Mahana to family and friends if they are going to Maui. We will surely stay there when we go back to Maui. Enjoy your stay Rob

Reviews.Title: “Aston Mahana was fantastic, but concierge Susan Ramos made our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Stacy R
Reviews.Content: As all the reviews have said the Aston Mahana has great views, nice rooms, friendly staff, and a great location. Walking to Dukes was also a plus. They serve great meals, happy hour, and fantastic sunsets. But what made our trip so wonderful was Susan Ramos from Expedia. She had called us about 2 weeks before we left for Maui, and said she worked for Expedia in the Mahana as the concierge. She asked if she could be of any help in giving us information or booking any tours before arriving in Maui. She e-mailed us information on the more popular tours and on a few things we were interested in. I'm so glad we booked early with Susan. Two tours we booked ahead were already sold out when we arrived in Maui, (Warren & Annabelle's & Old Lahaina Luau). It was so nice having our tour receipts ready for us when we checked in. Everything was so organized with a flyer of the event, a map of where to go, and the receipt of payment. Every time we walked by her desk in the hotel, she was so busy and had people waiting to book with her. We were even happier we booked early. Going to her breakfast presentation about all the things you can do is great, but if there is something you know you don't want to miss book early with Susan. She will save you a lot of time. Here is her information; Susan Ramos --

Reviews.Title: “Infinity Ocean - 1 bed over studio”
Reviews.Author: DHCDB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed whilst visiting Maui on our honeymoon. We had just completed the long drive from Hana (in the dark) after being bitten by bugs all day at the 7 sacred pools and needed a good rest. Unfortunatley due to our late arrival (after stopping off and the awesome Mama fish restuarent at the end of the Hana Highway - you need to go there) our requested highroom floor had been given away and we got given a studio on the 3rd. This room was nice enough with good facilities including cooker ect. Hawaii is not cheap and we had paid for the "refurbished" studio, so on seeing the room I was satisfied but not blown away when considering the cost. The man at the front desk had told us to come back the next day and he would upgrade us to a high floor 1 bedroom apartment. At 3pm the net day he duly did this - putting us on the 10th floor and wow what a view! All you can see is the sea. The apartment was lovely - it has this cosy blue carpet that made the sea extend into the living rom which was spacious and well equipped with TV, DVD and stereo. Kitchen was fully equiped also. Bedroom was very spacious with a massive comfortable bed and TV and DVD player. Bathroom was nice with shower and bath. This room made our stay - really felt like a 2nd home - so comfortable. The hotel pool and jacuzzi are small but in a good way as they were quite and intimate. The neighbouring hotel has a bigger pool that sounded more fun - but for a couples holiday - the Mahana fits the bill. Beach access is good - although not really for swimming right out the front - but is better a short walk down. Location is great as there is a supermarket across the road. Sunsets are awesome and the sound of the waves at night very relaxing. Hotel offers free DVS rental which is cool - make sure to attend orinentation on the 1st morning so you are fully informed and don't miss out. Please note that it is my understanding that all apartments are seperately owned or timeshared so fixtures and fittings can vary. View is amazing and the upgraded room really made our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it”
Reviews.Author: MarV713
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in the middle of our 2 week tour of the islands . Just loved to be in a condo with kitchen, washer and dryer (really needed at that point), 2 bathrooms (great when you travel with teens), and wonderful views. Sun sets were amazing. Walking distance to a nice supermarket where we could buy pretty much anything and prepare it in the condo if we wanted to. The concierge's, Susan Ramos, travel trips were really useful and we book a couple of things with her. 10-15 minute drive to Lahaina. We will stay here again for sure if we go back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “9 days of paradise at the Mahana Maui”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly P
Reviews.Content: Our last stay at the Mahana on Maui was in 2006 and we loved it then. There have been so many improvements since our last visit. We were there from Sept 16 to the 25th and it was like being in paradise. We had originally booked a studio but decided upon arrival that we would like to upgrade. Garrett was awesome and even gave us several choices but the first condo we looked at was enough for us..it was beautiful. I wish we had spent less time in the car and more time enjoying the outdoors. We did snorkel off the beach there and saw alot of beautiful fish even though it is tough to get in and out of the water due to the coral and rocks. Black rock is a must for snorkeling as we saw spotted rays and turtles. We used the grills most nights for cooking fresh fish and they were always clean. We did eat at Dukes one night and it was excellent. The one activity we planned which didn't work out well was the trip to Lanai on the "Paragon". It was very windy and the water was choppy and I don't think the trip should have taken place. By the time we actually got to Lanai to snorkel there wasn't much time left to eat lunch. It seemed very rushed. If you plan on going to Lanai ..which is beautiful I would suggest to take the ferry. It is quicker and you can decide which time you want to leave and return. We watched sunset most nights and even saw turtles swimming close to shore. It was breathtaking. The staff was great especially Garrett whom we had the most contact with. We are already planning our trip next year and it will definately be at the Mahana. We love it there and wouldn't stay anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the premium condos that had been upgraded and it was great! I would definitely go back to Maui and stay in Aston Mahan. Karen at the desk is such a nice person and as always there for you. We got to see some whales from our room. It was great! I am missing Aston Mahana since came back from Maui. Simply loved it and waiting to go back for other vacation at Mahana. Grocery stores are so close by and plenty of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning View from all rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jill T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 909 for 10 days. the view from this 2 bd/2 ba unit was absolutely stunning. When you look at your windows, you are so close to the water that it appears you are completly over it. We watched the sun set almost every night. The unit was very well decorated yet retained a homey feeling. Although our room was a corner unit, and had extra windows, no room at this property would have a bad view. We had stayed at a different property, on our prior visits, and were a little concerned that there was no restaurant at the Mahana. However, there is Duke's, at the resort next door which is only about a 5 minute walk down the beach. But, that resort does not have the beachfront view that the Mahana has. We will always stay at the Mahana from now on so that we can have it all!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay regardless of your ultimate goal.”
Reviews.Author: Pinkyr71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days before our incentive trip to the Ritz Carlton. Since they were not at capacity, they upgraded us to a two bedroom for free! How can you not love that? I was apprehensive about staying in a condo because we never have before, but let me tell you, this was a dream. We stayed in unit 409 (they are all independently owned) and it was perfect. The view was spectacular and the sound of the waves right outside was great. The only complaint I have was that the condo gets really HOT before sunset due to all the windows on that side. We cranked the air and could not get the temp below 80 during that time of the day. I suggest staying outside in the late afternoon. We rented some snorkeling gear and went right outside the condo's to snorkel. We heard there was a huge turtle living there, but we did not see him. We were able to wash our clothes before leaving, which allowed us to pack much lighter...thank goodness because we bought so many things, we needed an extra bag to cart it all home! This is a much more relaxed atmosphere than the resorts are. No one really comes by the room, except to make the beds and there are not many people, but we really enjoyed that.

Reviews.Title: “concierge”
Reviews.Author: pat198
Reviews.Content: Concierge Susan Ramos, at the Mahana Resort made an awesome orientation presentation. I booked two tours from her and her descriptions were right on. The orientation room, the food offered, her powerpoint presentation and the expediency in booking my tours made for a very lovely experience. The true aloha spirit. Thanks, Susan! Hope you can help me when I return to Maui (hopefully next year).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect views from your lanai.”
Reviews.Author: mamadub
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Mahana. We rented condo 603 thru VRBO and was not as pleased with our condo. It was in major need of upgrading, deep cleaning and had filthy carpeting, BUT the views are perfect at the Mahana. I understand tazmanaz complaints because we also heard the jackhammers each day, but thank heaven we were not as close as they were, so the noise was not as bad. We would go back to the Mahana again, but would choose a different condo.

Reviews.Title: “Concrete Rapair & Staff spoiled a near perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: TazManAZ
Reviews.Content: You look out your lanai and all you see is water. Just like on a criuse ship, until you look down to see the shoreline. Pure beauty! Problem is they started structural concrete repair 3 days after we arrived. Jackhammers outside your condo (even on the 11th floor) is no way to wakeup. They appear to be doing one small section SLOWLY at a time. This could take 6 months or more. The staff knew about this when we checked in and did not mention it or made any effort to find us a different condo. We could have asked to move, but being mid-way thru our stay elected not to. In general, staff was not helpful, knowledgable or friendly - except when checking in or out. They did comp the daily $10 amenities fee when we left. The view and location still make this a desirable place to stay, just check in advance about the repair work and try to get a room located away from it.

Reviews.Title: “5 STARS, OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: CantonLady
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Mahana, in 2 years. Mark Klaschka the General Manager was fantastic in his management of the condos. Karen and Garret at the front desk were very helpful in directions, suggestions for dinner, checking in and out and welcoming pleasantries. Susan, the Expedia concierge is a very informative, intelligent and a personable lady. Although we did not book any tours, we prefer to explore on our own or just relax at the pool, she has become a good friend. Always a hug when we arrive and willing to help in any way possible. The units are well maintained and furnished like home. There are wonderful Weber BBQâ€™s on the property, if you wish to prepare a meal. There is also a grocery store right across the street to purchase groceries, although their prices are a little higher than Safeway or Costco (closer to OGG airport). The Mahana also installed a gate with code for residents. You can exit at the gate in the parking lot and take the beach walk all the way down to the Marriott. There are wonderful craft shows on the way, Thursdays at the Westin. The beach walk jogs around the Sheraton, and you can even stop and visit the Whalerâ€™s Village for shopping and meals. Stop at the Sheraton beach area about sunset to watch a daily ritual of a diver that enters the beach to honor all the deceased people, lights torches while climbing the black rock, chants in memory of loved ones, and then dives into the ocean at sunset. Amazing!!! Dukes restaurant, is right next door on the beach by the Mahana. They have the best fish, chicken and nightly entertainment. Happy Hour is 3 to 5 with delicious drinks. The ambience is worth the trip. We have always rented directly from the Mahana. Many benefits in doing so. Any issues whatsoever from a light bulb out to faulty air conditioning is attended to by an in house technician quickly. Beach towels are provided clean every day at front desk. A 2 night deposit is required when you book, and the balance is paid WHEN YOU CHECK OUT. You get the CODE to the gate to use, coffee at front desk for 1.00, TIDE for 1.00 and daily cleaning service. Beds are made, kitchen and baths cleaned daily, fresh towels, fresh sheets every 3 days. DVDs are also available for 1.00. Anything goes wrong, simply call the front desk. You can also obtain a safe key from the front desk for 2.50 a day for use in your unit. I always left my laptop out on the desk and never had an issue. If you have an issue with your room, simply call the front desk and they will attempt to relocate you. This is all first class service only provided when you rent directly from the Mahana. I would recommend the Mahana to anyone traveling to Maui. The location is excellent, about 45 minutes from the airport and very close to Kapalua. You are about a 10 minute drive to Lahaina/Front Street for shopping, tours, snorkeling, restaurants. There are great craft shows and swap meets on the Island. Every Saturday all the locals are at the Community College near the OGG airport from 7 to 1. Thursdays are at the Westin right on Kaanapali Beach. Weekends in Lahaina around the Banyan tree. The best thing about the Mahana is that the people you meet at the pool, BBQâ€™s or on property turn out to be great friends. A lot of people return and faces become familiar to you. That is the atmosphere that is portrayed here. You will not be disappointed, and I hope your memories are as great as mine.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieandTony
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the Mahana and it was AMAZING!!!! we couldn't have asked for anything better. The place is beautiful and right on the water!! Everything was right at our fingertips. The room had tile floors, stainless steel appliances and it was SO clean. I can't even say it enough, we LOVED our stay at Mahana. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “MissingMaui”
Reviews.Author: john f
Reviews.Content: Aloha - This was a very nice place overall. The staff was super nice and accomodating. Susan Ramos(Concierge) was also very good and accomodating. The morning after check in is a 30 -40 minute activity presentation if you want to attend (I recommend it) and Susan will go over many of the island activities and can assist in making the reservations for you. That was very helpful. The Hotel is like a time share and the rooms have a touch of personality to them. The only downside (if you want to call it a downside) is the pool is relatively small compared to neighboring mega type resorts. Not a lot of other activities on site property. If you have kids, it may be better to go where they can experience the really big pools/slides, etc.at nearby resort facilities. Otherwise, i don't think there is a nicer place on the water with this view. Just my wife and I went so it was perfect. The place was quiet except for the sound of the waves crashing on shore below the hotel. I think the location was very good. Ate dinner next door at Dukes (ask for gate code at front desk to get access). I highly recommend dinner here. You are a 5 minute drive down to Lahina. Most hotels are on either side of the Mahana so location is great. Another must dinner is at Kimos in Lahana. Its on the water front with fabulous sunset views and terrific food (get the parmasain crusted Ono (Wahoo)), best I have ever had). There is a grocery store right across the street from the hotel as well if you want to buy a few things since there is a full kitchen. Feel free to walk up the beach to the next resort (north) and enjoy some music and a cocktails/Dinner (maybe 150 yards away). Highly recommend the Mahana and Maui. Don't forget to bring a hat and maybe a collapsable type ice cest with you. You can bring your cold drinks down to the pool area (we bought some plastic cups at the store) and truely relax drinking your fovorite beverage. Every room at this place is good (whether low or high).

Reviews.Title: “RIGHT on the water!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa H
Reviews.Content: Like some others, we were hesitant to book at a place we had never seen before! The place is beautiful, clean, and best of all - private and quiet! We had a studio room on the 12th floor and slept with the sliding doors open every night! The view and the sounds were amazing! I think we woke up every morning to a HUGE moon shining down on the water! We plan on going back in 5 years and will certainly stay at the Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort - Just What the Doctor Ordered”
Reviews.Author: SierraB48
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hawaii about 15-20 times mostly to Oahu. This time we booked at the Aston Mahana which is a sister property to my mothers condo in Waikiki. We arrived late at night and the sound from the ocean surf pounding on the shore was incredible. We stayed on the top floor in a studio and it reminded me of being on a cruise. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows that face West so you get the beautiful sunsets every night. We cooked most of our meals by the poolside BBQ area and it was great. We loaded up on groceries and things the first day at Costco by the airport. It felt like we were at the lake in the summer. Very relaxing and less hectic from central Kaanapali. The staff were great and I would recommend the Mahana anytime......Can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Will Definitely Go Back”
Reviews.Author: kgscott86
Reviews.Content: I was so hesitant on book any reservation in a place I've never been. What appealed to me was the "Newly Renovated" aspect. When my wife and I got there we were absolutely amazed. Having a full kitchen and a spectacular view was well worth every penny. We will definitely use this hotel again the next time we are in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, quiet relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul789_11
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Aston Mahana in August. This was our 3rd trip to Maui, and our favorite place to stay yet. Beautiful views from our 12th floor room - what a great way to start the day with breakfast on the deck - and the condo was very well furnished. We bought groceries or take out and ate in the condo about half the time, and enjoyed swimming and snorkeling on some great beaches within a 30 minute drive. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Mahana 1109.....OUTSTANDING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: molokinirum
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Mahana 1109. Unit is very spacious, extremely clean and updated. The owners, Bill & Dondi, are very responsive to any questions. The unit has new floor tile through out the entire unit and the views are awesome. Floor to ceiling windows, directly on the ocean...you can fall asleep listening to the waves!! The bbq area is awesome and also a great meeting place with other guests. The owners also provide linens, towels, washer & dryer, new appliances and all utensils, plates, pots & pans. Location is great, about 5 minutes from Lahaina and there are constant trade winds which keep the temp. cooler. Be prepared for sunsets like you have never seen before. All in all...a super stay and I will stay here everytime I visit Maui!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accomodations for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Tessie845
Reviews.Content: When we began looking at honeymoon locations we were doubtful that we would be able to afford a trip to Maui. We would have only been able to afford mountain view or partial ocean view rooms at most resorts. Refusing to give up, I continued to do research and found the Mahana. We found a great rate for flights + condo through the Aston website. We were so excited to be able to afford a room with a full ocean view! I was nervous about getting a room that wasn't very nice (based on some tripadvisor reviews) so we booked a premium studio. Upon arriving, we were able to view two separate rooms and choose between the two. The room we chose was on the 9th floor with the most AMAZING view! The bathroom, kitchen, and bedroom were all beautiful and suited our needs very well. We slept with the lanai door open every night and enjoyed falling asleep to the sound of the waves. We ate at several ocean-side restaurants during our trip, but we agreed that the sunset view from our condo's lanai was the best of the entire trip (we purposefully stayed in one night to cook dinner just so we could see the sunset from the comfort of our own condo). I never felt like I was wasting time by staying in the room during our vacation, all I had to do was look out the window and take in the breathtaking view! Breakfast on the lanai each morning in our pajamas was so relaxing and enjoyable. We used the DVD rental service included in the resort fee and it was easy and hassle free for us. We also appreciated the free beach towel service. Although the pool is much smaller and less impressive than other resorts, it suited our needs well. We always found it clean and it was never very crowded. We also enjoyed using the hottub. On our last day in Maui, we were able to use the pool and hottub after we checked out of our room - we had 5 hours before we had to leave for the airport. The staff even provided us with clean towels for our showers in the pool's restrooms. As other people mentioned, you can't swim in the ocean directly in front of the hotel, but we never found this to be a problem. It was a 2 minute walk to good swimming. Snorkeling was also good near the hotel. When we didn't have activities planned we usually walked from the Mahana down the beach to Black rock to snorkel and swim. We enjoyed this walk, but it is further than I had originally anticipated. If I am fortunate to return to Maui I would certainly stay at the Aston Mahana again! I would also recommend it to all of my friends and family. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “a true beach front condo”
Reviews.Author: dutchgirl54
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 9 day stay at the Mahana. Great convenient location. Floor to ceiling windows in the suite provided a beautiful view. The beach is nice and swimming and snorkeling are available just to the left of the hotel. Staff are polite and helpful. Request for a 4 hour delayed checkout seemed exorbitant at $175.00.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo right on the ocean!”
Reviews.Author: P G
Reviews.Content: I am so glad that we read the reviews here first to pick the Mahana for our 10-year anniversary. This was the best condo we have ever been in - 6 nights of bliss. We were on the 9th floor with a breathtaking view of Lanai, Molokai, and the awesome sunsets! It was rather windy, but that helped to keep the heat down (stayed in August). The concierge was great, the staff courteous, and the pool was awesome to hang around when trying to cool off from the hot sand just 20 feet away from the buildings. Definitely rent a car, use the free parking, go to Duke's beach house restaurant at the resort next door, and even walk the boardwalk all the way down to Whaler's Village. The Times supermarket was only a 10 minute walk away and perfect for stocking up the fridge. I only wish we could have stayed longer. We will return to the Mahana - hopefully during the winter when I've heard you can see whales breaching all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Ka'anapali”
Reviews.Author: kmantexas
Reviews.Content: The Mahana is a beautiful property. This is a vacation rental condo "hotel" where the properties are managed by Aston as if it were a hotel. They are located on site and have a front desk with a friendly staff. Other condos in the same building are privately owned and may or may not be managed by the same company. Our studio room was beautiful, and the view was stunning! It was cool and comfortable at night, and we slept with the door open to the balcony. All rooms are oceanfront, and all rooms have a secluded balcony so your neighbors can't see onto your balcony. It all felt very private. The beach directly in front of the hotel has coral formations right in front, so it's not ideal for swimming. However, a quick 1-minute walk down the beach in either direction and you've got perfect sand beaches and great snorkeling. We actually thought the fact that there wasn't much activity directly in front of the hotel was a plus because it was so quiet there. We enjoyed the full kitchen and made breakfast each morning so we could sit on the balcony and enjoy the ocean. It was simply beautiful and so quiet just listening to the waves. The room even had a stackable washer/dryer. We're not big on laundry on vacation, but it was nice to pull out clean beach towels from the dryer each morning. The staff provided clean sheets, coffee, dish soap and laundry detergent and cleaned our room each afternoon. There was wi-fi service and we were able to stream HBOgo and Netflix on the Mac whenever we wanted. The location was perfect and about a 15 minute drive south to Lahaina. (Renting a car is recommended on the island.) There's a grocery store across the street about 1/2 mile away if you want to buy food or alcohol to keep in the room. We're absolutely spoiled to this ocean view now, so we can't even imagine staying anywhere else on our next trip to Maui. If you need room service and high-touch service you may want to book at the Ritz or the Westin instead. We don't enjoy that level of service--mostly we want to be left to ourselves, and this property suits us perfectly. The entire experience was just perfection. If you're looking for a secluded part of Maui in a beautiful resort area, this is a great option. We can't wait to return. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan O
Reviews.Content: We book through a travel agent and got this hotel. Up front we requested an updated room on a higher level. We got room 1018 and loved it. Recently remodeled kitchen and bath...the place was perfect. The view of the ocean was awesome and the private balcony was pretty sweet too. The hotel is about as close to the water as you can get so the beach is pretty narrow. Others have complained about the rocks but this is actually a bonus for the snorkeler's (makes the water pretty clear). Good swimming areas are just a short stroll down the beach. We didn't have much interaction with the staff because we were out and about, but when we did, they were very nice and polite. If you'll need to get on the internet (like to look at your recently uploaded wedding pictures) bring a laptop! You'll have to pay an arm and a leg to use their computer w/ internet. However you'll likely have trouble finding WiFi service in your room...so you will need to go to the lobby area. I would suggest if you are staying several days that you rent a car! There isn't much sight-seeing/activities within close walking distance. There is a nice little grocery store across the highway from the hotel...we stocked up on some food to cook a few meals to save a little money. Overall we were very satisfied with the hotel and Maui in general and will definitely plan to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money, right on beach, quiet and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Onedogonebone
Reviews.Content: From the wide inviting balcony to the s/c kitchen and ample bed, this place is outstanding. Its a little bit away from the main action at Front St, but the rates are so good you can easily afford a hire car. Airport shuttles are non existent in Maui and with cabfares so high, car rental is easily best option for transport. Weather was great but windy; not exactly the Mahana's fault. Would recommend stocking up at the supermarket across the road. Then go along beach walk for happy hour cocktails at a variety of places. Drive to Basil Tomatoes or Hula Grill for best dining out. Beware most activities on the island come with a catch ...timeshare is everywhere and if only if you sit through their 2 hour preso's do you get the cheapest rates on helicoptering etc. We refused on principle. Snorkelling is only fair compared to other Pacific reefs but still quite ok and safe. The biggest rap we can give the Mahana is that we spent a day driving and looking at all comparable accommodation and nothing else came close. You will not get a true beach side balcony in Maui without paying double the Mahana's rates.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful getaway”
Reviews.Author: hanaumahumu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for part of our Hawaiian honeymoon. The hotel is on a quiet part of the beach and a 10 minute drive to the restaurants and shops of Front Street. The hotel itself is simple and laid back but clean and well maintained. There is no restaurant on the property. There is a restaurant at the adjacent hotel, but we never went there. The staff are friendly. Use of the outdoor parking lot is included. Our room had a clean washer/dryer and a working kitchen stocked with utensils. This hotel, and the location in general, is ideal if peace and quiet are what you want. Note: we stayed here July 2010, not the indicated September 2010.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Robert_Parr
Reviews.Content: This is my first time in Maui so I wasn't too sure which area to stay in. I first considered Wailea where all of the big and well known resorts are. However, after looking at their prices I was a bit hesitant. I wondered if by going to another area and saving a significant amount of money would I be getting into something much less enjoyable. I found the Mahana on this forum and, based on the reviews, decided to give it a try. Well, all I can say is that the positive reviews about this place are true! Super location, excellent and well appointed rooms (I recommend going for their Premium rooms if you like more upgraded newer looks), and you really feel like it's your home away from home...with daily room service :-). Good service from the front desk - he upgraded me to a larger room as there were some empty room available...and I didn't even ask. There is a good sized market across the street that also has prepared food and food ready to cook (I bought some marinated fresh ahi tuna steaks for about $4.00 that was good enough for two people.). Nothing like having a good meal on the private lanai watching the sun set! The market also has a $1 DVD rental if you want to play DVDs in the room. My room also had a Playstation and stereo in the living room. I did get a chance to drive tomWailea and, after walking through the resorts there, I felt good I made the righty choice and stayed at the Mahana instead. The resorts are indeed worth visiting but you can do that without staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place--incredible ocean front views!”
Reviews.Author: islandbeaches
Reviews.Content: Best of the best on Maui. Great location near LaHaina, shopping, and tourist attractions. Our unit was a premium king-size bedroom, 2-bath, full kitchen on the 15th floor with million dollar furnishings and wall-to-wall windows (beautiful views of the ocean, sunrise and sunset). Although we had one of the best units in the resort, we think a lower floor (perhaps floors 6-9 would have even better views of the ocean and palm trees). Our higher floor was an all-ocean view (felt like we were on a cruise ship) unless you were out on the balcony or close to the windows looking down on the beach. The hotel amenities were wonderful--large heated pool, hot tub, gas grills, beach chairs, conciere services and friendly staff. We highly recommend this resort and look forward to returning in 5 years.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! Incredible place to stay..The Views are breath-taking!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stan86
Reviews.Content: First let me give a shout out to all the folks who did reviews of the Mahana in late June and early/mid July. Your reviews are why we chose this place so Thankyou! I'll try not to repeat what others have said, but I'll add some context...The views are simply spectacular! The pics on the hotel website do not lie. From your patio, you have a view of the island of Lanai to your left and the island of Molokai to your right. You are literally 30-40 yards from patio to the ocean. There is a rocky reef directly outside your room. Swimming beaches are 100 yards to your right or left. There is a sandy beachfront to walk on - you are just not able to swim directly behind the hotel. While some may view this as inconvenient, what it really means is waves continually coming in and providing a soothing backdrop during your entire stay. We were on the 6th floor and left our sliding doors open which provided a very relaxing and soothing backdrop throughout the stay. Sunsets were incredible!! The other thing is there is never any people on the beach unless they are walking to the swim areas. So the beachfront is always quiet and with minimal people, which makes you think you are the only one there! On the beach, we walked 100-200 yards down the property and went snorkeling. A wide and large assortment of colorful fish provided a very nice experience for us. I had 2 different people tell me they went to Molokini Island and the snorkelling right there was as good as Molokini!! We didn't do Molokini, but that's what they said!! The beach area stretches quite far, and although there are other condos and resorts, there is more than enough beach area to handle all the people, which we never thought were large amounts. The pool area is small, but we never saw a lot of people there. Jacuzzi area got crowded in the evenings, but that's probably how most spots are. We used the free DVD service, which was convenient. We used the gas grills one night and grilled steaks, and had a sunset dinner on the patio. Kitchens are fully stocked with everything you need, and then some.... We shopped at Times Supermarket (short walking distance) and stocked the frig. If you want to go out for a nice meal, Duke's has a very good menu (we walked through but did not eat here - we went out to Lahaina instead (3-4 mile drive away) a couple times). There are also several counter service restaurants (ie: Subway, Ono' Kau Kau, L&L Drive Inn) within short walking distance also. If you're on a budget, but don't want to cook, that is another option. Wireless internet for us was great. No problems at all. Staff were fine, but we didn't really have a need to engage. Room was very clean and beds and trash were taken care of each day. Slept great in the beds also. Concierge (Susan) is helpful. We attended the continental breakfast presentation (1 hr) and this is worth it, especially if you know nothing of Maui. There are no pressure tactics. Its an overview of the island, and what services/tours/shows are available. We did not need anything here, but Susan was still helpful in giving me some tips for my journey to Hana (that's another post for another day!) One thing I need to emphasize. This is not a resort!! If you're looking for the 'resort experience,' you may or may not like this place as you will need to make some effort for meals, etc. But if you're looking for a fanstatic place to kick back with incredible views, and don't mind putting in minimal effort for meals (shopping, walking or driving to restaurants), the Mahana is the best. And the pricing fit our needs. There are many resort-like amenities, but do your research and you shouldn't be disappointed. I would recommend this to everyone - Newlyweds, Families, couples, groups, etc. I'm sure there are lots of similar places on Maui, but we were very happy with this place. It just all depends on what you want to do. Do your research and figure out what you want to do, what's important to you and what your budget is..... I'll summarize with this - We will return to the Mahana!!

Reviews.Title: “High end finishing with price to match.”
Reviews.Author: coolpoolers
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 (3 teens) and said if we ever go to Hawaii we would only stay ocean front and do it up right! We chose this condo because it was ocean front and had read many reports of condos having "insect problems" etc and did not want to have that distract from our holiday , so chose to up the ante and stay up a notch . The property is indeed beautiful and the upgraded units are beautifully appointed. Far greater niceties than you really need for a week in Hawaii! If you like the sound of the ocean every night you will love being this close to the ocean. If you do not. You will hate it. The condo had two bedrooms and pull out couch and claimed to sleep 6. The condition of the pull out rendered it totally useless as a sleeping area and that made the week crampy. The front desk understood but were of no use as there was no cot available . So if you are counting on pull out couch in your sleeping arrangements forget it! For $500 a night you think that would be a given. Once we got past this the place was gorgeous. Saw more whales off our balcony than on boat tour. Safety was never an issue. Beach right in front of condo was great. Close proximity to any and everything we wanted to do. Grocery/convenience stores etc right across road. If money not a bother and only sleeping 4 it is DROP DEAD GORGEOUS. Other wise you can shave a lot of money off your stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Mahana!!”
Reviews.Author: Andpandi
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, wonderful view, friendly staff. We were welcomed right away! Wonderful experience

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: DKom
Reviews.Content: My Daughters and I have been to Mahana for the 4th time and it seems to get better and better. Great front desk agents and ffriendly staff. Very clean and great amenitties for what they provide. We well defenitly return. Great for the entire family!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kweill
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Aston Mahana was totally wonderful. We are in a one bedroom studio, a little on the small side, but tastefully furnished and clean. The building is as oceanfront as I have ever seen. The views from our balcony are right across to Lanai and Molokai. The sunsets are spectacular. I am enjoying the balcony so much that I am almost too lazy to explore the rest of the island. Would definitely stay at the Mahana again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible. I can't wait to come back!"”
Reviews.Author: sirromeidolem
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a beautiful ocean-front condo and spent many a morning drinking coffee on the terrace outside reading and listening to the surf. The sunsets were breathtaking and we had the perfect view of Moloka'i. The size of the condo was perfect and we took advantage of the kitchen and ate in several nights to save some money. We had the option of a simple shower or the waterfall showerhead in a whirlpool tub. And to calm down after a busy day we took a dip in the hot tub that overlooked the ocean. Our concierge Susan was absolutely perfect. My mom and Gramma took part in the first morning informational meeting about all the activities on the island and took everything she said to heart. We made a list of everything we wanted to do in our short week in Maui and brought it to Susan who quickly booked everything right in front of us. She was really awesome and had first-hand experience from every activity she was recommending. The only things we weren't 100% satisfied with was the wi-fi. We paid an extra $10/day for wi-fi in our room but it only worked 1 out of the hundreds of times we tried so we had to pay for internet in the lobby. Other than that, our experience was perfect and we had the best trip of our lives. Absolutely stay here; there's no better hotel on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Totally relaxing..... perhaps a bit too quiet”
Reviews.Author: miserygutz
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a self catering apartment to wind down from a big party week on Oahu.We stayed at the Aston Mahana Maui in a premium apartment which offers ocean frontage location, incredible views of the nearby islands, on site BBQs, beach swimming & a small pool. No bar or restaurant but full cooking facilities in the apartment, shopping centre & restaurants & golf courses nearby & a Dukes bar & restaurant in the adjoining property. The crowd at Mahana was very quiet so relaxing around the pool or beach swimming/snorkelling was very restful. The beach in front of the apartments is rocky decayed coral so is best entered in front of one of the adjoining resorts. However, if you are in the mood for a few alcolholic refreshmentsor some dining, its back to the room or over the fence to Dukes or in the car a back to Lahaina. A great place for a family focussed holiday, but make sure that you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fondej
Reviews.Content: I cannot imagine that there is any place on Maui that would get you closer to the ocean! It is literally straight off your balcony from every unit at this property. We saw whales every single day from the balcony and sea turtles off the beach. Our one bedroom unit was perfect, clean, nicely furnished and very well appointed. Our friends had a studio that was very nice as well. This is not a full service resort. It is quiet, has a nice pool and most importantly the location cannot be beat! Right behind the resort you can access the walkway that runs all the way along Kaanapali beach. From there you can go to excellent snorkeling beaches, shopping and restaurants. I would happily visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Maui escape!”
Reviews.Author: iliketurtles79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana in condo # 1002 in July 2011 for our honeymoon. Everything from the cute Hawaiian decor, updated bathroom and kitchen, and AMAZING view created our perfect little honeymoon escape. I especially enjoyed drinking cocktails on the balcony while enjoying the Maui sunsets and falling asleep to the sound of the ocean...what more could you ask for?! The beach immediately in front of the premises is not very good for swimming as there is a lot of coral, but if you walk 3 minutes to either your left or right there are great beaches with crystal clear water and not many waves...perfect for swimming or snorkeling! My husband and I bought beach chairs to lounge around in since you're not supposed to remove the ones they have near the pool or lawn area off the premises. Also, I wish they had a small gym to use, but my husband just went to the resort next door and used theirs. The grounds itself were very beautiful and was relatively quite with not too many children. Great location...about 15 minutes from the grocery store and Dukes is within walking distance for drinks or dinner. Overall our experience at the Mahana was fabulous and we will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely luxurious place to stay”
Reviews.Author: slr_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family in two 2 bedroom units..(#419 and 319)...Both were fully furnished and tastefully decorated. The 2 bedroom units are on the ends of the building, which further enhance the great view and provide a quieter setting. All rooms at the Mahana have full window views right on the Ocean. The buildings and interiors are very well maintained. We found the staff very friendly and they were helpful in anything we requested. The pool is not as elaborate some properties but was sufficient for our needs. Excellent location, very close to the Times Supermarket. We had a full kitchen so we utilized the market often. Also in the Times shopping center are several reasonably priced places to eat if you do not wish to cook or spend a fortune in a restaurant. My only negative is that the Wifi never worked in our room and we had to go to the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: MA_Fuchs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon and will definitely stay here when we come back. Incredible ocean and surrounding island views. If you can get a higher floor, try to do so. We were on 8, and relaxing on the lanai while listening to the waves is pure paradise. The beach right outside the building is not swim or snorkel friendly, but an easy ten minute walk south gets you to a park area with both swimming and snorkeling options. Walkable (but easier to drive and park) is black rock and kanapaali beach to the south as well. Comfortable beds, through daily cleaning, and a fun island vibe to the room all made this an absolute perfect stay. Not as fancy or as many ammenities as the resorts elsewhere, but the value I am guessing is second to none. So close to the ocean that looking straight out, can't even see the beach.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: beck852001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week here on our honeymoon. Our room was very nice and had a beautiful view. The staff is friendly and helpful. The property and rooms are kept in great condition. Everything was very clean and housekeeping service was good. We loved having a kitchen and the ability to make our own food. It is in a great location. Very close to stores, restaurants, and other beaches. We would love to stay here again if we return to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Mahana and would certainly stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Rubyrobin
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a family with 2 adult and 2 teenagers. We loved everything about the Mahana. The closeness to the beach/water was awesome, close enough to walk to the market, nearby restaurants, Snorkel Bob's and other properties. Its a quiet property and not the place to stay if you want to party all night. No bar on site, but right next door is Duke's and is only a 5 minute walk. We used the room amenites, ate breakfast and dinner on our lanai and lucnh out each day. The new grills are very clean and nice. The concierge was very helpful and so was Garrett at the front desk. The ladies at the front desk a bit snotty and I would recommend that management discuss their customer service/friendliness with them. From reading past reviews, I can see I'm not the first to notice this. Our unit 1105 was is reasonably nice condition with remodeled bathrooms. Could use some improvements, new blender, AC unit in main living room has hard time keep up while the master bedroom was freezing. The unit was cleaned each day and the maid service was helpful and friendly. Overall, the entire property is very clean and well maintained. You absolutely cant beat the proximity to the water and every room have ocean front views. We watched mantas, dolphins, sea lion/seal and other marine life swim right out front. The snorekling is just so-so right there. I would highly recommend driving about 20 minutes north to Honolua bay...the snorkeling was superb....nearly as good as diving. Snorkel Bob's will say not to go there...I think they just want to keep it a secret for the locals because we snorkeled all over and Honolua was the best. When we return to Maui, we will definitelty stay at the Mahana again...hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home away from home ... in paradise”
Reviews.Author: far520
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week for my wife's birthday. This is our sixth time on Maui ... we've stayed at the Napili Bay Beach Club, Kaanapali Alii, and the Fairmont Kea Lani, all of which had their good points. But Mahana overall was the best, particularly for the price. Everywhere else, we paid a big premium for ocean view ... at the Mahana, all suites are ocean view with floor to ceiling windows in the living room and bedroom and a big lanai. Molakai, Lanai and sunset every night are right outside your window. The Mahana is very laid back ... if you're looking for over the top opulence or being fussed over, try something else ... but if you are looking for a home in a perfect spot on vacation, this is it, I can only speak for unit 914, but it was decorated tastefully in island style but very comfortable. The granite countered kitchen had every convenience. We booked our trip through AA Vacations, which gave us a standard room but called the hotel directly to upgrade to a premium room which included amenities like upgraded decor, kitchen, flat screen TV and stereo. What can I say ... we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The best honeymoon possible”
Reviews.Author: Jasonrw21
Reviews.Content: We are actually still here at the mahana. It has been the most amazing experience and could not wait to leave before giving it the rap it deserves. Everything has been nothing less than perfect. Our honeymoon has been far beyond our dreams. Thanks mahana and all the friendly people of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth it!”
Reviews.Author: lmeegan
Reviews.Content: The condo was nice and clean and ready for us when we arrived...lots of information about the property to review...easy access to beach and Duke's next store, as well as the long pathway that winds down Kaanapali beach. Kids got to get free movies every night to watch. I liked having a full kitchen to offset a few meals a day (which saved us loads of $$!). The condo had everything we needed for kitchen, bathroom, and laundry (washer and dryer in condo). There's a grocery story within a 5 minute walk across the street. The view was awesome, oceanfront, with floor to ceiling windows in livingroom and bedroom. Every night we slept with the windows open and heard the waves crashing...pool was just ok and there's a jacuzzi too, but we weren't there for that so we didn't care. Internet is best accessed in lobby and pool area, but sometimes we could get it from balcony as well. Some decent snorkeling right down the beach (another 5 minute walk) from the beach access door. There's a little snack cart in the lobby for a quick candy bar, shave ice, or sandwich. We didn't buy anything as we stocked the room for that kind of stuff. Nice location, great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana was great!”
Reviews.Author: KarlKT
Reviews.Content: The Mahana was an amazing place! The view is spectacular and the location is perfectly situated near the beach. Susan Ramos, the Expedia concierge, was very helpful and engaging. The "Supermarket Times" right across the street has everything you need for groceries and you are a very short drive away from Lahiana, Kapalua, etc. The pool was never crowded and has a great view of the ocean. We loved it and hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute dream stay!”
Reviews.Author: Super_Runinio
Reviews.Content: We have used the hotel ranking on the website (#2 at the time) and were very happy we did. The location is outstanding, the staff is both very helpful and pleasant. We had a Predmium1 Bedroom 2 Bathroom booked but upon arrival were advised that it was oversold and kindly offered an free of charge upgrade to 2 Bedroom, 2 Bathroom suite. It was like home away from home and more. The apartment is stocked with everything you can possible think of, both the Kitchen and the rest of the house. Also loved the lanai (the huge balcony) The sound of waves right outside of our window was totally incredible. We recommend Dukes, which is just a short stroll away from the hotel and if you have a car, definitely go to Napili Bay for swimming. It is pretty close and definitely the nicest beach around.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: scbuck
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful place to stay! The room we stayed in (1103) was just perfect. Everything was very clean and very nice! We called ahead and requested a higher floor and loved it (though honestly I don't think any of the rooms would have any less of a view). It was awesome having our own kitchen in the room. We went to the nearby store and bought breakfast items, and then ate breakfast on the balcony every morning! We definitely got plenty of bang for our buck! Can't say enough about how nice the room was and how nice our stay was! Beach is right outside the doors and was fairly empty. You definitely have room to spread out. The snorkeling in front of the hotel was pretty cool. I was a first time snorkeler and I can say it was the perfect place to start out. I later went down to black rock, which was cool, but definitely more of a challenge getting into and out of the water. I can also say the array of fish in front of the hotel was spectacular. There was definitely more species of fish there than at black rock (could of been the time I went). I highly recommend and will be staying here the next time we are in Maui!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: kahuna2011
Reviews.Content: Our son graduated H.S. and this was our final "family" vacation. We took one of our son's freinds with us so we rented a two bedroom condo. After reading the reviews on trip advisor, I made sure to reserve the "Premium" condo. It did not disappoint. We stayed in rm. 711. Fabulous and breathtaking. We definitly plan on staying here if we go to Maui again. Even though we were offered Conceirge service, we found better deals on our own. Our son and his friend wanted to go snorkerling and they were told to go to a store where masks were $60 to $70 a piece. They went one block down to an ABC store and found basically the same mask for $6. The lobby is simple and check in was freindly and efficient. The swimming pool was small but we had access to a world class pool right next door. They also have a very good work out room there. Very good room service. Quiet location but just a 5 minute drive to all the tourist shops and the next beach. Clean. Nice large and private balcony. Being literally feet from the ocean, the surf was a bit loud when we were trying to sleep at night. We had our sliders wide open and shutting them most of the way quieted the surf noise but still left plenty of breeze flowing through our room.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our 11th wedding anniversary here.”
Reviews.Author: Partycurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from June 7-14th in a remodeled condo 1br 2 ba condo on the 10th floor. This condo was part of the Mahana program so we received daily maid service, a newspaper and use of the movie rental program in the lobby. As everyone has previously stated the views are incredible. On our second morning we saw dolphins frolicking right outside the window. It was amazing. The condo is also very quiet. We have stayed at other condos on the ocean but closer to the road so you sometimes get that road noise. Not at the Mahana. It is tucked far back from the road so no need to worry about any noise other than the crashing waves. We attended the free orientation given by Susan Ramos on the first morning. We were so glad we did. Susan helped us find a massage therapist who came out to the condo. We had amazing massages on our actual anniversary right on the lanai. It was so wonderful to be able to hear the waves crashing and the price was better than any of the spas nearby. The massage therapist even commented that she had never been to the Mahana before on an outcall but it was now her new favorite place. Susan also arranged a sunset dinner cruise on one of the Pacific Whale Foundation's boat. That was also wonderful. Susan is great, I highly recommend using her if looking for excursions. She tries to get the best deal for you rather than trying to talk you into going with more expensive packages. She does not pressure you at all, just give you information and helps answer any questions you may have. All of the public areas of the Mahana are so well taken care of. I felt like I was at a high priced resort. They recently replaced the bbqs from what I understand. The new BBQs are very nice. We did not get a chance to use them but it seems that they scrub them down every evening because they all looked brand new. It is nice that the Mahana is on Kaanapali beach. One night we walked down to Black Rock to see the sunset torch lighting. It was a bit of a walk but very nice that you can actually walk there without having to go near the road. Georgina helped us initially with our reservations and she was the best. She was so friendly and very patient with us. I highly recommend staying at the Mahana. I don't think you can find another place with million dollar views for the price. Unlike some other reviewers we had absolutely no problems accessing the internet and my husband had to do some work while there and he never complained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good employees”
Reviews.Author: pjcasey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Mahana 14 years ago and found it to be as clean and nice as it was on our first trip. We had two units, a two bedroom and a one bedroom. Both were furnished nicely with well-stocked kitchens. One of the best features of this Aston is that it is quiet - no cell phones or music at the pool, quiet hours from 10 pm until 8 am. Maintenance of the property is outstanding (we even watched the sidewalks get scrubbed!) The employees were particularly nice (thanks Melanie and Garrett!). Location is great with a grocery store and several restaurants within walking distance. There are several (maybe 5 or 6) gas grills available for outdoor grilling. The Aston furnishes towels for the pool and beach. Our units had washer/dryer sets for dealing with the grime of the beach. On the down side, does a first-rate place like this really need to charge $2.60 per day for use of the safe in the room? Really? And do you really need to charge $12 / hour for using the computers in the lobby? The units are wi-fi but most vacationers don't travel with laptops.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for quiet”
Reviews.Author: webway
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 914. The unit was great looking and very close to the water. The people at the desk were friendly and helpful. Pool area was quiet, and beach access was great. Only a couple of negatives: Unless you like sleeping on rocks, get another unit. The bed never allowed me to sleep more than 4-5 hours at once. Also, there is no restaurant on the property and if you are looking for pool service for food and drinks, look to another elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A return visit for us! And, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: MMRDalton_Georgia
Reviews.Content: We love the Mahana. A very quiet location. Very friendly staff. Units are individually owned. Both we have stayed in were beautiful corner units. Lanais are sooo close the the water! Amazing views of whales in December - anytime just off the beach! Duke's restaurant is 2 minute walk. Large BBQ grills available by pool area. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Mahana”
Reviews.Author: HonuGirl
Reviews.Content: Aloha Trip Advisors Friends - From the moment we checked-in we knew Mahana was the right place for us. The front desk personnel were all really nice and always greeted us warmly. We stayed in Premium unit 505. Perfect. Newly renovated 1 bd, 2ba oceanfront in the north building. The Mahana location is absolutely perfect for beach walking, path walking and ocean swimming either north or south of the location. The Times grocery store, Snorkel Bobs, Pizza Paradiso are in the mall just down the long driveway. Great dining is very close by at Duke's on the beach which is a 5 minute walk on the path plus the best plate lunch in Maui at Ono Kau Kau is just up the street. 10 minutes to Kapalua for snorkeling or hiking and don't forget to lunch at Seahouse or have a special dinner at Merriman's. 10 minutes to Whalers Village or 15 minutes to Lahaina. Overall I can not stress enought what a relaxing, quiet and special place this is. The Mahana also has tons of easy close parking, brand new barbques by the pool along with a nice sized jacuzzi and pool. We will return here next time we go to Maui. Mahalo Mahana for a super special stay. Date of Stay June 12-18, 2011

Reviews.Title: “Loved the condo and will come back ASAP.”
Reviews.Author: Maureen6891
Reviews.Content: The condo we stayed in was wonderful. We walked out to the beach each morning. Floor to ceiling windows. All amenities provided. Our condo was renovated a few years ago. Pool was beautiful. All areas well maintained. Susan at the Expedia Concierge counter was very helpful in recommending activities.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the savings”
Reviews.Author: Staleys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was $150 cheaper per person in a package compared to the Marriott and Westin. Big mistake! Yes, we can all agree that the view is amazing at this hotel (all rooms have an ocean view) however, that does not make up for its extreme shortcomings. Â I will list these so that it is easier to read.Â  1. Attitude of the staff. Â On arrival, we were greated by Karen at the front desk. Karen displayed none of the attentiveness one should expect out of a front desk employee at a vacation resort. Karen was all business and didn't seem to care how much paperwork she threw at us so long as she could get back to her lunch, which she chewed on throughout our check-in, and get us out of her hair.Â  2. Housekeeping. Housekeeping came to our room everyday but we are not quite sure what they did. Â Sometimes our towels were refolded, sometimes they were left on a wet heap on the floor. Sometimes our duvet was placed back upon the made bed, sometimes it was folded on the couch other times it was left on the floor in the corner of our room. Â Some times we were left tide detergent other times we were not (that was included in our $10/ day charge.) one thing that was extremely consistent is that Â housekeeping never cleaned/vacuumed or mopped our floor. Â We were forced to walk around in socks and sandals due to the amount of sand on our floor in an effort to keep our feet clean. When you are in a tropical enviornment where people are constantly at the beach and in the sand, cleaning tile floor seems only reasonable, Â  3. Maintaince request response time (never). We stayed in room 1012 and the shower leaked and drain was partially clogged leaving a pool of water whenever we used the shower. Â We informed the front desk but nothing was ever done. Â There was also a brown stain on the wall next to the shower....may be mold from a possible leak. Â The drain in the bathroom sink was also broken. Â We informed the front desk about that as well, and per the usual, nothing was ever done. Â The room was shabby and dilapidated.....with holes in the curtains, tears in the sliding screen door, marks, scratches, and chips in the walls. The usual things one shouldn't expect in a resort-style condo. 4. Facilities. More of a warning than anything else. Expect to have the crummiest pool in the neighborhood!Â Also, the high Speed Internet was a joke. It was almost impossible to get a signal. For what we paid and what we saved by not going with slightly more expensive accommodations, this place was not worth the price and not up to our standards or expectations. We loved Maui in spite of this place and will not be returning to the Aston Mahana at Kaanapali.Â  Oh, and before the resort's general manager responds to this with promises to fix the problems and help us find a more appropriate room, we suggest he read a review of our room from October 2010 on Yelp that lists many of the same complaints and fix room 1012 before he offers to assist us or any other former guest!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Us”
Reviews.Author: LovinLife-027
Reviews.Content: NOTE: Not all of the rentals at this location are as fully-appointed as the unit we booked. Some don't have kitchens at all. And, in some of the 2Br/2Ba units, one of the baths is just a powder room, with no shower or tub. So, be careful and very specific about your needs when making your reservation! We traveled to Maui for a family wedding in June with several must-have requirements. First, since we were bringing another couple with us (relatives), we needed a 2-bedroom, 2 bath suite. Second, we absolutely HAD to have air-conditioning, which many accommodations in the area of Maui that we needed to stay in (Ka'anapali / Napili Bay) do not offer. Had we gone by ourselves, we likely would have stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for its proximity to the wedding venue but the cost of the 2Br/2Ba suite there, if available, would have been prohibitive. The condo we found at the Mahana was absolutely spot-on perfect for our needs. It had the required A/C, plus two spacious bedrooms, each with its own private bath, as well as a nice living/dining area (with wall-to-wall, floor-to-ceiling windows and breathtaking views) and a big kitchen with granite counters, stainless appliances and a full complement of dishes, glasses, cookware and utensils. It also offered a stacked washer/dryer that came in very handy for wet bathing suits and towels. As it was an owner-rented condo, the furnishings and artwork made it feel very home-like and warm. It had every amenity you could think of: Flat-screen TVs in the living room and both bedrooms - which we actually never used but it was nice to have the option - a stereo, CD and DVD players, nicely appointed bathrooms, plenty of closet and drawer space and a veranda big enough for a patio table and four chairs to watch sunrises with coffee and sunsets with a MaiTai. The Mahana is configured so that every room has an ocean view but our view from the 6th floor was truly spectacular. The condo itself was spotlessly clean, well-maintained and the daily maid service was accommodating to all of our requests. The pool/spa area looked to be clean and well-maintained as well, although we never used them. The ocean itself was too inviting! The beachfront at the Mahana was a bit too rocky for swimming but just a short walk to either side provided perfect, sandy beaches and crystal-clear waters for swimming, snorkeling and boogie-boarding (two of which were also provided in the condo). The staff were super-friendly, cheerful and eager to please. The only downside at all was that there was no restaurant on-site and, therefore, no room service, although there was a nice little snack bar down by the pool for breakfast sandwiches and light lunches. But, between the numerous other hotel restaurantsand free-standing eateries in the immediate vicinity and the convenient full kitchen in our condo, which we stocked with food upon our arrival, that didn't prove to be a problem for us. All in all, this was the perfect spot for our first but certainly not last, visit to Maui and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Honoluadude
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great in Maui and the Mahana was a PERFECT place for us. It has THE BEST views for the money. Million Dollar views!!! The condo is equipped with everything (including washer and dryer so you can pack a little lighter) that you need. They even have daily maid service, provide dishwashing soap, paper towels, washing powder, beach towels, and a bunch of other stuff that other condos won't give you and all this at no additional charge (we did leave a couple of bucks a few times for housekeeping just to show our appreciation). The beach has a reef directly in front of it but the snorkeliing and swimming is just 100 yards on either side of it. But Let's face it, if you came to Maui just to lay on the beach in front of your hotel or hang out by a fancy pool then the Mahana ain't your kind of place and Maui probably isn't the place for you. Go to Florida or something or pay $1000-2000 more bucks and stay at the Ritz-Carlton. We came to Maui for all the different beaches and adventures that it has. Yes, we did lay on the beach and The Mahana has a fantastic area with lawn chairs etc for laying on the beach and by the pool. Thanks again to the Aston Mahana at Kaanapali for a GREAT place to stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Fabulous...Loved the property.”
Reviews.Author: MccartneyTrav
Reviews.Content: Hotel/Condo is set in a perfect location just feet from the beach. Perfect are for snorkeling!. Swimming beaches are just a few yards either direction on the beach. Shower and rinse area just as you step back on the property. Pool onsite is very nice and cleaned everymorning. (Trade winds blow leaves in during the night) Hottub was clean and warm and never crowded. We usually had it to ourselves. Plenty of sun chairs for those wanting to just catch some sun rays. Nice quiet area too. Relaxing and just enjoying the sounds of nature were nice. Property was well kept and the staff were always friendly and willing to help if need be. We were constantly asking maids for extra supplies and they were always cheerful and never hesitated to help. Rooms are absolutly amazing and the views are breath taking(see pics). Having a kitchen was nice to save on the somewhat pricey meals on the island. Perfect place for Honeymooners, and familys. Would def. recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SMcGowan36
Reviews.Content: We traveled early June this year for our honeymoon. I must say that our room #507 seemed newly updated. The condo was a 1 bedroom unit. The view was spectacular. We had an oceanfront view and slept to the sound of the waves nightly. The check in process was slow, however the people at the reception desk were helpful. The unit had individual washer/dryer and laundry soap was included in the $10 daily amenity fee. The unit was very clean, also included were dish washing liquid, new sponge and clean dish towel. The kitchen was fully stocked with all flatware, bakeware, pots etc. - Very convenient and spacious (We did not use the kitchen due to our short stay) The internet access was spotty in the units and worked best by the oceanfront windows. The rooms were to be refreshed everyday although we only had service the second of our four day stay. The beach directly outside the property has a coral reef and is not ideal for swimming. Approximately 100 Yards in either direction there is beach suitable for swimming/snorkeling. Take care because the surf in Kaanapali The pool area was very nice but small for the size of the property. It also included a hot tub. The property is easily connected to the other beachfront properties by a boardwalk which makes for easy access to the other beach areas and restaurants/shops along this strip. The location was great!! However for your stay in Maui we recommend a car (regardless of where you stay). One downside was there is no onsite restaurant - there is however a breakfast/snack bar with coffee/hot drinks, shave ice, sandwiches/hotdogs and assorted snacks. There are eateries/restaurants within walking distance. The Concierge (Susan) was very knowledgeable and helped arrange our activities during our short stay. Don't let her convince you or talk you into seeing the abstract Hawaii heritage play - U'lelena. We are still regretting that decision to this day - this from two people who love going to see plays/musicals. I know you are wondering if we would stay here again - in a heartbeat - just save room #507 for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: DianeTraveler
Reviews.Content: I selected Aston Mahana at Kaanapali based on other Trip Advisor reviews and was happy I did. ALL the rooms in this property have an ocean view, and are right at the beach. The property was well managed, clean and quiet. My 14 year old son and I stayed here - I had the bedroom and he slept on the sofa bed. Both were comfy to sleep on. I didn't deal much with the property staff, but most I came in contact with were very nice and friendly. Interesting enough, the least friendly were the people who worked the front desk - they weren't unfriendly, just not overly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Maui Favorite!”
Reviews.Author: tomharman
Reviews.Content: For my wife and I, Aston Mahana at Kaanapali is the most relaxing resort hotel we have vacationed at and we have to say it is our favorite place to stay in Maui because of the freindly environment, beutiful beaches, clean rooms, great service, hospitality, and concierge. In addition to, there are local interests, activities and attractions within arms reach so you never have a long day of travel to get to your favorite desinations. Every experience is as good as the last and we plan to return to Aston Mahana for many trips to come.

Reviews.Title: “Your money is better spent at a resort down the street”
Reviews.Author: BaggioCat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Aston Mahana during whale season in February. A major plus to most of our stay was watching the whales from our balcony, hundreds of them during the week we were there. However, I wished we'd decided to stay instead at one of the nicer resorts just south of this dump, even if it meant cutting our stay by two or three nights to compensate. Here's why. When we first arrived, they placed us in a garden room. Guests were on lounge chairs on the grass just inches outside our sliding glass window. We begged them to move us at the front desk, and they said there were no alternatives because the owners were occupying most of the available units. I was in tears and since our stay was prepaid there was nothing we could do. Props to one woman at the front desk, I believe her name is Rose, for eventually moving us to another room, on the 8th floor with a view and privacy. However, the front desk staff for the most part are a nightmare. Any transaction involved an interminable wait, even for such a simple transaction as exchanging a beach towel. The lobby is uninviting and while some rooms are remodeled (our garden room for example) others (like the room we moved to) are extremely dilapidated and dingy. Maybe it's worth it to some to have the convenience of a kitchen and in-unit washer and dryer, but there are simply too many other drawbacks for us. Don't believe their claims to Internet access; it is spotty at best and completely unreliable. The worst part for us I think, aside from that horrible garden room nightmare, is that you cannot swim in the ocean in front of the hotel due to the rocks. Nor can you sit on the beach because it is so narrow. If we hadn't paid upfront (nonrefundable) we would've moved to another hotel, or left early. Learn from our mistakes!

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING BUT OCEAN! FLOOR TO CEILING WINDOWS-SPECTACULAR VIEW!”
Reviews.Author: wilf01
Reviews.Content: The Mahana is a quiet gem in the midst of many large, busy, BEAUTIFUL resorts. It's location is convenient for groceries, restaurants and beaches galore! The parking is free and there are plenty of spaces. The lobby is small with friendly staff that take care of things quickly. The room we reserved & paid for, a 2 bathroom, wasn't available, so we were given a credit for The Aston Kaanapali shores restaurant, almost next door, and ate some GREAT food! THE HULA PIE IS DELICIOUS! Upon Walking into the condo you see a WALL OF WINDOWS and an uninterrupted SPECTACULAR view of the ocean. Mirrored walls reflect the view everywhere in the condo.Before we knew it, we saw HUMPBACK WHALES jumping in the distance. It was BREATHTAKING and we saw it time and time again. FANTASTIC! Nicely Remodeled kitchen with everything needed to prep & cook. Beautiful bath with Huge walk-in/sit-down shower. Big Bedroom with mirrors to reflect the AWESOME view. King bed was pretty comfy but would have been better for restorative vacation sleep if it had a thick foam mattress pad. The in-room safes are small and won't hold a midsize laptop but are OK for small stuff. The wi-fi was weak and I had to a sit by the window for a signal. The grounds are nicely kept up. The pool and hot tub are small, but clean and a great retreat when the wind is blowing sand on the beach. There is a gorgeous grassy area between the resort and the beach that is only for Mahana guests. There are lots of lounge chairs and palm trees and no music or cell phones are allowed. IT IS PEACEFUL LIKE IN A HAWAIIN MOVIE!!! The beach is steps away, great boogie boarding and snorkeling within 100-200 feet. Mahana is WONDERFULLY PEACEFUL WITH A SPECTACULAR VIEW. I would rent from a private owner to get the condo you actually paid for. And by all means try to vacation during Whale Season.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but rooms out of date!!”
Reviews.Author: mrs_smith536
Reviews.Content: I was very unhappy in the condo room 419 at the Mahana, the master bedroom was VERY outdated. It had purple and green walls, with such an ugly bedspread. I couldn't wait to get to this place, and then I walked in..UGH. I did speak with the front desk to switch rooms, she let me see some other ones that would be another $50 per night, they weren't any better! The only great thing to say is it's right on the beach!
