We wanted to have a late check out, but the room was going to be used that night. Ok, that's understandable, but they do not offer to let you keep your suitcases to hold for you. Our flight didn't go out until 9:00 pm, so we were stuck putting them in the car. We had 4 people and we were warned not to travel with the suitcases in the car, as they might get stolen. Overall, not a very accommodating place. I will NOT stay at the Mahana again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii143
Reviews.Content: It was amazing, the condo was beautiful! The condo was supplied with everything we could ever need. Hotel service was excellent, housekeeping great service, and the concierge was great in planning our activities. We were celebrating my parents 60th wedding anniversary and the hotel upgraded our condo to a panoramic view. Our travel agent Akiko at Season's Travel highly recommended Aston Mahana, great recommendation. The hotel treated us all like king and queens with special attention to my parents. I have been raving about the hotel and I recommend to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A hit with the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: SusanM2004
Reviews.Content: There are many great things about the Mahana, but the highlight is walking into the condo and seeing the magnificent views. The â€˜wow factorâ€™ never fades from when you first arrive until you leave. The privacy on the lanais is wonderful as you only see the beach, ocean and the islands of Lanai and Molokai (plus palm trees and the lawn out front if you are on a lower floor). We loved eating all of our meals on the lanai. This was my second stay at the Mahana. The previous trip (a mother/daughter one) two years ago, and this trip was with DH, our two children and their spouses. I was anxious to return to the Mahana and was hopeful that the rest of my family would like it just as much as I did ... it turned out to be a hit with everyone (our ages range from mid 20â€™s to 50â€™s) ... all agreed that it was ideal. We had 3 condos amongst the 6 of us (1218, 818, both one bedrooms, and 1213, a studio) . We rented privately, with all 3 units in the mid-price range and all in good condition,with many updates. DH and I stayed for 14 days, and the â€˜kidsâ€™ for 8 days. (On my previous trip, I stayed in 611, a 2 bedroom, which I also really enjoyed.) The complex is really well maintained and very clean. Recent renovations keep it current looking ... from the redone pool/bbq area, to the glass railings on the lanai, new exterior finish, and landscaping. Itâ€™s a very quiet complex; the pool area was never crowded, and the loungers on the lawn facing the beach is a nice area for R&R. The bbqâ€™s are excellent quality and spotlessly cleaned every day. The tennis court is in great condition too. Snorkeling out front of the Mahana is really good ... beautiful coral and lots of fish. It was easy to get into the ocean for swimming or snorkeling at the beach between the Mahana and Honua Kai. The boardwalk (which goes for about 1.5 miles towards Black Rock and beyond) starts at the Mahana parking lot. Dukes restaurant is next door ... a 3 minute walk. We did most of our grocery shopping (other than a Costco stop) at the Times Supermarket ... a 10 minute walk, or 1 minute drive. We really like West Maui for the convenience of getting to some of our favourite places for swimming and snorkeling (Honolua Bay, Kapalua Beach, Napili Beach), for walking the Kapalua Coastal Trail and driving the scenic road to the blowhole. The Mahana sits on a very long stretch of beach - great for walking the beach, with some really beautiful swimming areas to stop at and cool off in along the way! Looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “No bait and switch here!”
Reviews.Author: TameraHanna
Reviews.Content: The Aston Mahana at Kaanapali was the home base for the best Maul trip ever (this was my third time staying in Lahaina). We were assigned room 407. Having read reviews stating that you never know what you're getting when staying at a condo rental (directed at condo rentals in general, not specifically his property)--as each unit is owned by individual owners and will contain varying decor and amenities--I held my breath as we opened the door to the unit. The first thing I saw was the SWEEPING ocean view (we'd rented an ocean view room) from the living room, lanai, and the bedroom once the amazing stained glass sliding doors were opened. Unit 407 is very funky and bohemian in decor--a perfect fit for us. The kitchen cabinets were a very modern cherry wood with granite counter tops and contained all that you could need in a kitchen. The vibe at the hotel, and with staff, was very comfortable, friendly and cozy (no pretentiousness here). The pool/spa area had a bbq area and there were other bbqs on another end of the property. Parking was easy. There are no restaurants on site, however Duke's is within walking distance, and there is a coffee cart on the property serving snacks, coffees, smoothies and shaved ice. I booked a massage and although there is no spa on site, the massage was booked at the Kaanapali Shores (a less than 10 minute walk away through a nicely manicured parking lot). I will definitely look into staying at this property the next time I go back to Maui. The only con I can think of is that the mission style bed in the bedroom was substantially squeaky. The bed was very creaky when getting in and out. If you call to specifically rent this unit, I would suggest asking if the bed is still very creaky. Also, a caution for the more conservative clientele--there is a mirror installed above the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Susan Ramos-Concierge..very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Shmitt14
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon, we stayed at the Aston May 15, 2011 for 1 week in Condo #205. Everything was in good order in the room. We wanted to write a special thank you to our concierge-Susan Ramos who was very helpful and helped us book our whole week's activities and restaurants the first day we were there. She listened to our requests, gave suggestions, and called each company/restaurant for us. She knows Maui and she was one step ahead (e.g. asking for a window seat at Mama's fish house even before we knew to ask for it). We visited her every day to ask more detailed questions and she was always willing to help...from providing coupons to making phone calls. Thank you! Maui was an amazing honeymoon vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: michaeljames101
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui. Loved the Aston Mahana from the start! You can't beat the location being right on the beach. We stayed in Room 605 for 9 nights arriving on April 5, 2011. We had a one bedroom, 1.5 bath suite that is part of the property's premier collection. The views from the room were spectacular, we never grew tired of those famous Maui sunsets. Overall, the property is quiet and the average age of the guests during our stay was in the 40s. Not a lot of kids around which, for us, was a welcome bonus. The hotel staff were polite and attentive. Early in our stay we experienced problems with our phone which was promptly remedied. The Supermarket Times across the street makes grocery shopping a snap. We found it to be a much better store than the Safeway in Lahaina. There are no restaurants at this particular property, but there are plenty close-by so that was never an issue. We ate several times at Duke's next door and would highly recommend it. Overall, our stay at the Aston Mahana was fantastic and we are looking forward to returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Maui Trip”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethM51
Reviews.Content: I had a beautiful suite, right on the ocean. The resort was immaculate, the staff was professional and courteous. Karen at the front desk was awesome. Only down side is they need a restaurant on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and views.”
Reviews.Author: roughneck784
Reviews.Content: We flew into Kahului around 4:00 in the afternoon. With decent directions you can make the drive in about 40 minutes. The check in process was fast and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The lobby has a nice view of the pool area and the ocean. Everything appears clean and well taken care of. We stayed in room 704. The room was very nice. The first thing that strikes you is that every inch of the wall facing the ocean is window. The bedroom also has this with a huge slide glass door out onto a large balcony with amazing views. Unfortunately the palm trees out front were about 75â€™ tall which put them in our eyesight. I think a floor higher or lower, they would be out of sight. I wonâ€™t complain too much as it was still a beautiful view that I took many pictures of. It was nice having the kitchen as we made several meals there and mixed a few margaritas. The housekeeping staff did a good job of keeping the room tidy. The pool area was a great place to relax after swimming in the ocean. The hot tub was just the right temperature. There were plenty of beach chairs in front of the building or in the pool area. The beach in front of the Aston Mahan was great for walks. Unfortunately the water didnâ€™t have a sandy bottom. I think reef shoes would be a must have for swimming right in front. The snorkeling was good right there but if I was to swim I would go a ways in either direction or simply go to one of a thousand other beautiful beaches on Maui. Dukeâ€™s is the closest restaurant, about a 5 minute walk. Everything that I ate and drank at Dukeâ€™s was fantastic and would recommend. Great service although reservations would be advised during busy evening hours. Favorite things we did while in Maui. Surf lesson at the Royal Hawaiian Surf Academy. Had a lesson with Mike, coolest and best instruction weâ€™ve ever had. We drove to Haleakela and saw a sunrise. Absolutely worth getting up at 3:00 am to get there. The road to Hana was awesome. We also rented snorkel gear from Snorkel Bob's and drove from beach to beach snorkeling and exploring. I loved Maui and canâ€™t wait to go back and would definitely stay at the Aston Mahana again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Grandma45_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the premium condos that had been upgraded and it was great! The only complaint we would have was the bed - it just wasn't that great, but everything else was fantastic! There was a bit of construction going on in the unit next to ours, but they were very respectful of the time of the day that they were doing their work and how else do you have great, updated units if they don't do the construction? I would definitely return to this location. Karen at the desk was very personable and knowledgable and was always there, so I wondered if she ever took time off! Having the grocery store across the street was great and we walked to restaurants nearby. This was our third trip to Maui and by far the best! Since coming home, I sure miss the sound of the waves and looking out at the ocean!

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER WONDERFUL STAY AT MAHANA...717”
Reviews.Author: coocoomaroo
Reviews.Content: We have stay at the mahana many times, this was our firts time in room 717, we went through a private owener. Just amazing! This room was spotless! The owener is Evie, had a lot of extras in the room. Candy, beach towels, laundary soap, paper plates, cups for use at the pool, baggies, and many other things. Going though a private owener you do not have maid service, or use the front desk... with all the money we saved, I can pick up after myself! the view, (in all the rooms) is amazing. This is a quiet place, so it is relaxing! Our room was 717 a 1 bedroom 1 bathroom, condo, that sleeps 4. if you need a larger one Evie might be able to help you. 1877 511-6284, or mauibeachcondos.com.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Views”
Reviews.Author: Ramdog2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week. We had never stayed in a condo but found it beautiful, comfortable and so handy. The views from the living room and bedroom were breathtaking and the entire property was beautiful. We loved the peacefulnees of the property and the friendliness of the staff. Susan was wonderful at setting up activities for us. We can hardly wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful view of the ocean”
Reviews.Author: hapret
Reviews.Content: We just returned home after spending 13 days in Maui, 8 of which we spent at the Mahana. We moved to the Aston Papakea Resort after the 8 days since we decided at the last minute to extend our stay in Maui. We reserved a "premium" 1 bedroom, 1 bath unit at the Mahana and it was fantastic. The kitchen had updated appliances and it was a joy to prepare meals there. We stayed in Unit 208 and would love to stay there again should we return to Maui again. The staff was very accommodating and this was our second time staying at the Mahana. I would highly recommend this property to anyone who wants a location right on the beach, extremely nice accommodations and close to everything. Kudos to the ownrs of Unit 208 for updating the unit in such a beautiful way.

Reviews.Title: “simply put it was a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: mike-n-jeff
Reviews.Content: everything from when we arrived and greeted by rose at the front desk to the amazing room views from the lanai were perfect. Had most of our time planned already but susan raymos the concierge in lobby managed to get us a couple of things we could not get on our own(at least in our price range on our own) and even took her advice and changed one that was already booked. highly recommend her to help plan your adventures she completed our vacation. Everything about the Mahana was enjoyable and Rose and the rest of the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “best ocean front hotel”
Reviews.Author: varsha906
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aston for 3 nights in april. when we checked in around 10pm they had booked us on the 1st floor. We told the front desk person that we had requested higher floor and we were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary. the front desk girl was very nice and upgraded us from sudio to 1 bed room on the 10th floor. we also enjoyed having dinner and watching whales from our ocean front balcony. I would stay at this hotel any given day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: sbo
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little disappointed that we had a ground floor room. However, the view was still great and we found it to be very convenient to walk right out the patio to the beach....not stairs or elevator! The room was very nice and the bed comfy. My teenage son slept on a sofa sleeper in the living room with no complaints. Just so you know...the beach is great, but the ocean right outside the hotel is a little rocky. My only complaints...they charge for the use of the in-room safe (should be included). Also, there was a landscaping project going on right outside our room #117 (on the pariking lot side not the ocean side), so we had to avoid the orange cones, flagging and workers each time we came or went. Not a big deal as the ocean and views were on the opposite side of the condo....just a little annoying.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Taste of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Sharron45
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Aston Mahana. Although it is not as elegant as the other hotel that surround it, it is comfortable. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the inhouse expedia agent Susan Ramos, greated us the first day with a continental breakfast and many suggestions for possible excursions to the best of Maui. She helped us plan a great itinerary which included a early morning trip to Haleakala crater to see the most remarkable sunrise I have ever seen and a helicopter ride over Maui to see hidden treasures that most will only see from the air. She was very friendly, not pushy and our trip would not have been as exciting without her help. The room had a magnificent view from a generous lanai. Although Room 1113 was modestly furnished and could have used some updates, it was clean and comfortable. This hotel has the best view of the beach. Dispites it small size in comparison to the surrounding hotels, it maintains a sense of quiet seclusions. There is plenty to do in the surrounding area, and restaurants are close by - everything from McDonalds to the Outback to the more Polonesian cuisine traditional to Maui. The grocery store is just down the street. The City of Lahaina is very close buy and has many sites, live theater, excursions, great shopping - not the usual tourist fair. The weather is great on Kaanapali beach - soft warm breezes and sunshine every day we were there. If you like the heat without the breeze, just drive 15 minutes to Lihaina. Beaches everywhere and lots of public assess. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; quiet & friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Linecutter
Reviews.Content: We searched high and low to find a quality condo that was affordable, but also located right on the beach in Maui. The Mahana fit this description perfectly and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay! My husband and I along with 15-yr and 22-yr old sons definitely needed at least a 1-bedroom with kitchen and laundry. When we checked in, they upgraded us to a 1-bedroom with 2 full baths...perfect! We loved being right on the beach and felt safe leaving our teenagers for part of the day while we went sightseeing. It's in a quieter section of Kaanapali beach, yet you can stroll the beach down to Black Rock and go snorkeling without a lot of hassle. It's also convenient to areas further North like Kapalua Beach. Especially loved watching whales right from our lanai. We stayed 4 nights and then spent 6 nights in Waikiki. We longed for a return to Maui after the hustle/hustle of Honolulu! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Janice075
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Aston Mahana at Kaanapoli for 3 nights. We booked a one-bedroom suite with ocean view for under $300 a night plus tax/fees. It was a great value. It has everything, even washer and dryer! Parking is free. Location is great, too. If you want to cook, a supermarket is right acrros the street. Otherwise, you can easily find restaurants at different price levels nearby. Everything was better than we had expected! What's more - the 2nd and 3rd day we were upgraded to a two-bedroom suite for free! It was the best hotel experience we have ever had. We will definitely go back next time we visit Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: sweetiek99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana March 3-8 in a studio. We loved how all rooms faced the ocean. We started out on the 4th floor in an unrenovated studio but had to switch our room because of an ant problem. They were everywhere! The Mahana was completely booked so we had to wait 2 days for a room to open up. Everyone was really nice about it and they offered to have someone come spray but since I'm pregnant, I had to decline and request a new room. The new room they gave us was beautiful, completely renovated and on the 5th floor. The only problem with that was the palm trees blocked our view of the water so it was hard to see whales, sunsets, etc. We enjoyed our stay at the Mahana and I would recommend it to others. The wireless didnt really work unless you were in the lobby. One major perk was free parking. Also there is a Times grocery store right across the street. We thought the prices were the same as they were at home, very fair. No need to go to Costco unless you will be there for more than 2 weeks (Costco is near the airport). We really liked the restuarant Dukes next door at the Honua Kai. We also found this really good japanese noodle restaurant called Star Noodle. It was close to Lahaina and probably our favorite meal (plus not expensive at all!). Also I recommend going to Warren and Annabelles magic show and doing the road to hana. We enjoyed driving to Lahaina and walking around down there.

Reviews.Title: “This is our 3rd stay at the Mahana & looking forward to the 4th stay!”
Reviews.Author: karenwoo
Reviews.Content: There are various sized condos available depending on your needs. We have stayed twice in the large unit (2br, 2 bath), and stayed this time in a 1 br, 1 bath unit. The sofa in the living room converted to a queen size bed. All high end appliances in the kitchen as well as a stacked washer/dryer combo. Good housekeeping service each day. All units are ocean view with spectaular views of the harbor & the whales. Would not stay anywhere else on Maui!

Reviews.Title: “On the beach, quieter part of ka'anapali, ocean front.”
Reviews.Author: Johnrfrazer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio, which had a good bed, full kitchen and laundry in the kitchen. What we liked about the Mahana was that all rooms are ocean front, we were 45 feet from the ocean. We spent much time on the patio watching numerous whales. While there, we checked out 1 and 2 bedroom units, very nice. We liked that it was not so busy as many of the resorts on Ka'anapali beach but could walk to them when we wanted. Also I want to mention that our travel agent Kay Ryan mauikay.com was a real asset. She recommended these condos, arranged direct flights for us and met with us when we were there. Then the Japan earthquake happened and we were under a tsunami warning. Kay called us and invited us and her other clients to spend the night at her comfortable home, which we did, while others spent the night on the street. Now that's what I call service.

Reviews.Title: “best view, words cant even describe”
Reviews.Author: suzie0016
Reviews.Content: after reading reviews and looking at many photo's i chose this hotel for location and the view, when i arrived i was speechless. i couldnt believe what i was seeing, ive never seen anything as beautiful as that view. we only stayed for 3 nights, i didnt want to leave. i could have sat on the balcony or down by the pool for weeks. we stayed in a one bedroom premium room, worth the extra $$$. booked on royal hawaii condo's website so saved a fair bit anyway rather than booking directly through the hotel. this was our last stop after a 2 week holiday, first Waikiki, then the big island, and last was maui. it was the best way to finish our vacation. as you could imagine after a week and a half of eating out every night by the time we got to maui the kitchen was used alot. there's a times supermarket about 10 min walk where we got fresh fish and veggies (much needed). we were lucky enough to be there during whale watching season, and did we see some whales. even on the way to the hotel we could see them. on our last night they gave us quiet a show, jumping up and splashing around for hours just outside our hotel. there arnt many shops around (in walking distance) but there are buses to two centres for $1 fare. if going to different islands shop in waikiki and just enjoy the view and serenity in Maui. i will be back and i will be staying at the mahana again. also check out dukes for dinner, right on the beach with great entertainment and food... and cocktails :) my favourite, lava flow.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed! Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: mrsmponds
Reviews.Content: As with most condo complexes on Maui, these are individually owned. I don't think I would ever go with a package where you have no say in which condo you get. Have to go with VRBO where you can see pictures etc. One of the biggest pluses I loved about the Mahana vs others is the buildings face the water, not each other. I loved being able to walk out on the lanai in my jammies (or whatever-no one could see up 12 floors!). We were not looking into someone else's bedroom. So much more private! We rented 1204 vrbo 15244, a 1b/1ba sleeps 4. Gorgeous! Plenty of living space. Do not be afraid of the building facing the sun-yes it's very warm in the afternoon but the entire apt has central air (unlike some that only have a unit in the front living room so you burn up in the bedrooms at night). You get a great cooler breeze once the sun goes down a little. Also, there are heat/light filtering shades/screens most people have there. Again, check the pictures and/or ask the owner. Great breeze off the water, fantastic water views, water color sunsets. There were a couple ants in this condo but not in the kitchen. Have them at home too so it didn't phase me. It was not an invasion-they are in the building so will travel to where they find food-just be clean and don't leave a mess! (did not encounter any flying roaches here as we did in 3 other places that were short buildings) All the kitchen appliances are new. Liked the window in the kitchen by the ceiling in this condo-helps to ventilate the heat out when you cook. The owners were wonderful to work with, very prompt in responding to email. They stay here too and it shows. Kitchen supplied with spices, lots of gizmos and electonics. Beach towels & toys in the closet. Plenty of closet/dresser space in this condo. Pool area is really reallynice-updated last year-new slate from one side to the other. Almost empty every day when we went in June. The hot tub is HUGE! Unlike another place we stayed-my 4 yr old did not get fussed at for having a pool float ring (even in the hottub-we were the only ones in it at the time). Used the grills a couple times-they were cleaned daily and very easy to use. A table and sink are available. The bathrooms are nice-showers available, plenty of room to dress. If you are catching a later flight, you could bring your change of clothes after packing up the car and spend the rest of the day at the beach or pool, then go shower before you go. I felt very safe here having things in the car. Oh yes-parking is free, not like the charges put on you just to the south on the main Ka'anapali beach. The beach-while IMMEDIATELY in front of the building has some flat rocks, a very short walk takes you to sand. Was not an imposition at all. Actually we really enjoyed the rocks at low tide-made tide pools and saw tons of little tropical fish and critters. My 4 yr old loved it. Speaking of-we had no problem with my 4 yr old son and being on the 12th floor. The lanai railing is a solid plexiglass-no kids falling through bars or getting stuck. There is a camera on the building if you want to check out the beach etc-http://67.53.48.2/CgiStart?page=Single&Language=0. Supermarkets-don't bother with the one across the street unless you just have to get a bottle of milk or something. Go down to Lahaina to the Safeway. We don't have a Cosco membership as we usually get fresh produce instead of prepackaged stuff. There is also a Walmart on the island. I'd advise stopping on the way in to get dinner/breakfast items for that day and next morning so you can take stock of what's in the pantry/fridge already. Most condiments, coffee, sugar and the like was already in this condo. Also some wine, beer, alcohol. The beach walk starts next door in front of the Honua Kai. Bring water! We stupidly started out right after lunch and baked after an hour. It does take you through the middle of a couple of resorts-kind of cool to see what you didn't rent and be thankful. Beach got crowded the further south we went (never went north past next buidling). There are bathroom facilities and water fountain on the way before you get to the Sheraton blackrock. We didn't go beyond that...just too pooped! We actually never went on that side of Ka'anapoli beach. Heard a lot of how there was little public parking and the beach we had was just fine. I do prefer this beach, and the ones in Kihei that we went to-Kamaole 1 I think, to the one up on Napili Bay. We went one afternoon and there was hardly any where to park. Glad I saw one review that said the beach dropped quickly. Boy did it! You must watch your kids at Napili Bay-a few steps out and I was over my head! It wasn't as bad further down the beach in the corner but we didn't feel like walking that far. There was a public shower to wash off before getting in your car-but it was broken when we left. The larger public beach a little north at DT Fleming beach was ok-still the drop off. The afternoon tides were too strong for us. Also noticed in the 3 wks we were there that the winds were really strong in the afternoons-like getting your legs sandblasted. Some locals said it was unusual for it to be that bad. All in all-we were very pleased with this condo and this building. Are looking to go back and rent here, then for a week down in Kihei. (if you are interested in staying there, check out the penthouse at the Kamaole Beach Royale vrbo 234923) Mahalo, ya'll!

Reviews.Title: “Best place on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: mdwoehl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Feb.21 - 27. Our our ocean front room was fantastic. The sunsets were spectacular. The staff was friendly and. helpful. Susan, our concierge was very knowledgeable and the activities we setup were great. We would definitely stay at the Mahana again. Mike and Dona, Ankeny, IA.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: smedley3300
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, even though it was a studio. Very clean, and the staff couldn't have been nicer, especially Malia. A little outdated, but the view was spectacular. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. The price was good for an oceanview room in Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: DJES75225
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the perfect ocean view and to avoid the center of the tourist activity, we highly recommend the suites at the Mahana. Not all have been upgraded, but we booked an upgraded unit and it was lovely. Excellent space. Kitchen upgrades impressive. But the best part -- the views, and the sound of the ocean from your lanai. The Expedia on-site staff did a great job of recommending and booking activities for us. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “I can't stay away!”
Reviews.Author: doreenpow
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my third stay at the Mahana and I'm already planning to go back next year. The Mahana was recommended to me when I explained that the most important thing to me is an ocean front room. Though the units I have stayed in dont have the chic, up to the minute furnishingsnyou might find in the Marriott Beach Club renovation, they have all been clean, homey, and reasonably fashionlble. Granite and stainless steel have been features in two of the three units I've stayed in. The beach is narrow here and the pool is small, but those factors give this resort a private and tranquil ambience. The grounds are beautiful and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Maui is so incredibly beautiful, comfortable, and appealing. There is so much to do! Susan, the Expedia Local Expert concierge who works out of the Mahana has experienced everything Maui has to offer and can hook you up with whatever you want or need. She is a big reason why Maui and the Mahana are so irresistible. Go to her presentation on your first morning. She will guide you to your best choices.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana 308 wonderful unit”
Reviews.Author: erogers1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana in room 308 Feb 2011. The building is in an amazing location. The benefit is that all the rooms are oceanfront and literally overlooking the ocean by 30 yards or so. The lobby of the builiding is a little outdated and does not offer all the amenities of a full service resort and spa, but the unit itself (#308) has been recently remodeled and looks brand new. Wonderful lanai and fully stocked kitchen with granite countertops and laundry facilities. Grills available for use. The pool is small, but the Hauna Kai next door has awesome pools with lazy river, waterslide, waterfalls. You can hear the ocean crashing outside as you sleep. Only minus was that the bed was a little uncomfortable (but that could have been due to the fact we had 2 kids squished in with us). Wonderful value for the location. Many other nearby units were twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: rfjurgens
Reviews.Content: Last year we were fortunate for a travel agent to select this motel for our stay. I told him we would really like a room where we could actually see the ocean. I told him we did not want a room where we had to peek around the corner of the lanai to see the ocean. He immediately said we would enjoy the Mahanna. What a wonderful experience! When we opened the door we knew we had found the place we really wanted! So were happy this year when we once again stayed at the Mahanna arriving in late January and leaving on Feb. 10th. How relaxing to sit on the lanai and see the whales go by and watch all the boat activity too. And how neat to be there for the beautiful sunsets! And this year we rented a premium unit. So we were very happy when we actually found enough cooking utensils so that we could really cook!!! In other places there had been a short supply! Always alot of activities nearby--Whalers are and Lahinna. And a neat grocery store just a couple of blocks from the hotel. Also not too far there was a Farmer's Market---selling the Most DELICIOUS banana bread! Also alot of fruit and vegetables. We always enjoy taking a whale watch boat ride. Be sure to go with the Pacific Whale Foundation Boat. The guides are fantastic and they do so much for the preservation and safety of the whales. And we have enjoyed Blue Hawaiin helicopter rides. The pilots are all professional and very knowegable of the area. And of course there is the tour of Hana! We had driven this road many times, but the last 2 years have enjoyed a tour with the Valley Isle. Our guide both years has been David----and he has such interesting information of the area. We have also enjoyed driving on around the island from the Ritz Carlton---where the driving guides say not to drive!! But it is a delightful trip---a narrow road in a few places---but once again --on one turn you will definitely want to stop at the little green house----Julie sells warm banana bread! And of course we really enjoy the staff. Everyone always has a smile when they meet you and really make you feel welcome. It was great to see Karin again. When we arrived we had a couple of problems but they were taken care of immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat perfection”
Reviews.Author: hanka1950
Reviews.Content: This is our sixth visit to the Mahana in as many years. We came for 10 days the first time, 2 weeks the next and have enjoyed a month each visit thereafter. We have discovered the jewel of Maui accommodations and locations and are sure to return many more times. We have also recommended this facility to our friends and everyone has had the same quality experience we have had. While some of the units need upgrading, the majority are recently renovated and tastefully decorated. We have stayed in a studio unit every time and have found it to more than suitable for our needs since we spend most of the time outside. The Mahana is ON the beach....as close as you can get to the Pacific. Every room has a lanai that directly overlooks the ocean. There is not a poor view on the property. The grass area is very well maintained and has more than enough lounge chairs for everyone who wishes to relax and enjoy. The coral in front of the Mahana provides some great snorkeling but it is best to enter the water further south of the complex to avoid the coral directly. We love the state of the art Weber barbeques that are around the complex. They are always clean and ready for use. It makes eating in very appealing. Dukes Restaurant, which is next door, is an excellent well priced place to grab a breakfast, a quick snack or linger over a delicious evening meal . The staff have all been a pleasure to deal with. Karen, at front desk, is always so friendly and gracious and willing to do anything possible to make the stay wonderful. Thank you, Karen. The housekeeping staff also are very courteous and do a great job of keeping the units neat and tidy and fresh. The concierage with Expedia in the lobby is very well informed and has directed us to some wonderful adventures that we might have otherwise missed. We always look forward to our next visit to the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay here - still great”
Reviews.Author: Nena12345
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay in the last 4 years. First time we stayed a week, then 2 weeks, and this time 3 full weeks, skipping 2010. In the 2 years we've been gone a couple of new hotels have sprung up in the area, and this once-secluded beach has now become very popular and very busy at times. The Mahana is still the same in its great friendly service, very accommodating to meet all guests' needs. It's quite expensive, considering there are not a lot of amenities (no onsite restaurant, no exercise equipment, very weak wireless access, extra charges for using an inroom safe, etc.) But the close proximity to the beach and the extraordinary unobstructed views make it worthwhile. If what you're looking for is to truly relax, this is the best place to be! Especially during whale watching season (Jan/Feb/Mar) you'll see whales all day long, passing right by your balcony. Each room is tastefully decorated and furnished by its respective owner. Very large balconies and every room is directly on the west facing ocean. Sunsets are great, star watching at night. Although the hotel was completely full, they did their best to move us to a different room after one week. Only reason we wanted to move is we were there to watch whales from our balcony, and our first room had 3 palm trees directly in front of the balcony. We moved up 2 floors and had a completely unobstructed view. Our daughter and her husband joined us the last few days, and their room was equally great.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana, a pleasure for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Donald61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for six nights in Feb. It is not a new resort, but it is well cared for and the grounds are beautiful. All rooms face the ocean and sat and watched the whales from our balconey. To let you know how much we liked it we made reservations for Feb. of next year. You cannot go wrong here. Besides you have a kitchen and a washer and dryer. You just cannot imagine how nice that is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: toodles4
Reviews.Content: We took our whole family to hawaii and stayed at the mahana because a friend had stayed there before. There were nine of us and we had two sets of rooms. My children and their family stayed in a updated room that was very nice. It had all the things other patrons mentioned. ( granite and flate screen TV's.) Our room was not as nice,but was just fine for the three of us. Our grandson stayed with us and slept on the couch. WE all had beautiful views of the ocean. My main complaint was that we did not recieve a 2 bath one bedroom but instead got one BR and could not be changed unless we paid over a 100.00 more each night for one more bathroom.. The front desk was not that nice either. I think if you book with someone other that Aston that they treat you differently. We had a few other concerns that were addressed by the Manager Mark after we came home. We may go back this year but will book directly with them instead of a agent. The location is great there, but I do not recomment it for children or teenagers. I think the Aston kaanapali shores would be better for teenagers with more activities available. As everyone else has said buying at Costco is cheaper but if there is only two of you I think going across the street to the grocery store would be about as cheap. We found a few items cheaper than Costco . such as Scallops and some steaks. Costco is cheaper for Milk ,eggs and large quanities of items, but if there is only two people I don't feel you would save that much. The pictures are right off our balcony!!

Reviews.Title: “More like my Hawaiian Home...I actually puddled up when leaving”
Reviews.Author: bnelson88
Reviews.Content: The Mahana is a unique expereince in the Hawaiian islands. First of all, the location and view...it's RIGHT ON the beach, not across a road, not ocean view...there is NOTHING between you and the water other than a tiny strip of sand. We had our huge window open and listened to waves all night long. We found accommodations to be very comfortable, spacious and well appointed. Staff was lovely, but completely unobtrusive. This is really more like your Hawaiian home than a hotel. What some of the reviews miss are the advantages of this location. Not only is it RIGHT ON Kaanapali beach, but it's at the end of a 2.5 mile beach boardwalk, so you can literally walk for miles the entire length of the beach, visit all the hotels, resturants and shopping without moving your car. Snorkle at Black Rock, surf in front of the hotel, whale watch from your lanai...it's all right there. But that's just the beginning. This place is literally a block away from a full service grocery, open till 2 AM, several moderately priced resturants and a gear rental place. Less than half a mile away is an organic grocery and the best fish market on the island. So you can decide whether to go out for dinner, or pick up today's catch and a bottle of wine and eat on your deck listening to the waves. Oh, and while all units are different, mine had a nicer kitchen than my house! On our third day, drinking coffee and whale watching from the deck I asked my husband what he wanted to do that day....his reply..."I'm doing it"...made total sense to me. If what you want is an ultra luxury hotel with the fantastic lobby and fake waterfalls, this is not your place. If what you want is a chance to do your own thing, relax in comfort and listen to your own drummer, and feel like you live in Hawaii, this is your place. We'll be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: hespower
Reviews.Content: This hotel has perhaps the best location / aspect along the entire beach front. (Really !) Our Condo was large and very comfortable. The huge full length windows are fantastic and almost all day there were whales not far off shore. Where else can you watch whales frolicing from your bedroom or lounge room? The facilities are first class and management are great. We had a small issue on arrival and the General Manager was extremley pleasant and had it sorted in a few minutes flat. Just fabulous service. We have since walked through and driven past a number of the nearby resorts and are very happy we chose here. Aston Mahana next time for sure. We have a bunch of us coming here for a 50th birthday next year. The search is already done, Aston Mahana Maui has got our $'s. Any Aussie folks thinking of where to stay, don't hessitate here. Just email me and I'll respond, no problem. Anyone else for that matter too. Mahalo.... and cheers... Bruce Heseltine Brisbane, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Aston Mahana”
Reviews.Author: MoreVacations:)
Reviews.Content: Sorry, but it has taken me a little longer than it usually does for me to post a review. My wife, 3 year old son and I stayed at the Aston Mahana for 8 nights in late November, early December. It was a great place for us to stay during our trip to Maui, which was a combination of just relaxing and taking a few day trips (Blue Hawaii helicopter tour, the road to Hana and up to the summit of Haleakala). The Mahana is not a typical hotel such that the rooms are individually owned condos which are managed as hotel rooms by Aston while not being used by the owners. It is not a timeshare property. Our unit was great. Had a separate bedroom with a queen sized bed, a large bathroom, washer and dryer, full kitchen, living room and a nice, screened in balcony. Having the washer and dryer, as well as the kitchen really was handy, especially as eating out can quickly add up. Food was more expensive than in Honolulu, even the groceries were quite a shock when compared to the prices back home. One tip, apply for the Safeway card that can really save you money on your groceries. Another tip, if you are only going to stay for a short time, you should consider bringing some basics with you if you can, unless you want to pick up some $5 aluminum foil. As a guest, you have access to a number of bbqâ€™s, both out back as well as out front, first come first serve. We never had a problem getting our turn. There is a pool and a hot tub if you donâ€™t want to hit the sand, but the area is not very large. Speaking of sand, the beach out front is not good for swimming because of the coral but it is only a short walk. The beach itself is very nice. The guests, at least when we were there, were mostly families and older couples. If you are young and looking for a place to party, this area may not be the best one for you. If you want a tasty meal at a close by restaurant, head out to Dukeâ€™s which is right next door. The place is really popular though so you should try and make reservations. The only real negative in my opinion is that the Wifi only works really well in the lobby areas. Our room was on the third floor, near the lobby, so we were able to access it primarily from the balcony. Now the last thing I want to mention, and praise, is the staff. They were so friendly and helpful and always had a smile on their faces.

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: candy5011
Reviews.Content: We (my siblings and I) booked this hotel because of the reviews. We certainly weren't disappointed! Our 2 bedroom condo (#911) was superb! It was not only clean and comfortable, but very updated. The views were "to die for," and the whale watching was "the best." We watched the sun set over Lanai from our balcony (lanai), and enjoyed the peace and quiet this condo provided. We scheduled many activities (whale watching, snorkeling, kayaking, horseback riding, hiking, etc.) and the Mahana isn't too far from these (about 7 miles to Lahaina). We enjoyed this condo because it was small and private. We also ate some meals at Duke's (next door), so you've got top notch restaurants next door (walking distance). It was about a 25 minute walk to Black Rock to snorkel, but a beautiful walk down the beach! There's also a walking/running path along there, too. This condo is more for adults. If you're looking for a large resort with lots of activities and people, this is not for you. It was so relaxing! You don't need to bring beach towels because you can pick them up everyday before you go to the beach or out and about. Just return them to the front desk or just leave them in the room to be picked up by the maid service. We will definitely stay at this condo again!

Reviews.Title: “we are going back”
Reviews.Author: Syd08154954
Reviews.Content: Mahana - Jan 10- 26th We were amazed by the sound and sights of the ocean, which we would see and hear from every room in our condo. The condo was clean and very spacious. We were upgraded promptly upon request, they even moved our stuff for us. The staff were very friendly and warm - the true aloha spirit! Karen at the front desk was always wlecoming and a pleasure to see each day. She has a way about her that made all her guests feel important. We were very please with the on site Expedia person. Her name was Susan Ramos. She was awsome and a person we can now call a new freind. She was informatiove and really listened to our needs and vacation plans. She was able to put together a fantastic activity schedule for us, she was even willing to take our dog (which she did on 4 ocassions/one on her day off) for the activities which were not accommodiating to animal. Susan has the Aloha spirit and you left her feeling completely taken care of. Thanks you Susan!!!! Everything about our stay at the Mahana was great and we are most certainly returning next year. Lance, Dianne, Sydney and Alberta

Reviews.Title: “The best whale views in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Bjwhales
Reviews.Content: We went to see whales and it exceeded all of our best expectations! We sat on our lanai or in our air conditioned living room with floor to ceiling windows and watched whale after whale. We kept trying to leave our room but were so enthralled by the close views we could hardly stand to leave. As far as we could tell no other place was as close to the beach with such exceptional views. It was close to stores and small restaurants. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: SilverXFire
Reviews.Content: Wow!! what a nice place to stay. Not a full service resort, but condo with full kitchen. We stayed on the 9th floor overlooking the Ocean with views of Lanai and Molokai. Whales were everywhere, splashing, spouting, playing...babys jumping. Just sitting in the room was fun!. But toured the rest of the island, shopped, snorkled, Road to Hana etc.. Was nice having a kitchen for those late night returns. Great for breakfast and coffee. Only downside was swimming and snorking were a couple hundred yards either side of the condo. In front, the sharp reefs made it a safety issue. Nice swimming a short walk either way.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THE MAHANA!!”
Reviews.Author: Kansasfarmers
Reviews.Content: Our trip was Jan 10th-15th, and we couldn't have asked for a more beautiful room, and so close to the ocean!!! From our balcony you can see both Molokai and Lanai islands! And we spotted whales each day from our balcony, with pics to prove it!!! The Mahana is beautiful in every way!!! The kitchen area was full sized with every amenity you could ask for!! Susan, the Expedia adviser (concierge) was excellent!! So helpful and knowledgeable!! The staff was courteous. The pool and hot tub so close to the ocean. Gorgeous! Our room had everything you could need for a wonderful stay!! The grounds around the hotel are well kept. Would have loved to stay longer, but left for another island. Thanks Mahana for a wonderful memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING, VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: CantonLady
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 days here in December, 2010. The condo complex is absolutely outstanding, I wish I could give it more than 5 stars. The staff is supurb, Karen at the front desk, Mark the manager and Susan the Expedia Guest Services representative. All went the extra mile to help us during our stay. The view is breathtaking and the grounds are very convenient to all activities on the island. The best new thing is the beach walk opened in 2010. You can go through the condo parking lot and walk 5 miles all the way to the Hyatt. Dukes a great restaurant is right next door. There are many beach facilities along the walkway if you want to stop and swim, walk, whatever. Great jog in the AM. There is no much to do on the island or you can do nothing. The units are updated yearly and my fav unit, 915, had many upgrades next year. I always rent from the condo itself, NOT VRBO, because of the personal assistance. The deposit is small and balance is not due until you check out. If you need anything, call the front desk and they are right there for you. Parking is free, there is a great grocery store across the street and a great pizza place in the same complex. You are about 15 minutes from Lahaina, a great place to shop on Front Street, restaurants, etc. If you go, you must try Kemo's and Ruth Chriss Steakhouse. They are wonderful. Had a great lunch at Cheeseburger in Paradise. This town reminds me a lot of St. Thomas in the Virgin Islands. Overall, you will not go wrong with this location. I am planning on making this a yearly condo rental and hope the pricing stays within range. THANK YOU MAHANA FOR A WONDERFUL VACATION. My ratings for this hotel Value Rooms Location Cleanliness Service Sleep Quality

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Longtallangie
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, and the fact that all units face the ocean. Also liked that this is a small, quiet accommodation, but this may not suit everyone, the pool area is small as are the grounds. Our studio condo (403) was pretty comfortable except for the bed which was supposed to be a queen but was a double and we are tall people so it was cozy! Also the wi fi mostly didn't work - it was pretty exciting when we could connect to the internet. I think each unit is outfitted differently as they are individually owned, so next time I would try to get one with a larger bed a more comfortable chairs for relaxing in. Great to have free parking, the maid service was great, and it's nice to have the shops across the street for groceries, booze and even restaurants if you need them.

Reviews.Title: “Money CAN buy a bit of paradise”
Reviews.Author: noduvet2010
Reviews.Content: I'm a research nut before I make most big decisions so took heart in all of the amazing reviews on Trip Advisor for the Aston Mahana. I was hard-pressed to find any negative comments and now I know first-hand why! Although a little tricky to find (once you're on the Kanaapali stretch of highway, and you pass through the intersection with the Budget Car Rental outlet on your right hand side, take the FIRST left-hand turn lane that comes up and follow the road down until you see 3 hotel signs on your left side, one of which is the Aston Mahana - follow this road - the Mahana is the last of the 3 hotels). Because we were there pre-Christmas, we got to delight in the outrageouly fragrant, massive Christmas tree set up in the foyer - no one could tell me what kind of tree it was; it looked like a pine tree, but smelled like a hibiscus... that was our first impression, and things just kept getting better. We dealt with lovely people at the front desk, and then made our way to our gorgeous studio room on the 11th floor.... truly stunning views, and the room itself was a beautifully updated haven at the end of each day. The sub-zero fridge, and well-appointed kitchen (all new stainless appliances) all made for efficient and easy use (tip: we stopped in at Costco en route from the airport and stocked up on some easily-prepared meals: at $4.99 for a huge roasted chicken, you can get creative for lots of great lunches and simple dinners. Oh, and 100% Kona coffee - Costco seems to be the best place as far as I could see for value. For last minute meal prep needs, the Times grocery store, a quick 5 min walk across the street provided great variety.) Arriving just at the onset of whale season, we were treated one morning to a 3 hour show, right off of our lanai, to an incredible dance of whales breeching and playing. Our camera's zoom lens, and daughter's steady hand provided for some incredible keepsake images. Whales, surfers, sunsets, people watching, and general tranquility were enjoyed at all times of the day on that lanai. It is incredible that every single unit offers the same beachfront opportunity, although perspective would be different on each floor; I'm sure that each holds its own charm. Apparently, building codes no longer permit construction that close to the beach so it is truly a decadent treat to reside there. In terms of proximity, the Mahana is very well-situated. It's true that the beach directly in front of the hotel is not great for swimming due to the reef, but steps in either direction affords easy access for snorkelling or general surf play. You can also walk the boardwalk up to the Sheraton (about a 30 min walk), passing gorgeous private residences, and beachfront restaurants along the way - we had a lovely breakfast at the Castaway one morning, and have heard good things about Duke's but didn't get to it ourselves). A quick 5 min car ride north to Napili beach was another lovely outing with great meals available at the Gazebo, also right on the beach. We didn't get to see them ourselves, but apparently turtles like to hang out here. We attended the complimentary breakfast that the activities co-ordinator, based out of the Mahana, invited us to, and if anything it was a good crash-course on what is available to do on the island. We had already read up on most things (I did say I liked to research... and would highly recommend the book Maui Revealed, which is available at Maui Costco, and has a great companion website). We booked a couple of activities through the activities co-ordinator (the Molokini snorkel was really great!) and by agreeing to take in a time-share presentation through another company, saved a WHACK of cash on the luau we attended. I must say, those time-share presentations are NOT for the weak of conviction or financial means! Old Lahaina town is about a 7-8 min drive south and full of character, restaurants (Cheeseburger in Paradise and Bubba Gump's were quite good), and retail, retail, retail! You must see the Banyan Tree - quite magnificent and truly magical when done up with all of the Christmas lights. The ONLY negative experience we had at the Mahana was in relation to their "No-Smoking" policy in rooms and on the lanai. Apparently, if you're a visitor, you can face harsh fines upwards of $400 for disregarding the rule.... HOWEVER, if you are an owner, the staff (as lovely as they are) feel that their hands are tied and cannot enforce the rule... a double-standard to be sure. We were only in Maui for a week and didn't want to exhaust ourselves running about from one activity or location to the next, so found our location to be the perfect mix of all that we were looking for. I know that many of the neighboring resorts had fitness facilities and much more extravagant rooms and ammenities, but truly, being beachfront was FAR superior for us than having a goosedown duvet! Falling asleep to the sound of the crashing surf and a night sky FULL of stars (no city lights to compete with), and waking to brilliant blue sky and endless ocean is all we needed to feel COMPLETELY satisfied and refreshed by our selection and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Crossborder_10
Reviews.Content: Folks, my wife and I stayed at the Mahana from Dec 7 â€“ 14 and had an absolutely wonderful experience in every way. The location, accommodation, service, amenities and general feeling connected to the Mahana were absolutely top quality. We selected the Mahana after reading the many positive reviews on Trip Advisor and then made our reservations through Royal Hawaii Condo rentals. I must admit that I was a little concerned, I didnâ€™t actually know anyone who had been to the Mahana before and wondered about the accuracy and reliability of the reviews. However, we shouldn't have worried at all, when we arrived we were simply blown away by our whole experience. We reserved a premium one bedroom unit on the 9th floor and it was simply stunning. It was beautifully decorated using premier materials, including marble floors and granite counter tops, rosewood cabinetry and the very latest in stainless steel appliances. This unit had every convenience, it was warm, inviting and you couldnâ€™t help but feel important staying there. I canâ€™t speak to other units but this one was fabulous. The view was incredible and our timing was great because the Humpbacks were just arriving from Alaska and coming into the bay out front of the condo. We witnessed whales breaching the surface from day one, it was simply amazing. Not to be overlooked though were the incredible sunsets from the Lanai and the sound of the surf every night to lull us to sleep, worth every penny. The whole area around Kaanapali is beautiful, take a walk on the beach towards Black Rock you wonâ€™t be disappointed. On one of the days we drove over to the other side of Black Rock and snorkeled so close to a pair of sea turtles you could reach out and touch them, they must be used to this they were so laid back, I wondered whom was watching whom. There all kinds of great options to dine in the local area, Dukeâ€™s is right next door and make sure you visit Lahaina, see the Banyon tree and then stroll the shops, you canâ€™t go wrong if you have dinner at Kimoâ€™s on the water to witness a fabulous sunset while having your meal. We highly recommend the Mahana and Royal Hawaii Condoâ€™s to assist you with reservations. We will be back, no question about it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ocean Front View for the Price”
Reviews.Author: ronu2
Reviews.Content: All of the reviews are very accurate. Here are the main points: The Mahana is an older condo building that has been remodeled for the most part. By this, I mean that there are some pretty nasty rooms that have not been remodeled. If you get stuck in one, you should ask to be moved or ask for your money back. We were first put in a room that was old and smelled really bad. We asked to be moved and the Mahana accommodated our request. The newly remodeled room was awesome, granite counter tops, flat screen televisions, nice decor. Because the Mahana is older, it is right on the beach, like fifty feet max, hence the fantastic views from the rooms. Most newer resorts are set back 100yds or more. The only problem is you can't swim at the beach. You have to walk 100yds in either direction. The staff at the Mahana were very nice. The place is kept very clean. We would definitely go back. We only had one bad experience and that was with a business called MVP Photography. They have fliers at the front desk and offer a free 8x10 portrait. We decided to have family photos made and give them as gifts for the holidays. It has been six weeks since the photo's were taken and we have not been able to contact the business. They basically took our money. MVP Photography is a scam, beware. I have contacted the Mahana and provided them the details.

Reviews.Title: “Holy View Batman! Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiigirl44
Reviews.Content: Ocean front property. Incredible view. Simply unmatched. I have stayed in many Hawaii hotels and this is the best view by far. I have stayed here 3 times. There is a wall to wall window and nice balconies with table and chairs. Great place to view the sunset. I woke one morning, opened my eyes to the ocean and saw a whale breaching! Great way to start my day. I wish they had a hot tub, only a pool here. Room was clean. Some of the staff had attitudes but didn't bother me and other staff members made up for it. Both the one bedroom suites and the studio suites are great. Word of advice, SUNBLOCK. Burned on the first day but the view was so awesome didn't mind staying in the room until it got better. Great in suite kitchens. Grocery store nearby. The driveway into the property under the canopy of trees is so beautiful! We had those tiny ants in our room, 'nonos' but it wasn't a problem, just seal up your food or put it in the fridge. Typical Hawaiian decor in the room, nothing fancy or fabulous, but comfortable. The beds were comfortable enough. Room was ok, view was amazing. don't expect a big sandy beach, but you can walk to one from here. Great off shore snorkeling at Kaanapali beach. Drive the road to Hana in a convertible if you can. Find Makena beach, or 'Big Beach' but use caution swimming there, biiiig strong undertow. Pacific Whale Foundation has a fun day snorkeling trip to Molokini, nice lunch (sandwiches and fruit) and snorkeling if you are into deep water snorkeling (which I am not, scared me right back onto the boat). Lahaina is a cute little town, watch out for local kids trying to sell you drugs though. Just say no! Relaxing trip, good for a romantic getaway. If traveling with kids I'd suggest Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana is even better the second time!”
Reviews.Author: Chas3
Reviews.Content: So that I am not redundant in a lot of details please read my review from our first stay here in 2006. When we left the Mahana in '06 we knew that if we were returning to Maui we would definately stay here again. For the value you cannot beat this place. Everything in Hawaii is very expensive- $4 Gas, $4.50 Gal Milk, $25 a night to park your car at an Oahu hotel, etc... When you stay at the Mahana you don't feel like you were ripped-off, or nickel and dimed. We're not wealthy people and have been hit by the economy like many of you. It takes us many years to save up for a trip like this. On our first stay here we did not fully utilize having a well-equiped kitchen in the unit and several beautiful gas grill downstairs. This time we went to Costco on our first full day and stocked up on groceries & beverages. I was eating cereal and drinking orange juice on our balcony while watching whales-every morning! We would take steaks down to the poolside grills, bring them back to the room, whip up some Mai Tai's or Pina Colada's in the blender and have a sunset meal on our balcony. We really dug our heels in and relaxed here. There's also a nice beach boardwalk that goes south. This path seems to go for almost a mile (though down further it snakes through some off-beach areas) and you can take it down to the Sheraton Black Rock. There's also a nice beach about midway that has restrooms, picnic tables and sandy shorelines (the water at the Mahana is rocky). You can also walk to the new Duke's restaurant, which is open for 3 meals and serves some great hula pie. Anyway, for our 11-night stay here we could not have been happier. The G.M., Mark, helped us out tremendously and we are very thankful for his help. We love Maui and hope that we will again return, and when we do guess where we'll stay?!

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach, mostly clean, really dated & soiled upholstry on couch & chairs”
Reviews.Author: redrileydog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aston Mahana from Dec.1-6th 2010 in a one bedroom, two bath Condo. As described the entry is at the back of the condo. Living room and bedroom was facing the ocean, it was a great view. The waves were so loud at night we had to close the doors.The couch - I couldn't believe that the seams were ripped and poorly repaired (hope the photos show this). The two living room chairs were soiled yuck! We requested sheets from housekeeping and covered all three pieces and I felt much better that we did not have to sit on dirty furniture. When inquiring and making reservations the aston staff at the 1-800 location mentioned that they almost always upgraded and asked if we had any requests. So I requested an upper floor away from the elevator. Upon arrival we were slated for the 5th floor I requested a different room and ended on the 8th floor and we never did receive an upgrade. This condo bldg. was quiet mostly age 40 and up saw one family with a small child. The cleanliness in the rest of the condo was quite clean. The king size bed was heavenly but the sleeper sofa was well a sleeper sofa really not good for teenagers but there own room was going to be another $100.00 a night. We did research obtaining this condo through Costco but found the cancellation guidelines costly. Since we were in Hawaii before (second time to Maui) we were prepared for sticker shock in the grocery stores. My husband eats cream of wheat, which is $2.88 in Cleveland was & $7.00 there. Although this is a vacation we did prepare by packing a few items which we did find expensive which gave us more room for souvigners. We of coarse love our Costco membership and it came in handy on both islands where we shopped, bought gifts and ate several times both on Ohau (Nov.27- Dec1) and on Maui. Both stores have Hawaiian items. Let me tell you about some great tips for shopping there and go over a few prices: Gal. Milk $4.36 & $3.99 (fat free) motts applesauce (36 count) $8.99 same price at home Dry Roasted Macadamias 6 (4.5oz cans) $15.99 O Hawaii Fine shortbread cookies at Costco 28.99 set of four boxes M auna Loa Macadamia Nuts - Gift Set of 6 $20.99 at ABC: $17.49 Costco Maui blend coffee (10%) 2# was 12.29/ Costco; at the maui coffee roaster store $14.40 per # to order it from home on the web. I could kick myself for not buying more. It is the most delicious coffee. They also had very fresh leis. On Maui there are no fuel pumps to gas up your rental car. The Costco is about five minutes from the Airport and the Mahana is about a 45 minute drive away. Close by to the Costco is a Walmart and K mart In all the Mahana in Kaanapali was nice I was told that condos further up the road were more reasonable. Also check your private individuals who rent out their condos at the Mahana on the VRBO website. The accommodations may be more updated for the money. We never saw any whales or turtles that week- guess I'll have to go back. PS I recommend flying from LA not Houston that put on an extra 3 hrs of flying

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: doreenpow
Reviews.Content: I booked through Royal Hawaii after spending lots of time on the VRBO website, trying to match my needs up with owners' calendars. One of the VRBO owners suggested Royal Hawaii as the next best way to get into Mahana. They gave me a good price, the dates I needed, and even accommodated my request for a room near the top. I booked my next stay at Mahana through the Mahana front desk. Can't wait to see whales from the lanai! I've noticed on the Royal Hawaii web site, as well as others, that Mahana rooms are "standard" or "deluxe." Our room was "standard" but had lovely furnishings and finishes. As far as I'm concerned, there is no reason to pay more money for a deluxe room here because the standard room is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: travelguy134
Reviews.Content: You simply can't beat an ocean front room at such affordable prices. We stayed on the 12th floor (top floor), which we were excited about and slept to the sound of the ocean with the balcony door open each night. It was nice to have a full kitchen to save on breakfast costs and some lunch costs. The hotel does a nice job of equipping you with cleaning supplies, which helps cut down on costs at the grocery store. The pool area is small, but it never felt crowded and was usually pretty quiet. As others have mentioned you can't swim right in front of the hotel, but there are perfectly fine areas just a couple hundred feet in either direction. Those beaches were swimmable, but a little rocky so we went to D.T. Fleming beach most days. That beach is only a 10 minute drive away and was great for swimming and wakeboarding. The staff was generally friendly and helpful, although a couple of the front desk employees were slow to help and not the most attentive, but nothing that would prevent us from coming back. Overall, the hotel is pretty quiet - not many kids when we stayed - and given that you're guaranteed an oceanfront room and relatively close to the other main resorts, the value is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view!!!”
Reviews.Author: Champagneandcupcakes
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location. We were in the dolphin room 213, and it was convenient to have a kitchen and washer/dryer. There is a grocery store 1/4km away. Rainbows and beautiful sunsets were plentiful and it was fun to drink champagne or coffee on the lanai and watch the surfers.

Reviews.Title: “Want a beautiful ocean view? This is the place”
Reviews.Author: BettyTravel49
Reviews.Content: My sister, daughter in law and myself checked in room #1105 on a very rainy night. The check in was fast, freindly and efficient. Thank heavens since our flight from New York State kept us up about 24 hours at this point. The room was newly refurbished. The kitchen had granite counter tops, really nice white cabinets and stainless steel appliances. The living room/ dining area was larger than I anticipated. The bedroom had a king bed (mattress was just ok - I have back problems so most mattresses are just ok for me). The main bathroom had a tub with sliding glass doors and beautiful tile work, again it looked new. The second bathroom was a tiled walk in with a two wall glass enclosure. Absolutely gorgeous. we went across the street to Subway for sandwiches, ate and called it a day. We could not believe our eyes the next morning when we woke up. Since we couldn't see anything when we arrived due to the rain and darkness, we didn't know what the view would be. One entire wall in the livingroom was a window. There was nothing between us and the Pacific Ocean. The laini was off the master bedroom and the living room with a table and 4 chairs as well as a chaise. We used it often for reading, sunning and snacking. If you go to Maui for a view, you would never need to leave the room. We also were surprised when we left the room. We opened the door and had another fabulous view: mountains , other condos and could still see part of the ocean. We used the large hot tub most nights and did get into the pool a couple of times. You couldn't do better than this hotel for your stay in Maui. Also, the best grocery store was a 10 minute walk (next to the Subway) called Times. Good prices and variety. We did go to the Safeway about 4 miles away in the Cannery Mall but it was a little more expensive and crowded. also the best palce to find affordable souviners was Long's Drugs on the Cannery Mall. Great prices on macadamia nuts, candy and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck!”
Reviews.Author: justvisiting78_510
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. We found the room in excellent condition, it was very clean and comfortable. The views of the ocean couldn't be beat! We visited the island the week of the Labor Day holiday and it was not crowded at all, the perfect time to visit! The front desk attendants were okay, but far from spectacular. They seemed annoyed with everyone they helped, but other than that, it was a perfect stay! We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to the island.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: 5986shelena
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on vacation to Hawaii for the first time. I had no idea where to stay, so I looked on TripAdvisor for a condo in Maui. I read so many great reviews for Aston Mahana that I thought we would give it a try. It was fabulous!!! We stayed in room 912 and loved every minute of it. The studio/1 bath had granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, flat screen TV, comfy bed, window shades, glass/tile shower, and great decor. The best part was the view!! It was floor to ceiling views of the ocean. My husband and I sat out on the lanai many times to eat or just watch people surfing and snorkeling. The sound of the ocean was great when falling asleep and waking up. The staff was great and so friendly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Condo - Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: dsmoothe
Reviews.Content: We spent the first half of our honeymoon at the Aston Mahana and had a great experience. We stayed in Unit #305 which is a private unit (so no daily maid service). It is right on the ocean and we slept and awoke to the sound of the ocean. Kitchen was well equipped and condo had 2 big screen tvs and a state of the art sound system (not that we spent much time using it) but we did watch a few shows. Nice Beach a few yards down from property beach (which is narrow and sloping). Even nicer Kaanapali beach about 5 min walk. Nice pool and spa as well. There were not many younger couples (or young kids) but the older folks there were friendly and fun! Only negative is that someone attempted to jimmy open the driver side door of our convertible mustang re rented. They didn't get in and nothing was taken. The Mahana was understanding, took a full report and provided me with a copy for the rental car company. I didn't call the police for fear of spending hours filing an "official" report. No big deal in the scheme of things. I highly recommend this place. Paid $225/night and well worth it. FYI if you rent a condo ( which I recommend) pack spices and other non perishables you may want to eat b/c the supermarket prices are about 30-4-% higher for many things. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable views and value”
Reviews.Author: roamingnoni
Reviews.Content: We had the most incredible stay at Mahana last week. All oceanfront units....we were on 3rd floor so could still see the palm trees along with sunsets and full moon. Will definitely return for the great beaches, snorkeling right outside. Duke's and Whalers'Village within walking distance for happy hour/meals. Great staff and comfortable suites! Thank you, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Paradise”
Reviews.Author: livinglifeover50
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the hotel front desk staff (Larissa) was so nice she made you feel very welcomed. She checked us in quickly and was always smiling. Our room (817) was wonderful. We were very happy with our room. It was a 1 bedroom suite. Clean and roomy. Every day we would go out and come back to clean towels, garbage taken out and floors vacuumed. We didn't do much cooking because we were on vacation, but we did cook breakfast every morning and cleaned up after ourselves. Not much mess. Larissa gave us information on the restaurants near by and the supermarket, Tymes, which is right across the street from the hotel. You can walk there. Where Tymes is at there is a strip mall there with some fast food services. When we went on the Road to Hana we bought a styrofoam cooler from Tymes and walked to the Subway down the strip for sandwiches to take with us. We stayed 6 nights. They went fast. Helicopter ride, luau, road to Hana and beach fun was all we can fit in. The hotel pool area was very relaxing. We have to admit that we liked the pool area better than the beach. It was shady and sunny and relaxing. My husband loves to lounge in the shade. I love to lounge in the sun. Best of both worlds. The hotel grounds were Hawaii all the way. Beautiful. Palm trees swaying in the wind with beautiful flowers everywhere. I would definitely come back to Mahana. So peaceful and serene. Service is excellent. Nothing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Amazing Trip”
Reviews.Author: mdmom1924
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui for my nephews wedding. We rented 6 different rooms on different floors. Every floor had an amazing ocean view. Every room was decorated differently but very nice. It felt like we were at home with an ocean view. Our family used the BBQ facilities and hung around the pool area. We all have decided that we are returning next year and staying at the Ashton Mahana. Amazing trip and perfect place for families to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maui and our Condo!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal1970
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary & decided to go to Maui for a week. After much research I gave up and found a travel agent who has been living on Maui for 20 yrs so she knows Maui inside & out. Kay Ryan has a warm & friendly personality & provides helpful tips. Her website is mauikay.com. Also, buy the book Maui Revealed by Andrew Doughty which is a great resource of finding restaurants, activities, etc while staying in Maui. He also provides maps. The book costs less than $14 if you order online. Kay found us this condo right on the beach. Eating out can be very expensive so we wanted to be able to cook some meals in and we could also pack fewer clothes with a washer/dryer right in the unit. We chose a studio with a King sized bed on the top floor. With 2 adults the space was adequate as most of the time you'll be out sunbathing, sightseeing or shopping anyway. The view from the lanai was fantastic! There really are floor to ceiling windows looking which gives you a view of the ocean & mountains. While there we saw three rainbows. Awesome! When you arrive at the condo go down & check out the pool area which has 4 grills for barbecuing.
