If you ask Kay she can recommend a seafood place where you can purchase fresh seafood which is not too far from the condo (get the crab cakes which are wonderful). We also snorkeled at Black Rock which is near the Sheraton Hotel which you can see from your lanai if you lean out slightly & look to your left if you're on one of the higher floors. There are snorkeling tours but why pay for something when you can do this for free with the exception of renting your snorkeling gear. Also drove the road to Hana in our convertible Mustang which we enjoyed. Again you can pay to take a bus tour or can drive yourself & not be a slave to their schedule. Driving the road is 44 mi long & we only made it a little over half way because it's a long & winding road. Pack a picnic lunch because places to eat are few & far between. There's a Safeway grocery store near the condo where we purchased an insulated cooler & food for the trip. There's also a Snorkel Bobâ€™s where you can rent gear. Two activities you that are a must do are the luau in Lahaina (most authentic) & if your budget allows take the helicopter tour which was well worth the money. Kay can help with booking the luau & book early to get the best table. We booked the helicopter tour from the Expedia desk which is on the 1st floor of the condo. We selected the hour long tour which the hour goes by very fast. We loved Maui and hope to be back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay!!!! Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: superstina13
Reviews.Content: Went here for my honeymoon and couldn't have been more pleased. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. We were given a room on the first floor, but after reading reviews on TripAdvisor I aksed for a different room on a higher floor. They quickly accommodated me with a room on the fifth floor. We had a one bed/one bath condo and the view was indescribable! Condo was confortable and clean. Nothing too fancy, but we are very simple people. Pool was nice and the BBQ's were usually available and clean as well. Quick walk to the beach and beuatiful sunsets. I haven't slept a full night in 6-7 years and finally was able to the entire trip. I was very sad to go and am very pleased with out decision to stay at the Aston Mahana. I would definately come back and cannot wait to do so. While there is no restaurant in the "hotel" there are plenty of options to choose from. Highly recommend the Alhoa Mixed Plate which is about a 10 min drive. Only downside was we found the facility difficult to find at first.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome condos with great views!!”
Reviews.Author: gr8maui
Reviews.Content: We were at Aston Mahana for a week in August. Initially, we were assigned a condo on 2nd floor but we changed it to 11th floor. Every condo has ocean view. It was a mesmerizing view with two islands seen from the private lanai and awesome sunsets right from your condo (though we were always out on other beaches at sunset except for the first day when we arrived). The service was good - rooms were cleaned everyday with towels/sheets replaced every 3 days. They also gave extra beach towels which came handy. Lot of good places to eat nearby. Morning walk on hotel-side beach was very serene and peaceful. Wifi is available in lanai and close to windows. Parking is free. Overall, a nice place to live in Maui. Will definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, amazing views, fabulous vacation!”
Reviews.Author: LilEllie
Reviews.Content: I rented from mauibeachvacation.com directly from the owner Sue. Her unit was so clean and had everything there for us! I even used her little cooler when I went to Hana. She had ice packs and ice in the freezer. It was so convenient. She also had boogie boards, and snorkeling masks, but I didn't take advantage of those fun activities, since I was only there for 5 days. Her unit also had a washer/dryer and it was so convenient to do laundry. She also had plenty of towels for you to use. We loved the local restaurants, like Da Kitchen and Aloha Plate. We also had a lot of fun at the Old Lahaina Luau. We went zip lining with Eco Adventure tours in Ka'napaali and they provided great service and great fun. Please tip the guides! We also went snorkeling half day with Ocean Raft, but would definitely skip this company since it's advertised that they take you to Lanai island, instead they just took us to Honolua Bay. I would definitely go with a bigger boat and different company next time. We also went on a powered hang glide and it was soo amazing! Maui is so beautiful! I can't wait to go back. Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “The Aston Mahana lives up to it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: LuvinMaui23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in room 1105 for 9 nights to celebrate our 25th anniversary. It was a one bedroom, two bathroom unit. The kitchen and bathrooms had been updated with granite counters and slate stone floors. We enjoyed nearly everything about the Mahana. The only thing that was less than stellar was the mattress. It was way past its need to be replaced. My husband has back issues and I don't but after a couple of nights on that mattress even I had a sore back. The staff was very helpful and did try to accommodate us with a foam pad on our bed. The living room sofa could use some updating but everything else was really nice. The view was priceless and the grounds were always pristine - like the room was. Our housekeeper was always concerned with our satisfaction and did a fantastic job. Any questions or concerns we had were always completely answered by Karen at the front desk. Mahalo Karen! We loved the location and would never stay anywhere else. We will be back with our family in June and can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: jcg1958
Reviews.Content: Everyone at front desk was professional and friendly. The room was great, with great views. Location was idea, good pool right on the beach. Not swimmer friendly but close to good snorkeling and other water activities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location on the best beach.”
Reviews.Author: CarolHarb
Reviews.Content: Three couples on a 40 year reunion trip, found this on Trip Advisor. These are condos, one of a few where you can rent for days instead of an entire week. Special rates for age 50+, but is also family friendly. Location can't be beat, every room is ocean front. Very clean, excellent pool area and very friendly and helpful personnel throughout the resort. Only drawback is there is no on-site restaurant, but we didn't care as each unit came with a full kitchen and the Times supermarket is right across the street. Only about 3 miles north of Lahaina, adjacent to beautiful golf courses and good local restaurants. Would go back there in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Best Waterfront Condo in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: OCgirl2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving in 2009 and it was in a great location - right on the beach! We loved having a kitchen and a washer/dryer. The rooms aren't fancy but worth it for the price to be so close to the ocean. The view was beautiful. It's a condo but operates like a hotel with room service and all. The condos are 10 minutes from Lahaina to the south and 10 minutes from Kapalua Bay to the north. You can walk to Whaler's Village (about 30 minutes). Great spot! The Old Lahaina Luau was beautiful. We took a trip on the road to Hana one day, had lazy beach days, visited Wailea, took a snorkel trip out to Molokini and Lanai.

Reviews.Title: “The service is Super”
Reviews.Author: write2staceyz
Reviews.Content: We went there for our honeymoon. We actually have a comparison with another four star hotel, and to tell you the truth, this is better than four star hotels. Number one---room service. We checked on Tuesday noon. One Tuesday, the cleaning lady came in and asked me if I need any cleaning towel. How sweet is that! Yes, the front desk lady is very friendly, especially the elder one, I forgot her name, but she was very friendly and answered any questions. Number two---clean. They have room service everyday. Number three Location---We stayed on 8th floor. Everyday, we listen to the sound of ocean. My husband said that he had never experience this before. Number four---Quiet. Even though this is a condo, we would have expected a lot of family stay here. We didn't hear any noise from the neighbor. I am glad that they have AC because the room does get hot Number five ---Value. They have oven, cooking pans, salt, pepper, but not cooking oil. So we just bought cooking oil, and baked some food. My husband likes to eat out, but I like to eat at home. I feel eating at home is cheaper and healthier. There is a costco near the airport, so we bought some vegetables with good price. The washer and dryer is nice because we almost snorkeling everyday, and it is nice to wash and dry the swimming suite everyday. room---The room is big. I was surprised there are two bathrooms. One toilet of bathroom keeps leaking, so we turn it off, but the cleaning lady keeps turn it on after we turned it off. I do yoga in my room everyday. The decoration in the room is beautiful. There is a turtle decoration on the wall. We actually saw the real turtle (really big too!) in the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JAB0828
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana 08/30/2010 - 09/06/2010 for our honeymoon and had a great time. The resort was great and the view from the room was incredible. All of the staff was accomadating and provided us with great service. The location was also great as it was just minutes from Lahaina. We chose the place based on the customer reviews are were completely satisfied. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE!”
Reviews.Author: wjburns
Reviews.Content: The worst day of our honeymoon was the day we left this paradise! We spent five days at the Mahana, after having spent five days in Waikiki, and my husband and I agreed that we should have spent the entire time on Maui. Our unit was gorgeous...beautifully updated bathroom with nice tiled shower. Kitchen stocked with dishes, cookware, etc. There was even a blender for my usual morning yogurt smoothies that I had been missing. There aren't words to describe the view from the lanai...magnificent! From that lanai, we were treated to two of the most magical things that we have ever seen...a nighttime rainbow (didn't know that was even possible?) and the most amazing moonset that you can imagine. By car, you are only minutes to area grocery stores, drug stores, etc. You DO want to rent a car on Maui and the Mahana had ample free parking. There are a couple of grocery stores in the area so you can easily stock the kitchen and not have to spend a fortune on eating out for all meals. The Mahana doesn't offer breakfast (no restaurant)but that really wasn't a problem for us as we were already on food overload by the time we got Maui. The Beach Club restaurant at their beautiful sister property, Ka'anapali Shores, was very good and affordably priced. We had dinner there a couple of times and were not disappointed. You are a short walk from a nice beach...no beach right in front of the Mahana. We ended up driving down to Ka'anapali to go snorkeling at Black Rock...one word AMAZING! Great spot, great variety of fish, came face to face with Eagle rays and turtles! Incredible experience! We can't say enough about the Mahana and, if the opportunity ever presents itself again, would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth....................”
Reviews.Author: Badboyy1911
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mahana for our anniversary. Rented a condo there. Had 7th floor unit over looking and right on the ocean. Very quiet and romantc. Sunsets from the Lanai take your breah away The facilty overall was excellent and our room great. Its a fully furnished condo. A home away from home of sorts. Pots, pans, washer/dryer, full kitchen, living room, separate master bedroom, and patio/lanai. There is a nice pool, jacuzzi and many bbq grills there for your use. Concierge service is available to help you book excursions if you have a need. The Kaanapal location was central and close to Lahaina and Kapalua. Grocery stores, restaurants, and shops are close by. Its a good value compared to the larger resort properties. I highly reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: Icemanbrit13
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui, after doing research we decided to stay at the Mahana. We wanted the best view possible, access to shopping for cooking etc. We had a great room, the sun sets where absolutely amazing from our balcony. The staff where fantastic, especially Larissa. Grocery store 3 minutes away (Times its called) had everything we need had we forgetten anything. The beach out front is not the greatest for swimming, but, a 30 step walk down the back and you are in by far one of if not the best beach in Maui. Ka'anapali beach is awesome, the snorkelling was fantasic. Dukes beach house was not what i was expecting at all, i was expecting a hole in the wall type dive. It was great, 5 minute walk, great food and drinks. Overall the hotel was great, we would and will stay again. A great place to base our first memories in Maui. It is truly one of those spots that you want to tell everyone about, but want it to remain the way it is and not get over run.

Reviews.Title: “Is a nice mattress too much to ask for?”
Reviews.Author: BearNakedChris
Reviews.Content: Overall a great place. We stayed in a renovated studio and loved falling asleep to the ocean waves. We paid $180/night. Nice tile floors, redone showers. The only downside was the mattress. It had no support. The pool was great, nice shuffle board and access to the great beaches and snorkeling. A bit of a hike to the highly talked about "black rock" snorkeling area but there's ok snorkeling right outside the hotel. Free parking and a full kitchen along with laundry (no restaurant in the hotel though). Some shuffleboard, too. They do annoy you like other resorts with the offer of a "free" breakfast as they tell you about the activities. Overall, we love it and would go back - but still wish for a solid mattress.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: megtot
Reviews.Content: we stayed in room 319 and can only say it was perfect. the room was clean the people were great and the location was excellent. You are right on the beach and every room overlooks the ocean. Lahainia is a short 10 minute drive and about 20 minutes from the harbour if you are doing any boating excursions. A Safeway is about 10 minutes away and it convient considering our room was complete with a kitchen suite. Our room was a 2 bedroom, 2 bath and had everthing in it you needed. I have read on Tripadvisor how some rooms are out dated but I can say 319 was great and would recommend the Mahana to be your place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mauifan38
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mahana for a week in August 2010. Everything was perfect. The front staff was so helpful and friendly. All the rooms are oceanfront, you go to sleep listening to the sound of the waves and you wake up to the same sound. You can see and enjoy the beach, the outdoors from every corner of the rooms. I had a one bedroom, living room and 2 baths condo. It was tastefully furnished and it felt like a home away from home. The kitchen was stocked with everything including dishes, pots and pans and utensils, washer and dryer etc. The housekeeping staff kept it cleaned and fresh. Location is perfect, close to all, including shopping. I enjoyed my stay so much that we plan to return in the future, hopefully the near future. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel, none whatsoever and I am not easy to please.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views! A little out-dated unit..”
Reviews.Author: RockyLover
Reviews.Content: It was all about the views. The view was beautiful with a few palm trees in front of our balcony with the background of the sea. But the unit we stayed was a little out-dated, especially furniture. There were many things - stereo, big screen TV, VCR player, alarm clock, night stands, but dust on them wasn't nicely controlled. Also there was not enough space on the drawer to put your everyday stuff as the stereo occupied the space. We have NEVER seen a bug in the unit during our 9 days of stay but there was a guide note that implies there had been bug problems before. But I believe they are taking an intense care for that as I think of their intention of note and the fact that I haven't seen any. (Of course I put extra care for keeping everything clean and sealed) The disappointment actually came from the small bathroom with an old bath tub. Spots on the bottom of it made me uncomfortable. Many people say every unit is different because it's an owned-condo, but ours was not the best we hoped. But good for the value, definitely. You can hardly have the ocean front views with the same budget.

Reviews.Title: “It's as good as advertized--what a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: D_Richard_C
Reviews.Content: The Mahana is one of the rare exceptions to the rule of thumb that something that seems too good to be true probably is. The windows really do extend from the floor to the ceiling; the ocean views are amazing; the Mahana is so close to the ocean that it seems that the units are almost hanging over the sea below. And yes, you can see turtles swimming in the ocean next to the Mahana. We loved this place. The units were spaciousâ€”plenty big enough for our family of five including three teenagersâ€”and bigger than most condos we have stayed at in Florida and California. We stayed in two different units at different times on our vacation. Both were very nice, but one was exquisitely decorated in a Japanese style by the owner which certainly added to our pleasure staying in that unit. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant which also contributed to our enjoyment at staying at the Mahana. Every day we walked a few hundred yards down the beach where the snorkeling was excellent: beautiful coral, many kinds of colorful fish, and some turtles. The pool and spa were more than adequate for us, particularly since we were spending so much time in the ocean and doing other activities. We also didnâ€™t miss having a restaurant on the premises. There are a few within easy walking distance and many within a short drive, including some of the better Luaus. And finally thereâ€™s the price: the Mahana is a terrific deal compared to many of the pricier resorts on Kaâ€™anapali beach. Overall, it was a perfect base for our vacation and it will be our first choice of a place to stay when we next go to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME CONDO !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rickrSeattle
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best condo and location we EVER stayed. The view from the balcony overlooking the ocean was unbelievable, you can even whale watch. We were pretty late for whale season but many could still bee seen from the balcony. the pool area looks to be just renovated, and the grounds are nice. Take a short walk on the beach walk to the Duke's restaurant, great food and views. coming back for sure to stay longer then 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: MrsRobinsonPrestonUK
Reviews.Content: Had booked a six night stay on Maui and booked a studio appartment which was ideal as there was only the two of us. Bit apprehensive on arrival as we'd read that previous guests to the complex had found that some of the appartments were a bit dated and had asked to be moved. We were given room 1113 and were pleased with it straight away. Spotlessly clean and had everything that we needed. In a lovely location, right on the beach with beautiful views towards Lanai and Molokai. Free car parking. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. A well stocked supermarket was within walking distance. Had a lovely evening meal at Dukes, a restaurant practically next door. Lots of good restaurants in nearby Lahaina. Good snorkelling and swimming about 50 metres along the beach in either direction. Really enjoyed our stay. Especially eating breakfast on the lanai each morning looking at the beautiful view. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: asnc76
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here! The hotel is the closest one to the ocean in Maui. The staff was always so very helpfull and conceirge desk helped us plan wonderful activities. We enjoyed having a full kitchen so we didn't have to eat out at every meal. Try to stay on a higher floor if you can above the palm trees. The view is spectacular from the rooms. The sunset photos we got from the room are some of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the stay at the Ashton.”
Reviews.Author: cowboyfan1950
Reviews.Content: Loved the view and the location was terrific. Everything was superb, service was great and done with smiles!! Always nice to see employees who seem to actually enjoy their jobs and want to serve customers. Pool could be bigger but who wants to spend a lot of time doing what we can do at home???

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation at the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: NCPantherFan
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to Maui (and Kaanapali) and our first stay at the Mahana. The location is north of the black rock that divides Kaanapali beach but is close enough such that it is a short drive to Whaler's Village Shopping Center. We were in room 315 in the Lanai tower and the view is spectacular! Every room faces the ocean with a private lanai that is accessible from both the living room and the bedroom. Our bed was spacious and the mirrored wall in the living room allowed you to see the ocean from almost anywhere in the condo. At the entrance road to the resort there is a strip mall with a Times Supermarket that has reasonably priced groceries if you want to save some money and eat in from time to time. We chose to buy fresh pineapple and other fruit and eat it in the morning on the lanai while watching the waves. There is also a coffee/bar called Java Jazz, which has a great atmosphere with pretty good Kona coffee. About a block north of the entrance road is an ABC store (Hawaii's version of general store) with a gas station which is always less crowded than those in the shopping malls in Kaanapali & Lahaina. So, the location of the Mahana is very convenient to all of the needed supplies. There is a gate that leads to a nice walkway across the parking lot that has a cipher lock. Just ask the front desk for the combination and they will give it to you. The walkway leads behind several neighboring properties and behind the dunes leading to the larger beach area. Also along the walkway is Duke's Grill and several access points to the beach. The beach in front of the property is very narrow but is a very short walk to the larger beach areas where you can stretch out for a tan or snorkel/swim. You can hear the waves gently break against the rocks all night long and makes for a very restful sleep. My wife and I both loved this! The swimming pool was nice and clean, plus the staff is great. Even though we didn't use it, Expedia has a concierge on-site to help assist with booking events. There is also a small stand in the lobby next to the pool that sells smoothies, snacks and hot dogs. Housekeeping will not bother knocking if you have the Do Not Distub sign on the door but they will call you after a couple of days and ask if you need anything. We found this to be great for us because we don't like housekeeping entering our room without us being there. There is a safe in the room but it is an extra $2.60 per day, which is a very small price to pay for piece of mind if you have valuables with you. I used it to lock up a 13" Macbook (too small for a larger laptop), a couple of ipods and a digital camera when we went out to dinner. In summary: Beautiful scenery, convenient location, wonderful staff, private rooms/lanai = peaceful and great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “If a picture paints a thousand words”
Reviews.Author: Mauithegreat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana from 7/26 to 8/2 and it was our 3rd time there. We cannot go anywhere else because this is THE PLACE. Room 1215 has become our second home, we have been in that room twice, in 2008 and 2010. The only thing that needs to be replaced is the sofa bed it was rough. I tell you, I dream all year long about going back to Maui and The Mahana. If you go there say hellow to Karen a real great lady at the front desk, and to Susan who works for Expedia activities. Don't drive to Hana, take a tour because if you drive you will miss the BEAUTIFUL sceenery. If you don't want to go to the volcano for a sunrise, take the tour at mid day, and it will take you The IAO VALLEY, too!!! Mahalo, Ed Lopez

Reviews.Title: “In a Word -- Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: PDALURWX
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii. We didn't know what to expect and can't draw comparisons to other properties, but I'm pretty confident that this is one of the nicest locations you will find on Maui. The lobby area is quiet and relaxing. It was so easy pulling up to the front door to unload our luggage and check in! Just a short walk to the elevators, we all took a quick look at the room before I moved the car. We walked in and my wife and I couldn't believe our eyes. Our 2 BR/2 BA condo on the sixth floor was heaven on earth. We actually teared up a little. The kids were able to check out a wave board and "noodle" at the front desk at no cost for the duration of our stay. Our double-wide lanai was perfection. The condo was upgraded with tile and granite and electronic shades. All the rooms were quite spacious. We loved it and we would absolutely go back -- already starting to think about our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Beanster2112
Reviews.Content: We'd stay at the Mahana for 2 weeks in July in room 914. It was spectacular in every way. This room has set the bar by which every hotel/condo that we ever stay in the future will have to beat. I dont think this will be possible! The view is outstanding from the lanai. The kitchen was superb and came with everything but the food. The pots, pans, utensils, and everything else were clean and ready to go. This saved us an immense amount of money on breakfast, lunch, and even two dinners which we ate on the lanai watching the waves come ashore. Paradise to the max! Many thanks to Mark, the hotel manager for politely and quickly answering my pre-vacation questions. If Maui itself were less crowded and more entertaining, we would come back and stay again at the Mahana. My only gripe is that the pool is too small and really needs to have an "adults only" time of day. When parents are tired of dealing with their kids, they send them to the pool and its just chaos abound.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant and conveniently-located beach resort with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mcfliege
Reviews.Content: We came to the Westin after 3 days at a noisy inn on the North Shore. At first we were assigned a ground floor studio which was dark and dank and equipped with a MURPHY bed! Because it is not safe to leave the back door open, we were instructed to keep it closed and locked all the time, and of course it would be practical to close the curtains so passers by on the beach couldnâ€™t look in. We took the chance of asking Larissa at the front desk if it might be possible to move to a higher floor. She said she would look into it and get back to us. We grabbed some snorkeling gear and headed down the beach for a few hours--miles of gorgeous beach. When we returned, there was a voice mail that theyâ€™d found a new room for us. When we got to the Reception desk, Larissa gave us a key to a 6th floor room to check out (Room 613), and we knew we wanted it immediately. It was a huge ocean view suite and so high up and private, that we didnâ€™t need air-conditioning. We left the screen door open during the day and night and were blessed with pleasant and mild trade winds the remainer of our time in Maui. What a dream it was to have the ocean waves as the only background noise. The suite had a full kitchen, washing/drying machine, and a decent bathroom. This room was truly our idea of a Hawaiian beach hotel, and we had a fantastic 4 days there. Many many thanks to Larissa and her friendly customer service and can-do attitude. She was always friendly and hospitable, and she helped make our vacation top notch and a very positive experience. All rooms are ocean view with staggered balcony (great idea!), and the facilities are superb: beautiful pool, gorgeous beach â€“simple with plenty of palm trees. Free towel service, and the parking situation is reliable, too.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated!”
Reviews.Author: Monicat14
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how this could have been ranked #1 on TripAdvisor. This has definitely made me question my confidence in TripAdvisor. Our room had disgusting carpeting with bad stains throughout. We had to see 3 rooms before we found one that was clean & sanitary. The pool area is tiny. Pictures posted on the website are deceptive giving the illusion that the resort is much nicer than it really is. I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fell asleep to the sound of surf”
Reviews.Author: Bexley5
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably close to the ocean! We stayed in #1001- beautifully decorated corner unit. Felt like I was in someone's home (nicer than my own:) Did miss not having a beach right out from hotel-but gorgeous beach just a short walk away. Full kitchen was helpful-did breakfast and lunches in the condo. Small pool- though we did not use it much. Rented boogie boards and snorkel equipment. We would definitely stay here again. Had a good dinner at Kimo's in Lahaina. Recommend "Maui Revealed" travel guide- spot on!!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: JRNorCal
Reviews.Content: Wow! Was our first response to the incredible view as we entered our condo rental unit at the Mahana. It was like having a front row seat at the I-MAX. Floor to ceiling windows in every unit give you a breathtaking view of the Ocean, which is literally 40-50 feet from the high rise towers of the Mahana. We enjoyed watching the beautiful and ever-changing colors of the surf, sailboats going by, and incredible sunsets. There are much more expensive resorts nearby, which can not offer the kid of beach and ocean views you get at the Mahana. The lobby is nicely decorated and updated, the elevators are fast and efficient, and the pool area is inviting. This is a condo property with no onsite restaurant, but there are great restaurants nearby, including one of our favorites, Duke's Beach House, at the Honua Kai Resort next door. The units are well built to minimize noise transference, and this condo resort seems to attract a quiter crowd. Not alot of small children. We intend to return to the Mahana on our next visit to Maui. Highly reccommend booking through a by-owner vacation rental site, so that you can choose your specific unit. Some of the units have not been refurbished. Since these units were built in the late 1970's, you definetely want one that has been updated. Floors five and above (There are 12 stories) will offer the most spectacular ocean views. We enjoyed the covenient location on Kaanapali Beach, just a short drive from Lahaina Town.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Ohana3
Reviews.Content: We rented our condo (#1204) through VRBO website. The condo was amazing! The view from the bedroom and the living area looked directly out into the ocean. I sat on the lanai every morning and night mesmorized by the view. The unit was completely updated with a full kitchen. We stopped at Walmart near the airport to purchase bottled water, milk, eggs, etc. for our stay. There are two grocery stores near the Mahana, but prices are higher than Walmart. The beach in front of the Mahana is perfect for snorkling. We snorkeled along the reef and found many fish and a turtle. Our favorite beaches were Napilli and Kapalua. They both had beautiful sand and calm waters. D.K. Fleming was a fun beach for body boarding. Honalua Bay is a black rock beach where many of the snorkling excursions stop at. I suggest getting there early in the morning 8-9 A.M. for a good parking spot. Many people parked on the side of the road and returned to find a ticket, so be careful. All four beaches are just a short drive north of the Mahana. We also attempted the Road to Hana trip. We only made it to mile marker 32 which ended up being the best place to end the day. Twin Falls at mile marker 2 (beginning of Road to Hana) is a great place to stop and hike to three different waterfalls. You can swim in all three spots. Mile marker 32 has the Waianapanapa State Park. The park has a black rock beach, a lava tube, and a cave you can swim in. Not to mention the view is amazing. My son got car sick from the drive so be cautious. We went on a snorkel and dolphin adventure to the island of Lanai'i through the Pacific Whale Foundation. There store can be found in Lanai across from the Banyan Tree and marina. I booked our excursion through the Expedia tour operator in the downstairs lobby of the Mahana. It was very reasonably priced and includes light breakfast and lunch. Overall, the Mahana was a great place for our family. It never felt overcrowded. It was a relaxing and beautiful place to spend our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent property and location for a family”
Reviews.Author: buster1957
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Mahana. The unit was a two bedroom corner condo with updated accommodations, including very nice bathrooms and kitchen. Great view and right on the water. The location was quiet compared to the hustle around Whaler's Village, but it is close enough to get to those locations. Snorkeling is great right in front of the unit. The staff were very friendly, helpful and polite. Aston does a good job of managing their properties and we try to stay with them when we travel. There is no restaurant or gym, but they have arrangements with another managed property a few resorts away to provide those services and bill to your room at the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: mattjurgens
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a bargain. Felt like overall price was great for what you get (great view, washer/dryer, kitchen). Also very close to some of best spots on Maui. A few of our favorite - Black Rock, Napali beach, Honolua bay. If I came back, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Texdawg
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui with our 3 teens and stayed at the Aston Mahana. It was perfect! Right on the beach! Our unit was a two-bedroom unit and was clean, spacious and perfect. We had an amazing lanai and couldn't have been closer to the ocean. The beach directly in front of the Mahana does have a lot of coral, but you just have to go down the beach a little and it is fine. The pool area is small, but private and very nice. You are close to Lahaina and lots of shopping and eating spots. The concierge was great and made booking all the extra stuff easy. We had an awesome time and would definitely return to the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay away from the hustle & bustle.”
Reviews.Author: Lucy63
Reviews.Content: This is a great location away from the crowds. As the condos are individually owned, the quality of the accommodation can very greatly. The first one we had was old and tired. We requested to change into a nicer one and the very helpful receptionist kindly obliged us and gave us a much nicer one with newer furniture & fittings. Great location, friendly staff & very comfortable accommodation. Would recommend apartment 715.

Reviews.Title: “great location, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: bluejack55
Reviews.Content: Our hotel condo was huge, clean, and in a great location. The views of the Pacific, especially at sunset, were stunning. The only complaint we had was that the "heated" pool was a little chilly for our taste. But overall, good value and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Prettylady69
Reviews.Content: Great quiet place with excellant views. The room was clean and had everything we needed. We had to travel for restaurants, but the room had a great kitchen so we could cook food if we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations with ocean view”
Reviews.Author: GeogiaDawg
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week in Room 314 and the stay was perfect. The desk personnel were always accomodating. The room was awsome, clean, tidy, immaculate. I would recommend this location and the Mahana highly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: KGK92
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights on a studio ocean front. The room had granite counter tops . The bed was comfy. The ocean front view was breathtaking. The place is not very crowded. The pool and spa is very well maintainted. The parking and wifi is free . We would definitely stay here again. We loved it overall.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana, Some things to know first. Long.”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Mahana for three nights in a 2bd 2ba top floor premium unit. The Aston Mahana is the same condo complex as the Mahana at Kaanapali. There are over 200 units total. Aston manages maybe over half of the units I think. Other units are managed by smaller firms and others by owners themselves. Some Units are never rented I was told. Just used as vacation homes by their owners. These owners are very lucky as the units here are very nice. Location. When they say ocean front they mean OCEAN FRONT! You can't build a project today this close to the water. In fact our top floor unit was maybe to high. In order to see the sand and waves you had to hang over the lanai railing. The snorkeling here was/is the best on the Island. And I probably have snorkeled most all known spots on Maui. You will need to walk up or down the beach to get in the water but the sea life out on the reef in front of the complex is awesome. Well worth the effort. The BBQ facility here is first rate. New, clean and right next to the pool. Our 2/2 room was a premium unit. Premium unit I believe means gutted and remodeled. All 2/2 units also are on the ends of the blds with wrap around views. Some 2/2 rooms have double Lanais as ours did. One off the master and one off the living room. Some have their Lanais converted to indoors. I'm not sure who owns or rents those units. The view from the 2nd bedroom is mainly mountain. Our unit had.....Granite counter tops, Travertine floors. Custom baths. Upscale furnishings, New hd tv's, Upscale appliances, and AC's in each room that will freeze your a*s off. Our unit was under $500 a night with all the fees. Try to find 2 hotel rooms ocean front with all the fees under $500 in June. I couldn't. Be careful though if you rent a unit from someone other than Aston. While some owners might have better units, some might not. We peeked in to a unit here that looked like a dump. Maybe in the midst of work being done. Not sure. I don't think it was an Aston rental however. I was told that all Aston managed units have been remodeled. Ask and make sure though.

Reviews.Title: “Great again... for our third visit”
Reviews.Author: none17
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our third visit to the Mahana, and we've never been let down. The combination of the spaciousness of the units, the incredible unobstructed ocean views (try finding anything else like it on Maui in this price range - you won't!), and the quiet location near Lahaina and Kaanapali keeps us coming back. In addition to the rooms, the pool, BBQs and landscaped grounds are excellent. We actually like that it's not a swimming beach in front of the property, as it keeps it a little quieter than Kaanapali beach just a few metres down the shore. The only drawback is that some units are definitely nicer than others - many have been renovated to a high quality, but some are still 1980s vintage. On two occasions we have been disappointed with the quality of the first unit we were assigned, so we asked for a different room and both times were very happy with what we got. Although in the past we have always booked directly with Aston, in the future we are going to try to research and book a specific unit directly through its owner, so we know exactly what we'll be getting. We definitely recommend staying in this part of Maui versus the busier Kihei area. You can always go to Kihei for the day but you will appreciate returning to the beauty, conveniences and peace and quiet of the Mahana. And if you're here sometime between January and April - you can watch the whales jumping from your lanai every morning. Does it get any better than that? Tip: If you stay here, definitely make the little extra drive to the Lahaina Cannery Mall Safeway for your groceries instead of the Times Market in Honokowai... better quality, selection and prices. Check out Sansei near Kapalua on the north shore for great sushi. And stop by Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina for an inexpensive, yummy local lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: DBM1006
Reviews.Content: We reserved a 2 bedroom with the 2nd room having twin beds for our kids. When we arrived they brought us to a room with no twins in the 2nd room. When we told them they quickly walked us around to a couple other rooms and told us to choose. We chose room 911 which has a great view. The room was clean and comfortable. Duke's restaurant which is next door is a great place to eat. Safeway is 10 minutes away for groceries. There are also some stores across the street that helped out. We rode a motorcycle to the road to Hana which was great. A problem that the whole island was having 2 weeks ago was fruit flies, but they didn't bother us to much, although we would of prefered them not to be there. As I said all the resorts were dealing with them. If you fly to another island using Hawaiian airlines beware of their rule that your carry-on bags can't weigh more than 25 lbs. We had 2 bags that they charged us 10 each. One weighed 28lbs & the other 32lbs. The overhead baggage space on the plane had so much room because they forced all their customers to check their bags at the last minute. A souce of $$$ for them. We at the last minute lightened 2 bags by putting them in the other 2 which had to be checked anyways which saved us some money.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo with a killer view”
Reviews.Author: ScramentoTravler
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week in April 2010 in one bedroom remodeled condo (1004). It had everything you needed. Only negative is that the bed could have been better. All units are ocean front. Reef in front, easy walk to swimming area. Friendly staff. Dukes restaurant (great staff and good food) short walk along the board walk. About a 20 minute walk to Whaler's Village.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location - can't get any closer to the beach than this”
Reviews.Author: goose1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in room 217. The room was beuatifully renovated. All the rooms are right in front of the beach and as close as you can get. Hotels are not allowed to be built this close to the ocean any more in Maui so the bigger resorts all the rooms are much farther away. Perfect if you are with family or want a quieter resort. The pool and spa was fairly basic compared to other resorts and there is no room service or restaurant but if you want an apartment on the beach then I don;t think you could find better in Maui. I would defiantley come back and stay here again. When we wanted a restaurant we just went out. Our 2 year loved the Steam Train ride in Lahainia and also Bubba Gumps for lunch was fun.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in 512!”
Reviews.Author: jenlikesrocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second half of our honeymoon (first half was on Oahu). The hotel is wonderful because every single room has a spectacular ocean view. Overall, the hotel was very clean and well kept, the pool/hot tub were wonderful, the grounds were beautiful, and our unit was great. We did have a problem with fruit flies outside our unit and with neighbors not observing the "quiet hours" posted everywhere and slamming doors/furniture early in the morning (which I don't really blame the hotel for). Overall though, we could not believe the huge deal we got on such an awesome resort. We snorkeled, walked the beach, and took the bus to parasailing, a dinner cruise, and other awesome excursions. The front desk crew was generally very nice, but we didn't find them to be particularly willing to help you out with anything - maybe that was just our experience. If you rent gear nearby, I'd recommend A&B rentals just down the road - they were reasonable and when we decided to keep our snorkel gear and extra day they were easy to work with. The Mahana's grills downstairs were also wonderful and very nice! We grilled steaks, vegetables, pineapple, and more, and several other guests were doing the same thing. Thanks for a wonderful honeymoon stay!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nekrophile
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in room 215, a 1BR unit, for four days. The furniture was a little dated but the view more than made up for it. Being right on the beach was amazing and really is worth the extra expense. Although you can't swim on the beach directly out front, it's a very short 50-75m walk to a swimmable area. This a great place to stay if you're looking for someplace quiet. I didn't hear any noise from neighboring units and the majority of the residents I came across there were older. I also didn't see any children while I was there. If you're looking for someplace trendy or are staying with children this might not be the place for you. My wife and I are both in our 30's and it was fine for us. We cooked most of the time we were there so the lack of a restaurant didn't bother us. If you want to eat someplace nearby, the restaurants at neighboring resorts are just a short walk down the beach. All in all, we had a nice relaxing stay at the Aston Mahana. As long as you understand that you're going to be giving up some amenities as it's not a resort, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: Rebel4life
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Condo 1116 which was nice. Beautiful ocean view. The grounds could have been kept better. Did not see as much of the traditional Hawaiian foilage/flowers we had seen at our recent stay at the Embassy Suites aka Kannapali Beach Club which is next door. The Conceirge didn't have much to say to us once she booked our 1200.00 worth of excursions. No restaurant in the hotel and we did not learn until the day we were leaving that in one part of the building they did offer coffee, snacks, pizzas to purchase. Beach was beautiful but the coral/rocks keep you from going directly into the ocean. I personally prefer the Kannapali Beach Club. Alot more classy in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Klous
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Mahana every time we have gone to Maui. Every room is ocean front. They all have kitchens with washer and dryer. There is a pool and hot tub that they clean every morning. The grounds are being manicured all the time. The staff is always there to help with anything they can. The beach behind the Mahana isn't the best but 100 ft. to the left is a great beach and right down the beach are 2 of the best places to snorkle on the island. We will always stay at the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: rswatt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Mahana. We had an amazing time and kept on pinching ourselves that we stayed at such a perfect place. We booked a studio directly through Aston (as we didn't want any "surprises" by renting from an owner). The studio was great - exceptionally clean, updated (granite & tile), large flat-screen tv with cable, well-equipped kitchen, air-conditioning (we didn't need to use it), modern & clean bathroom - and the view was incredible. We were on the 8th floor and had a perfect view of every gorgeous sunset. At night, we slept with our window open and could hear the waves lapping the shore. The lanai was a lovely place to unwind after a day of sightseeing - a glass of wine in hand - and it was very private... you can't see any other units from the lanai nor can you be seen. We missed any whale-watching (too late in the season) so we plan to go back earlier in the year in the future. I really loved that this place was so mellow and low-key. There weren't a lot of kids, people were quiet and content to hang out around the small pool or on the lawn, and the staff was very friendly but unintrusive. There is no on-site restaurant but there is a Duke's restaurant just a short walk away and it was delicious. (The Mahana does have a very small cafe that serves smoothies and sandwiches.) The Kaanapali boardwalk ends at the Mahana so you can take a walk down the coastline and see the other resorts and try out all the beaches. To me, they seemed very posh but they still couldn't beat the Mahana's proximity to the water. One knock is that the beach directly in front of the Mahana is not a great place to swim or snorkel but that is easily remedied by a VERY short walk to the left or the right of the property to more swimmable beaches. We also enjoyed staying in the north end of Kaanapali (really it was closer to Honokowai) where there were less crowds, but still a short drive to Lahaina for evening entertainment. We saw Ulalena there and HIGHLY recommend it. We also went to the Hyatt Luau but would like to try Lele's next time. If you stay at the Mahana and want an awesome Hawaiian plate lunch, just go up the road to the Honokowai Okazuya... yum! In summary, if you want a laidback vacation at a hidden gem, then BOOK a condo at the Mahana. If you are high maintenance and need ALL the amenities of a large resort, then this is not the place for you. My husband and I plan to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: CraigPerney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana 5-17-10 to 5-22-10. We have stayed here before and decided to come back again. The rooms are very nice and well equiped. The viw of the baech/ocean is outsatanding. Your fisrt morning you should go the the presentation put on by Susan Ramos of Expedia.com. There is no pressure to buy anything just a lot of good info at the best price. Do not go to any small stands in the island town for things Stick with an export in your own hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Aston Mahana at Kaanapali - Room No. 713”
Reviews.Author: IAmore
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice of this place. The studio is ocean front with the best views of ocean one can expect. The studio was very clean and fully loaded. We got much more than what we had paid. I will definitely recommend this place to all my friends who visit Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great views”
Reviews.Author: ginaj1
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Aston Mahana was excellent. Some things to note: - If possible, request a room on the upper floors. It's not a guarantee but always good to ask, since the views are obviously better on the upper floors. - Although there is a daily cleaning service, they do not have a restaurant so if you're looking for room service, there is none. We cooked a lot of our own meals so this wasn't a problem for us. They have a huge bbq set up downstairs, which we used on several occasions. - Other friends and family of ours stayed in different locations throughout the area, but all agreed our room was the biggest and had the best views. We saw some amazing sunsets, rainbows and even whales jumping and swimming while sitting our out lanai. - If you're not a fan of listening to the ocean at night, then this location might not be for you as you are right on the surf and it can get pretty loud. But we loved it. - We took our laptop along and wireless service was pretty good in the room (sometimes you needed to go out on the lanai for better reception) - The staff were really helpful. I got sick at one point and they recommended a nearby clinic that took great care of me. - Overall, our experience with the Mahana was excellent and we will stay there again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “We Can't Wait to come back!!”
Reviews.Author: countingmyblessings
Reviews.Content: Before departing for Maui, I found four coworkers who had stayed at the Mahana, and they all had high praise for their stay. When we arrived, we were greeted by a very warm and gracious clerk at the front desk who got us into our room in less than 10 minutes. We had a studio unit, about the size you would expect, but the room was very clean, had granite countertops and a marble-tile two-person shower, and a comfortable bed. The view from the 12th floor was spectacular! Exactly the view you find on the virtual tour site, except no palm tree trunk, and the room was pretty representative as well. Beautiful blue ocean and sky, with a nice breeze and 82 deg. The balconies are staggered and designed such that you really can't see anyone else's balcony, so I assume ours was private too(hope so...). Just you and the ocean, and a couple songbirds at times. The first morning my husband was treated to a humpback breaching offshore directly in front of the Mahana during his morning coffee on the lanai. Incredible site the first time you see it. Soon you realize that you can see many whale spouts in the channel, and this was late April. Must be really busy in January! We experienced very little noise from other units or the pool; just the sound of waves breaking on the shore 60 feet from the bldg. The Mahana is closer to the water than any other hotel/condo we saw during our stay. And the beach was not crowded like Kaanapali south beach( a handful vs hundreds, no kidding). Many guests appeared to prefer lounging around the pool, which meant there was always a lounger or beach chair available on the grass or the beach; and little green lizard friends to keep you company if you look closely. The beach really isn't as nice just a short distance north of the Mahana, we wouldn't recommend going farther north in Kaanapali unless the beach doesn't matter to you. We enjoyed using the BBQs available near the pool on two occasions, and they seem to be popular with many of the guests; but I only waited 5 min one night for a grill. They are really nice grills too. The smell of steaks cooking at dinner will draw you in from the beach. The whole property looks much newer than it's age, being well-maintained, updated, and clean.. We found that the WiFi worked very well in our unit, as did the cable TV, airconditioning and laundry. In the afternoons the breeze is off-shore, which will ventilate a hot room in just a few minutes with the front and balcony doors open. The beachwalk ends at the edge of the Mahana property which is a nice way to check out some of the nearby restaurants at some of the hotels, or walk all the way to Kaanapali south beach if you're up to it. There are many shops and small restaurants within walking distance, and it's a five minute drive to Lahaina. The sunsets are incredible in west Maui, and the Mahana is front and center. We found that the guests were mostly adults looking for a calm place to relax. Families who want alot of activities for the kids onsite may be happier at one of the other resorts, yet a family still might find the Mahana a good base from which to explore Maui. We toured the entire island, including the road to Hana and beyond, so although not centrally located, it is still doable. We recommend renting a convertible to see the island, we went everywhere with the top down and got a great tan! Don't be afraid of the road to Hana or the road north of Kaanapali, the drive isn't as bad as some make it seem, and there is fantastic scenery the faint-hearted will never enjoy; like discovering private jungle waterfalls within walking distance of the road to Hana. We loved everything about our stay at the Mahana. The room was very nice, the grounds were nice, the staff was great, and the room rate is a bargain compared to other 4-star properties in Kaanapali. And while we were once offered an opportunity to attend a breakfast timeshare meeting, we didn't get a high-pressure sales pitch and it wasn't brought up again. We plan to visit Maui again, and already know we will be calling the Mahana our home-in-paradise again. Ahuihoi Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views of the maui sunset!!”
Reviews.Author: Spork_1337
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Mahana and it was absolutely wonderful. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed on the 6th floor in a 1bedroom condo. The ocean view was superb and watching the sunset everynight from the lanai was amazing. Most rooms are newly renovated. Ours had a very modern kitchen, granite counters and everything. The king size bed was super comfortable as well. It is very affordable for what you get. Now granted, it doesn't have a restaurant, small pool, and small beach area. Don't let this bother you. The best restaruants are not attached to hotels anyway,plenty of great food around maui. While the pool may be small, you don't go to maui to lay by a pool. As for the beach, walk 50-100 yards in either direction and you have some great snorkeling and much larger beach area. All in all the Mahana is an excellent place to go if you are looking to relax, want an oceanfront view, and don't want to pay a premium for it.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: biomase
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with g/f for a vacation, we are an active couple in our late 20's and we booked a 1 bedroom suite for a week. Its an alright hotel, the ones closer to blackrock provide more amenities and have a bit more life about them. The places in Wailei are probably the most up-to-date and have amazing beaches (Big Beach) and more local places to eat and great places to snorkel. Its also a lot more central if you are planning to head into Hana or do any activities in upcountry Maui. This place is pretty barren, just your basic place to sleep and you'll need to walk down the beach for actual places to swim. You'll also need to drive to get into Lahaina (which is ok for a day, but gets to be very touristy and crowded after a while and especially when cruise ships dock) Good: - Location near the beach - Free parking - Views are nice - Sheltered Lanai - so nightly gusts of wind don't really affect you - Nice compact pool area (albeit a little small) - Good if you are planning to just post-up in a hotel and take long strolls on the beach and read a book or generally just enjoy life. Probably more appealing for an older crowd...not many young couples or families around there. Bad: - Not much activity going on around here. You absolutely need a car to get around, otherwise, you'll be stuck in a land of nothingness - Couldn't swim in front of hotel, lots of coral reefs and the surf was extremely rough - Units are extremely dated and desperately needs an upgrade. Furniture looks like it was from the 90's and was really worn in - good if your trying to reminisce about your childhood, depends on what your looking for - Loud on Lanai, you can hear full conversations of people above and below and all of the footsteps and chairs creaking. - Screen Doors were pretty broken up, really annoying to try and open and close a door that kept falling off the hinges - Bed was not that comfortable despite being a king. - BBQ's were set way in the back of the pool area so its far if you are trying to bring food closer to the ocean - Internet was worse than garbage, you had to literally sit next to a screen door to get any connection. Its hard to research up on places to go see, eat and visit without a good connection (I have a brand new laptop too).

Reviews.Title: “Great Oceanfront Views”
Reviews.Author: kimljackson
Reviews.Content: After an initial mix-up with our suite, we were upgraded to a beautiful two-bedroom condo overlooking the ocean. Very roomy and comfortable. Had all of the comforts from home. We sat every night on our lanai and watched the sun go down. Most nights we saw a pod of humpback whales crusing by. Nice beach to walk along but not a good beach to swim, as there was too much coral, etc. The pool was kept clean and was a nice size. Very close to groceries and restaurants. Just a short drive to downtown Lahaina. Worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “It was a piece of heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller154964
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Mahana for ten nights in April. Our unit (1006) was lovely, had every amenity we could ask for - blender, hair dryer, iron, lots of dishes, cutlery, pots and pans, etc. The owners took great pride in their condo and had done some fairly recent renos. We slept with the sliding doors off our bedroom open (with screens) every night to hear the ocean waves lull us to sleep. Watched the whales play in the daytime and saw beautiful sunsets each night! Lots of space in the condo, couldn't ask for more. Staff were friendly and accomodating, pool and grounds well cared for. Lots of BBQs that we put to good use. Travelled with two other couples who stayed at the Mahana, their units were very nice too. Would definitely recommend the Aston Mahana to anyone who wants a very comfortable "home away from home"!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect...but great value”
Reviews.Author: PDP001
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Mahana, Unit 908 in the Molokai (North) tower. Will get right to the facts as that's what I want when I read reviews: Pros: - outstanding location beachside - quiet, mostly adult complex - beach area is very quiet. Most guests must stay around the pools! - close to everything. Walking distance to Kaanapali resorts/shopping. The boardwalk that extends all the way to Kaanapali is great for walking/jogging - great snorkelling directly adjacent to the building - Aston provides outstanding service for their managed units - sound of the surf at night - views to die for and whale watching from the balcony - sheltered, west facing decks that are completely sheltered from the wind. Great spot to catch afternoon sun/sunset with a mai tai in hand Cons: - units are showing their age - wireless access is reliable only on the balcony....not a totally bad thing..... - sound travels from the balconies directly above/below if your neighbors are loud - would be nice to have a few more "beach amenities" in the rooms (chairs, beach towels, coolers, boogie boards). We bought ours and left them behind for the next guests. Summary: Very solid resort and worth the money for the location, size of units, amenities, etc. If you're looking for perfection in the units, you'll either need to relax your expectations a bit or go next door (Honua Kai) for more money. If you are looking for good, comfortable accomodations directly on one of the nicest beaches (and relatively quiet) in Maui, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and spacious”
Reviews.Author: loverster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. It was clean, nice and spacious. We had the 1 bedroom 2 bath which was more than we needed but its nice to get ready at the same time when you are on vacation. The kitchen was full. We were close to the beach and had a great view from our living and bedroom. You could hear the waves at night. My only complaint is that the wireless internet was very limited here. They have an activities director, Susan, who helped us book a lot of fun things to do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SPKK06
Reviews.Content: We booked this condo through a travel agency, based on availability, price, location, and this one came up to meet our needs. I couldn't have been happier with the results. Even though it was rated a "3" out of "5" in the travel agency brochure, it was perfect for our needs. Right on a private, clean beach, spacious rooms, friendly service, on-site booking of events and outings, and right across the street from a fairly large grocery store. It was away enough from a crowd, yet easy to get to the more populated areas. There is no restaurant on the premises though, but having a full service condo we ate breakfast/lunch on our own and went out to dinner in town. If you don't want/need lots of frills like valet parking or shops in the lobby, this is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, rooms alright”
Reviews.Author: qpas3
Reviews.Content: The views are beautiful, it really feels like you are floating on the ocean. Overall, felt it wasn't great value as it was a bit pricey for what you got- fairly standard room with a small kitchen (we didn't really use it except for the fridge). Ours also had mirrors all over the walls which was a little strange, but newish tile floors throughout and the bathroom was fine. Overall I'd say it was decent, but price a bit high for what you got (not a swim-able beach, and had to drive to get dinner in Lahaina, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic ocean views”
Reviews.Author: pagirl11
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine a condominium with better ocean views. We stayed in unit 708 rented from Kathy Sheehan on vrbo. Rental was a well equiped one bedroom with great views of the ocean. We saw lots of whales during their seasonal migration. The Mahana has a good location which appears to be the closest to the beach in west maui. The resort was well kept. The condo was an easy rental from a trust worthy owner that delivered a professional service. The rental condition was as promised with the only complaint I could possibly have was that the carpet in the unit was stained in spots. The condo complex had the basics. Some renters may desire more of a resort style in common areas including the pool which was small, but sufficient. I felt that the resort delivered the basics and that what they had was well kept and attractive. Location was good, being adjacent to the walking path that led to many of the hotels in the area. Overall , I was extremely satisfied with the condominium complex and would highly recommend this particular unit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, if they'll LET you stay”
Reviews.Author: kays76
Reviews.Content: On previous trips to Maui, had stayed at a couple of different large resort hotels until our last trip when we stayed at the Mahana, and couldn't have been happier. Since we were returning in the month of February, the ultimate in high season in Hawaii, we made our reservations through a travel agent last September since our trip this time, in addition to some much needed R & R for my husband, was specifically to have a front row seat to the whale show. We had seen whale activity on previous trips, but they were usually at the tail end of the season, and whale sightings were usually spotty. After traveling for 16 1/2 hours, door to door, we walked up to the front desk at the Mahana very tired, but with huge smiles on our faces and greeted with a very warm "Aloha", then handed an envelope and told that since they were overbooked and had no room for us, we were "given an upgrade" at a resort just two properties north. We both snapped back to attention rather quickly and said that this was unacceptable, not only since we had never even considered staying anywhere else on this trip, but that we had years ago stayed at the other property, which is a huge timeshare resort, very attractive with great suites, but still a resort "hotel", full of families with children, not the great oceanfront "home away from home" condo units with non-stop views that you get at the Mahana. The gentleman at the desk finally called for the Manager, who assured us that if we checked out the next morning and returned to the Mahana, she could put us into a great unit on the twelfth floor, which she did. The next eight days were like being in Heaven and fullfilled all of the expectations we had upon our return. To Aston Hotels, shame on you for overbooking. We really don't understand how this can happen, what with modern computer programs and such. It seems like a blatant disreguard for their customers, many of which have saved long and hard for trips to destinations like Hawaii. We will definately return to The Mahana on our next trip to Maui, whale season or not, as it is a wonderful property, totally ocean front on a great part of Maui. Next time, however, we plan on booking directly through an owner which can be done on many different web sites, such as VRBO. This property is generally very quiet and very well maintained. The units in these two buildings are owned individually, so furniture and decor will differ, but from what we've seen, most owners take pride in their units. Make sure to buy groceries from either the Safeway in Lahaina (don't go in the evening - it's a disaster) or the Times market in the strip mall right across the road from the entrance off of Lower Honoapiilani Hwy. I was leary about the latter, but it's a great store, much better than when it was owned by another company previously. When on Maui, don't hesitate to travel to the north shore for a fabulous meal at Mama's Fish House. We go there once every trip. It is pricey, but you won't get a better meal in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View - Unit 307”
Reviews.Author: looking4honeymoon
Reviews.Content: The Mahana was the beginning of our honeymoon. What a way to start it off! The location of this hotel is amazing - just off the beach. It's not in an overly busy area as well, which we really appreciated. We chose unit 307, and we were not disappointed. The views from the living area and bedroom were unbelievable. We thoroughly enjoyed sitting on our lanai eating our meals while soaking up the views (especially at dinner with the amazing sunsets!). My favorite part was at night falling asleep to the sound of the waves crash upon the shore (and waking up to them in the morning)! Unit 307 was clean and comfortable, and such a value. If we're ever able to visit Maui again, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “What a great view of the whales”
Reviews.Author: 4Chihuahuamom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana again just a few weeks ago in room 1213 rented directly from the owner. It was even better than our first visit. We saw so many whales from the lanai we lost count. As for the hotel in general we did find that they were doing a lot of work in the lobby area but seeing we only ever passed there on our way in or out it never bothered us at all. It would be nice if there was somewhere to eat right on the property if you did not want to cook in your unit, but you know upfront there is not so it should not be an issue. There are plenty of places to eat out several within easy walking distance. Staff were all friendly and helpful even though we did not book a unit through Aston. I look forward to returning to the Mahana again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations don't mean much”
Reviews.Author: tsunami2010
Reviews.Content: Booked and prepaid this hotel last December for an 8-day stay in Feb 2010. After a delayed flight and 12 hrs. of travel, what I didn't need to hear when we checked in was: "we don't have a room for you so we've reserved a room for you at the Maui Kai next door." We weren't the only ones that heard those same words that night. If I had wanted to stay at the Maui Kai I would have booked there. Our thank you for accepting the room (as if we had a choice) was a fruit basket and $100 credit at a restraurant. So I can't rate the actual hotel - as much as I would like to - other than their reservation system. Which obviously needs some work.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I would have used VRBO.com and gotten a better room”
Reviews.Author: GEORGE468
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mahana last year and loved it. The view is still wonderful, the staff is still excellent, the room was clean. However the value wasn't there. Going though a travel agent, we were put in room #113, a garden level studio. While recently updated, the condo owner hasn't put anything into the room. There wasn't a picture on the wall, a rug on the floor, or anything to give the room any personality. The television was a 20 year old 24" relic. The furniture wasn't comfortable and it lacked a toaster (quickly remedied by the ecxellent staff). Immediately outside our door is a motion activated sliding door which woke us continually though the night. You can rent rooms directly from the owners by going to vrbo.com. Similar rooms for the same price had 50" HDTVs and comfortable furniture. However, saying all that, you can't go too wrong at the Mahana. It is well run, with a wonderful staff snf s wonderful location. Please stay safe. While we we there a snorkler lost his life directly in front ot the Mahana. He ventured too far and the wind and waves came up.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana is wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: Love-Maui2goto
Reviews.Content: we stayed at studio #713 by the owner, found it on line. This place is is wonderful, many other condos are not oceanfront but this place is direct oceanfront and nothing between you and the ocean - place is just awesome. Highly recomment it. look at vrbo.com or gomahana.com or homeaway.com for the mahana and save money.

Reviews.Title: “WHALES, WHALES AND MORE WHALES from unit #1003”
Reviews.Author: talaja
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit Maui at the last minute which is their 'peak time' and fortunately for us #1003 had the week we wanted open. We were so happy with our choice!! It was absolutely wonderful. Every unit is oceanfront and during this time of year you can see whales right from your lanai. We sometimes lost track of time just watching the several whales that passed us by. We rented directly with the owner via VRBO and they were very accomodating and very easy to work with. We found that the little extras the owners have there for their visitors a tremendous help. They had beach towels available for use, books to read while bathing in the sun, coffee filters (this was great as I always seem to remember to buy coffee but never the filters!) and some spices if you decided to cook dinner. Thanks to the owners of unit #1003 for making our winter getaway absolutely wonderful! I will definitely be keeping your contact information should we ever get back there again - no other place will ever measure up. Your place was too wonderful! .

Reviews.Title: “No need to look any futher....”
Reviews.Author: salobrenaholidays
Reviews.Content: ..for great value (if you rent directly from the owner) than the Mahana. This was our third time in Maui and second stay at the Mahana. This time we stayed in 708 http://www.maui-beachcondo.com/condo708.php courtesy of the owner Kathy Sheehan who arranged everything seemlessly even allowing for the fact that we were travelling from the UK. The Condo is very fully equipped, beautifully clean, and has spectacular views. No complaints whatsoever and we would definitely return. Thanks Kathy! We can thoroughly recommend Gemini Charters http://www.geminicharters.com/ on Kaanapali beach for whale-watching: very knowledgeable and friendly. Dining out was not a great experience, the best restaurants being very, very expensive, and the more modestly priced ones very bland and disappointing. Possibly our best evening meal was "Dunes" next door to the Mahana , reasonable food at a reasonable price. Best venue was Pacific'O http://www.pacificomaui.com/, but very expensive. Best value dinner was at Moose McGillicuddy's http://www.mooserestaurantgroup.com/Lahaina-Maui.html. Worst value and worst food was at The Sea House at Napili http://www.napilikai.com/dining-entertainmnet/index.cfm, very bland and unimaginative food. Hurried and impersonal service. Best venue for breakfast or brunch was the Gazebo at Napili http://www.mauihawaii.org/restaurants/gazebo.htm. We will definitely stay at the Mahana again if/when we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo, great view, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Mauiloveit
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful condo with great oceanfront views, & mountain views. The condo was beautifully appointed and large enough to be comfortable for me & my husband and my daughter, her husband and their daughter. We were able to share meals, watch whales, see rainbows and relax on the lanai. We felt lucky to be staying there and sharing our Chistmas together!

Reviews.Title: “No Better Value on Maui. Period.”
Reviews.Author: markduck
Reviews.Content: Best place I ever stayed in Maui, and one of the best places I have stayed on the planet. Was in a recently renovated one bedroom, high floor. Right out of Sunset magazine. Clean as a hospital. 55 inch HDTV. Whales, dolphins, turtles out the sunset beach view. All ocean front. Right across the street from Times Supermarket and shops. 5 minutes to Kapalua or Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further than The Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: NeedzAnotherVacation
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in Maui at The Mahana. My family has been going there every year for the past 10 years and have nothing bad to say about it. They did end up having to switch rooms for a couple reasons, which ended up better in the end. My boyfriend and I stayed in a studio (#1113.) Breathtaking view, Beautiful sunsets. While it wasn't the best room in the hotel/condo, we certainly can't complain. I love the fact that each unit has a kitchen and washer/dryer. We saved so much money going to Costco & Wal Mart then cooking in room. The location is OK. It would be nice to be a little closer to shopping/swimming etc, but the view you get makes up for it. Normally (from what my family says) it's quiet. The coffee cart was closed our entire stay. Our in-room coffeepot didn't work right. I either went without coffee or walked up to Java Jazz. Not real convenient. Our only complaint was all the construction going on. We heard drilling & pounding all day (Monday-Friday.) The only 2 days we actually spent at the hotel and tried to take a nice afternoon nap, we couldn't because of the noise right next door. They were repaving the parking lot, so that was ridiculously loud and very annoying to try and find somewhere to park. I appreciate all the updates they are doing but it would have been nice to have been notified of everything going on. A discount or free night would be nice to help compensate. Oh, one last thing. I did a load of laundry the day before we came home and the washer ruined 2 of my brand new shirts I had just bought and a pair of shorts. I recommend you check the washer before putting your clothes in. (I think it may be a rust stain, whatever it is, it won't come out and I am not happy about that.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Loved It! Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: EvonneZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana on our honeymoon from Nov 27/09 to Dec 5/09. Neither of us has really travelled outside of Canada before so planning our honeymoon was a bit intimidating, how do you decide on where to stay? Our decision to stay at the Mahana was pretty much soley based on the reviews I read on TripAdvisor. So hopefully this review can help others. We booked directly through the hotel and were given room #218, a one bedroom condo. When we checked in and walked up to our room (late in the evening after a long flight) and seen a crooked door knock, my heart sank.... until we opened the door and turned on the lights.
