IT WAS FANTASTIC!!!! Tile floors, granite counter tops, floor to ceiling ocean facing windows, beautiful kitchen the list just goes on. We couldn't have picked a more beauiful room if we tried. The service was great and everyone was smiling. When we were looking at location the only thing that we really cared about was an ocean front room, and this met out expectations. It was great just waking up and looking out the window to the clean blue water and the sea turtle swimming by! The beach front was awesome and the views fantastic. With no resturant on site that didn't really bother us at all, there are plenty of places to eat in Lahaina or smaller places across the road within walking distance. We did go to the neighboring hotel for supper on our last day and one thing we noticed was the amount of children at that location. At the Mahana we hardley noticed any children at all (which made the place quite and relaxing for us) Our tours we booked through Susan (the Expedia travel gal located right in the hotel) who helped us plan our week. We did the trip to watch the sun rise at Haleakala (which we didn't get to see because clouds moved in) but that trip was totally made worth it by our awesome tour guide Koa. We also did some snorkeling to Molokini (which we also didn't get to go too due to rough waters) but the great crew at the Pacific Whale Foundation took us to another location where we seen 6 sea turtles and got to touch an octupus. We were lucky enough to go whale watching (only because the whales came back early this year) and hung out with 3 humpbacks for a while. A lualu was a must and we went to the one at the Hyatt. The food was great, and so were our seats (we just paid for a standard ticket) and the open bar was always enjoyable. The road to Hana... we had every intention of driving it on our own until we booked our tours and thought the tour would be the good choice. Apparently the first part of the trip is called honeymoon alley and the later part of the trip is divorce row. I can now see why, book the tour!!! The driver doesn't get to experience the trip at all, with the 617 hairpin turns their eyes are always on the road (we hope). Plus the guides are awesome and can answer all your questions about history, plants or where to go to eat. Our honeymoon was absolutly perfect, we can't say enough good things about every aspect of it! I highly recommend #218 at the Mahana for anyone looking for that little piece of Maui paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise revisited”
Reviews.Author: TheNRHBOYDs
Reviews.Content: Working directly w/the owner who was most cooperative and straight forward made our 16 day visit here excellent, and we plan to return again to this marvelous Mahana condo (#308). We negotiated the price to a level we couldn't pass up. The condo's decor throughout was modern and tasteful. Leftover refrigerator and cabinet goodies from previous guests was a nice surprise and we too left our share. The 3rd floor, palm tree level, was stupendous. Each evening we left the bedroom door which opens onto the Lani open and slept to the sound of the Pacific lapping at the beach just below. Another nice feature here is that on site parking is free while most every property in/near Kaanapali charges daily for parking, often as much as $20 daily. A big plus to us was knowing how quiet this complex is; no noise from people above, below, or on either side as this building was so well constructed. The pool is inviting, yet smallish. One closet is full of beach gear to your use and plenty of beach towels for use as well. The kitchen has all the utensils needed including the all important cork-screw. There is a small library in the condo, mainly paperbacks left from other guests and in that spirit I left a new Vince Flynn novel to be enjoyed. The free use of the well maintained grills nearby is a plus and we did make regular use of them those evenings we dined in. The lobby ATM is convenient. Excellent Chinese food can be had reasonably at Lu Fin on Front St. close to Safeway; it's not fancy or pricey...just great.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana = Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: itsallgood1277
Reviews.Content: Oh, dear. What have I done? I've gone and spoiled myself for life. No hotel room after this will ever measure up, I'm afraid. Now, it's not a PERFECT place, but the "Con"s are most definitely outweighed by the "Pro"s. Pros: (1) 100% OCEANFRONT ROOMS! No paying through the nose for upgrades! Only a few feet of sand from the water! Waves washing up on the shore all night long to soothe you to sleep! And I will NOT apologize for using so many exclamation points! (2) We stayed in a studio room on the 9th floor, so we had a completely unobstructed view of the ocean. There are a lot of tall palm trees out front, so if this is important to you, ask for the highest room possible. Of course, the tradeoff to this is that you might get a more dated-looking room, which seemed to be the case with us. It definitely wasn't bad, but the ambience was much more 1992 than 2009. But other than the floors (see #2 in Cons), it was clean and pretty. Nice pictures on the walls throughout the unit (though I'm not a fan at all of silk plants, but that's probably just me). Frankly, for the location, we didn't give a hoot that we might have had marble countertops if we settled for a third floor unit. (3) It's RIGHT ON THE OCEAN. The sound of the waves at night is sooooo soooooooothing. We actually kept our screen door open all night just to hear it (76-degree lows are deceptive to the unaware - it's REALLY breezy in Ka'anapali/Honokowai). (4) FREE PARKING. w00t! In West Maui - actually, Hawaii in general - you must never, ever take this for granted. After coming in from a weekend in Honolulu (where free parking at a good hotel is nearly impossible), we were soooo grateful for this. (Oh, and be prepared for downtown Lahaina parking fees, and the fines if you're late getting to your car. I've been told it can get uuuuugly.) (5) Down at the end of Ka'anapali Shores place and across the street, there is a strip mall with a Snorkel Bob's, a few restaurants (mexican, pizza, coffee shop), and a supermarket. Quite nice to stock up on some essentials (although prices are probably a little bit better at KMart or Walmart around Kahului Airport, if that's where you're flying in). (6) An Expedia Local Expert on staff during most of the day if you put off scheduling all of your excursions until you arrived. We only booked a tour for Road To Hana, but were glad we did because it took us ALL around the island (which you cannot do in your rental car - you have to turn around at Kipahulu and go allllllll the way back around, or else risk making your car company VERY CRANKY). (7) A pool and hot tub on site. Yes, the pool is relatively small, but it's not bad. And I didn't swim in it anyway; that's what having an OCEANFRONT HOTEL is for. (note: bring reef shoes, as the oceanfloor right in front of the hotel is rough from coral and such) (8) Friendly front desk staff...most of the time. (The night staff tends to be a tad less enthusiastic, but they're still nice and helpful.) (9) Only 15 minutes from old Lahainatown, which has some of the best lu'aus, restaurants, sights, and shopping in all of Maui. (10) A full-size kitchen with an electric stove, dishwasher, fridge, and most importantly a WASHER AND DRYER. Had I known this, I wouldn't have packed nearly so many clothes. Darn it! ;) (11) ...Have I mentioned that this hotel is TOTALLY OCEANFRONT? And how wonderful the ocean sounds? :) Cons: (1) No restaurant on site. However, you can take your room key to the Aston Ka'anapali Shores (a relatively short walk down Ka'anapali Shores Place), eat breakfast there, and charge it to your room at Mahana (as both facilities are Aston-managed). We didn't actually do this, though; we went across the street to Pizza Paradiso for their big-as-your-head breakfast burritos, which can easily be cut in half and stored in your fridge to reheat the other half the next morning when you're dashing off super-early for Haleakala. (note well: there's no food or gas at the Summit - go prepared!). For lunch, we ate on the run, and dinner we were usually in Lahaina. But I know for a lot of people, no on-site restaurant can be a deal-breaker, so thought I'd mention it. (2) Ceramic tiles in our room were FILTHY. We were there for eight days, and I doubt they were given a proper mopping at all for our entire stay. I'm a person who loves to be barefoot (especially on a hot day on a cool floor), but even from our very first morning, I couldn't walk from the shower to the lanai without the soles of my feet being caked with grit/dirt. GROSS. I swept the floor myself several times a day, and we only made one beach trip (on our second-to-last day) and shook out everything before we went inside, so we weren't bringing THAT much dirt in. I got by with laying damp hand towels throughout the unit and occasionally wiping off my gritty feet on them (or rinsing my feet in the tub and rubbing them on the bathmat). Blech! (3) Constant renovations going on, sometimes starting as early as 8AM and going until 3PM. Sanding, chopping, nailing, drilling, sawing, UGH! If you're someone who likes to have your lanai open while you take a leisurely mid-morning or early afternoon snooze after you just got back from your 2AM Haleakala sunrise trip...well, don't expect to get any sympathy from the staff. "They have to get work done." Yeah, well, I have to relax and enjoy my vacation, too - I mean, I'm certainly not staying here for free after all! To their credit, they did contact the worker in the next room who was drilling holes in our shared wall to install a mirror in that unit, and verified we wouldn't hear anything more *from that unit* for that week. And these are condos after all (where some actually live here), not hotel rooms...not like it was any less irritating. I suppose the logical solution is then to turn on the A/C and shut the lanai door, but I thought they wanted to try us saving on energy costs? Hmm. Anyway, the construction only seemed to happen during the week, not the weekend. On the other hand... (4) Parking becomes a bit more of a headache on weekends. I don't know if residents just have more people over, or the weekend we were there was just before Thanksgiving, but we noticed a LOT less parking spots beginning Friday night through Sunday afternoon (we'd arrived the previous Sunday night). We still could find parking, just not as easily. But most of the time, you can find it very easily. And have I mentioned that it's FREE? (5) The ocean is too loud. Haha, just kidding. Honestly: WHO COMPLAINS ABOUT THE OCEAN BEING TOO LOUD? Isn't that why one elects to get an oceanfront room?! If it bothers you, perhaps you shouldn't stay at an oceanfront location. :) Two quick tips: (a) From the road, the sign is only labeled "MAHANA", along with the Ka'anapali Beach Club and Maui Kai. It doesn't say anything about Aston until you get inside - so if your exhausted jet-lagged self driving in the pitch black didn't know this, you might inadvertently end up driving into Aston Ka'anapali Shores in the next driveway and then having to explain to the gatekeeper, "whoops, wrong hotel" and getting a pass out of there. Um, not like we did this or anything. :) (b) Although the NAME of the hotel says "at Ka'anapali", the hotel is actually just across the north border of Ka'anapali in the town of Honokowai. Just in case your GPS or map directions have a hard time finding it (which, by the way, a GPS is strongly recommended to get anywhere in Hawai'i). The hotel is still considered to be on Ka'anapali Beach. A downside of staying in West Maui (in general), as opposed to South Maui (i.e. Kihei/Wailea) is that it's a longer drive to Ma'alaea (for snorkeling and the Maui Ocean Center), Kula (for Haleakala), and the road to Hana. You can't probably do snorkeling AND Haleakala AND Hana all in one day, so you're adding on about 20-30 more minutes each way with each excursion that you could be saving yourself staying in South Maui. On the other hand, you're much closer to Lahaina (VERY fun dining/shopping!) and the better lu'aus (South Maui is really NOT known for its lu'aus, if your research hasn't already indicated otherwise). After a lu'au, trust me, you want to be as close to your hotel as possible because you are going to be very tired. Plus, South Maui towns aren't nearly as picturesque. And remember: You're on vacation, and in Hawai'i no less. So stop worrying about the time, and just enjoy the rides and the scenery. YOU DON'T HAVE TO DO EVERYTHING to have a great vacation. If we stay in West Maui again, there is no question that we would stay at the Mahana again - even with all the prickly little annoyances. Because at the end of the day, that's all they were. And even with the longer drives aside, as nice and convenient and beautiful as the Mahana is, I would still put up with the commutes to stay here again. It was an absolutely amazing experience staying here, and I'm so glad that we did.

Reviews.Title: “If you love the ocean, this is your place!”
Reviews.Author: Visit Your National Parks
Reviews.Content: Beautiful studio condo (#1113). Furnished very nicely with a full-size kitchen and a large soaking tub. The big draw, however, is the ocean. Sunrise or sunset on the lanai listening to the ocean was absolutely incredible. The views are stunning, with the island of Lanai on the left and the island of Molokai on the right. The view you get on the hotel's webcam is exactly what you'll see in person (although much clearer, of course, and with sound). My wife and I snorkeled about 300 yards or so south of the hotel (to the left, if you're looking out at the ocean) and conditions were fair. Kaanapali Beach's Black Rock area provided much better snorkeling; it was as blue and clear as a swimming pool. A Snorkel Bob's (very good service) is right across the street in the plaza near Pizza Paradiso, which was pretty good. The Mexican food place was so-so at best; if you're in the mood for Mexican food, traveling south to Lahaina is probably a better bet (and it's not that far). You're also close to the Farmer's Market on the Lower Road, and that's definitely worth a stop. Good produce and free samples. It's a fun place to spend some time, and a good chance to buy local. They offer a first-day in Maui breakfast with a chance to purchase some package tours at a discounted rate (we didn't attend). The concierge and front desk staff seemed very nice. The pool and grilling facilities were very nice, and beach towels may be checked out at the front desk. By the end of our four-night stay, my wife and I were picturing ourselves retired in Maui, living in the Mahana, listening to the ocean. What a way to go! We highly recommend the Mahana. Check the website often for specials. We were able to use the government rate, which helped us out a great deal. You don't have to be on active duty to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: idontknow123
Reviews.Content: Excellent place for the price. Staff was helpful and friendly. Only complaint was that I did see a roach in our room.

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana #308 - Everything we expected and more.”
Reviews.Author: breezz02
Reviews.Content: Mahana 308 Working with this owner was great. Everything he told us was accurate. No games, no surprises, very professional. The unit was in great condition and clean. He gave us a great rate at $140 p/n. We were traveling in the off season though (Oct. 26-Nov.8). The room was just recently remodeled. New kitchen, Stainless steel refrigerator and dishwasher, tile floors, bathroom shower, kitchen table, granite counters, wall coverings, flat screens in living and bedrooms and the AC is definitely working. The kitchen is fully stocked to with pretty much everything you need to whip up a tasty island meal. Towels, chairs, umbrellas, snorkel gear, beach stuff all available too. Only negative things I can say are that the couch and bed are a bit dated and washer and dryer are tiny but THATâ€™S IT! I had to come up with something. Let me say this, the views are drop dead. This room is so close to the water that you have to get off the couch and right up to the window to see the beach. No gimmicks about this room, at all. This unit is legit. Left the sliding doors open every night and let the surf put us to sleep. There are amazing sunset and island views from your balcony too. We ate out on the lanai almost every day. Pool at the Mahana is nice and has outdoor grills available for guest use and a lawn area with loungers between the hotel and beach. The facilities do not compare with other hotels on this strip though, like the Westin, but youâ€™re not paying $350 per night either. Lobby is beautiful though. Beach directly outside the Mahana is small and rocky and not good for swimming. If you walk 2 minutes down though, it opens up. You are a 15 minute walk to Whalers village and 10 minute drive to Lahaina. Off the beaten path a little but still shops and stores within a couple minute walk. It is on the beach walk which runs about 4 miles through Whalers Village and the Kaanapali area. Free WIFI was nice, but it was spotty and slow. I took it as a sign to get off the computer though. Donâ€™t expect to do any real work here via computer. Overall, this unit was everything we expected and much more.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Condo Unit #1019”
Reviews.Author: Vcundy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Mahana at Kaanapali unit #1019 for 10 days beginning Oct 24th. This unit is not available for rent through Aston, you have to contact the owner's directly at website http://www.mahanarental.com/index2.html Unit #1019 is a CORNER unit, which offers views from EVERY room, where other units at this resort will only have the ocean front view. This condo really exceeded our expectations, they have numerous pics posted on the website of each room that will not disappoint. The location is perfect--everything you need is close by. You can easily snorkel right off the beach in front of the resort, nice swimming pool and whirlpool, numerous grills, small shopping center across the street and anything else you need close by. We've stayed at numerous places and this one tops the list! The owners really have gone above and beyond in decor and providing everything you need for a comfortable stay. As we looked at the other units here you realize the advantage to having a corner unit. If your planning a stay in Maui, I highly recommend unit #1019 at the Mahana. Other tips---for the best snorkeling, drive to Honolua Bay early in the day, you enter through private property to access the beach area---there is no charge and is where many of the paid excursions actually take you.***Drive approx. 5 miles down to FRONT street for shopping and dinning...Visit the Banyon Tree. *****Lahaina Cannery Mall is a fun place to shop. Old Lahiana Luau was wonderful and well worth the price. Dinning is expensive--expect to pay on avg.$15/$20 pp for breakfast and lunch. We shopped at Safeway and had many meals in the very well equipped kitchen at the condo. You can also save money by doing many of the excursions on your own.....Road to Hana, Haleakala Crater , Nakalele Blowhole, Wailuku. and Snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Most Beutiful Spots in the Universe”
Reviews.Author: Pyrokrusty
Reviews.Content: Hello, Rating this hotel is important to me becuase, quite honestly, it's the ratings from others on here that encouraged my wife and I to stay at the Mahana; the ratings were right, and we are extremely happy we chose this hotel. First off, just a quick bit about us to offer this in context. My wife and I travel a lot for business, and, though we do not take a lot of pure vacations, we have been around A LOT,,, and we know the difference between a good and a great hotel. Call the Mahana a condo, resort or hotel - it doesn't matter; it's a little of all of the three, and it's a great place to stay. My wife and I play between both mild and wild sides. We appreciate peace and quiet, but we are also extremely active people, so we were looking for the best of both worlds with our hotel. The Mahana is a beautiful resort. Though certainly big enough, it is not as large as some of the others in the area, but it has unique character and a real personality of its own. I have to specifically thank all the people who reviewed the Mahana as perfect for cleanliness and asthetic beauty because they were spot on and absolutely right! So, here's my own details of review: The Mahana's web site is very accurate. The actual rooms look EXACTLY like the pictures on their site, and, yes,,, they are absolutely gorgeous. The view cannot be described in fair justice. Honestly, if it's ocean view you want, there's no way possible to top this hotel. It's incredibly close to the water. The other islands are easy to see in the distance, and, when you look out your window, all you can see is ocean. The hotel is so close to the water that you honestly cannot even see the shore unless you look down (first couple floors excetion, of course...). As for what's in the view, well, the water is a touch rough right in front of the hotel, but there are very nice swimming areas within 100 - 200 yards away on either side. We tried snorkelling 125 yards to the West, and only about 30 feet from the sand shore (very soft sand by the way, far less rocky feeling than Waikiki Beach on Oahu) we saw hundreds of little fish and a few other things. One word of advice (for any Hawaii beach really) the water socks really made such a nice difference. Though there are several clear areas, it was so much nicer to not have to worry about gouging a foot on something with the water socks on. I would suggest that further as I viewed at least a dozen sea urchins while snorkelling - wouldn't want to step on one of them!!! My wife and I bought water socks, boogie boards, and snorkels, and we had a blast. Sometimes we just floated around; sometimes we snorkelled. All was very fun. The beach near the hotel is terrific. There are enough people, but it is certainly not crowded. The water you will swim/play in by the hotel can be rough, but it is not too deep. I am not a strong swimmer, and I had no trouble at all. Everything can be found in the area, but Kaanapali is nowhere near as busy as areas like Wailea. The Mahana has unique situation because of this. Again, the area directly in front of the hotel is not the top spot for swimming, so,,, that meant there was never any noise on the grounds right below us. On the other hand - 100 yards away, it was prime beach area. As for shopping - quite easy; the grocey store in the area is expensive, but it's extremely close to the hotel, and it does have everything. The famous Pizza place right behind the hotel lives up to its quality reputation. I prefer more formal meals on vacation and rarely eat pizza, but I found the other items at this place to be of excellent quality. I cannot remember the name of the place, but there is also a very nice Italian restraunt just a few blocks away. There's also the other hotels. I found it odd that the Mahana did not have it's own diner, but it really does not need it. Regarding other shopping, Lahaina is very near and has the coolest of the little shops on the island. Now, for what you probably REALLY want to know - the rooms. I'll be more brief here: The Mahana has big beutiful rooms, and they are very well kept. If you really look, you can tell that the hotel is at least a couple decades old, but everything is treated with excellent care, and it is so easy to see that everyone is trying to keep this resort at its best. When we looked at reviews, the two things we valued first were cleanliness and location. The Mahana is tops for both. We stayed there for 5 days and, "did I find any insects?" Quite honestly, yes, but ONLY one or two tiny little fly like things that were noticed on a small crack in the brick work by the bathrom mirror (right besde the outside wall). I'd challenge anyone to stay in any room on that beach and not notice at least that. I demand total cleanliness out of any hotel I stay at, and I have no problem rating the Mahana a complete 5/5 for that. It's clean - no funky smells - no mold - no major bug issues. Did I mention that the rooms are absolutely beuatiful too!?! The air conditioners are excellent quality - not the cheap outdoor wall units so many use. These ones work off interior walls (outdoor intake of course...); they are quiet and they work very well. I don't like strong air conditioning, but these were excellent if you just wanted to take the hote edge off. It's all ocean view, and the widows all have semi tranparent pull-down mesh privacy blinds. You can open them right up or leave them closed and still see through. There are additional drapes in any areas with beds if you want them, but nobody can really see into the rooms anyhow as they are so close to the water. The Lenai's are really nice. We had a one-bedroom unit, but I know the lenais are exactly the same for studios or 2 bedroom units as we checked out comparable rooms just for our own reference. My wife and I loved cuddling up on the lenais watching the waves rool in at night. In daylight, we often watched the massive sea turtle that seemed to live right outside our window. The free parking is a major plus, and though we really never used it (used the beach instead) the pool area was exceptionally clean. There are very nice outdoor shower stations to rinse off salt water right as you approach the Mahana's beach grounds, and there are walkways everywhere along the beach. Unlike many that charge in Hawaii, the Mahana has free wireless internet. They state that you need to use their hot spot on the first floor for that, but I had no trouble picking up the signal 8 floors up. If you want to print something, you'll need to acces their business center stations which charge 20 cents per minute for internet use - quite reasonable compared to other hotels in the area. The tennis courts on the grounds are very nice and offered a great additional experience. Expedia conducts some sort of 'introduction' deal in the mornings for new guests, but they won't hastle you to attend. I don't know if they talk any type of time share deal or not, but I do know that nobody ever pressured us to attend (and we didn't go). The front desk simply let us know that it was offered. There is a concierge who seemed quite friendly in the lobby. Personally, use this site, do the research, and book what you want, but, if not, she can hook you up with just about any tour. I am interested in trying Wailea just due to curiosity the next time I'm in Maui, but I cannot imagine another hotel/resort nicer than the Mahana. My wife and I will certainly look forward to our next stay there. PS: We stayed on the 8th floor in a one bedroom unit. We also saw untis on the 4th and 12 floor just for comparison. All rooms are very quiet and quite beautiful. The only noise you'll here at the Mahana is the waves. I truly believe that the Mahana is one of the most beautiful spots in this universe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent condo and view!”
Reviews.Author: drpeperlvr
Reviews.Content: When we made reservations at the Mahana, we asked to have a condo that was on a higher floor and one of the upgraded units. We arrived and was shown to condo 408 and immediately walked back out and asked for a better condo. Luckily we were given condo 807. When we walked in it was like night and day compared to 407. Nice clean tile throughout the condo, granite counter tops, upscale stainless refrigerator, stove and microwave. Shower was tile with some rock design in the bottom. Really looks cool. The large window has a motorized shade and nice furniture. We were very happy and comfortable in this condo. The downside to this hotel is that there is not a restaurant attached and the front desk clerks. Upside is the view, nice pool and hot tub and mainly adults. Beach out front is rocky but yoiu can walk a little distance to a nice swimable part of the beach. I will say that our housekeeper was always asking if everything was alright when she saw us and the grounds people were friendly. One evening a younger male at the front desk was very nice and had a smile, as for the rest of the front desk people, not friendly at all. The wireless internet worked fine in our unit. The Mahana needs a few personal touches to make it even better, but I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb view and excellent room but still with some limitations”
Reviews.Author: spicykit
Reviews.Content: Rented through vrbo and got a nicely decorated roomy and clean 1BR unit at a great rate. Thanks to the owner!! As other said, the view especially the sunset is superb and I can't agree more! I know that many people buy CD that plays wave sound to soothe them to sleep, but maybe since I am a "city" person and light sleeper who is not used to the sound of wave, the wave get pretty loud especially at night when it is high tide. I have to wear ear plugs in order to fall asleep. I just wish that they have installed a better soundproof balcony glass door in the bedroom. The glass windows in the living room has much better soundproof. Also I was glad to book through the owner instead of using Mahana. I find the people at the reception area not too helpful. The owner told us to bring recycling glasses/bottles to the reception area when we checked out and so we did. However, when we talked to the receptionist, she doesn't seem to know why we brought the recycling bottles down. And when I pass them the bag of plastic bottles, she does not want to take it at all with the attitude that as if I was passing her some dirty/stinky trashes and asked me to just throw on the floor... One thing I have to praise is their cleaning staff, I saw them always sweeping the floor and keeping the hotel area very clean and well maintained. Another limitation is the shore right in front of the hotel is pretty rocky and wave pretty strong when it is high tide so it is no suitable for swimming at all. Also the supermarket nearby is not really within walking distance especially if you are carry heavy groceries. So everytime when we need to go get something we have to drive although it is just less than 3 mins drive... They also claimed to have Free High Speed Internet maintained by hotel not individual owner. However, the speed is no where near High. There is one day we had to stay in to log on to the internet to do some work, and throughout the day the signal strength was either low or very low. Takes forever to load a webpage and sometimes the signal is so low that IE just throws cannot connect error. I would recommend the hotel because of the view and the unit but not the hotel service, so better off rent through vrbo.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana #216 a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MINN7
Reviews.Content: We rented #216 at the Mahana from the owner for 5 nights. When we walked into the condo, it looked like we were floating on the water because the ocean is so close! Beautiful views from the living room, lanai, and MBR. The condo is updated with stainless steel and granite and furnished very attractively, obviously with great care and love. It's a 1BR 1 BA unit that was spacious and comfortable and had a large flat screen tv. There is a large shower and no tub, which is fine with us. This is a great location, easy driving distance or 1/2 hour walk from Whalers Village. There is no beach immediately in front, but you can go in the water just a few minutes either direction from the building. The sunsets from the condo were fantastic! Sophie, the owner, was wonderful to work with; she has prepared a large notebook with area information and suggestions. She also left us a yummy gift basket. If we are lucky enough to return to Maui, we would definitely rent this unit again. On the north end of Kaanapali Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Not a better view anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: aimlesscat
Reviews.Content: We chose the Aston Mahana off the internet based on the ocean view and the kitchen. We couldn't have been more pleased with the view and the sound of the surf. The surf was so loud we actually slept with the door closed and still heard it. The balconies are very private with wonderful sunset views. The hotel was extremely clean. There were people cleaning around the clock. There is a boardwalk starting right next to the hotel which takes you all the way down the beach past Black Rock so it's perfect for a morning or evening stroll. They have a tennis court to use at no charge, as well as a pool and shuffleboard. Swimming right off the hotel isn't great as there is coral, but a short walk on the beach takes you to a wonderful swimming location. Parking was no problem at all. Desk staff was helpful and professional. There is a nice grocery store across the street, and great grills available on a tiled area outside. The only thing we didn't like was that our room (504) was very dated. It was clean, but looked like it was decorated circa 1980. They are individually owned so I am sure there are nicer ones. I would stay there again though for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ocean/sunset view”
Reviews.Author: Pepsimanfan
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to the islands and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. The view was the best we could have asked for -- overlooking the ocean and amazing sunsets every evening! It was very clean but the decor a little dated -- we didn't come to Maui to stay in the room so that was not a big deal!! The staff was very accommodating. We were first placed in a ground level unit and asked if they had anything higher (12 floors) -- we did get a fourth floor room which was more to our taste. They had some construction project on the outside of the units but they were only working during the day when we were out exploring the island so it didnâ€™t bother us. We had a full kitchen which gave us the option of eating in if we wanted. The rooms have a washer and dryer in case you donâ€™t want to pack much. We rate this as one of our best ever finds!!

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE AT IT'S BEST”
Reviews.Author: badych
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days with the love of my life , at a place that is paradise. Great location, away from all the traffic and crowds. A view out of this world. Pool and beach front can't get any better,stuff was the best. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the view, average accomodation”
Reviews.Author: fijiqueen
Reviews.Content: The thing about the Mahana is that every room is different since they're individually owned so it's hard to tell what you're going to get. We booked 8 months in advance and requested a high room (to see better sunsets over the trees/noise from below) and asked for one that was upgraded. They seemed to totally ignore that and gave us a room on the 2nd floor that was not upgraded so we requested another room and got one on the 9th floor that was decent but nothing great. It has a kitchen and a laundry so it made life a little easier but we really chose this place for the views. The sun set straight ahead of you and the beach was quiet and remote (mainly b/c it's too rocky for it to be a popular spot for snorkelling/watersports). We really didn't spend any days AT the hotel itself.... there's not much to do.... but I made sure we were back at our balcony for sunset every night. Bottom line, don't expect anything fabulous unless you get lucky enough to have an upgraded room, but if you want a quiet place to come back to with a spectacular oceanfront view (all rooms have oceanfront balconies) then this is worth it. Oh, another thing that as annoying is that we booked 8 months ago directly through the Mahana and I'd been checking on a monthly basis for other rates and found none only to find out that people who had booked as walk-ins or 2 weeks prior paid $35 less a day for booking directly as well. Then when I asked, they wouldn't lower our price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ramblereddie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mahana @ Kaanapali. The staff was friendly. The room was well maintained and appointed. Our room was right on the ocean. Everything was clean and fresh looking. The entire stay went very smoothly. I would definately try to get this place again when we go back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Very good...Could be excellent though.”
Reviews.Author: roisnem
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mahana for our anniversary and we did enjoy it for the most part. They had renovations going on and it was very annoying especially given that they started at 8:00 am everyday with the cutting of metal (VERY LOUD AND ANNOYING) to where it made it impossible to sleep in which for us is kind of important on vacation. I think that the hotel should have given special rates or at least a coupon off the next stay to those affected as it was select floors that were being worked on and they know who was going to get the nice morning wake up calls with the metal grinding. The view was just insane with a panoramic view of the ocean right from the window & balcony. There is unfortunately little to do around there without walking a considerable distance and the hotel does not provide a shuttle and instead you must rely on public transit or drive yourself place. The rooms were very nice except for the outdated A/C controls which did not work very well. The bathrooms only have showers which lacks the romance of what a bath would provide. The elevators are extremely annoying, almost as equally as the noise from their renovations as they beep constantly for no reason. Most elevators beep to let you know that they have arrived at your floor and that they are going to now open, well these ones beep regardless, and it is not a quiet, subtle beep but a decently loud and sleep deprecating beeping. Mahana staff, if you are reading this, PLEASE STOP THE INCESSANT BEEPING! The maid service is whatever as they only change the sheets every 3 days, and they do not clean the floors, so a few days in we had sand all over the entire floor to where you had to wipe your feet off to get into bed. The last complaint would be the in room safe...they charge for it?! I have never been to a hotel that charges to use the safe. It is also the most outdated safe that I have ever used at any vacation establishment. Most are digital or card swipe, nope this one had a good old turn key that if you lost you owed them a bazillion dollars for(WOW). If you are going to stay here just go for the view and the fact that it is equiped with a kitchen and perhaps the price. Other than that there are some much more centralized, and happening places on Maui that would serve you better than the Mahana. Either way enjoy Maui! It is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: Mark3529
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 10 days in Maui staying at the Mahana resort. We have nothing but good things to say about our stay. The resort staff were friendly and helpful. The grounds were very well kept. Out condo unit (1209) was a two bedroom, beautifully decorated, and very up to date... stainless appliances, granite countertops, tile floor throughout, beautiful decorations and paintings, with three flat screen TVs, a DVD, and stereo sound system. Of course, the best thing about staying at the Manaha is the view. Ocean front, in fact I mentioned to my wife that while sitting on the balcony or looking out from the living room or bedroom, you would think you were on a cruise ship because all you see is water and the islands. The sunsets were outstanding right from the balcony. As you've probably read, the beach directly in front is not for swimming, but you can walk a very short distance in either direction for a great beach and we liked the lounge chairs in the grass area. We used those often too. Do not be concerned about the construction. They are working on the balconies, but only between 8 and 3, Monday through Friday. It did not bother us at all. Do not book your activities until you get there. Susan, with Expedia, will help you book whatever you want. You get the Expedia discount and if you have an AARP card, you get another 10% discount. I booked some things in advance and I wish I had waited. I could have gotten a better deal from her and she is fantastic. She really knows about all the activities and can get you set up with anything you want to do. I give the Manaha a "10 out of 10." You won't be sorry with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to Stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: TravelerJames
Reviews.Content: We rented a 1 bedroom condo directly from the owner. The rental process was seamless and the owner was very accommodating. The price of the condo was a fraction of what you would pay for an equivalent unit at a big name hotel on Kaanapali. It was a 1 bedroom OCEANFRONT with a full kitchen, washer/dryer, and living room. I couldn't find a standard room with a view of the parking lot at the main resorts for the same price. The unit had two 42" plasma tvs. We barely watched the tvs but it's a good gauge of the quality that was put into this condo. The furniture and decor was elegant and beautiful. The unit was as clean as could be. As I'm sure everyone knows, the view is ridiculous good. All the units are oceanfront and you can just stare out at the ocean for hours if you wanted. The side of the condo that faces the ocean is all glass windows and a balcony. The balcony was a good size and we spent many nights out there with drinks watching the sunset between Molokai and Lanai. We saved a staggering amount of money because of the condo. We went grocery shopping the first night at Star Market just down the road and picked up stuff to make breakfast and alcoholic beverages. Yes groceries are expensive, but not nearly as expensive as it would be to go out for every meal. Somehow they have found a way to charge $80 for breakfast for two in Maui at the hotels. We cooked breakfast at the condo every morning before we went out. We did carryout for most lunches when we were near the condo. Again, a huge savings over sitting at a restaurant with a beautiful view of the ocean. You are paying for the view and location but if you're staying at the Mahana you already have that view....plus you have privacy plus the booze is a fraction of the cost because you got it from the grocery store. There are a lot of places to pick up fresh fish or whatever you want right on the main drag that the Mahana is on. We loved The Fish Market Maui, went there twice on our 4.5 day trip. Get the ono burrito. The only downsides were very small issues for us. We had to drive and pay for parking when we wanted to go to Black Rock for snorkeling plus we just really liked the beach right in that area. But then again we didn't have to pay for parking at the Mahana or internet as we would have done at a hotel so we still felt like we were still ahead. The beach in front of the hotel is not good for swimming but you can go a little further down each way for better beaches. Once again we just drove to Black Rock because the main part of Kaanapali beach really is awesome. The pool is small but then again I really feel like the ocean water is too awesome to be sitting in a pool. I understand kids like pools so maybe it's worth paying a lot more money if you have kids to stay the Hyatt or Sheraton. I used to be a pool person but when the water is as clear and warm as in Maui and the beaches so soft and inviting you're wasting your time in the pool. Our flight out was not until 8:40 pm and the owner allowed us a 6 pm checkout. How many hotels will allow that? Not many unless you pay for another day. It essentially gave us an extra day in Maui since we were able to have a base of operations the whole last day and clean up before we headed to the airport. Hey if money is no object by all means go with a 1 bedroom oceanfront suite at one of the swanky resorts but for the rest of us the Mahana is a great way to enjoy Maui and save enough money to go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, good view bad location”
Reviews.Author: masgharnia
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and the view was hands down amazing! The pool was really small and didnt really give me that paradise feel so we actually ended up going to the pool next door. Grocery store right accross the street so that was very convinient. So the only reason I didnt rate this place a five was 1) small pool 2) pretty much no beach and too much rocks and reef to swim in beach. My suggestion is to stay at the Sheraton hotel and or any of the ones right next to it like the Kaanapali Beach Hotel if Sheraton is too expensive for you. They have an amazong beach there and bars and activities like snorkeling and ket skiing near by which pretty much means you dont have to even go anywhere throughout your trip and can stay near the hotel. Oh and really great shopping there too.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I could've expected!”
Reviews.Author: pilotgirl83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mahana in mid-April. Every room has an oceanview room so that was a plus. I really liked that they had fresh flowers at the front desk everyday you could put one in your hair. The downside to this place is the beach out in front of the resort has too much coral to be able to get in. I love to get in the water so this was a downside for me, but you could walk down the beach in either direction for one that was swimmable and those were fantastic! I could see the bottom even when I wasn't able to touch the ocean floor. Being there in April from our Lanai (that's what everyone calls your balcony) we were able to see turtles and whales out in the ocean (Season typically runs from Dec-April I believe February being the best month for whale watching). And nothing compares to watching the sunset. We slept with the windows open so we could hear the ocean all night, very peaceful. The windows are full length and provide a beautiful view. The kitchen is also full of utensils. From what I understand each room is slightly different, but where we stayed was excellent and I wouldn't expect anything less from the rest of the place. There was even a personalized touch with a journal of all those who had stayed in our room prior to our arrival, their time, experiences and recommendations. I would definitely stay there if I went back.

Reviews.Title: “*Best choice-hands down!*- Absloutely breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: Reyna42
Reviews.Content: -Stop debating- THE MAHANA IS THE BEST PLACE TO STAY IN MAUI- No better way of saying it other than it isTRULY A HOME AWAY FROM HOME. My husband and I went to Maui Aug 10th through the 15th for our 1yr anniversary and also our honeymoon since my husband got deployed for seven months shortly after our wedding. I knew Maui was the best place to go but wow- staying at the Mahana made our trip the best it could have ever been. Before I begin to tell you every reason you should book this place I think by you knowing that we paid only about $160/night vs. the $250-300/night other people pay to stay in a "patrial oceanview" room in a crowded resort is enough to get you excited. We stayed in Unit #412 and we booked through the condo owner herself (mauibeachvacation.com). Sue was extremely helpful and made sure we had everything we needed to make our vacation memorable. The room...- how do I begin- IT WAS AMAZING! Everything from the decor to the wonderful fully stocked kitchen to the amazing bathroom to the comfy bed to the convenient washer/dryer and best of all THE VIEW WAS LITERALLY BREATH TAKING! Waking up and going to sleep to sound of the ocean literally outside your window was enough to say- WE are coming back. The room even had a boogy board, beach towels and snorker gear! You could really tell Sue puts lots of thought into the decor of the place and includes everything and anything you may need. We had never stayed in a condo in the past and we loved it! Being able to cook your own breakfast and eat on your own lanai right in front of the ocean was incredible. And not to mention the greatly appreciated privacy since this place is no where close to being overcrowded and there is no swimming allowed right in front of the building so that's another plus. Even though you are away from Kaanaplai beach- this beach and all other great beaches and activites/food is very close by. (maybe like 5-10minute drive and there is also a shipping center right across the street from the hotel). The pool isnt avery spectacular but you can always go pool hopping if you want - OR GOING SWIM IN THE BEAUTIFUL OCEAN- YOU'RE IN MAUI. Last recommendations- Do the Safari Boat Excurions tour-MUST DO, see the Westin Luau above all other Luaus, eat at Cheese Burger Paradise in Lahiana-best best burgers, do the road to Hana-great adventure, do the 1200 feet Parasailing-not scarey/lots of fun, book all activities through tombarefoot.com (the are the cheapest of all), take lots of pictures so you remember EVERYTHING and WEAR LOTS OF SUNSCREEN! =) Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean rainbows from The Mahana, thank God all mighty”
Reviews.Author: Mauithegreat
Reviews.Content: I just left The Mahana yesterday and It was my second time staying there with my parents. When I book trips to Maui I don't even bother to check anything else because this is the place!!!, i thas the best view one can ever imagine, To the left one can see the island of Lanai, in the middle the beautiful ocean and to the right the island of Molokai. We have been on the 12th floor both times, and believe me the views from there are UNBELIEVABLE!!! The staff was very helpful, especially when I got really sick. They were ready to help and I ended going to the ER that night, but thank God the next days I was like nothing had happened after taking the medicine. We also discovered on the other side of the street a REAL GOOD restaurant, actually the best, Java Jazz. Java Jazz is excellent with its food and service. The Mahana and Maui in my opinion have to go side by side!!! We hope God can grant us another visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Mahana”
Reviews.Author: CAtortoise
Reviews.Content: We are a bit late in this review but we stayed at the Mahana in February 2009. We had not stayed there in 10 years so we were looking forward to going back. We had a wonderful time-excellent view with lots of whales. The room was very clean and quiet. There is a large building going up to the south so I do recommend that you stay in the north tower. The only problem is that you are not guaranteed a specific room. We had a 10 night stay planned so we wanted a quiet room that was high so we could see the whales. So I did become a bit of a pest with emails to make sure that we would get what we requested. And while I was not thrilled that one of the staff called me 'her stalker" I was very pleased that being so persistent paid off for a wonderful room. And we did tip the front desk staff for getting us such a nice room. We hope to go again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: funnytraveler1
Reviews.Content: I was bumped from my booked hotel, the Kanapalli Shores and was sent to this sister hotel. Glad it happened! The Mahana was a great place to stay. I was given room #318 and it had an incredible ocean view. The front desk staff was very friendly, especially Debbie. The hotel has free, convenient parking and among other things, gas grills for guests. It's location is convenient for the beach, dining and grocery stores. If I ever return to Maui, I am staying here without question.

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana at Kaanapali 1213”
Reviews.Author: kbroughton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the The Mahana at Kaanapali Unit 1214 in June 2009 (in the Lanai building). What a wonderful experience!! The condo is in a great location on Kaanapali beach in West Maui. We felt like we were staying in a resort! The beach and pool were both superb! The condo unit itself was very nicely decorated. We actually loved that it was a studio because we had full-length windows right next to our bed to watch the ocean (and sunsets!) from. Talk about a fantastic view! Our only complaint is that we wish the unit was stocked with "gear" for the visitor (i.e., snorkel stuff, beach umbrella, coolers, etc.). Touches like this would have gone a long way in turning our stay from a great one into a fantastic one! However, that aside, we had a great time! When we go back to Maui we'll likely stay in this unit again!

Reviews.Title: “Aston Mahana is a very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: alig8or
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a summer deal to stay at the Mahana and was pleased with our selection. While the property was well maintained, it does lack a little on amenities. There is no eating facility in the condo complex and the beach is very small due to a close shoreline and a reef directly outside; however, there is a nice beach at a sister property about 100 yards west. Beach was not our biggie, so this was not a disadvantage. The pool was small, but not crowded and very well kept. There was no bar or waiters to supply drinks, but again, this was not a problem for us. Our room was gorgeous. All rooms face the ocean directly and since it faces west, the sunsets were "to die for". The 1 bedroom suite we had was roomy and had two complete baths, making it easy for us to dress quickly without bumping to each other. The kitchen was small, but well appointed and complete with all needed dishes, etc. I would not recommend this location to a family with teens or tots, but for a for a couple it was excellent with ample free parking, easy access to your room, and close to good entertainment and shopping. It was a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy construction”
Reviews.Author: sonicblues
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location but they are working on the balconies and spalling during the day and the hammering and power chisels vibrate through the whole building. The work is going on through till the end of October so I'd recommend staying somewhere else unless you're just in for the weekend or plan to be out all day. Maybe ask for a BIG discount.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: nicolgang
Reviews.Content: Spacious, comfortable apartment with outstanding views. Quiet rooms, friendly service, nice pool. Very good value. Beach directly in front has coral, but sandy beaches are 200 yards away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but parents watch your kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: detmike
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Mahana three times for 15+ days each and loved it . We did have a challenging time though, this 3rd visit, with parents not watching their kids there - it made part of our stay unpleasant at times. It is nothing like a kid doing a cannoball right next to your head and the parents doing nothing about it while in the pool. Or sitting in the hot tub, with a sign stating under 14 needing supervision - with a kid coming in with no parents and then playing with the metal rings at the bottom of the handrails inside or practicing their kick swimming - of course the parents left and went to their rooms at this point. Or a kid hoping in the pool that was around 8 years old with no supervision splashing around - parents took off. Mind you, these instances happened more than once! My wife and I plan a vacation for relaxation. This means I do not feel like babysitting your kid or having them infringe upon our space with no parent around to correct them. We pay money to stay there as well, why not respect this!!! Annoying....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views”
Reviews.Author: illinigal
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the delay- better late than never. We stayed in room 1015 at the Mahana in late October 2008. When we stayed at the Mahana, it was a ResortQuest property. I understand it is now an Aston property, so I don't know if any changes have been made because of that. The rooms are individually owned, so some rooms are more updated than others. We got lucky- room 1015 was updated and beautiful. Nice cabinets, granite counters, travertine tiled shower. Our room had a kitchen, dining room area, and living room. And then off the hallway was a laundry closet, bathroom, and bedroom with king-size bed and another bathroom included. Both the living room and bedroom had huge floor to ceiling windows with amazing views of the ocean and Molokai, which could also be enjoyed on the balcony. The beach out in front of the hotel is narrow, but is clean, and widens if you walk a short distance in either direction. Sunsets over the water are fabulous. We also enjoyed the free wifi from our room. There are several restaurants nearby, but not very many so you'll probably want to drive down to Lahaina for dinner. There are lots of great dinner choices in Lahaina. And if you have leftovers, you can bring them back to your room since you'll have a frig and microwave- very helpful. When we return to Maui someday, we will definitely plan to stay at the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: jenlyn17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana June 29-July 8th for our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. We rented through the owners we found on VRBO and were delighted at how nice the accomodations were. Unit 316 was more than we could have asked for. The pictures on the owner website don't do the condo justice. The owners were very nice and easy to work with. They have their own website, mauimahana.com, if you're interested. The grounds at the mahana are very well kept. The staff was great and friendly. The location was perfect for those who want a slower pace and less crowded environment than is found in Ka'anapali. The shopping center across the street has a great little restaurant called Pizza Paradiso. The cheesesteak sandwiches and the gyros were fantastic. Also, the Star Market seemed to be reasonably priced for a grocery store in Hawaii. The view from the condo was breathtaking. We spent so much of our time sitting on our balacony watching boats go by and people walking along the beach, playing games, and enjoying pina coladas. We found ourselves not wanting to leave. We definitely want to return to the Mahana and will definitely be renting unit 316 again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: BLG522
Reviews.Content: The Mahana at Ka'anapali is a great value. The location, the rooms, the service, the view--all are exceptional. Although the beach is a little too rocky (coral) for swimming, the Mahana is right on it and sandier beaches are nearby. The condo also has a wonderful pool. No restaurant on site, but there's an agreement with a nearby hotel that has one (which we never bothered with). The appliances in our suite were all new and we even had a great washer and dryer in the master bedroom. We stayed on the 10th floor where we have views of Molokai and Lanai. The sunsets were transcendent. The Mahana helped make this a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: gatekeeperlion
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for our wedding.honeymoon. We loved it. The front desk clerk was wonderful and had good advice on where to eat and things to do. Our room was very nice and clean, with the best view we could imagine. We would love to stay there forever! Zero problems and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view with the sound of the ocean”
Reviews.Author: IanneYan
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter (2 y.o.) and I stayed here from June 15-June 23. We arranged our accomodations through Expedia, which was actually cheaper than going through VRBO. Our room was #1208, which was a 1 bedroom condo. The kitchen and bathroom were updated with granite counter tops and tiled floors. The decor wasn't our style, but it was nice enough and relatively kid friendly. I am glad that my sister didn't come with us, as the sofa bed was terrible with very uncomfortable springs at the surface. The staff was friendly, although our interaction with them was relatively minimal. A very BASIC crib with very slim "mattress" was provided, but I was grateful regardless. I tucked 2 standard pillows under the 2 inch pad for a little extra cushioning. It was also very small; luckily my daughter is rather petite, so she just barely fit! The view from the living room and lanai/balcony were to die for. Just beautiful. As for swimming with a little one, the beach right in front isn't very friendly because it has a fast drop off. A little walk to the north in front of Ka'anapali Shores is a nice little beach that many families hung out at. We didn't get a chance to snorkle since we had a young one with us, but many reviewers indicate that it's not too bad here. When we went it was also VERY windy, so much so that the sand kicked up and pelted your skin. This freaked my daughter out -- not a reflection of the hotel though. Maui is very expensive, so brace yourself. There is a Star Market nearby, but I would recommend you travel about 10 minutes south to the Lahaina Safeway. MUCH more reasonable. Of course, there are numerous restaurants in the vicinity, but expect to drop at least $25 for takeout for 2. For the value, I would definitely recommend this place. The hotel is quiet and private with no frills, and the location allows you to experience the laid back, somewhat less touristy side of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location!”
Reviews.Author: mwooduk
Reviews.Content: We had four nights here after a week at the Royal Hawaiian in Honolulu. Room 415 far exceeded our expectations. A gorgeous one bedroom, two bath condo with floor to ceiling windows, a jetted tub in the master bathroom, a stunning kitchen, all the amenities you could ask for including a cooler for the beach and a great patio! It's fabulous. The staff are nice, the pool and jacuzzi are very nice and there's plenty of chairs. There is a stunning coral reef right off the shore where we saw tons of fish and a turtle. There is a grocery store about a mile away where you can stock up on provisions and you can rent snorkel gear right up the road for $1.75 a day! Very impressive place and no extra charge for parking! (refreshing in Hawaii!) There is also a fantastic walking path just outside the hotel which you can take all the way down to Whaler's Village or the Sheraton at Black Rock. Great for exercising. Stay here, it's fabulous! We can't wait to go back! Don't forget to ask for the AAA discount:-) We still dream of the waves crashing on the shore and we've been home for a month!

Reviews.Title: “The View doesn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: Hawkins30102
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at Mahana Ka'anapali. The view from the room was magnificent to say the least. The room was clean & the staff was wonderful. We actually were supposed to leave on the 11th and head to Oahu, however, we were enjoying our time and location so much...we stayed here until the 14th. My family and I would stay here again in a heartbeat. If I could make one suggestion...Mahana needs vending machines.

Reviews.Title: “Maui - the Paradise”
Reviews.Author: AlohaOttawa
Reviews.Content: Aston Mahana at Kaanapali formerly ResortQuest We stayed 4 days in Maui, the Paradise on earth. Maui is more expensive than Oahu (Honolulu). We rented the condominium based on the reviews posted on Expedia. I would recommend the place because for the price we paid we had reasonable comfort (kitchen included, with stainless steel appliances in our room) but with a five stars view and a beach basically to ourselves. POSITIVES: The view is breathtaking: the ocean is â€œbeneath â€œthe balcony. Basically, sitting in the bed you look at the ocean... and at the other neighbouring islands, Molokai and Lanai. The beach is almost just for you. Not too many people around, as in the resorts crowded with hotels (picture attached: the view from the balcony). The location: On Maui, you need a car to go around. The Condo is located into the west side of the island. Within walking distance of the Condo, there is a big store for food and other places to eat. I would highly recommend the Pizza Paradiso. One of the best pizza I ever ate and, definitely, the best Tiramisu ever. It is a casual, family friendly place (looks more like a fast-food) where you buy your stuff from the counter. The people are extremely warm and nice. We ended up eating there every night. I felt like I was going to see my friends. They won numerous awards for their Tiramisu and pizza. If anyone wants to buy food, there is also a Costco located near the airport; the cheese selection was absolutely great and half of the price we regularly pay in Canada at the same store. They sell good wine as well. Amenities: kitchen, washing & dryer machines in the room; pool, barbeques, sauna, towels, free parking and free Internet which worked better outside, on the beach chairs... which was great! Recommended places on Maui: Haleakala Volcano and then coming down, go inland towards the Kula area. Visit the farms and the small shops . We liked the Tedeski Winery and the Lavender farm. The Hana road. The Wailea in south, with the Four Seasons and other luxury resorts. There is a shopping mall (a luxury one) in the area where you can park the car. Then head towards the hotels/beaches. Great place for weddings. If you go north, DO NOT DIVE on the KAHEIKILI Hwy, between Poelua Bay and Waiehu. The road is plain dangerous (one lane cliff-hanger road, no space to turn, no space for incoming traffic, lots of blind curves!). We used a map from the rental agency . The Hana Road drive is nothing compared with that portion. Absolutely crazy, and did not understand why there is no sign to let people know of that dangerous road prior to entering it. NEGATIVES: After staying in Hilton Prince Kukio in Honolulu, the room in this condo looked sad and outdated: dark brown colours with artificial flowers. Once I did some changes, and moved the plastic flower on the balcony, the view and the ocean brought back the spirit of Aloha inside.

Reviews.Title: “Good snorkelling just down the beach. Excellent place to stay while on Maui”
Reviews.Author: danno719
Reviews.Content: We were in unit 608 and were perfectly happy with it. I noticed a lot of reviewers had to change rooms before being happy. I was prepared to ask to change but there was no reason to. The place is probably one of the best values on the island. If you like to snorkel there is a sign by the pool pointing you 125 yards one way and 200 yards the other way to snorkel. I suggest going about Â¼ mile towards Black Rock to snorkel. Walk down the beach or on the boardwalk just past the 3rd beach access walkway, swim out about 30 yards to a nice little reef. For some nearby really nice snorkeling, about Â½ mile down the same direction is Kahekili Beach Park (AKA Old Airport Beach.) You will know you are there when you see the restrooms and showers. Get there before noon when the wind shifts though. We booked a Luau through the activity desk in the lobby. Susan hooked us up with a great rate. She was very helpful and didnâ€™t try and shove the time share garbage down my throat. She mentioned it, I said no thank you, and she left it at that. They have wifi, but the reception in our room was iffy, it was best out on the lawn by the beach, or the parking lot. Itâ€™s not in the middle of it all, but you need a car on Maui anyway. There are some stores for necessities right at the entrance. Definitely worth checking out if you are going to stay in the Kaanapali area.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Crazy88SD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana towards the end of May. We ended up staying in two different rooms (1 bedroom units), 817 in the South tower and 404 in the North tower. The unit on the 8th floor was just above the tops of the palm trees and had incredible views. We had seen pictures of some of the rooms and were hoping to get a unit that was similar to what we had seen. Our unit had been updated at one point, but it seems they overspent on the bathroom and kind of ran out before really doing everything else right. The room wasn't bad, but just not quite what we were expecting. I think the rose colored carpet, linoleum flooring and laminate (granite looking) counter tops in the dated kitchen threw us off. There were no ceiling fans either, but luckily we found a portable fan in the closet. It was still a comfortable place to be, but after seeing picture of other rooms, we were hoping for more. Iâ€™ve read other reviews about this room that described it as a great room to be in. I guess we just had different tastes than some. We did ask for another room, but the only available room that day had about the same decor as the one we were in and it was on a lower floor. We were ready to relax and enjoy ourselves, so we decided to not worry about trying to get another room. Just a warning, there is a new time share complex being finished near the South Tower. We didnâ€™t hear the construction from our room, but I do think it upset some of the other guests. Unfortunately for us there was also needed repair work going on in the South tower at the Mahana. They had a movable platform rigged up, the kind they use to wash windows, and were working on the beach side of the building. By day 6 of our trip it had moved to our section of the building. I went downstairs and let them know we didnâ€™t want to hear or see the repair work going on for our last 2 days of the trip. Luckily there was another unit available right away. It took us about an hour to move our belongings and transfer the food from one refrigerator to another. It was an inconvenience, but worth it in the end. Our new room was in the North tower on the 4th floor. Overall it was a much nicer room, very nice bathroom and updated kitchen with all granite countertops, new cabinets and just overall better dÃ©cor. The only complaint I had was our new bed was really hard and was only a double (we had a King in our first room). The view was still spectacular, just below the palm trees so we could still see everything. Having a full kitchen was a huge plus for us. We bought the bulk of our food and drink at Costco and we're able to save money on breakfast, lunches and a few dinners (we used the saved money for activities). We also bought some small items at the Star mart nearby (expensive). I would recommend taking a collapsible cooler with you. It was perfect for packing a lunch and drinks for our day trips as well as just hanging out down at the beach. The pool area was nice, never over crowded. There are plenty of lounge chairs around the pool and on the lawn, so plenty of places to lay out and enjoy the day. We rented snorkel gear and went out right in front of the Mahana almost everyday. There are areas you can enter near the Mahana that are sandy so you don't step on and destroy the coral. It was crystal clear while we were there and was a really great place to snorkel! We had an 8:45pm flight home and werenâ€™t sure what we were going to do with a noon checkout. The front desk told us we could store our luggage with them until 4pm and continue to use the facilities all day. We packed our cooler with drinks, bought some take out and hung out at the pool until around 3:30pm, cleaned up, then headed out to make our dinner reservation before our flight home. They have showers available to use at the pool restrooms. The Mahana provided us with towels for the pool as well as for the showers. It ended up being a very relaxing last day. If you have a late flight, plan for it. If you are really picky about the room, the only way to guarantee what you are getting is to rent directly from the owner. We went through expedia and took our chances. Could have been better, but overall still a great place to stay. Sitting out on the lanai, listening to the waves and watching the sun set was really what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana AGAIN is the best!”
Reviews.Author: greatsteinways
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Karen and the rest of the staff for making our stay at the Mahana all it could be. This was not our first visit to this condo, and it won't be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Tropical Paradise that feels much more exclusive!”
Reviews.Author: stlouieblues
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana from 5/19/09-5/25/09. We couldn't have been more pleased with our choice. The staff was always pleasant with an Aloha! on their lips, everyone from the desk to the pool to the housekeeping staff. Every room is facing the ocean so you always have an ocean view! We were given a room on the 7th floor with a breathtaking view of the ocean and the two islands Lana'i and Moloka'i. As we stepped through the foyer to the room we were taken aback by the exquisite decor. The comfort of this room made our stay that much more pleasant to return to after our excursions on the island as tourists! The bed was heaven at night, with the sound of the waves to lull you to sleep. (The first night they kept me awake as I was unused to the sound, but slept soundly the following nights!). The beach is right there just a few steps from your room. A short 150-200 yard walk towards Black Rock brings you to one of the best snorkeling spots on the island. We walked the beach daily in the morning and snorkeled every morning! The variety of fish is amazing! We saw several we had seen in the Caribbean and many others that were new to us. We even saw a moray eel. We actually saw more fish from the beach than on the snorkeling trip we took the first day out to Molokini Crater. The pool was a nice respite from the salty ocean. My husband appreciated the BBQ grills next to the pool that were kept spotlessly clean. He would grill a steak for him and Mahi-Mahi for me which we would eat out on the lanai with a glass of wine, while listening to the waves and watching surfers with chutes, kayakers, and strollers on the beach. If you prefer to pay for your meals it's a very short walk next door to the Maui Kai or 3 doors down to the Ka'anapali Shores where you can charge your meal to your room. You can walk across the street to shop at the Star Market or drive 4 miles down the road to Lahaina and shop Safeway. The washer/dryer in the room made it so easy to only bring carry-ons on the plane since we didn't have to bring tons of clothing; and bonus of no lost luggage by the airline! All the amenities one would need were supplied by the owners of the condo and the daily housekeeping staff kept us supplied with fresh towels and linens, also doing a quick cleanup every day. All in all a great value for your money! We had already decided to return here by the 3rd day of our stay! Maui and Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: DustyAngel14
Reviews.Content: The Mahana has amazing views! The room was not one of the best, but the views made up for that. Not having a restaurant was not a problem as there is a 24 hour market across the street and many restaurants in the area as well as in the downtown Lahaina area. The pizza place across the street is great and affordable! There is also a farmer's market down the street to the left where you can buy fruits, vegetables, fresh guacamole and salsa for dirt cheap! Go here for this as the market is overpriced for these items. Try Aloha Mixed Plate where all the locals go and for some night life try Moose McGillycuddy's as they offer $1.00 drinks at night and cheap food!! Overall Maui was beautiful and the views at the Mahana made it that more enjoyable! Rent a car as you cannot walk everywhere. There is a bus from what I read, but I never saw it. If you like to snorkel you can do it right in front of the hotel to the left. I would definitely come back to the Mahan with the hopes of getting a nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Pros outweigh cons”
Reviews.Author: cherbonsy
Reviews.Content: We were assigned a first floor room (107) upon check in. Some folks love the bottom floor; some loathe them. All things being equal, I'm closer to being in the latter group. Given my experience at the Mahana, I'd advise you to accept a 1st floor room only if you want speedy access to the lawn or a mediocre beach, and don't mind either sleeping with the oceanside sliding glass doors closed or the security issues of leaving them open. The single best improvement the place could make would be lock-behind-you sliding glass doors on the first floor. Pros + location: all rooms are oceanfront, overlooking Lanai to the left and Molokai to the right + location: near the highway and equidistant between the north and south of the westside of the island + location: a 3 minute drive to a grocery store (Star Market) + huge units (the studio is way bigger than most hotels' 1-bedrooms) + well manicured grounds + pool area with hottub, bbq grilles and shuffleboard is excellent + full-sized in-room laundry (washer/dryer), refrigerator, coffee maker, microwave, toaster, dishwasher, stove, TV, stereo, hairdryer Cons - woefully understaffed, and therefore painfully slow and sometimes curt, front desk - swimming isn't too good on the beach, as there's lots of sharp reefs, and the visibly is too poor for snorkeling - insufficient parking: mostly tiny stalls and you might have to park on the street rather than the lot, especially if you return late - nickle and diming ($1 laundry soap or coffee; $2.60/day safe) - shows some signs of wear and hack-jobs on repairs and improvements - weak in-room wifi signal, available only within a few feet of the oceanside windows - 1st floor units can't be accessed through oceanside sliding glass doors if locked (they're not keyed from the outside); also, you can't lock sliding glass doors partially open, meaning you'll have to sleep with the doors closed unless you're not worried about security You be the judge ~ incongruous 80s, 90s and 2000's amenities and design aesthetics ~ while not overrun, at least overwrought with feral cats ~ self-catering: housekeeping only makes bed, changes towels and sweeps ... the rest is up to you ~ relatively soundproof construction, but you can still hear neighbors - ahem - honeymooning ~ noon checkout; you probably won't get an extension ~ despite the pros about the location, there's nothing within walking distance worth bothering with

Reviews.Title: “Greatest view in hawaii”
Reviews.Author: markme50
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at the Mahana.When we arrived we were given room 504 while it was ok it wasn't what i expected,we booked thru Expedia and you don't always get the best room.We asked to see another room and were given room 1202.It was perfect what a view from the lanai on the top floor.While the Mahana has no restaurant there are plenty of good eats and a supermarket close by.For the money you can't beat the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “Best ocean view EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Vacagirl777
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I are staying at the Mahana in Room 709 a two bedroom suite. We are overjoyed with the service and ammenities at this hotel. The view is fantastic because all the rooms face the ocean. Our lanai is huge and we can see all the way to Molokai because we are on the end of the hotel. We were first given a 1 bedroom condo that was booked by our travel agent through Classic Vacations. Unfortunately, when we entered the room, I knew immediately that we would have to be moved. (In case you are going there, stay away from Room 908!) The ceiling was moldy, there was carpet almost throughout, (something I specifically has asked NOT to have!) and it was REALLY WORN and DIRTY!
