So I contacted Karen at the front desk and she was fantastic! She and Larissa went to work to move us and we were shown two other suites, each with 2 bedrooms. We would have to pay a $50 fee per night to upgrade, but I knew these rooms were very expensive and I didn't mind that at all because this was my Mom's first time to Maui and I wanted it to be very special! We decided on Room 709 and we were floored by the room, level of decor and how comfortable it is! Whoever decorated this Suite put a lot of thought into the beautiful Asian art and sculptures throughout the condo! We are thrilled to say the least!!! I will write more after we return, but as of right now, I am soooo happy with our accomadations, and the high level of service we have received from all of the staff here at the Mahana! We definetely will be returning again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Maui Wowi!”
Reviews.Author: doodlebugster
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel, our stay there was awesome! The room was clean and comfy, and the oceanfront view was breathtaking. The staff was really friendly and always said Aloha with a smile. The Mahana hosts a Welcome Breakfast which I highly recommend, the Concierge (we had Susan who is awesome) informs you about the island of Maui, all of the sites to take in and a whole host of activities to do while you are there! It's only an hour and there is no obligation to purchase any activity packages, but you will learn about the island and all it has to offer...very cool! We stayed in Room #107 which was on the ground floor and had no bug problems whatsoever! I enjoyed being on the ground floor as you can walk onto your lanai and then if you like, take a few steps to the lawn chairs and chill out! There is no restaurant in the Mahana but you can go to the restaurant in the neighboring hotel and charge it to your room at the Mahana, so I thought that was very convenient if you didn't feel like using the awesome fully stocked kitchen in your room! All in all I give the Mahana 5 out of 5 8)

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana surpassed all our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: MrDiesel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are just wrapping up the second week of our honeymoon at the Mahana, and we stayed in unit 1004, booked through Kay at Maui Vacation Consultants. Both of us are in our early 50s and wanted a relaxing trip without all the hubbub and distractions found at the major resorts. To say that we're happy with our time at the Mahana would be the understatement of the century! In fact, we can't imagine coming back to Maui without staying at this wonderful place! So, here are our thoughts on the Mahana and what other travelers here should expect: - First of all, we booked our entire trip through Kay at Maui Vacation Consultatants. Kay is local, is known at the Mahana, and made sure we got a unit that was upgraded and in splendid condition. She was also a valuable point of reference for things to do and places to go on the island, and kept us from falling prey to the deluge of "activities dealers" who are really just hawking timeshare deals in disguise. Be forewarned: Maui is LOADED with these types, who if you give them the chance will absorb hours of your valuable vacation time for a few dollars discount off of a tour. My wife and I would like to strongly urge anyone planning a trip to Maui to try to use a LOCAL travel agent (such as Kay), who can help you find the most suitable accommodations for your needs and budget, and assist with activities planning based upon your personal likes/dislikes. Her website is: www.mauikay.com. - The Mahana is a peaceful condominium complex with all units directly facing the ocean. The water is so close, you actually have to lean close to the floor-to-ceiling windows or over the balcony railing to see that there's a beach down below! The sound of the waves crashing at night is one of the best sleep-inducing tonics we've ever experienced. The building and grounds are spotlessly maintained. Having our own fully-equipped kitchen saved us a TON of money on this trip -- we ate out a few times (see recommendations below), but often just enjoyed making our own Mai Tai's and watching the sunset from the privacy of our own balcony. - A few things about what the Mahana is NOT. In our opinion, this is NOT the ideal place for families with little kids, or couples expecting lavish room service. There is no Disney-esque kiddie pool, no restaurant, or strawberries and chocolate in your room at night. If you want any of that stuff, you'll need to stay at one of the several resort complexes down the beach a ways. What you do get here is an exquisitely comfortable condo with most of the creature comforts of home, in a very romantic setting that's perfect for couples who prefer more peace and quiet than the carnival-like atmosphere at most of the major resorts. - The most memorable highlights of our stay at the Mahana include watching the whales while eating breakfast on our balcony, watching the windsurfers and boating activity in the afternoons, and the gorgeous sunsets. - Activities: we drove up to Haleakala but elected not to go for the sunrise view. In our opinion, the trip was just as enjoyable and there was a lot less traffic to deal with. We drove the road to to Hana, to the "Halfway to Hana" stand (which has excellent banana bread, by the way), and then drove back. We took driving trips around the North loop, and to the southern remote area to where the road became unpaved and impassable. We do plan to take a helicopter tour (Kay recommended the Sunshine Helicopters Hana/Haleakala package), but that will be later this week. We also drove to the "Enchanting Floral Gardens" -- it was pretty, but seemed in decline so we can't really recommend it to others. The Tedeschi winery is worth visiting. We also went on a sunset sail -- on the Gemini -- highly recommended!! Don't bother with the sunset "dinner" sails -- most of the food is just so-so. The Gemini "champagne" sail offered an open bar and plentiful appetizers for a lot less than a full dinner sail. - Shopping: early in our stay, we went to Costco and loaded up on the basics. The Costco is located in Kahului, near the airport. Well worth the trip. In between we'd suggest the grocery store at the Napili Market rather than the Safeway at Lahaina. The Napili Market also has a DVDExpress rental machine (similar to Redbox), which made renting movies cheap and easy. $1 a day. Lahaina is an interesting place to stroll around in, park at the far end near the old Prison for free for 3 hours. Most of the shops along Front street in Lahaina sell variations on the same beachy stuff. Avoid Lahaina if you see a cruise ship floating nearby -- the town will be overrun with tourists. - Eating out: In our opinon, there are two "must do" eating experiences on Maui. Both are pricey, but you can make up for it in other ways. One, Mama's Fish House near Paia. Two, Nick's Fish Market at the Kea Lani resort at Wailea. Either place will set you back about $150 for a couple, but the experience is divine. The service at Nick's is an experience in itself. For Luaus, do the Old Lahaina Luau -- it's legendary and the best on the island, the food is quite good as well but we wouldn't put the food in the category of "five star". For breakfasts out, a short walk up the beach from the Mahana will take you to the Castaway Cafe, which offers excellent omelets and specialty pancakes. The Gazebo at Napili shores is a short drive away, and worth going to once, but expect a long line to get in. We waited about a half hour. They had outstanding omelets and pancakes. A hidden gem is the Okazuya takeout, just down the street -- great for lunch and dinner. There's no tables there, you just order and bring it back to your condo. All this being said, we didn't lavishly eat out for most of our two-week visit here -- we enjoyed the privacy of our condo at the Mahana. Buying our wine and cheese at Costco made for a much better evening than constantly shelling out the $10 - $15 per glass that many of the restaurants and resorts demand.

Reviews.Title: “Unit 1204 - Million dollar view!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaGirl8
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the top floor in Unit 1204. And my husband's first words when we entered our room were "Are you kidding me?" We rented through a private owner from VRBO.com and it was the best thing we ever did. Our room was completely up to date... with all of the furnishings necessary to have the most comfortable stay. We were never in need of anything. Of course, you have to go out and buy groceries if you plan on cooking, but it was nice to see that there were some dry goods already stocked in the kitchen cabinets to use... so, definitely check the stocked items before heading out to the markets. There is a Safeway on the way to the condo and Star Market right across the street... very convenient. We were just a short drive to the popular Whaler's Village and downtown Lahaina... great places to eat and shop. We also took our 2 children, ages 2 and 7... and they had the most wonderful time. The pool was just perfect for them. They do not like big crowds, so it was a stress-free swim for all of us... never had to wait or jump for the first available lounge chairs like we had to do at the Hyatt Regency several years ago. Now, let me tell you about the view from our unit. One word... AMAZING!!! To wake up to those views every morning and watch the sunset every evening... it was truly remarkable. One more thing... ample parking spaces. It was one of the most stress-free and relaxing vacations my husband and I have ever taken... with two kids in tow. We are already thinking about going back next year... and definitely renting this same unit... #1204. You won't be disappointed. I will continue to daydream until then.

Reviews.Title: “Nice R&R”
Reviews.Author: 2012done
Reviews.Content: Last minute we decided to change from Sugar Beach @ Kihei to the Mahana; it was the right choice. The location is great, Lahaina is only 5 minutes away by car. We spend 7 nights in the one bedroom unit (#808) from 04/21-04/28; the view from the lanai is breath taking. We did see the humpback whales migrating from our lanai; a binocular would give a close up view of these majestic creatures. The beach on either sides of the resort is good for snorkling; becareful of the reefs. The Star market is where we stock our pantry; it's cheaper than foodland at Lahaina. Overall, I have say that this is a very good resort for people looking for little R&R.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: simonk83
Reviews.Content: Wow. I must have said that word about 50 times since we arrived here. The view takes my breath away every time, it's just spectacular. We booked unit 708 through the owner via VRBO and I can't recommend it enough. Modern, comfortable and clean, not to mention the huge array of stuff that was waiting for us. Chocolate and coke in the fridge, detergent for the dishwasher and washer/dryer, sunscreen etc etc. I'd say you do need a car if you want to get out and see more stuff (we actually booked a cheapo economy through Alamo from Australia before we left, and they upgraded us to a jeep when we got here :D). Just beautiful, I could live here with no dramas whatsoever. Ok, that's enough, I'm going snorkeling

Reviews.Title: “First Time”
Reviews.Author: SEastCincinnati
Reviews.Content: We were there in March and stayed in room 1103. The room was updated and very nice compared to my daughters room 903 which was not. The veiw from the room was spectacular whales, two islands ,sunsets and rainbows who could ask for more. I would come back in a heart beat and stay in the same room. Having the gas grills on the property was a huge bonus we used them almost every night. The staff was friendly and helpful the place clean and neat. I would reccommend this complex to anyone going to Maui. We will return. Thank you for making our first trip to Maui memorable.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I was still there”
Reviews.Author: teamcobra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding/honeymoon. We absolutely loved it!!! I don't know where to start.... We stayed in Unit 1119. It was awesome! I have NO complaints about this hotel. We had friends that stayed in Unit 618 (they book through Vacation Rental By Owner- and I wish I would have looked into VRBO before I booked) Anyway- their room was nice, our room was nicer... I can't imagine this place having a bad room because Maui's laid back attitude and peacefulness is infectuous!! More about our unit: bed was comfortable; kitchen was nice and fully stocked; bathroom was nice with good-size shower- clean and modern; washer and dryer was great to have (you may want to slip a couple of travel-size detergent into your check-in luggage and don't overpack like I did); sitting area was nice-although I sat on the couch once just to look at a phone book; dining area right in front of the floor to ceiling windows that gave an amazing view of Lanai'i and Moloka'i and WHALES!!! The views were SPECTACULAR!!!!! We arrived in Maui at night and worn out. Restaurants around this area close kind of early. Stay away from the Mexican shack across the street... may have been just bad timing- but it was awful. We went to bed early and woke up early. We went out on the lanai to see our first view of the Pacific and saw whales blowing and jumping in the ocean!! I was so excited and it never got old- the whole time we were there we saw them playing in the ocean and they seem so close!!! Everything is more expensive in Maui- but since I knew that before we went, it didn't seem so bad. The grocery store across the street is more expensive than if you go to the Safeway in Lahaina (get the Safeway card/ coupon card thing at the Customer Service desk- it's free and saves you some money). I'm glad I read the reviews on this site because I almost booked another hotel. After reading the reviews, I realized that this hotle/ condo-type is more my style!! I liked the separate bedroom from everything so you don;t have to stare at your luggage, you can cook, keep munchies and lunchmeat, etc. I don't like the fancy, pampered stuff so why pay more for it? Other suggestions: The book 'Maui Revealed' was a huge help for the Road to Hana, restaurants, maps, shopping, etc. We also got one for another island we went to on this trip. I highly recommend to rent a car ( a Jeep for the more adventurous). Going to Hana was amazing- I couldn't believe my eyes and the drive wasn't that bad, although pretty windey. Getting married on Maui was awesome and easy if you contact one of the tons of wedding coordinators. I can't wait to go back!! I will stay here again and again- with family, friends...it's just perfect to me, even without the 'frills' of a resort- but in Maui, who needs frills?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation in Maui”
Reviews.Author: zzhotrod
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Mahana was outstanding. My one bedroom on the 12th floor was beautiful. The view was great, you could see humpback whales from the lanai and even while sitting on the couch in the living room! The location of the Mahana is perfect. Easy entrance and exit, easy parking, and a 24 hour market within walking distance. The drive to Lahiana was under ten minutes. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I booked through Blue Hawaii and the service was also top of the line. Tommy set me up! All his suggestions and recommendations were right on. I booked early (Oct 08) for a March 09 trip. During that time I spoke with Tommy a few times and Tom once. These guys know their stuff and are great to deal with. I will not travel without talking to Tommy first, I consider him a great resource but also a friend. Going to Maui? call Tommy and ask about the Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “Think again...”
Reviews.Author: TGWTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel and based on the reviews I knew I was taking a chance. We checked in and asked for a recently renovated room and the frontdesk cleck wasn't sure if it was or not but could change us if it wasn't. The first condo was dated, peeling wall paper, very dated furniture, and needed painting... We called and gave us a second room which was just as bad. From here the front desk clerk told us, we could have our choice of rooms the following day, however we did not want to switch rooms and found this unacceptable, as we felt he couldn't guarantee it, based on the rooms we saw. We immediately called our travel agent she got us into a new hotel which was much much better. The lobby, pool area etc gives you a feeling that everything is updated and clean etc, which is not the case with all their units.

Reviews.Title: “Rated #1 and deservedly so!”
Reviews.Author: Kamaainawannabe
Reviews.Content: Need to qualify my comments by the admission that my Wife and I are card-carrying Maui lovers; addicted to the laid back Honokowai neighborhood...wonderful beach and unsurpassed Humpback Whale watching during season. For many years we enjoyed a unit at the Maui Kai (next door to Mahana), but ownership changed hands and the new folks imposed a price increase that moved it out of our reach. Fortunately, after much searching, we discovered studio #803 (an individually owned/VRBO listing 108165); currently priced at just over $200 during peak season. The arrangements were made through a delightful Lady named Sophie and everything went extremely smoothly from reservation to checkout. Unlike many neighboring condos, Mahana is steel'concrete constructed; no "ceiling thunder" intrusions and the elevators were never much of a wait. As is commonplace at Mahana, #803 includes a much appreciated washing machine and dryer, as well as central air conditioning (seldom needed in February) and all the furnishings were up-to-date; including a very comfortable King bed right next to the lanai. For a single person, or couple, preferring reasonably valued ocean front condos over hotels, Mahana is difficult to beat. About the only generalized caveat being that the nicely landscaped grounds include beautiful palm trees that, in some instances, partially interfere with the view between floors 4 through 7; # 803 has no such drawback. We're already in the process of 2010 dreaming and Mahana #803 is certainly in our thoughts as well as having recommended it to a number friends. We've experienced problems with .com links in past Trip Advisor reviews, but vrbo dot com/108165 (with the necessary . substitution) should take you to the listing. Hope you have as much fun as we did! Dodge & Sharon in Albuquerque

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Mahana experience”
Reviews.Author: sakeller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Maui and wanted to share the great experience my husband and I had at the Mahana complex. We booked through our travel agent after I checked out the condo property on line. I didn't want to stay at a hotel with facilities paid for and never used as we did a few years ago by staying at the Sheraton in Maui. We just loved our condo unit # 914. The unit is lovely and efficient. We watched the whales in the morning while having coffee and breakfast on the lanai. Looking out on the ocean made it seem like we were on a cruise ship - wonder scenes of water, whales, sunsets and even a full moon while we were visiting. Listening to the waves hit the shore line was the best! This property has so much to offer - self parking, beach front, close to all the Maui action without all the fluff of a big hotel complex. We stayed on the Big Island of Hawaii for 4 nights at hte We hope to be back to the Mahana in a few years if not sooner!

Reviews.Title: “We're back! Top notch rooms, amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: dreamkitaro
Reviews.Content: We're stayed at Mahana for 1st time in Sept. after reading many reviews. We had a fantastic time there. We were not planning to return to Hawaii (particularly from PA! so soon) but there were some amazing deals so we did. We paid a bit extra to stay at Mahana because we had such a lovely, positive time there before. The views just can't be beat. This time we were there during whale watching season. The staff was amazing. They upgraded us (without us asking) to a 2br condo corner unit, 809. This condo was exquisite. The kitchen had stainless steel appliances and counter tops. The furniture and art pieces were beautiful. The views from this corner unit were gorgeous. We could see whales, surfers and turtles right from our balcony! The most lovely sunset at night with view of Lanai and Molokai. It was very windy that week right there but just a short trip north or south and it was find to bask on the beach :) This hotel also has a concierge on site to help with any questions, a pool and hot tub. Downside there is no restaurant or fitness center right there but plenty nearby. Most of the time we ordered from a nice restaurant takeout then would eat on our balcony as the sun set. Couldn't beat that view. Our unit had a CD player to add ambience to dinner in the evening. I am not sure if all units do. This unit also had 2 flat screen TVs.

Reviews.Title: “Aaaahhhh.....”
Reviews.Author: MrT43
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana in early January for nine days. Stayed in #804 rented from the owner. Most transactions took place by email and were very easy and prompt. Absolutely loved the condo! It had been updated a couple of years ago and was beautiful. My favorite part of the trip was having coffee in the morning as we watched the whales from the lania or the floor to ceiling windows. Bring binoculars for the best viewing, although some of the whales came very close to shore. We saw some dolphins one day as well. Made many of our meals and ate on the lanai which was so relaxing. Susan, the Expedia trip person was very helpful. We went to the Feast at Lele, which is a luau but you are seated the whole time and don't have to go thru a buffet line. It was wonderful! Ask for a Lava Flow drink. Did the helicopter ride to Hana and then rode in a van to come back. We thought it was fun and I didn't have to be afraid for my life on the twists and turns on the Road to Hana. That was an expensive tour, but worth it. One thing that is a MUST is the Warren and Annabelle show in Lahaina--so funny and entertaining. Order tickets before you leave home since they sell out many days in advance. I must warn you not to do the time share presentation!! It is promised that it will only be an hour and a half, but this is not true. And you are pressured to buy. It is not worth the $100 discount on your tours. Food and restaurants are expensive on Maui. Bring along things that you can fit in your luggage like snack bars, peanut butter, nuts, etc. We liked Java Jazz and Ruth's Chris Steak House, but thought that Kimo's was not worth the price we paid. Cheeseburger in Paradise is fun and worth it. I suppose everyone has different opinions on restaurants, but I enjoyed eating at the condo most of all. We rented snorkeling gear at Boss Frog's right down the road from the Mahana. Rented it for the week and then were able to use it only once since it was windy and the water was murky. The fish market in the little strip mall about a block away from the Mahana has the best mahi mahi sandwiches ever! I dream about them... ; ) The only complaint Ii have with the Mahana is that one day we wanted to play tennis. The front desk would not let us borrow rackets since we had rented our unit from a private owner. We felt this was very petty and short-sighted. We had such a nice time at the Mahana and hope to go back again soon. But I guess we'll have to bring our own tennis rackets.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana-mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: LoriOhio
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui, we took our 10 year old daughter. I had read all of the reviews and booked the Mahana thru Blue Hawaii. I felt like I was able to get a good deal for a room with such a great view. We stayed in a 1 bedroom with 2 baths. I had requested an upgraded room and Tommy at Blue Hawaii had even called a few days before our visit to ensure we got an upgraded room. It did not happen. The first night we arrived around 1 a.m. after flying for about 24 hours, we just took the room they gave us #215. The next day they did offer us another room, it was even older than the one we had, and the view was not as nice due to the palm trees. A couple of days later we had ants in our kitchen, I called the front desk and asked for help. When we returned that night I could tell nothing had been done. When I called the front desk again they said they would check on it and call me back. Never got a call back. The next day I was told that because it was Saturday the company they use would not come out and there was nothing they could do. I was very upset! At that time I asked to be moved to a different room. Both rooms I was shown were in worse condition than the one I was already in. My choices were to stay in the room with ants and buy my own bug spray or change to a down graded room! My advice to anyone staying at the Mahana, do not go thinking you will get one of the FEW upgraded rooms. Everytime I walked by the front desk I could hear people asking for a newer remodeled room. The view from our room was amazing and the cleanliness was average. The pool was very windy all of the time but heated and that made it nice. The spa was broken the entire time we were there. The beach in front of the hotel is not good for swimming but was good for snorkeling. Walk down the beach about 5 minutes to one of the other hotels for swimming and you can also rent a chair and toys there. One of the most amazing things we did was the Pacific Whale Foundation cruise. It was one of the highlights of our trip. The crew was fantastic and the boat was very comfortable. We had an unbelievable encounter with some whales and I think the crew was as excited as we were. I felt like these people love there jobs and were happy to help us with anything we needed. We loved the Road to Hana, beaches were the best there. The drive is difficult, but worth it. I would not take the tour, that way you can spend as much time as you like. The other beach we really liked was Big Beach. The only problem is no showers, no restrooms, no chairs, no food. There are two parking lots, the first gets very busy, drive down a little ways and you will see the next one. Be sure to take what you need, but it is a must see. Hope this helps all of you going to Maui!!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: elvisfan19
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the fifth floor from Feb2/2009 to Feb/9th/2009 and we thouroughly enjoyed every second of it. You can't beat the view of the ocean and the quietness. The floor to ceiling windows and sliding glass doors gave us a great opportunity to see the whales and to see the beautiful sunsets. We also are grateful tohave been upgraded from a studio to a one bedroom which we really appreciated. The condo is not plush but it is roomy and ithas all the things necessary ....even a washer and dryer which was greatly appreciated. We spent a lot of time just watching the beautiful ocean views which I think was my favourite thing. The location is very convenient. All in all it is a great value and I hope that we can return someday for a longer stay. It is the perfect spot if you want some peace, some quiet, and some relaxation to unwind from the stresses of life which is just what we were looking for........

Reviews.Title: “Mahana - great for couples”
Reviews.Author: EDHJIM
Reviews.Content: Mahana is the perfect spot for older couples without children. All units are beachfront with beautiful ocean views. We had a one bedroom unit which was perfect - a nice size bedroom with a king bed, and another room which consisted of the living room, dining area, and kitchen. Mahana doesn't have all the bells & whistles for children, but what you get in return is QUIET! All you hear is the sound of the waves crashing on the sand. So, if you want a roomy condo on the beach without a bunch of kids running around, this is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views at the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: rustysmom
Reviews.Content: For our 25th wedding anniversary my husband and I spent 5 nights on Maui, 5 nights on the Big Island and 5 nights on Kauai. In Maui we stayed at the Mahana at Ka'anapali which I booked through Resortquest using the Entertainment book which got us a better rate than those listed through Tripadvisor brokers. When we arrived they upgraded us from a studio to a one bedroom/two bath unit on the 11th floor. The Mahana is directly on the ocean. From our lanai we saw either whales or rainbows or both on a daily basis. It was awesome. Ka'anapali is on the West Coast of Maui, so some of the sights (Haleakula, the Road to Hana, Mama's Fish House) are a bit of a drive, but we had stayed elsewhere on the island before and wanted to experience the West Coast this time.

Reviews.Title: “More than we ever imagined...”
Reviews.Author: justmarried09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for our honeymoon and had such a great time; the view out of our room was amazing (all of the rooms face out over the ocean), it was so nice and clean, and the staff was so helpful if we needed anything. Because it was a condo we had a full kitchen so we could cook if we didn't want to go out for dinner. We stayed in room 1004- nice appliances (they had a washer and dryer combo which made packing to come home nice- we had clean clothes!), granite countertops, plenty of storage. There were floor to ceiling windows in the living room area and bedroom with sliding glass doors out onto the balcony area so we constanly had a great view. The Mahana's location in ideal, not only is it right on the water it is walking distance from a grocery store. We hope to return to the Mahana soon, it was so relaxing and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable oceanfront stay”
Reviews.Author: pkcasa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for the first 5 nights of our Hawaiian vacation. It was a bargain compared to the sky high hotel prices. We rented a studio through ResortQuest. It was perfectly sufficient in size for a couple. It was super enjoyable having the incredible ocean front view. Each nice we slept with the balcony doors open and the waves crashing against the shore. There was a lot of construction next door (huge resort is being built) but you cannot see it from the condo and you cannot hear it if your patio is open. Having a fully equipped kitchen made it possible to eat breakfast on the lanai every morning. What a pleasure. The condos are not luxurious but more than adequate. Having our own washer and dryer was so convenient. Location is very good, within 10 minute drive of Lahaina downtown and within walking distance to Star market. The pool was windy but pleasant. The hottub was not working for a few days we were there. The only thing that would knock this place down a star for me is that the beach is truly unswimmable in front of the hotel due to coral reef. You do have to take a hike down the sand or through the parking lots of the condo complexes to find a swimmable area. We finally decided upon going in front of Kaanapali Shores Hotel as an agreeable spot. We would recommend Mahana for those who are a bit flexible, are looking for a quiet holiday and value economy for the ocean front views.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views and luxury combined with service”
Reviews.Author: KAsperges
Reviews.Content: This anniversary trip was compromised with some lost credit cards. The outstanding efforts of the front desk staff, both Debbie and Karen, saved the occasion. After upgrading us to Room 415, a one-bedroom unit with Jacuzzi, which has luxury appointments throughout, they worked to help us have our credit cards overnighted to the ResortQuest so that the rest of our vacation could proceed. Beautiful facility made more outstanding by the helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an amazing honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: absolutangel21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana for our honeymoon. We were amazed *how* close the beach/ocean was to our room. By the end of the trip, we midwesterners were a little freaked out by the loudness of the ocean. The room was kept immaculately, and in relatively attractive decor. It was for the most part quiet, with the exception of some occasional noise from the upstairs condo (sounded like people kept dragging chairs across the floor). We were well equipped with a full kitchen, including all of our dishes and utensils. We even decided to make ourselves a steak dinner one night. We also had a washer and dryer (to allow us to do our laundry there on our last day, rather than when we got home) and dishwasher to easily keep our dishes and utensils clean. The beach is excellent for walking, and very scenic as you are able to view the islands of Lanai and Molokai in the distance. For swimming, it's recommended you hike down the beach 150 - 200 yds. to avoid any sharp coral, as there is a reef directly in front of the hotel. This makes for amazing snorkeling though, and the water is crystal clear. There is considerable wildlife near the resort (we saw and heard *many* types of birds, geckos and snails), and since we were there in January, saw an infinite number of humpback whales from our room. Some even ventured 300 - 400 yds. from the beach. The pool area is cozy with a heated, well kept pool and a relaxing hot tub; both which provide a stunning view of the beach. There is no bar in the hotel, for those who enjoy sipping a frosty libation near the pool or beach. There are no dining facilities on site, which may be bothersome for some less-adventurous travelers who weren't planning on leaving the resort. But if you planned on coming to this captivating Eden without exploring all of the island's beauty, you're probably not cut out for travel in the first place. We strongly recommend checking out Chowhound.com for recommendations on the best places to eat (and please check out The Gazebo restaurant). Finally, if you're like us, and concerned about the price of eating on the island for a few days or more, there is a Star Market just outside of the resort. It is open 24 hours and extremely convenient to purchase snacks and groceries to save some money rather than going out to eat for every meal. I became ill one night at 3:30 a.m. and my husband was able to make a quick trip there to purchase medicines, sodas, etc. Convenience has a price though ($9 for a gallon of milk) so be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo for the Memories!”
Reviews.Author: hrpy
Reviews.Content: After doing lots of homework on Trip Advisor, I chose the Mahana at Kaanapali for our 20th anniversary trip to Maui. The Mahana was wonderful for our trip!! We weren't interested in the nightlife, or hotel activities because we were there to see the island!! We didn't cook as many meals b/c it seemed we could dine out for our $$ as easily as buying groceries! But the kitchen was nice with a fullsize fridge, and stove. Loved the coffee---that Kona Blend was a highlight of the trip! We walked just a bit to a nice, swimming spot, and enjoyed the fact that there weren't crowds on the beach. We did our snorkeling on our days out, and honestly, spent the majority of our days away from the condo exploring north, south, east and west! But having the Mahana to return home to was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jessc2078
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana at Kaanapali during the Thanksgiving holiday. We stayed in room 113 and it was great. We were on the first floor right next to the pool and the beach only a few steps away. The room itself had an updated kitchen with all modern appliances. The only downside to the hotel is that it does not have an onsite restaurant, but The Village in Lahaina is only a couple of miles down the road. Overall the experience at the Mahana Kaanapali was great and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana suggestions”
Reviews.Author: FehrLadyAllentown_PA
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Hawaii and we decided to settle on Maui on the Kaanapali Coast. After reading reviews and getting prices My husband and I decided to try the Mahana. Traveling from the East Coast, Maui is a long trip and unfortunately I developed a very sick headache and by the time we reached Kahului around 5:30pm I just wanted to crash. The time change really throughs you off and the headache made me yearn for a hot shower and bed. When we arrived at the Mahana, I had planned on requesting an upgrade unit. We were assigned unit #402 and it wasn't great. Since I felt ill, we stayed and that was our mistake. The carpet was disgusting (very dirty and stained) and the kitchen was probably the original and space was extremely tight. The bathroom was newly remodeled, but very small. Beyond that the view was wonderful and I enjoyed sitting on the lanai and enjoying the view. The waves at night lulled us to sleep and were occasionally loud enough to wake us up. We never quite adjusted to the 5 hour time difference. Lots of wonderful things to do and see in Maui. Loved Haleakala (drive up is a little scary) and glad we did the road to Hana, but would never do again unless we plan on staying in Hana. Great restaurants, good food, love Lahaina and the atmosphere. Enjoyed the Old Lahaina Luau, and highly recommend Ulalena. Stayed on Maui back in 2001 in Wailea and loved it. Stopped back to visit and I would definitely recommend over Kaanapali. Beautiful beaches, nice walking paths along the beach, great shopping and restaurants. As per the recommendations on Tripadvisor, I highly advise anyone to go for breakfast at the Gazebo, a short drive from Kaanapali. There's usually a line, but it's well worth it! I would stay at the Mahana again if I could experience an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: aktumbleweed
Reviews.Content: After carefully researching and planning our 25th wedding anniversary trip, we decided to book the Mahana through Resort Quest for December 1st - 6th, 2008. We asked for a recently upgraded room, and were not disappointed. We were assigned unit 506, which was a one bedroom, and it was absolutely beautiful. It was a wonderful place to celebrate our anniversary, and our first trip to Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: kimpeteca
Reviews.Content: So after carefuly consideration and review of many websites we chose the RQ Mahana in Maui. We booked through the resorts web site, although we really did want to book a specific room through the owner. The problem we encountered with doing that is that most owners require 50% minimum down to hold the reservation and if for whatever reason you need to cancel/change your reservation you loose the money. By booking with the resort directly we had up to 48 hours to cancel our reservation with absolutely no penalty. The room we received was a studio (#313) that was recently renovated. Bathroom, kitchen and most of the suite was excellent. I did leave the owners a note to seriously consider updating their bed linens (old, tattered comforter) and to remove the rug in the living room. The rest of the suite was beautiful ceramic floors, easy to keep clean and fresh smelling. I would suggest that this is probably one of the most beautiful views in all of Maui, and it is right from your room/lanai! The Mahana is the closest building to the ocean anywhere that we saw so the beach is rather narrow and the noise of the waves is unbelieveable! One of the reasons we chose this location was for snorkelling, but forget it. You really need to go either to Black Rock in front of the Sheraton which has a great beach and all the amenities, or our favourite the beach in front of the Ritz Carlton. The one at RC had way more variety of fish, calmer water and a good deal of shade if you wanted it. However, no beach chairs/umbrealls for rent so come prepared. So, if you;re looking for good value, good service, consider the Mahana. We paid about $1500 for the week, but when we were checking out I heard someone at the front desk quote a walk-in $1100 for the week, so its worth asking for a deal! The pool is fine, in the shade most of the afternoon, BBQs spotless and plenty of free parking....have fun in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: cindylou421
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana 12/2/08 - 12/13/08 in room 516. We loved it!!! It was quiet and beautiful. We really enjoyed the view. We had palm trees near our windows and it really made our pictures lovely. The room was simple, clean and elegant. We only had to go to the front desk to have our keys rekeyed, and the front desk people were great. We booked through our AAA travel agent and had no problems. I have pictures but am unable to post them at this time. My mother had wanted to visit Maui again and stay at the Mahana. Sadly, she passed away earlier this year and did not get to visit. I thought it would be nice to do the trip that she and I had started to plan. My husband and I brought some of her ashes to the island and left a little in several beautiful spots. The Mahana made our stay such a joy that we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Maui vacation”
Reviews.Author: Indyking
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from Dec 4-10, 2008. The overall experience was just good for me. The hotel is in a very good location, next to the kaanapali beach, the most popular and one of the best beaches in Maui, after visiting a few other beaches in the island. There is also a good grocery store in walking distance (5 minutes) called star markets (prices a bit more expensive than Safeway, the most popular grocery store in the island, but groceries in Maui are expensive anywhere). The best feature of this hotel is the view, all condos face the ocean and they are very close to the water compared to other hotels nearby, so you can intensely listen and feel the ocean from your room. The beach is terrible for swimming, as many other beaches in Hawaii, because of the shallow reef areas. I also found the sand in the beach a little bit less clear compared to some other beaches I visited. The hotel has a nice area by the pool with clean gas grills and a great hot tube (spa) for guests. The pool was just OK, since it's small and shaded most of the day due to the proximity to the hotel buildings. The staff was friendly until they demand us to move to a bigger condo because the studio we booked and spent the first night was for 2 guests only, including our infant. It was not our fault, I booked through cheap tickets, and there was no note saying we should get a bigger condo when booking, so we assumed everything was OK, but when they realized our party had 3 people, they suddenly changed from nice to unfriendly. Once we decided to stay and move to the bigger condo and pay the difference, they got back to the "nice mode" again, so not very professional in my opinion. I believe most condos, if not all, are privately owned, therefore, they are all different as far as updates and decoration. Our big condo was a one bedroom apt with living room, kitchen, and 2 baths, room 515. That unit was highly recommended by the guest leaving it that day, but it was just OK in our opinion because it had only basic furniture/appliances and decoration was just good, no major updates or features. Parking in this hotel was good because was free and mostly shaded (we like shaded parking). In your first day, there is a 45-minute presentation from the concierge service lady with complimentary breakfast. The food is very unimpressive (just a few sweet treats with coffee) but the lady does present good suggestions and tips for activities nearby. I believe this hotel is also cheaper than the resorts in the kaanapali beach (a 10 minute drive from this hotel), but the beach there is much better. So, overall, if you want to stay near where this hotel is, I would recommend checking the rates of other hotels nearby for a possible best value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: ftp1234
Reviews.Content: 4 nights stay. Booked through an online travel agent for resortquest. (not an individual owner) The week before, there were heavy rains and hence water had come onto the carpets. Thats why the management had kept a large fan to dry it off. When we reached, it had almost dried off. But that wasn't an issue for us. The condo was excellent. We wanted ocean-facing, and we got it :) We were very happy. We would definitely recommend Mahana to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Condo in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Jennunc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana from Nov. 21-Nov 28, 2008 for a partial business trip partial vacation and for the Maui Invitational. We stayed in room 914 and it was great! I couldn't have expected more or better. The condo was completely upgraded to even include self closing cabinet drawers and a 50inch flat screen TV. The views were amazing and the condo was very comfortable as living quarters and office space. We did not miss having a restaurant on site, as there is a Safe Way grocery store right across the street and we cooked breakfast most days. (We did stop at the WalMart near the airport on our way in, but it wasn't necessary with the Safeway across the street). There is also a small sandwich and drink cart by the pool, for snacks, smoothies, coffee, and sandwiches which we used one day. It was tasty and not too expensive. The staff was accommodating but not overly friendly. The pool and hot tub were very nice and the grounds pretty, also. There is construction going on at a new resort in front of the Mahana, but we could never hear any noise from it and all our windows faced the back (ocean) so there were no problems there. Parking spaces were small, but we didn't have to pay for parking. We would definitely stay at the Mahana again and room 914. Friends of ours stayed in room 916 and it was also upgraded; however, missing the top notch touches that 914 had. Activities and Restaurants we enjoyed during our trip: Rusty Harpoon- we ate breakfast here and watched football from back home- Great breakfast and drinks, pretty golf course view Ma'alea Aquarium- this was just OK and we only did it b/c it was a rainy day Sansei in Kapula- EXCELLENT Sushi Plantation House- we had a great brunch with very pretty views Old Lahaina Luau- Very entertaining and the food was great Roy's- EXCELLENT fish and desserts Ron Bass Kayaking & Snorkeling- personal (we were the only ones on his trip) and a LOT of fun Mala's Lahaina- Very good, pretty views during the day Big Beach in Wailea- very pretty sand and water Good snorkeling in Wailea Makena Grill in Wailea/Makena- GREAT fish tacos- one woman stand Kobe in Lahaina- Very good sushi Eco Adventures Hiking Tour- EXCELLENT views and waterfalls, also saw the Napili Blowhole. Hike a little difficult for those with injuries or older. Black Rock- great snorkeling- we swam with two turtles Mama's Fish House (Thanksgiving Dinner)- WORTH IT! EXCELLENT Kimo Lahaina- More great views and good food- Hula Pie!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: What a stunning view of the ocean. We were in room 505 and it was perfect. Two bathrooms nice decor. New kitchen and a great view. We could walk 100yrds to the left and have a great beach to swim. The afternoon trade winds do make the pool too windy in the afternoon. There is a small store right across the street along with a pizza place. We stocked up at the Safeway just off Route 30. Having a washer and dryer was great. We ran a load of towels and clothes every day. I would recommend to anyone going to Maui to check out these condos. We did have some construction going on close by and there was a loud pipe running water all night long. Only thing that might turn someone off would be the lack of bar/dining on the property and the small and very windy pool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: KonaDreams
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 609 for 5 nights last week. Our stay was fabulous! The accomodations were perfectly appointed and the staff was courteous and helpful. We had reserved a one bedroom with 2 baths and were instantly upgraded to a 2 bedroom end room upon arrival. I would readily recommend this facility to my friends & family and will be sure to return for another stay in the future. My travel agent Tommy with Blue Hawaii Vacations promised me that he would book us a gem and he was right! The only problem we had was a bit of rainy weather and some high winds, but even that was enjoyed from our fabulous view from our lania!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Condo 505”
Reviews.Author: Hauger
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Friday, November 14th and stayed until Sunday, November 23, 2008. Our condo (unit #505) is newly renovated and has two baths, one bedroom (king) and a full modern kitchen and washer and dryer. We were absolutely thrilled with the accomodations. The lanai faced the ocean and we had the best ocean beach sunset views. The location is perfect for us. It's a little north of Lahaina and is more secluded. There is no restaurant in the building, but you have full access to one at the hotel next door. At check-in we were given coupons and key cards. The only problem was the key cards are very tempermental and you usually have to use it 10 times before it lets you in. We had the key card rekeyed, but it was the same. We would come again and request this same unit. We used the two-for-one coupon at the Hyatt Regency Maui Drums of the Pacific Luau and had a wonderful time. We were very pleased. Service at the front desk was good and the pool and hot tub were enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Rainco
Reviews.Content: We stayed for nine nights in a studio. It was nice, the staff was friendly. It is in a great location. Good beach for walking in front of the resort. Snorkeling and swimming 300 feet either direction of the resort. The parking spaces are a little small. We would definately return and recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location.”
Reviews.Author: AvineshB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Unit 602 during the week of Nov. 1. The front desk was very helpful in getting us our welcome kit and parking pass quickly. The welcome kit includes two digital room keys, a 2-for-1 coupon for any Luau and a coupon guide. During our 7 night stay, we discovered that our room keys didn't work on two separate occasions. However, a quick walk to the front desk resolved the issue. The beach and ocean is literally 10 meters from the condo. Great views of the islands of Lanai and Molokai. Unreal sunsets. The room itself was well-equipped with a full-kitchen. There was a mid-size fridge, sink, stove, microwave, coffee maker and toaster. Pots and pans, as well as cups and bowls are all included! The unit was furnished with marble counter tops in the kitchen and bathroom - a nice touch. The bed was a bit on the hard side. We opted to turn off the AC for most of our stay as it gets very cold (hey, it works!) even on the low setting. There was an extra comforter in the entry closet, which was a bonus. Wireless signal was low (1 bar) unless you are on the patio. However, wireless is free at the hotel, as is parking. Rooms were cleaned daily. Each unit has a small safe, but costs extra per day. No real cons, but water was shutoff for a day to make some emergency repairs, as was electricity (for a couple of hours). No snack or pop machines in the hotel. A mobile coffee and snack stand is open during the morning. An ATM machine and two computers are available near the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel we stayed at while getting married in Maui”
Reviews.Author: melissa_n_glen
Reviews.Content: Well as you can tell from the photos the views are amazing!!! If you want to have some of the best views on the island then stay here! My wife & I stayed in a one bedroom on the 11th floor. The floor to celing windows in the living area were amazing! It can get a little windy to sit out on your Lanai but the views are great! But wait it's not just the ocean views that are great, as you take the elevator up to the room take a look to your left & see the mountains! Those views were really cool too but I hope you are not affraid of heights because the path to your room is very open. We did not stay here again the second time went to Maui & we will not be staying here on our thrird trip to Maui in Feb 09 but I would not rule out staying here again in the future. Great views ... not the best service ... friendly but not overly so. When I stayed here there was no Hottub but it looks like there is one now from the pics I can see. Great snorkeling in front of hotel too!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: googles111
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get to this condo. I had done months and months of research and people kept talking about how good this place was. After a VERY long flight all I wanted to do was get in the room and relax. We came with 3 others couples and we were all supposed to have different rooms. When we went to check in they told us they had no rooms.. WHAT!! I am usually not one to complain. I just settle and go with the flow. I could not just sit there and NOT say anything. I was so upset. They had told us do to remodeling the place our room was not ready. I asked why nobody could have called me a couple days before to let me know about this. I would have booked at another hotel I was looking at. The lady at the front desk told us the room was supposed to be ready that morning and it wasn't. What a lie. I think you would know a couple days before if construction wouldn't be done in time. That's when I became upset. If they just told me they messed up, then okay. The lying part is where I just had no respect for the place after that. They did tell us their sister property Kaanapali Shores would let us stay there. I had looked on trip advisor to research that condo before booking with the Mahana. It wasn't what I wanted. The Kaanapali Shores was also less then what I paid for the Mahana. I just didn't see how I was getting a good deal when I paid for an ocean view which I wasn't going to get. They would not refund my money because I went through Priceline. If I went direct through the Mahana, I still don't think they would have given me my money back. They did tell us we would get a partial refund and the check would be mailed in 2-3 weeks. Here it is week 4 and still no check. We will see if they come through on that. We were told we could check back into the room after 2 days. I didn't want to have to move all our stuff again and we had a wedding to go to that morning so we stayed at the Kaanapali Shores. I did like it there. VERY good customer service. Our friends moved back to the Mahana. They did have a nice room with a great view. I just would not recommend this place because of their customer service. Sad that my opinion was ruined because of that. I hope other people have a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing pool and intoxicating Views”
Reviews.Author: DarkRevan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in 401 and found it very satisfying, the condo was clean, spacious, air-conditioned & fully furnished (although we thought some of the decor were in urgent need of an update). As mentioned by countless previous reviewers, the condo view of the ocean with the islands of molokai & lanai in the background is UNMATCHED! With such a short strip of land between the resort and the ocean you feel like you're on a cruise liner than on land. The pool is on the western side and with the height of the hotel there's a lot of shade with a nice cool breeze. There's a supermarket at the top of Kaanapli Shores Pl so you can stock up on food or personal hygience items. Some construction work is happening on the resort's southern side but our condo was on the northern block so we couldn't hear any noise from there. Overall it was a very memorable stay (Maui is fantastic) and we would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews here as well...”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBellinCA
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Mahana many months in advance of our trip in September. This was our first trip to Maui and we were getting married while there and then on to the honeymooning. When we arrived at the Mahana, our room was not ready, but we were early --so we explored the grounds and then settled in a lounge chair right in front of the beach. Gorgeous location! We were told to come back at 4PM and our room would be ready. We went back around 4:15PM and our room was NOT ready. Ok, no big deal, we're on vacation, so we head back to the lounge chairs. About half an hour later, we went back to check but there was a different receptionist upfront at this point and she had to search for our reservation/check in papers/key. We were given a key and a room # and proceeded to go up to the room. The door was open and housekeeping was just starting to clean the room and told us it would be another 45 minutes to an hour. Frustrating!! Because at this point we just wanted to get settled in our room after a long day of traveling and sitting out in the sun for over 3 hours. I went back down to the front desk, informed another receptionist of the problem and asked was there another room that we could be put into sooner and one that was away from the construction next door. I explained that we were getting married the next day and that we would be here for our entire honeymoon. None of that seemed to matter, and YES, I was nice and polite! More frustrated now after being told there was nothing available and nothing could be done until the next day, we headed BACK to the pool area and just sat. After another hour, we went up and our room was finally ready. The rooms here are very nice if you get one that has been upgraded. Our room in particular was very nice. The view was FANTASTIC!! You could open the doors and hear the waves crashing on the beach. However, if you were in your room during the day, you could hear CONSTANT noise from whatever renovations are being done in the surrounding rooms. Sounded alot like jackhammers and nailing. It's great that they are making improvements, but it does NOT make for a peaceful, relaxing and romantic honeymoon!! You could also hear the construction that is going on next door if you were out at the pool and didn't have your earphones in your ears! Beep, beep, beep...all day long during the weekdays. Overall, Maui was AWESOME, Mahana was great, except for the customer service level at the front desk and the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Unit 218, but mixed feelings.......”
Reviews.Author: JacinMR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 15th anniversary this year and part of that celebration was a trip to Maui. After many hours of research, we decided to stay at the Mahana. We booked our room in Feb 08, using the Entertainment Card which books through ResortQuest. We told staff it was our anniversary and wanted to have a special vacation at the Mahana and requested an updated room on a higher floor. Based on other reviewerâ€™s experiences on TripAdvisor, we knew would be well taken care of. Our stay was from Sep 27 to Oct 9. Our flight arrived late so by the time we got to the hotel it was about 10:30pm. Check-in was fast and we were assigned to unit #817. I could have cried. We didnâ€™t expect the Taj Mahal, but this unit was awful. There were bugs on the walls, bugs on the carpets and on the tile. The carpet was stained, very well worn and frayed in some places. The furniture was old and mismatched - to top it off, the unit smelled musty and â€˜oldâ€™. It was disgusting. My husband called down to the front desk to ask if we could change to a different unit and the front desk person, Lana, said no, she didnâ€™t know how to do that. We were about ready to leave to go to another hotel. My hubby took a couple digital pictures of the bugs and took the camera down to the front desk to show Lana and told her we didnâ€™t even want to put our luggage on the floor, thatâ€™s how filthy it was. A short time later, Lana called and was very apologetic. She said she called her manager for help and then gave us another room on the 5th floor and gave my husband a couple of coffee mugs and box of mac chocolates. This new room was very clean, but not updated and not what we expected when we had booked our reservations way back in February. We would have settled for this room, if what we requested wasnâ€™t available, but the next morning before 7am, Lana gave us unit #218. This room was gorgeous with granite and tile throughout, stainless steel appliances, and very nice furniture. This was what we expected when we first checked in, despite the unit not being on a higher floor. The view was exceptional. There were no beach towels, but we picked up a couple from Costco, so that was ok. Prior to arriving, I had enquired about noise from the construction site and was told that we could be put in the building located furthest away from the construction noise, which we werenâ€™t. Noise from the construction site was not noticeable except for the occasional beep beep from trucks backing up â€“ which you could hear with the balcony door closed, but it was no big deal. Noise from renovations to units inside the Mahana, however, was a different story. I think they were grinding tile or something like that â€“ whatever it was it definitely got our attention. We didnâ€™t bother complaining at this point, because quite frankly we had had enough with complainingâ€“ this was supposed to be a holiday, so we just put up with it. Besides, this unit was really nice and we didnâ€™t want to move into another nightmare, like #817. The pool area at the Mahana was good, and we both liked the windiness of the area â€“ kept the heat of the sun to a comfortable level. New barbeques were also appreciated. As noted before by several reviewers swimming 100 yds to the left and right of the building was excellent, although there was a noticeable sewage smell to the left close to construction site, so we went swimming to the right. Black Rock and Whalerâ€™s Village was a nice easy walk along the beach on several occasions for us. We booked an extra day because our flight was leaving at 10:50pm and when we were checking out, noticed that we werenâ€™t charge for the extra day, which we thought was nice of the Mahana and made us feel a little bit better about the crappy unit we were first given. A couple days after arriving home, however, we received an adjusted bill with the extra day tacked onâ€¦.. Now that weâ€™ve had some time to reflect on our stay, we both think that we would probably stay at the Mahana again, but would go through VRBO to rent directly from an owner â€“ viewing photos of the unit ahead of time so we would know exactly what we were getting. Lana of RQ staff was extremely helpful, and other staff were pleasant and efficient to deal with. I donâ€™t know who assigns the units, but I think they definitely dropped the ball in this case.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable view....not so good service”
Reviews.Author: pattynlandon
Reviews.Content: Well, let me just start off by saying the view from our condo was AMAZING !! Definately the best view of anyone that we traveled with. Unfortunately our vacation got off to a bad start. When we arrived we were told that due to some remodeling that they did not have a room for us and that we had to stay at their sister hotel Kaanapali Shores. Don't get me wrong the Shores was nice...but not what we wanted. No ocean front, only ocean view. This also happened to 3 other couples that traveled with us. We were told there was nothing they could do. Unfortunately we spent the first few hours of our vacation arguing with the staff. Finally after a couple of hours our travel agent called and talked to the manager. She was able to get us a $300 refund and after staying at the Shores for 2 nights we could stay the remainder of our vacation there. At first we didn't know if it would be worth moving back. But I'm sure glad we did. We stayed in 817. Very nice condo. We left all the doors to the patio open at night and just listened to the waves crashing. The only thing I would say about this hotel is that it is not like a big resort with all the restaurants and spa's. But we don't care too much about that. It was very quiet. There was some construction going on next to us but unless your outside you really can't here it. Will definately stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Awesome view”
Reviews.Author: olay020
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Mahana for our honeymoon and was advised that my wife and I would be staying on the 4th floor. I informed the lady at the front desk that it was our honeymoon and she moved us to a two bedroom(same price) on the 10th floor. Room #1001 was the room we received and I would recommend this room to anyone. Everything was upgraded with 3 flat screen tvs, marble countertops, granite showers, stainless steel appliances. Couldn't ask for a better room. The views were amazing and the hotel was quiet and relaxing if that is what you are looking for. If you are planning on staying here book #1001.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: TuckerFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 216. We booked directly on vrbo. It was an amazing unit. So luxurious. Granite countertops, flat screen tvs, fluffy beach towels, beautiful furniture. It also had lovely plasterwork. The kitchen appliances were really high-end too. We got a lovely welcome pack from the unit owner too. The view was great. Out of this world in fact. The mahana itself was fine but the pool was a little windy. I didn't see any units as nice as ours inside which might be a reason for booking directly with the owner. We had no problem parking but I could see that could be a problem in peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana, hated Room 1108”
Reviews.Author: DreamGirl65
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying the location of Mahana can not be beat. It's right on the beach with every room facing the ocean. We had incredible views of Molokai and Lanai and don't even get me talking about the sunsets! They just kept getting better and better with each passing day! Seriously. The lobby area and grounds are really beautiful. The staff was polite, friendly and very helpful. I still can't get over how friendly everyone was. The only problem I had with this hotel/condo was with room 1108. This room is in serious need of some T.L.C.! It's completely dated and, I'm sorry to say, pretty dirty. The carpet needed cleaning, the walls were dirty, there was mold in the bathtub/shower and the windows were dirty. The only saving grace for room 1108 is the amazing view I already spoke about. The owners of this unit should give some serious thought to refurbishing the entire unit. I would definintely stay at the Mahana again. I would recommend this condo to my friends. Just please, whatever you do, stay away from room 1108.

Reviews.Title: “Condo # 307 - What a place!!”
Reviews.Author: nucmed24
Reviews.Content: We contacted the owner of unit # 307 through www.vrbo.com. We found them to have the most reasonable price in Kaanapali with the best view. We were completely mesmerized when we arrived in the condo. The view was better than any picture can show. The condo is a spacious 1 bedroom with a nice sized lanai. (great place to watch the sunset!) The condo comes stocked with everything you could need. (even had coolers which came in handy for our trip to Hana) The location, IMO, was perfect. Far enough away from the chaos, but close enough (10 min drive) to Lahaina to get dinner, or to shop or whatever. The Mahana has a pool and jacuzzi. Plenty of places to lay out by the pool or in front of the unit along the beach. We would go out to the jacuzzi each night, and I think only twice was someone else down there with us. There was construction of a new condo nearby, but it wasn't really a distraction. There was plenty of road construction in Maui that it all blended in. =) I would definitely recommend unit 307. Jan and George have thought of everything for your stay. Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “My room at Mahana was perfect no complaints”
Reviews.Author: ksetree
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel and was told that I would be staying in the room I requested, I knew this was going to be my dream vacation. I researched the rooms with the help of trip advisor and didnt think I would have a chance but we ended up the room I requested, 1209 a top floor 2br corner condo. The condo was elegantly decorated with Hawaiin artwork, ceramic tile, stainless steel appliances, and dark wood furnature. There were great views from all directions. The side view in the kitchen even had one of the best ocean and beach views I have ever seen. We ate our meals on the balcony which had an even more amazing view. We saw rainbows nearly every day and one ended right in the ocean in front of us lighting up the water. The pool and hot tub were perfect, there was only a slight breeze while we were there (I saw other complaints about the wind no complaint from me). Dont book with the expedia person in the lobby (less expensive in Lahaina) but do go to breakfast and presentation your first morning there just to get all the info on activities available. We went on a snorkleling tour but had more fun renting our own and going to Honolua Bay. If you drive to Haleakala to see the sun rise leave your condo by 3:00. If we would have left any later we wouldnt have had a good parking place. After sunrise at Haleakala or when going to the Road to Hana drive towards Paia and eat breakfast at Charlies Resterant great menu, low prices, and good food. The Mahana was a perfect location easy drive North to all those sites, close drive to the Kaanapali walkway and Lahaini. I am looking forward to making Mahana a family tradition.

Reviews.Title: “#314 condo. Loved my second stay at the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: JCC73
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my Maui Vacation last night. We booked this trip through COSTCO travel. This was the second time i've stayed at the MAHANA and have LOVED every minute. There was abit of construction going on next door due to condos being built, but that was ok. They stop at night. Most of the time we were out and about exploring maui or snorkeling. By the way, snorkeling in front of the suites is doable, but it's better to walk about 200 yards to the left or right of the hotel. Our room was fantastic!! The first time we stayed there, we had a studio on the bottom floor. This time we were higher up...i recommend getting a room higher up. The view is just amazing. The staff was awesome. We got a newspapaer every morning. All the rooms have a full kitchen, so we saved money by purchasing food from the market across the street. Our food for breakfast / lunch was market food, and we splurged for dinner at a restaurant. We saved alot of money by doing this. :) They had an orientation breakfast every morning to discuss some activities available. We ended up booking a few activites just from what we learned at that orientation. I've stayed at other hotels before, the mainstream big hotels with people everywhere. If you like a quite, laidback atmosphere...i HIGHLY recommend giving the Mahana a try :)

Reviews.Title: “#818 Maui Mahana Magic”
Reviews.Author: MahanaMaui
Reviews.Content: Maui is a piece of paradise that was worth every penny. One week is not enough to see and do all that Maui offers. The beaches are beautiful, the condo was so accommodating, and the water so crystal clear. The breathtaking view from the living room and bedroom balcony looks directly out to the beach and ocean. All you need to take is your toiletries, shorts and swimsuites. Even beachtowels are provided. There is a very nice and affordable grocery store within waking distance, and everything else you need is provided in the condo. The bed was more comfortable than mine at home. This is a one bedroom unit but with the (new) queen size fold-out couch, we slept four comfortably. A concierge can plan all your excursions, but check on line at least two months ahead for special interest bookings since they fill up fast. I can't say enough praise for our stay in Maui and this unit. As soon as we can return, we want to stay in Mahana #818.

Reviews.Title: “great relaxation at the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: traveltrica
Reviews.Content: What a perfect little place! The best value we could have found. My husband and I did the Studio Supersaver, which was the perfect size for us. We wanted to be on the water, with a kitchen and AC for under $200 and couldn't have asked for more. We loved being able to eat in most of the time, and enjoyed the sunsets looking from our balcony. It's a convenient walk to the grocery store, and not too far from some excellent snorkeling at Black Rock and the activities at Kaanapali Beach. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Little Place”
Reviews.Author: ericsmommy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana in August 2008. The hotel room was pretty nice although not as amazing as some of the photos I have seen. It had Hawaiian decor with wicker furniture , updated bathrooms and amazing views. We were able to sit outside and enjoy meals and we barbecued more than once outside. We did have a few problems but I think it is just random. 1. Our second bedroom had a view of the parking lot and the construction next door. Unfortunately this meant that when Mahana had to repair the plumbing in the middle of our stay, they worked all evening in the parking lot with bright lights on the site. That and the sound kept me up all that evening. 2. During the repair they shut off the water from 10 pm to 5am . This meant no air conditioning and no toilet etc. I think this only really bothered us because we were getting up at 3 to see the sunrise on the volcano. Luckily we know how to rough it and just used bottled water to wash up. 3. Our air conditioner blew water in the room all night the first night. We had to call to get it repaired and it took all day. Then we had to have a gigantic fan on in the room for two days. 4. The second bedroom had twin beds ( we were not expecting this) which we just pushed together to make a full bed. The cleaning staff actually changed the sheets to accommodate us, which was unexpected and greatly appreciated. Like I stated above, I think these were just random problems and the staff was quick about getting us the help when we needed it. Two things I should mention - there is no safe beach at the hotel and you need to walk a little way to get to a safer area, and while the pool area is very pretty and new it is almost unusable because of the WIND. The wind is almost unbearable at all times of the day . Shoes become flying projectiles after 4 pm ! BUT we were in Maui for the beaches so we spent most of our time in the ocean. Who cares about the pool when you have Napili Bay ?

Reviews.Title: “Condo Living on the Beach - 1202 style”
Reviews.Author: sleepytraveller03
Reviews.Content: Personally, I have never done the condo- thing for a vacation. It is always hotels and resorts for me. But, this I admit, was alright. My wife and I stayed at the Outrigger Keauhou Beach Resort on Big Island, and yes, we did the laundry service once, and it was pricey. The next time, we did the coin laundry room option, like we did in on another stay. Yeah, sitting, and check in on the laundry is not that fun, even for 1 1/2 hour. The condo in Maui had the standard stacked laundry unit in the suite, which was great. The kitchen, was nice and had all the tools we needed to stay in and have a nice cooked meal when we felt guilty eating out all the time. And, it was a nice meal in the condo. The super-market is 2 min driving up the street, and has all the ingredients for even a high-end meal if you want to cook one. We (meaning I) made a nice dinner in the condo, and the view was great, and it was private. The condo was really nice. Since it is a condo, there are some rules that are different than a resort/hotel room, but it isn't too much trouble. The main rule, is respect, as this is a owned living space. The condo is kept nicely, since people do live there. The one pool is small heated, and they have plenty of Weber Genesis BBQ's for use. The beach is there, the sand is nice, but the grading of the beach is very steep and with the coral nearby and the strong waves, I don't recommend it as a swim/snorkel spot, although I saw someone try it. Definitely, the beach behind the resort and beside the resorts next door, I would not recommend for kids, for safety reasons. If you are going to hang on the beach, I would recommend walking up closer to the next resort, where the beach is wider. There are some great resorts in the area, but if you are going to be on the island for more than a week, I would consider the condo. The beach club hotel next door, I was really envious, from the look of it; it has everything. But, as we spent most of the time sight-seeing, and not hanging around the resort, it wasn't an issue. The first night in, to find the Mahana, is a little tricky; you need to look out for the one little sign on the main street. No hotel/resort food, only a snack bar and vouchers to the resort next door, which can put your meal on your room if you eat there. This resort charges for all phone calls, even 1-8xx, which we didn't care for. Also, a warning regarding the Expedia reps. We use them extensively, but if you can find exactly what you want to do, and who you want to do it with, you can save some $$$ by booking directly. You might as well take the discount rather than having the rep take it. The reps do want to sell you the big trips, so beware. They do offer good advice and insight, and we use them to book, but, you should do your own research. Also, we don't care for the time-share selling job. It does save some $$$, but we didn't want to waste our vacation time and have someone do a sell job on us.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: JConner17
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (mid 20's) stayed at the Mahana 08/16/08 - 08/23/08 in Unit #1017 (10th floor - 1bd/1ba), which we booked directly through the owner (www.stayonmaui.com). It is going to be difficult to express how much we LOVED the Mahana and Unit #1017!! I was hesitant to book directly through an owner (this was my first time!)... but I wanted to ensure we were going to have a room with an unobstructed view. The owner of this condo was VERY professional. All correspondence was made VERY quickly via both e-mail and regular mail -- receipts for payments, etc. came in the mail so quickly I was amazed! The owner was also very helpful with any questions re: the unit, and all of my questions were answered in a very timely manner. The unit itself was unbelievable. VERY, VERY clean when we arrived. And the view... oh the view... pictures of the view will do no justice for seeing it in real life. The hotel could not be any closer to the ocean unless it was actually built IN THE OCEAN itself -- gives a whole new meaning to "ocean front". We slept with the lanai doors open every night and enjoyed the sounds of waves crashing as we slept. We were suprised at how comfortable the temperature was without the air conditioning! It was wonderful! The Mahana grounds are also beautiful. The pool was NEVER crowded (no problem getting chairs, etc.). And the spa was HUGE!
