Although you can't swim on the beach directly in front of the Mahana, there is an absolutely gorgeous, practically deserted beach about 100 yards down from the property. We were amazed that we were almost alone, and felt sorry for everyone packed along the fronts of the big resorts! Snorkling down from the hotel was also amazing (again, within walking distance), and we saw more fish than at some of the other "more popular" dive sites! During our trip, we must have said at LEAST a thousand times "We are so glad we are not in the super-croweded resort area" --- we would have paid an arm-and-a-leg for a "partial ocean view", been in a crowded resort on a crowded beach, been in a croweded resort pool stuffed with people/kids and it would have seemed as if we were being herded like cattle. We had no probelms driving to Lahaina for dinners (parking was not as difficult as I was thinking) or getting take-out and eating on the Lanai. Again, I can't speak highly enough about the Mahana. It was absolutely wonderful and I HIGHLY recommened it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: dschley
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 1017 in August, 2008 and had a fantastic experience. We rented directly from the owners so knew exactly which unit we'd be staying in (which sounds like a plus given that not all units are recently renovated). Unit 1017 was clean and modern and had everything we needed for a week in Maui (beach chairs, coolers, modern kitchen with everything needed for cooking). And the views are outstanding! Our only complaint (and it was the same complaint that other family members staying in other units had) was that the air conditioning has a hard time keeping up with the heat in the mid- afternoon as the sun shines in the huge windows. We found the Mahana to be a perfect place to stay. Nice pool and hot tub, good location, tremendous views, and steps away from some of the best snorkeling we've seen anywhere. True that the beach directly in front of the complex is not the best for sitting or swimming, but a short walk in either direction will take you to very nice and relatively quiet beaches. Be aware that there is construction going on next door and the noise can be disturbing sometimes if you have your windows open during the day. We will definitely stay at the Mahana again if our travels take us back to Maui, but will also rent directly from the owners so we know exactly what we're getting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our #608 condo”
Reviews.Author: phaquet
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our home-away -from-home at the Mahana. Our children loved the pool as well as the hot tub and we enjoyed grilling steaks at the numerous BBQ pits available. The views from front balcony (overlooking the majestic mountains) to the balcony (gorgeous sunsets) are just unbelievable. The condo was clean and maid service was available on a daily basis. However, this place is situated in west Maui which is somewhat far if you want to head to Heleakeala or to the town of Hana. Moreover, if you plan on taking any tour, we suggest you go on-line and book yourself and save some money instead of going thru the local Expedia agent on-site. One more note, a good book to take along on this trip is Hawaii for dummies!

Reviews.Title: “Unit #804 was Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: Nicole218
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana from 7/24-8/1 and absolutely loved it. We booked unit #804 direct from the owner www.mahanarental.com. He was super easy to work with and the condo is absolutely gorgeous. Recently remodeled in 2005 with bamboo floors, granite countertops in the kitchen, stainless steel appliances and a beautiful walk-in shower. The kitchen was fully stocked and the grills by the pool were immaculate. We grilled twice and were able to eat leftovers too- something we really missed when we got to the Moana on Waikiki. We went grocery shoppnig at the Star Market right behind the condo the first night, and there is a Safeway grocery store ~10 minutes away. It is windy, but it didn't bother us as it made the heat bearable. The smoothie cart by tthe pool was nice. While on Maui, we drove to Ka'anapali Beachwalk daily to run in the mornings and were able to find free parking near the Westin (there was a small lot that fit about 11 cars, and we were there around 7am when it opened and always got a spot). Then we'd eat breakfast back at the condo and set out for the day. We spent one day at Ka"anapali Beach near the Shearton and snorkeled around Black Rock, then went back that night to the Hula Grill for dinner- had good seats to watch the sunset. Drove to Haleakala to watch the sunrise and left the condo at 3:00 am- glad we didn't leave any later as by the time we got to the summit (~5:15) the top lot was nearly full. Went back to the condo and spent the day by the pool, then went to the Old Lahaina Luau at night. We parked right at the Luau and had traditional mat seating- I booked this several months in advance and we were literally the first two seats by the stage. A great night. Sunday we drove ~25minutes north of the condo to the Nakalele Blowhole and Honolua Bay to snorkel, then went to Napili Beach for the day. We grilled out that night. Monday we drove the Road to Hana and left the condo at ~5:30 so we were on the Hana Hwy by 7am. We didn't have any traffic pressuring us from behind this way. Stopped at the Black Sand Beach and several waterafalls on the way, got to 7 Sacred Pools and were able to get in briefly before we had to get out as it was raining further up the mountain and the rangers were warning of possible floods. Didn't have to tell us twice! Then we hiked the Pipiwai Trail ~1hr 15min to the 400 ft waterfall at the end, and also saw the Infinity pool feeding another waterfall about half way in to the hike. Beautiful bamboo forest. Take your ticket from Haleakala Sunrise as this is part of the same park and you won't have to pay again, but only good for 2 days I think. That night we ate from Okazuya (sp?) take out right down the road from the Condo and had great Ono and Maui Onion Burger. Tuesday we went to Molokini with Four Winds II- great experience on the boat, but snorkeling a little disappointing after Honolua Bay. Very little variety in fish species and not many to see period. Stopped at "Turtle Town" on way back ot the harbor and saw several turtles near the boat. Went to Big Beach (Huge-but kind of bigger shore break- knocked me over a few times!) from there past Wailea for the rest of the day, and grilled out that night at the condo. Wednesday we stayed a tthe Mahana byt the pool, then left for Lahaini around 2:30, walked around and shopped, saw the Banyan tree, and went to Warren and Annabelle's Magic show. Very funny (clean) and great magic. Worth it for an evening out. Ate at Cheeseburger in Paradise after for a late dinner ~9pm and didn't have to wait at all. Thursday was our last full day in Maui and we went to Wailea Beach, walked around the shops at Wailea, and then went back to Big Beach. Ate our leftovers that night and packed to go to Waikiki that night. Overall, we loved the Mahana and would love to go back again when we make it back to Maui someday. We don't mind driving and exploring, so it didn't bother us that the beach in front of the condo wasn't swimmable- just walk south ~100 yards and from there to BlackRock you can swim. We loved the "home away fro home" feeling and having the space a condo allows over a hotel room. Very clean facility and frendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - But Construction Next Door”
Reviews.Author: rpcpa
Reviews.Content: The room was exceptional, a one bedroom on the sixth floor of the south building. We felt the owners of the unit we stayed in had excellent taste and the unit had been very nicely upgraded. We looked at two other units (in an attempt to distant ourselves from the construction noise) and this unit was far better than the first somewhat better than the second. Had we stayed at the first other unit, we would have been very disappointed. Construction is going on next door on a series on new condos which means we had to contend with the "beep...beep...beep" of vehicles backing up and other construction noise from around 6 am to late afternoon. In the room with the a/c on full the noise was hardly noticeable. However, the pool and the beach to the south (airport beach) were another story; it was quite noticeable and far from relaxing. For us, we made the unit work by finding other places to be, and in Maui that isn't difficult (sightseeing, other beaches, sailing, etc). The value for the room we stayed in offset the distraction. You would be hard pressed to find a full ocean view one-bedroom unit with a full living room and kitchen. The window on this unit encompassed the entire wall with views of the islands of Lanai and Molokai in the distance.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Deron
Reviews.Content: This Condo is an experience in luxury beyond description. Every corner expresses beauty and the atmosphere invites relaxation and solitude. The ocean views are as if you are floating on the water and surround the living and sleeping areas. Although we had nine days in this dream atmosphere we felt like we had a month away from our busy lives. We have stayed in 5 star hotels all over the world but feel that the Mahana is a true find and we'll go back often.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: maui0608
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights at the Resortquest Mahana in mid-June and had a great time! We booked through AAA and made sure to request a room higher up (to get an unobstructed ocean view) and one that was recently remodeled. Our unit was on the 10th floor but most floors are fine except for maybe the 4-6th floors where the palm fronds block the view. If you're interested in ocean views than the Mahana is the place for you as both buildings directly face the ocean and all units have ocean views. The livingroom and lanai have the views. We were lucky our unit was remodeled - we saw another unit that had an open house and it was not as nice. Very basic white and a little used looking (but had that great view). So make sure to request a remodeled unit. The staff at Mahana was nice and requests for additional shampoo, dishwasher detergent were easy. There were a few days that the timing of the cleaning of our unit was not the most convenient but if you're out all day, that shouldn't be a problem. We stayed in a one bedroom unit with 2 young kids (under age 12) so the arrangement of the sofabed worked well. Our kids were fine with the small pool and hot tub here. Older kids might want more action which is close by at the Resortquest Kaanapali Shore, just 2 resorts north. You could probably walk on the beach to this other resort and use their very large pools with waterfalls. Also you can go there to get a drink and listen to music as the Mahana does not have any of these amenities. We used the very clean bbq grills several times and it made for a quick dinner with little clean up. The grill area is nice with a sink and counter area behind. One warning about the Mahana is the tradewinds which were more breezy than I liked. Our kids still loved getting in the pool and didn't care but I didn't really like lounging by the poolside with all the wind. It seems less windy farther south by the main area of Kaanapali. The Mahana is a quiet resort and that's what we wanted. If you want more and don't mind walking or a short drive, there's always the Resortquest Kaanapali or southward, the whole Kaanapali Shores complex to get your fix. But if you want that action where you stay, than the Mahana might not be for you. Also onsite at the Mahana is an Expedia agency where we booked a boat trip to Lanai (through Pacific Whale Foundation) and a luau at the Royal Lahaina. The luau was better than expected but the boat trip was really rocky. The boat staff was really great though and very helpful as my son got really seasick. I would recommend both activities. Good places to eat in Lahaina - Lahaina Mai-Tai Lounge, right on the water Lahaina Grille and Oyster Bay Different place to check out - Makawao Town, cool little town with shops Also stock up at Costco before going to your condo. It's on the way from the airport. Although Safeway is pretty close (about a 10 minute drive) so that's convenient enough. We would definitely stay at the Mahana again!

Reviews.Title: “Know what room to reserve!”
Reviews.Author: Travelswell4fun
Reviews.Content: My goodness! As I write this review, I'm noticing that the three most frequent admissions to this review site where staying at the Mahana the same time we were. And I agree with everyone that the Mahana IS the place to stay. Quit looking around and wasting anymore of your time - trust me, you have found "the place". Just know which unit you are reserving because they are not all the same. As best I can piece together, each unit is individually owned and not all the units are "rental managed" by the ResortQuest people. We reserved throught the ResortQuest website directly secondary to several reviews stating difficulty dealing with the front desk in regards to "non-pool" units. But to that I can only say this: (and it is the moral to my story). We booked months in advance (as you'd better do for your luau at the Old Lahaina or the Feast at Lele). We requested a renovated unit on a high floor away from the elevators. Upon arrival, we were given #703 which, while nice and clean enough, was not one of the spectacularly renovated units seen on TripAdvisor. And it is right next to the elevator. When we discussed this with the desk clerk Alana (my savior and a true angel!), she arranged for a transfer to #1016 the next day. And what a new day it was in this incredible, unbelievably beautiful unit that is actually a one bedroom converted to a studio with a drop-down Murphy bed (which was truly a comfortable bed, surprisingly). Now, I've stayed in some of the nicest hotels all around the world and I will tell you that this unit #1016 was possibly the most impressive of all. Tile floors and shower (with bench), new everything, a most impressive kitchen with the newest of everything, etc, etc, I can't impress it up enough - it really was the very finest of accomodations available on the island. Everthing nice you have read in the latest reviews are true. I personally wouldn't even think of staying anywhere else. The location is great, the people are super, the clientele is adult with well behaved children (read: upper class; well-educated; disciplined and mannered children - No thugs). The moral is: go through the reviews and choose which rooms are the sweet ones and which are not. #1016 is sweet! #703 is clean but not a recent/big-time redo. You still are getting your $250.00 worth in #703, but you get a $700.00 a night pad in #1016 (and similar) for the same $250.00. I mean, it's really that good. The Mahana is my highest recommendation. O.K., now that we have that taken care of let me recommend some of what was fantastic on our trip. Breakfast was awesome at The Gazebo restaurant at the shore line of some hotel up the road (ask the front desk at the Mahana). They open at 7:30 A.M. and the line started at about 7:00. We did a Blue Hawaiian helicopter ride and can recommend a 45 minute ride. We booked this and they upgraded us to the hour long ride. At about the 45 minute mark we both got the queezy's. The next day we did the Haleakala sunrise which, unfortuantely, was too cloudy to see - BUT, after most people left because they didn't see the sunrise we stayed and watched the sun start breaking through and burning off the clouds which afforded us some of the most heavenly pictures you can imagine, so hang out and chill. On the way down we ate at the Kula Lodge where they had the best fruit plate I've ever eaten. Their garden is spectacular! I think we took 70+ pictures of flowers there alone! Mama's Fish House is the best. It's very close to the most famous "kite-surfing/wind-surfing" venue in the world. Those dudes are awesome. Watch for free. Mama's is really fantastic but expensive (naturally). Everything is super tasty, so a reservation is a must for dinner. (Eating at the bar would allow instant seating as it is not sat by the hostess - It's personally my favorate place to eat because of the instant service available at all time by the bartenders). If you only do one restaurant, this is it. The next day we did a Trilogy snorkle trip to Molokini crater/turtle town. I recommend Trilogy highly, but not the Molokini trip. It was too crowded with boats and snorklers. The Trilogy people are the best, though. Read my review of them separately. Snorkle Honolua bay, then Kapalua bay, then Kaanapali by the Sheraton/black rock. Do not park in the Sheraton's garage -- three hours was $20!. Use the Whaler's Village parking. Yes there is currently construction going on right next to the Mahana property. Yes we could here the "beep-beep-beep" backup alarms on some of the trucks, but it wasnt' too bad. Obviously not enough for me to tell you anything other than, "stay at the Mahana - you'll be glad you did". I tell you of the construction so that you are best informed. Nothing is better than the Mahana. Know your room reserved. Have fun in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Laredo82
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for my Maui honeymoon based on the reviews from this website. My husband and I wanted something beachfront, but we weren't prepared to pay for a luxury hotel. The Mahana was fantastic. We were in unit 314 and we really felt at home during our 5 day stay. The view from our one bedroom condo was really amazing, and as soon as we walked into the room and walked out on the balcony, we knew we had made the right decision. You really can't beat the ocean view and being able to watch the beautiful Maui sunsets from the comfort of your own balcony. The room itself was tastefully decorated. The shower was big enough for the two of us, and the kitchen was beautifully appointed with granite countertops and stainless steel appliances. It was stocked with dishes and anything we could possibly need. The washer/dryer was also a huge convienience. The beach right in front of the hotel isn't great for swimming, but a nice stroll a couple of hundred yards in either direction leads to beaches more suitable for swimming. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Mahana, and I recommend it to everyone. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views! Privacy of Home!”
Reviews.Author: OhioMauiluvr
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend the Mahana to family and friends! This was an amazing trip! We were on our 2nd honeymoon and we couldn't have asked for a better one. We stayed on Oahu for the first 5 days and then came to Maui. We wished we would have booked the whole 10 days on Maui at the Mahana! It seemed very private. The pool was never very busy and the beach in front of the hotel never seemed to have very many people on it. The view from the balcony was incredible. The sunsets were beautiful and we even saw a rainbow once. We slept with the patio door opened every night listening to the ocean. We will be back for sure!! Thanks Mahana for a much better 2nd honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasTraveler97
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my trip to Maui during which time I stayed at the ResortQuest Mahana. I have to say that I typically don't write reviews, but I use them to make my decision. I was so impressed with this hotel I had to share my thoughts. I booked 2 rooms through Travelocity so I wasn't sure which room I was going to be getting, but I had contact the staff prior to arriving and requested 2 rooms on an upper floor near one another. We were assigned room 902 and 903. Room 902 was modern with a king size bed and the view was spectacular. Room 903 was fine but it had a smaller bed and wasn't updated so the staff offered us room 605 which was excellent (although considered a studio because only 1 bed it had 2 bathrooms a living room, dining room, and a sizable kitchen-902 had a full kitchen but small). We stocked our fridge at Star Market (just outside the large parking area) and had breakfast daily in the room. The kitchen had everything but the food itself (coffee maker, coffee, pots, pans, plates, dishes, silverware,...). I travel often and had always heard about the outrageous prices in Hawaii so I packed a small suitcase full of food also (pancake mix, cereal, snacks, ....). The prices weren't outrageous except the dairy items seemed to be significantly higher. We had pre booked our luau, The Feast at Lele and I would recommend it to anyone. It was $110/person plus tip but each group had a private table and the food and entertainment were excellent. There was 1 vegetarian in our group and they were extremely accommodating. We booked most other activities through the Expedia tour desk in the hotel. We opted for a 45 minute helicopter ride over Molokai, kayaking and snorkeling with South Pacific Kayaking, zip lining with EcoTours (booked separate), and I can't remember the name of the surfing company (booked separate). I wasn't impressed with the Expedia rep at all. She told us zip lining was fully booked (1 location was but when I called on my own they had openings at the one at the base of the volcano) and tried to talk us into biking down the side of the volcano. I told her I wasn't a great biker and she said it would be fine but when we went to the volcano to watch the sunrise and saw the bikers coming down the mountain on the same road with us on tight curves some of which had no guard rails and steep drops I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who wasn't a serious biker. We combined the sunrise with the zip lining (we went down the mountain and had breakfast at a cafe in between). After the helicopter ride we had lunch at Milagros in a town called Paia. It was great so we went again after zip lining. The hotel was great about letting us take towels to the beach, and their pool area was very nice. They don't have a ton of amenities but with the kitchen I wasn't bothered. When I return to Maui I will without a doubt return to this hotel. Since we rented a car we just zipped off to wherever whenever, the location is very convenient. The only travelers that I wouldn't recommend this hotel to would be people looking for serious nightlife. In addition, I wish somebody would have told me to bring a hat, scarf, and gloves to the volcano. We took the extra blanket out of the closet it just wasn't enough to keep us warm. With the wind chill up there it was too cold for me! I will be recommending this hotel to anyone and everyone taking a trip to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Condo, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: dave50Seattle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in March 2008 and we could NOT BE HAPPIER that we did. What an awesome location, with direct ocean front rooms The sunsets were amazing! We had a great room, with everything we needed. Fronts desk and staff went out of their way to make us feel extra comfortable. We'll come to Maui just to stay here again. ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Best Family Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: iflores1102
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip to Hawaii and so I wanted it to be real special. I did my research and read the reviews this property had. I am so happy to have chosen such magnificent place to stay. We couldn't have asked for more - we had a beautiful unit (1005) with absolutely breathtaking views from our bedroom lanai to the living room. The minute we walked in, we had the ocean right infront of our eyes. Everything was just perfect from the decor, the spacious bedroom with comfortable bed, the living room area, dinning area, the bathrooms (2) both completely remodeled/new with very spacious showers and not to mentioned the kitchen. WOW, I mean this kitchen was fully remodeled/new and equipped with everthing needed to cook. I just really enjoyed cooking/preparing meals for my family in such beautiful kitchen. But that's not all - our unit even had a washer and dryer which was just perfect. I mean what more can you possibly want? This, by far was the BEST! The staff - THE BEST! So professional and always willing to help and answer any questions we had. Every morning and evening they would all greet us with big smiles in their faces. We even booked our helicopter tour through them. I mean these people were just all so friendly and happy. The lady in charge of cleaning our unit (Juicy - sorry if spelled wrong) this lady was so nice always making sure we had everything we needed from towels, toiletries etc. and again always with a big smile. The pool and barbecue area were all perfect. I must say this was the best vacation ever... Other extras this property has which no other does unless you pay a daily fee is the FREE PARKING AND FREE WI-FI! Again, this property was just beyond SUPERB! We cannot wait to come back again next year June 2009. Thank you all for such wonderful stay. Thank you all from the bottom of our hearts. Until we meet again next year June 2009, The Flores Family Miami, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Wow Factor!!! Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: shotbadly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit #216. First off let me say that the lower floors are where it's at. It was like standing on the ocean at this level. You could hear the waves all night and we slept great! We booked with the owner via a website that featured direct booking. The ownerâ€™s of our unit went above and beyond to help us in any way they could with info on great places to eat and which attractions would be a waste of time for us. We snorkeled right outside the room. The pool is great and there are five or so BBQ's to use if you so choose. The building is beautiful and well maintained. There are plenty of restaurants, grocery and gear rental places close by. We will be back and we will stay in the same room. Donâ€™t waste your money on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our family loved the beauty and ambiance of the Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: Letstalkcoffee
Reviews.Content: After months of planning a four island tour of Hawaii, I chose the ResortQuest Mahana because of the good reviews/ratings and was not disappointed. We arrived on May 22nd and were assigned a beautiful and clean one bedroom suite on the 3rd floor. There were granite counter tops in the full kitchen, a washer and dryer, pretty ceramic bathrooms, but our favorite were the breathtaking ocean front views and sunsets! Sitting on the lanai and eating meals were simply delightful! We attended the free breakfast put on by the concierge in which she discussed activities we could sign up for and purchase through Expedia--it was all optional and low-key. We decided to book a luau (I believe it was $56 a person) and a snorkeling trip to Molokini which was also reasonably priced. The whole family enjoyed the luau and it was a great way to begin our trip and we also had fun on the snorkeling trip with the Pacific Whale Watch group. I also cannot say enough about the beautiful landscaped grounds and the walk to the Star supermarket across the street was a relaxing one--no need to drive to the Safeway--the Star had more of an "island" feel to it. We grilled out almost every night on immaculate grills that I noticed were cleaned in the morning by staff members. I remembered someone mentioning the high winds, and did recall it being windy in the afternoon, but not bothersome. My concentration was the pure pleasure of relaxing on the nice loungers facing a beautiful beach, then leisurely walking to swim or snorkel and end the day in the hot tub gazing out at the ocean and jumping into the refreshing pool. My teen-aged son appreciated the air conditioning because we did not have a/c on a couple of the other islands. I would love to send my daughter here for her honeymoon. WOW! All I can say is that I can't imagine returning to Maui without staying at the Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: barmach
Reviews.Content: This was my families first visit to Maui. I booked the Mahana based on the reviews on this site. I am so glad that we stayed at the Mahana. We had a one bedroom for for my wife, 16 month old son and I. We were very comfortable and loved our room. I had requested a room on a high floor and we had a room on the top floor (12). I was very impressed that when we got to our room and a crib for my son was setup in the bedroom. The Mahana is in a great location and the Star Market across the street came was a good place for us to stock up. This allowed us to have breakfast daily on the lani. What a view we had! The staff was very friendly and very helpful. My only complaint was the housekeeping service was not the best. We had to call down in order to get our room cleaned (we did not have serivce until the 3rd day). We are looking forward toour next trip to Maui and staying at the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “The best Honeymoon ever”
Reviews.Author: ladychippy
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from our honeymoon in hawaii. Our first stop was in Maui. We had been booked into the Resortquest Kaanapali shores but from reading some reviews felt it was more a family themed property and wanted something a little more with a honeymoon feel. We then picked the resort quest mahana. we made sure that we e mailed the property before hand to ensure we had an updated room. The slight worry with this property is that all rooms are decorated by the owners of the property so it is pot luck what room you get. Having said that when we walked into our room No 506 we were absolutely blown away in how stunning the room looked. The room had all comforts of home with a fully updated kitchen with every type of appliance imaginable including all stanless steel applicances and granite brench tops. A very comfy lounge which included a flat screen TV and massive king size bed which also had another tv in the bedroom and a beautiful marble bathroom with a shower big enough for two people with a seat and a massage shower head. The staff at the Mahana were more then helpful whilst also giving us some spoace to enjoy out honeymoon. If they needed us to know something they left a messge oin the answring machine. While we were there there was no access to the pool area for 2 of the days. But that was no problem as there was just so much to do around that it was no issue. After 5 nights we reluctantly had to leave to go to Oahu which the hotel we stayed at in Waikiki was nowhere near the class of the Mahana. I could go on and on about this property all day on how great it was but i just urge everyone to stay at the Mahana. We are now counting down the days that we can come back to stay here again. It was the honeymoon to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Maui”
Reviews.Author: traveler3278
Reviews.Content: Wonderful condo with a million dollar view! Spoke directly with the owner of the condo and booked on his website. Very easy process and pleasant interaction. Condo is located on the beach with a view of Lanai and Molokai. Beautifully updated unit with plenty of room and just the right amount of privacy. Property is very clean and accomodating. No problems during our entire stay!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: FoodForThought101
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable! I would have rated this condo 5 star except for the underhanded booking. To be specific, because we booked during a busy time and (perhaps) for a decent discount, months ago via Expedia, they "downgraded" our room without notice (and probably because they overbooked the rooms). Needless to say, I was furious and discussed with the manager "Debbie" the next day who was able to accommodate us with the size room we had requested. My advice: Call before-hand and make sure you get a proper room. Also I learned that they consider their rooms "gold" and "standard" which refers to their condition. Moving on, we were assigned room #408 which was simply beautiful, updated, and clean. Kitchen was well equipped with all the common utensils needed to cook a meal and more. Pool is rather on the small side, but kept clean and was adequate for us. You will literally be beach-front which is a few steps away. Keep in mind that there are no lifeguards on premises (or on the beach) and the water is rough. Friendly staff. Across the street from the hotel is the "Star Market" which is a large grocery that sells everything (including a huge selection of wine and liquor). Save some $$ and check them out. Safeway, another large grocer, is a 10 minute drive away. Tip: Take or rent a car with GPS.

Reviews.Title: “Loved condo 708 and the view”
Reviews.Author: travel0723
Reviews.Content: Before considering the Mahana, please note that the Mahana is a condo building with a basic pool. It is very nicely landscaped complete with tiki torches at night. It is not a full service resort. Every room faces the ocean directly ( big + for us ), no partial views. If you are on a level lower than 7, you may have a palm tree between you and the ocean. Because the condo faces west, you will enjoy beautiful sunsets. Before considering condos, we had considered the resorts... but after reading reviews about how tired most of them are, and the premium prices for a full ocean view, I started looking at condos. The other thing I didn't like about the resorts was all the gotcha fees - beach chairs, parking, 'resort fee' etc After I found the Mahana, I started reading the reviews and noticed that there were a lot of hit and miss experiences. Then I noticed a trend... those people that rented from private owners seemed to always have a better experience. I followed the advice and found the vrbo website. ( Special thanks to fellow reviewers for the advice ). I emailed/called a few of the owners and finally decided on 708 after reviewing their pictures and talking to the owner on the phone. I could tell that this was one owner that took pride in the look of their condo ( they have two others at the Mahana ). We were not disappointed. The condo looked exactly as it did in the pictures. Since I knew beforehand EXACTLY which room I was getting, I didn't have to worry about what kind of room the Resortquest mgmt would give me. The kitchen had all the utensils one could need and there was a new washer and dryer as well. Kitchen and bathrooms were all up to date. This unit also had beach towels/chairs stored in a closet. The fold out bed in the sofa also had a real mattress. Check-in was very smooth. Parking spaces are narrow ( this seems to be the norm in Maui ). You can also take a nice stroll on the beach in either direction - going to the north you eventually get blocked by a rocky beach and a fence, going to the south you can walk all the way to the Black Rock. The beach immediately in front of the Mahana is very rocky and you are warned about this. To enter the water they recommend going north or south on the beach. In conclusion, an owner-managed Mahana condo is a perfect place to stay if you want a awesome, nothing-but ocean view and if you are not interested in paying higher prices for a full resort plus the endless add on fees. You can also save on food costs ( and calories ) by making some of your own meals. Grills are provided on the ground level of the Mahana for all guests. It may not be a good choice for families with little kids if the pool/resort scene is important for them. Side trips: For the 'Road to Hana' experience, I would recommend taking a tour rather than driving. The driver won't get to enjoy it as much. The roads are narrow and most bridges are one lane. We took a tour that included a lunch at the fancy resort in Hana. America II: see my review www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60634-d526240-r16370591-America_II-Lahaina_Maui_Hawaii.html Reefdancer: see my forum comment: www.tripadvisor.com/ShowTopic-g29220-i86-k1525794-Reefdancer-Maui_Hawaii.html We attended the Old Lahaina Luau and found it entertaining. The food was ok, not great. The drinks are watered down. The meat was dried out -- probably because it had been cooked many hours before. The restaurant next door, Aloha Mixed Plate, is so close that you can hear the entire luau from there. An interesting way to 're-live' it, if you have previously enjoyed it. We went to the Kupahana Magic Show at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. The food was decent for a banquet style dinner, drinks were limited to just a Mai Tai and/or soft drinks. The show itself was entertaining - it was a combination of magic + hawaii history. At times though the magician did seem to rush through his lines. Also drove to Haleakala crater (not for sunrise) but it was fogged in that day. Even though we couldn't see very far, it was still a surreal experience. Don't forget to bring a jacket. The Kula resort on the way has a restaurant, some neat views and a little botanical garden to walk through.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Mahana Room 803!”
Reviews.Author: littlemarichan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in Room 803 at the Mahana in Kannapali. We stayed there last year as well but in a different room. We booked 803 directly through the condo owner and got a fantastic deal. She was very sweet and helpful over the phone. When we got to the studio, it was wonderfully decorated in a hawaiian theme. The place was very clean, cute and cozy. She even had goodies such as cookies, chocolates, macadamia nuts waiting for us. She also had a little portfolio of her personal recommendations, which were all very helpful. She even had beach towels, beach chairs, and boogie boards for us to use. The view was great, as all Mahana rooms are. My boyfirend and I had an excellent stay in room 803. We would definitely recommend the room to friends and would stay there again ourselves. Thanks Sophie!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: maui_girl_81
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay May 3-13th in 804 at the Mahana. It was perfect! We booked through the owner of the condo at VRBO. This condo is beautiful!! The decor is amazing and has an awesome view! The kitchen is nice with plenty of utensils and dishes. Even had some extras we didn't expect. The bathroom was really nice with large shower. Nice bedroom with a very comfortable mattress too. We loved hearing the waves come in at night from the bedroom. This place made our vacation perfect. I did alot of research before we stayed here and read some negative reviews of the Mahana so I was a little skeptical. I know some of the rooms here aren't as updated as others. The Mahana itself is a beautiful hotel. It's on the other side of Black rock, on North Ka'anapali Beach which in my opinion is alot less busy and more quiet. The beach itself is nice as well, you can't swim directly in front of the Mahana due to coral, but you literally walk a min down either way on the beach and it's fine. It's great for snorkeling with all the coral right there, tons of fish. We saw a few turtles from our lanai as well. The pool area is nice, they just put a nice new hot tub poolside and also a bbq area with a handful of new grills and tables to grill out. They were also updating the bathrooms by the pool while we were there. There is also a litlle smoothie/snack bar by the pool which is a nice touch for the guests. No alcoholic drinks though. We went and bought a collapsible cooler for $12 and took our own drinks to the beach and that worked out fine. The staff at the Mahana is also very nice too. They were always helpful if we needed anything. The Mahana is in walking distance from a little plaza with a grocery store and some restaurants too which is convenient. We loved the Mahana!! I don't know how anyone could say anything bad about this place, it was perfect in every way! We will definitely be back here, hopefully soon!!! We miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Resortquest Mahana at Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: CandACalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property for a wedding. We really enjoyed our stay....it was reasonably priced, had beautiful views, and updated, clean rooms. All of the rooms are absolute ocean view. This is a very nice place to stay in Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “I miss you already Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: Cruisedave
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a great 10 nights here. My wife and I were in a one bedroom, one bath on the 6th floor. As everyone says, the views are unbelievable!!! Our unit was upgraded and had the nicest shower I've evern seen. I just took a shower in my own house and all I could think of was that incredible shower now 5000 miles away. If you're looking for a big resort with a lot of amenities etc... this place is not for you. If you're looking for a great room, with incredible views with a lot of piece and quiest, then this is where you have to stay. I'll just put it like this, my wife and I travel quite a bit, stayed in many nice hotels and some bad one's too. But this is the firsts time when we walked out the door of our room for the last time, my wife had tears. What else do I need to say? When I return to Maui, I will be returning to the Mahana and hopefully the same unit as well. It really felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our condo!”
Reviews.Author: amyxoxo
Reviews.Content: I booked a studio, but was upgraded to a 1 bedroom, 2 bath. Probably due to us checking in late. The view was spectacular. We even had a couple of whale sightings. The condo was upgraded with a great kitchen and the room was all in all perfect. And more importantly, I couldn't hear any noisy neighbors. Although the beach is not swimmable, there are other great beaches in close proximity that more than makes up for it. I would definitely recommend the Mahana again!

Reviews.Title: “Mahana”
Reviews.Author: a9413
Reviews.Content: The hotel/Condo may not be the newest but it has a million $ view if you get an ocean front view room. Staffs are friendly and will help with all request. My first night, we got a 1 bedroom with attached kitchen 10 feet away from your bed. The had shaggy carpet and was a little too dusty for me and my gf. I asked the reception if we can get another room. She gave us a freaking amazing room with 1 bedroom 2 baths a living rm and a full kitchen. The pool is a little small but who cares when the ocean is just a few feet away. If you want five hotel, this is not for you. If you want a quiet, clean and beautiful view, this is for you. Advice: Don't book excursion thru expedia at the hotel. They're good but pricey. Go to Lahaina with 10min drive south of the hotel, there you'll find lotza tour vendors. Luau: We went to the one at the Hyatt. It was nice. They did dances from around the pacific. The food sux. Open bar though. The fire torch guy kept on dropping his batton. We heard that the old Lahaina luau was the best but it was booked up. Food: Expensive!!!!!......Don't buy anything from walmart. Buy everything from costco. Maui pineapples are super sweet. You have to try mama's fish house and kimo's, awsome food. Hana: Drive to Hana was dangerous. If you are not a good driver, don't do it. They said its the most beautiful drive, i don't think so. Save your time and enjoy the beach.

Reviews.Title: “MAHANA IS THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana August of 07. When we arrived the hotel was not full so they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom instead of a studio. The front desk was very pleasant and accomodating. The ocean view was beautiful. I don't know where else in Maui you can get that view and be so close to the ocean. The beaches were great. The beds were oh so comfortable. My husband and I will always return to the Mahana when visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover1236
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana 4/12/08-4/22/08. We booked through Royal Hawaii Condos which made me nervous at first because I had never used them before but everything was perfect. The staff was helpful and friendly. Overall, we were absolutely thrilled with our experience. We stayed in a one bedroom condo (room 1118) and it was BEAUTIFUL! I know the rooms are sometimes the luck of the draw with condos, but ours had granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, washer and dryer, a huge tiled shower, and updated decor. Not to mention the view!! We watched whales from the family room! Both the bedroom and family room have floor to ceiling windows that face the ocean so you constantly see sailboats, surfers, and wildlife. I woke up to see a rainbow over the ocean the first morning I was there. As for the rest of the Mahana, the pool and hot tub are gorgeous. They were just updated and look brand new. It may have been the time of year but the pool and hot tub were never crowded and there were always plenty of lawn chairs to choose from. We walked to the neighboring hotels a couple of times and noticed that their pools were really overcrowded. My husband and I are in our early 30's and thought we might miss some of the excitement the bigger, more crowded resorts offer, but we realized that we really loved the relaxing atmosphere of the Mahana. Since we had a full kitchen we usually ate breakfast in the room and then went out for dinner. Lahaina is right down the road and has great restaurants. I highly recommend the Mahana. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the ocean”
Reviews.Author: Danny007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the ResortQuest Mahana from April 12 to April 19, 2008. I booked this condo based on the reviews from Trip Advisor and have to say that I was not disappointed! We rented a Studio and got exaclty what we were expecting. It was a very cozy room with a full kichen, washer/dryer...everything that you need. Each condo has an amazing view on the ocean, a decent size lanai and most rooms have recently been renovated. We were hoping not to be on the 6th floor since some reviews said that the view was partially blocked by the palm trees...and we got a room on the 6th floor!!! We tried to change room but to no avail. However, the view was still spectacular, we could even observe humpback whales playing and feeding from our lanai! There is no restaurant nor bars in the hotel, however, there is a small coffee/smoothie bar opened during the day by the pool/jacuzzi area. The pool is kind of small but with a property right on the beach, we chose to swim in the ocean instead. Even though some reviews said that it was not recommended to swim in front of the hotel, we had no problems swimming right there. It is obviously not the best place to snorkel, but I snorkeled 50 metres from the beach and observed a variety of beautiful fish. However, I would recommend that you bring swimming shoes since it is a little rocky in front of the hotel. The beach goes for miles each side. We rented a car but there is a bus stop 5 minutes from the hotel that takes you to the Whalers Village and Lahaina. There is a little strip mall with a pizza place, a mexican restaurant, a Subway and a 24 hour grocery store 7-10 minute walk from the hotel. Other family members were travelling with us and some of them rented a one bedroom condo through VRBO web site and it was great . My wife and I will return at the ResortQuest Mahana but next time, we will book the condo through the VRBO web site. The big advantage is that you can actually see pictures from the owner and know exactly the condition that the condo is in, you might even be able to obtain a better price than by booking it with ResortQuest who manage 70% of the condos. The only negative thing we experienced during our stay is that it can be noisy during the day as they are building a big condo complex behind the Mahana. Otherwise, this is a great place with the best location!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Mahana”
Reviews.Author: smstevenson
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui the week of April 12th for a family wedding. Altogether there were about 21 people who traveled to Hawaii for the wedding and majority stayed at the Mahana. My family (my husband/me/15 yr son) were in Unit #107 and my inlaws were in Unit #106 -- ground floor. It was nice being able to walk to the lobby/pool area/front desk/Expedia (very nice having Expedia right at the hotel to book last minute activities) without worrying about an elevator but we lost some of the "view". Next time I would like a higher floor to get a better view of the ocean. It would have been nice to open the sliding glass doors with the screen and listen to the ocean waves all night but being on the 1st floor we didnt want to take the chance. Our rooms were clean and well maintained. We had a problem with our shower sliding glass door but maintenance came and fixed it right away. Maintenance did shut off water for 2 hours and they were doing work on the A/C system but we really were not inconvenienced since the work was done during the day and we were out. Internet connection wasnt that great, very slow and sometimes would not load at all. We were told to use the computer by the balcony . It was great having a kitchen well stocked with supplies and having a unit washer/dryer--I packed less clothes (although you had to pay for any additional Tide packets $1 per box). The pool area is smaller compared to other hotels but we really didnt use it that much-early morning, later at night.. You're mostly out in Maui enjoying tne sun, water, and sightseeing--for $287 night, it was perfect! You can use the hotel next door for restaurants--very close. My husband and father-in-law often walked to the shopping center for quick supplies early am--very close 10 min walk. Mahana was in a very convenient location for us--town of Lahaina short drive 20min and lots to do (restaurants, shopping, Atlantis Submarine, Hard Rock Cafe, Bubba, etc). It's about 45 min from the airport (shuttle cost $66) but we rented a car for the rest of the week. My son and I walked to Black Rock at Sheraton and it's not a 10-15 min walk, more like 45min or longer! But we stopped along the way at another hotel and had a great lunch at Castaway Cafe, rented snorkeling equipment and had a great time. For beginners in snorkeling (me), def go to Black Rock (the ocean waves are really rough when you're trying to snorkel for the first time). BR may be alittle crowded but its calmer water and you can really practice -- I actually swam at BR with a sea turtle!!! Our other activities included Aquarium (nice/small but if you have 2 hrs to spare which we did before the wedding its worth going); Luau at the Hyatt--wonderful food/drinks/show; Oahu--while we were in Hawaii we booked our 1-day flight thru Go Hawaiian (inter-island flights, $100 per person) and saw Pearl Harbor--I loved this trip--the tour of the Arizona, USS Missouri and the Bowfin was just terrific, I thoroughly enjoyed this day and highly recommend you make it a part of your trip. (I dont usually like to do history-type activities but this one is a must-see).. We also booked the Atlantis Submarine and Mauiscape Helicopter tours thru Expedia last minute (on Wed/Thurs to do on Friday). We did not get a chance to drive the Hana Road--Im told it takes almost a full day (5 1/2 hrs longer) and we just couldnt devote a whole day to it so we booked the Helicopter Ride which I loved.. First time in a helicopter and it was just fantastic to be in the clouds looking down at the volcano and the ocean. I thought it was too expensive to do but you know, you're in Hawaii, when will you get the chance again... We also booked with Blue Water Rafting 5 1/2 snorkeling trip -- highly highly recommend--it was awesome!!! the captain Jeff and tour guide Dante were just the best.. We felt like one big happy family even though we were all strangers!!! We stopped at 3 diff places to snorkel, saw a sea cave and spent time studying "rock formations" in the ocean.. Its a very fast raft trip and they warn you thats its not for pregnant woman or people with bad backs--you most def get wet on the boat going to/from the diff sites.. It's alot of fun though.. By mid-April, the whales are starting to leave for Alaska but Jeff thought he spotted one so although our tour was not a whale watching tour, he took the time to stop and look for it. We spotted a momma and baby whale.. All of a sudden the baby whale went under our raft, blew bubbles on the one side, turned around and came back under the raft, blowing more bubbles then swam off to join his mother.. Both whales then popped out of the water not far from our boat so we could see them perfectly. It all happened so fast.. Apparently it's rare that the whales come that close to the rafts and even more rare for them to blow bubbles so close. Our captain/Dante were just amazed, beyond words!!! lol They said we were "mugged" (when a whale comes close) and "bubble blasted" lol This was the best trip and highly recommended. The entire wedding party did the 2 1/2 hr whale watching/snorkeling tour and saw the same ones we did but at a much farther distance, calmer boat ride, and little time to snorkel. If you're looking for more excitement do the longer 5 1/2 tour. they take you to Molikini Crater/ front and back wall, Turrtle Town and the Kanaio coast.. I loved our trip--always wish you had more time (and money, Maui is not cheap.lol) but I think we accomplished majority of the activities. Next time, I would like to drive the Hana Road, more snorkeling and perhaps spend more time relaxing on the beach. April tends to be windy and it was very very windy esp at the beachfront Mahana resort. Would stay at the Mahana again--price was decent, close to restaurants and tours and shopping..

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: Gadgetbox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for just three days/nights at the beginning of April, 2008. Without a doubt, this hotel was a highlight of our stay. There was no way to be prepared for the view from our room - #1013. As soon as we opened the sliding glass door and stepped onto the lanai, we had a 180 degree panoramic view of the ocean- with Molokai and Lanai hanging out like old friends. We spent a lot more time on the lanai than expected- I ended up sleeping on the comfy patio lounge chair every night. Blissful. Whale watching from our lanai was equally as good - even late in the season, we were treated to dozens of whales breeching and enjoyed the calm sound of the waves breaking on the sand all hours of the day. I know I'm elaborating on the lanai- but we spent time searching for a better lanai in any of the hotels.... couldn't find ANY. This hotel is very special- with EVERY lanai having 100% privacy (no way to see any one else's lanai), and it was THE CLOSEST to the ocean in all of Maui. At least everywhere we looked in west and south Maui... what a treat. The pool scene was mostly kid-friendly, but the hot tub was a generous size, was empty often in the later evenings, and allowed for a lot of relaxing downtime after dinner. Parking was easy and fun- we were overachievers and out til late night many nights, and there was always a reasonable close spot to park in. Accomodations: A+ Staff: A+ ( we checked in 3 hours EARLY! Thanks Karen!) Cleanliness: A+ Overall: A++ -- would do it again in a heartbeat. Mahalo Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “Mahana awesome trip”
Reviews.Author: calgarytravel
Reviews.Content: I am so excited for you we had such an amazing time that we wanted to buy that condo!The fridge is full size and the kitchen has everything you need.Kona cofee on the lanai sounds like heaven right now. Star Market is across the street and its a full size grocery store so we never bothered with Walmart or Costco.We loved watching the sunset from our balcony so we would get salad from the salad bar at Star Market,some sort of meat or fish for the grill,bread cheese and wine.What a lovely way to end the day! If you are up for a nightcap the hotel next door (Kannapalli Shores I think)has a pool bar that is open until about 9pm.We went to bed early and got up early(totaly opposite of home!) We snorkeled almost everyday and it was so awesome!We swam with many turtles,saw an eel and an octopus and the many amazing fish of Maui.We did not bother with tours there was great sightings 100 yards from the hotel.The Dive shop (same parking lot as Star Market)is extremely helpful! Promise me you will do at least one breakfast out!This was our favorite:The Plantation House at Kapalua.Gorgeous views of the ocean and the world renown golf course.They have crab cake Benedict for $11!Need I say more?We went 3x! Whalers Village is fun for shopping and lunch.You can get there by walking on the beach (about 45 min.)not that easy in the sand since the incline is quite steep so good exercise.Good news is there is a $1 bus that will take you right back to the Mahana!Or you can drive it's only 5 min,we got lucky with free parking but be prepared to pay for parking.Check out KARIZA it's a kiosk in the middle of Whaler's Village.I lived in those wrap dresses so comfortable and pretty.They show you all the ways to wear them and give you a DVD too. Lahaina is fun town a 20 min drive away.My husband took surf lessons and loved it!He highly recommends Goofyfoot.I shopped that day and I highly recommend jewelry from local artists.You will see! Enjoy!And I would love to hear about you trip.Any more questions are welcome! I meant to drop you a note and now I realize that I just relived my trip.Thank you.So I guess I will copy and paste and post the review that I was procrastinating to do so. Aloah

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THE MAHANA”
Reviews.Author: Laurie23
Reviews.Content: This was our second time we stayed at the Mahana and I have to say we are going back in 2009. In 2007 and 2009 we booked through a private owner. This year we were there from March 22nd to April 2nd and stayed in Unit 815. It was wonderful. This is a 1 bedroom 2 bath condo. The Owners have kept this unit up very well. Very well supplied with all the essentials you should need or want while there. Snorkeling equipment, extra sheets, blankets, laundry detergent, etc. The kitchen had a full variety of spices, salt, pepper, paper towels, coffee, creamer, tea, even water and diet coke in the refrigerator when we arrived. Very clean, nice decor, and the view was unbelievable. We enjoyed sitting on the lanai watching the whales, sunsets, and just simply listening to the tide. The new whirlpool hot tub down in the pool area is awesome. They did a wonderful job. We had great weather. Our girls aged 13 and 14 had a wonderful time as well. Try the Atlantis Submarine, we enjoyed that very much as well as the surfing lessons in Lahaina. We did alot of snorkeling each day just South of the Mahana and it was great. We seen lots of creatures, fish etc. Down by Black Rock is one of the best places to snorkel. We also went out to Molokini and Turtle town on the Mahana Nai'a. What a wonderful Captain and crew work on this boat. We fished on the way out there and caught an Ono. We stopped and watched whales - they were very laid back and really showed us a good time. Will definintely do that again in 2009. The fish market just a little North of Mahana had a very good selection of fresh fish. We went there a few times and cooked out on the grills at the Mahana. I hear they are going to be putting in more grills back by the pool area again which will help. Alot of people like cooking out on the grills and it's a good time to meet alot of new people staying at the Mahana and their adventures on the Island. I miss the Mahana and cannot wait until we return next year. We have made the Mahana our annual vacation location. I also have to give a great applause to the Coffee Cart located by the pool. We enjoyed an Americano each morning and simply loved it. Good snacks too. We like the quite atmosphere the Mahana has to offer at night. We went down to the other big hotels by Leilani's and Whaler's Village but were happy to return to the Mahana. Just too busy for us at those other properties. I have stayed once at the Kaanapali Ali' - it was nice but just way too many people ALL THE TIME. We found the earlier in March you go the more Whales you will see. I give the Mahana a A+ - they have really done a good job keeping up with the grounds. See you April 2009. I would tell you about the Condo we were in back in 2007 - but it's so georgeous, we are finding it harder and harder to book with this owner. We will be in it in 2009. I missed out getting it for 2008 by a day. Mahalo everyone and hang loose.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: snooksmama
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful. Having the option to cook saved $$$. Great place to stay and see the island. Go to the Sheraton/Black Rock for great snorkeling...too rough for us in front of the Mahana...but we still loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but WINDY!”
Reviews.Author: Houstondoglover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over spring break. We booked through vrbo for a privately owned-condo and we got everything we expected. The view was spectacular and our condo was updated with granite and a great shower too! The folks checking us in were pleasant, but not overly so. The pool had been redone and there was a large wonderful hot tub. We went to the pool a few times, but then the WIND kicked up, and we couldn't stay down there. It was actually humorous - the pool towel just blew across the ground. We asked around, and evidently it is very windy at times of the year. That meant that the beach near us was also too windy. Therefore, we just went south to Kihei one day and near Whaler Village on another, and were fine. There were cranes in front of the condo for a new condo being built. We couldn't hear the noise inside - good soundproofing. The last time we were in Maui was during the summer and we didn't experience wind like this. Also, the traffic near Lahaina has increased and it crawls for about 20 minutes. There is a lot of construction and you see construction cones and those road barriers all over the place. It's easy to overlook it, however, when you are in Maui! We liked the location being near Kaanapali and Lahaina for meals. We also went north to Napali for dinner at the Sea House, which I heartily recommend for atmosphere and great food. We rode the Kaanapali zipline which was accessible from the golf shop just down the street. Great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Room at the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: ahhboc
Reviews.Content: This is my second review that I tried to post, hopefully it will be posted this time. We stayed at the Mahana from March 1 to March 5. We booked a one bedroom condo, and when we arrived we were given a studio condo. We called our travel agent and she was told that they overbooked the rooms so they downgraded us to a Studio thinking that we would not notice. We were moved to condo 1015. This condo was absolutely maginificant. The view was wonderful. I could not say enough about this condo. I just want people to beware of the room that you are getting. We never got an apology from the front desk. That was very disappointing. If we ever get back to Maui, I would definately stay in condo 1015. West Chester, PA

Reviews.Title: “UNIT1219 at the Mahana was a disgrace!”
Reviews.Author: heat1968
Reviews.Content: PLEASE read this entire review, you will be glad you did!! With respect to the Mahana, this review is only about the deplorable conditions of UNIT 1219, in what the owner calls the Penthouse Suite with authentic Hawaiian dÃ©cor! Make sure what is stated and/or pictured on any site that Peter, (I will leave last name anonymous) lists has RECENTLY been UPDATED! Iâ€™m living proof that you can get the Un luck of the draw booking through a private owner! After returning home Iâ€™ve read reviews of praise about the units at the Mahana, and a lot of them deserve that praise. Iâ€™ve stayed here on 3 previous occasions and have had awesome units each time! I even emailed the person from Elk Grove Ca who gave a good review of UNIT 1219 if they would be willing to give me insight on the conditions they experienced in 2006, and they did. THANK YOU! She replied telling me thatâ€™s why she left her email address, so that she could be honest if someone did email!! I booked through the VRBO site, and read the comments. Knowing they were old reviews, a lot can happen in a year if the owner does not take proper care, or in this case, the ownerâ€™s management Co who has been ripping him off! I normally read reviews with a grain of salt. Important to me is the accommodations! Mahana states wifi? We couldnâ€™t get any connection anywhere! On the top floor, we SHOULD have had the best reception right? Desk said, â€œ Have you tried the lanai, or out by the pool?â€�Câ€™monâ€¦..I donâ€™t go to Hawaii, and expect to sit by the pool to use my laptop Now on to the review: CONS We had to wash the towels before we could use them. I also double pillow cased my pillow, I saw how the extras, were full of slobber/sweating stains! Some of the things that need attention are not pictured. Here is just a sampling of the shabby conditions! Main bedroom: Light fixtures above the main bathroom sink were full of bugs (shows shabby house cleaning or infrequent) Loose ceiling light fixture in toilet area, loose faucet handle in shower. Guest bedroom: Stained curtains and luckily I had a safety pin, to pin them closed. I didnâ€™t even want to lay on the beds (btw husband and I had to sleep on TWIN beds) type of bedding was not listed in description. Couldnâ€™t put them together, a huge dresser was between. The box springs covering was ripped and hanging on floor, floor was filthy. No closet space here either, owner had 2 huge boxes stored in that one also. Living area: Ripped chair, other chairs just looked dirty, worn and very out dated. A lamp sits on top of a stereo??? TV sits on some huge antique buffet of some sort? Curtains are pinned up. A beautiful chandelier over the table is in desperate need of cleaning. Again, all floors were filthy! My feet were black 5 minutes upon arriving and that was BEFORE I went out on the lanai! (Outdated old patio furniture there too) Kitchen: Lots of dishes and utensils to use, but were just a mix match of stuff and when I opened the cabinets, again, we could tell no activity has been around there for awhile. In here also, one whole section of cabinet was stored with a bunch of junk! PROS The ONLY thing this place has going for it IS the view, but the Mahana has nothing but ocean view units anyway. This corner unit didnâ€™t give you any more view needed, than the other units! I called Peter when we returned home, and told him of the condition of his unit, in case he wasnâ€™t aware but sounded a little shocked at what I told him. Had it not been for the abundance of whales to watch, awesome whale watch tour and great weather, staying in this unit would have almost totally ruined my anniversary celebration! In my opinion private owners that do not keep up their units are hurting the reputation of the MAHANA! If we had not rented previously, and this was my first time at this hotel, we definitely would NOT be back! Oh one last note. I usually donâ€™t let a review about the staff sway my opinion. Wellâ€¦ I can say without a doubt someof the staff at the mahana the 5 days we stayed there were NOT particularly helpful, especially Karen, who seemed like she could care less. I hope this review will save another from a disastrous vacation in UNIT1219! Please feel free to email me at Heat1968@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Mahana Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: UGAPackers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana based on the reviews here on TripAdvisor and were not disappointed! We requested a room on a higher floor one day prior to arrival and got a wonderful renovated room on the top floor (1202)! We had total privacy, and could see whales frolicking from our room. It was just the right size for myself and my husband (studio) and the in-room washer and kitchen were fabulous. All amenities we needed were there, marble countertops, stone tiled shower, beautiful new furniture, dimmable lights throughout - it was wonderful. The pool is also very nice. It is small, but there was hardly ever anyone in it, and it's a fantastic pool for swimming with a 4 ft section, 6 ft. section, and a big 9 ft. section. I loved swimming in the heated pool, floating on my back and looking at the sky through the palms.....it was great. The property is really great and there is plenty of great space to relax by the beach. We will stay here again, as a couple, or in a larger room with family. This place is quiet and the location is great. We go out and about almost all day every day adventuring, so it was perfect for us - a beautiful haven to return to after a fun day in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maui and the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: Shermstress
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana 2/27/08 to 3/5/08 for our 16th wedding Anniversary and loved our stay there. We booked our stay through cheap tickets and originally were put in a condo unit on the sixth floor and requested one on a higher level because we had palm trees obstructing part of our view. Nothing was available for a couple of days, but the ladies at the front desk were very friendly and accommodating and even gave us a call when we were out and about to let us know when another room was available. When we returned to take a look at the other room which was three floors higher than the one we were in, we were so excited! Not only was the view spectacular, the best ocean front view Iâ€™ve ever seen, but the condo unit was beautiful. It was much more updated than the previous unit and was done in great taste. We were in room 913 the last part of our stay at the Mahana and I would recommend this unit to anyone! It was immaculate and had a very comfortable king size bed, tiled floors, granite counter tops, and a fully equipped kitchen. It had a very nice bathroom with a nice big walk-in river rock shower (no tub). It was so enjoyable to sit out on the lanai and eat our breakfast and have our morning coffee. We saw whales every day right out from the lanai. They were so fun to watch. We actually saw one of them breach the water and do a lot of tale slappingâ€¦so cool! It was so nice to come back to this lovely room every evening after our island exploring. One thing to note is they do provide dishwashing soap for the dishwasher and also one small box of laundry detergent (for one load) at no charge. If you need any more laundry soap they provide it for $1.00 a box at the front desk. I wish I had known this before doing my shopping, so hope this helps others. I canâ€™t wait to return to Maui and there is no doubt that we will return to the Mahana. A great place and very friendly accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: tarabrew
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other hotels in Maui, but this is the one that I will return to. The rooms were spacious; the staff was curtious and attentive; and the location was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved The Mahana!!!”
Reviews.Author: bebe1467
Reviews.Content: I booked through VRBO Room 804 1 bedroom 1 bath, I absolutley loved it! I didnt want to leave the view was breathtaking whales everywhere you looked. Very nice weather all week, The pool was not crowded at all very quiet, Only thing is cant really frolic in the water lots of coral in front but i didnt mind at all...

Reviews.Title: “perfect place”
Reviews.Author: jal58
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom condo through the property and stayed in room 609 Feb 16-23, 2008. Very nice in every way; gorgeous view from the lanai with whales visible to the naked eye in the bay. We had some problems with the washer/dryer and the bathroom but they were addressed very quickly to our satisfaction. The kitchen is very nice, bathrooms as well. The construction noise next door was only noticeable once we left the room. The beach is good for snorkeling but the entry to the ocean is tough because of rocks; just walk 20 yards in either direction for easier access, though. We hope to come back net year.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to the Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: jennalulu
Reviews.Content: Oh, I miss the Mahana! It was our first trip to Maui and to the Mahana, and what a stay we had. Booked directly with Resortquest, which I wouldn't do again (see my review on Kona by the Sea on Big Island for that explanation), but we got lucky with our unit #205 in the Molokai building. The views are incredible, and even though I had requested upper floors and were given second floor, the palm trees didn't detract from the views! I believe this unit is privately owned (not sure, but it had a guest book to write notes in), and could use a bit updating, especially in the master bath, but everything else was great. New LCD screen tvs, CD/radio, microwave, and pretty well stocked kitchen. Daily local newspaper as well, which we appreciated. As others have stated, the beach here is pretty steep, and not that great for swimming, but my husband did venture out with the snorkel gear and saw a few turtles and some other fish. The grassy area with chaise lounges is fantastic, and no sand in your shoes! The pool area is small, didn't go in, but did use the new jacuzzi, which seemed nice. The only bad thing I would comment on is the construction. We didn't notice the new condo building noise behind the Mahana, but there was loud tile cutting around the pool area every day, not sure what they are doing, but maybe finishing up a few areas that are on the outer edges of the new patio. Also, one or two of the units within the Molokai building were having some construction work done on them, and it could get very loud while they were doing demolition on the outside tiles. This didn't seem to be a problem for the many people lounging on the grass, but it got irritating for me and my husband, so we moved down a ways to get away from it. I would have been extremely loud if you were next door to that! I didn't notice if this was happening in the Lanai building, but I can't imagine that other properties aren't having some sort of construction going on too. The area seems to be growing fast! We would go back here in a second and would stay in this unit! Miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: grm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana from February 5 to 14th in Room 708. While nearly all of the reviews are accurate., we would disagree in one respectâ€”you are better off renting from a private owner. The Resort Quest Front desk and Concierge are pretty much worthless. Not a problemâ€”just ignore them. I looked around at other facilities and other Mahana units. I will rent again from Kathy Sheehan via vrbo.com. (Kathy has two other units for rent at the Mahana) The complex is closer to the beach than any you will find. The beach is simply uninhabited. Forget about the construction as it is nearly done. Besides that, it is refreshing to see a complex that is well maintained and shows pride of ownership. Once you get to the Mahana you could do it without a car. There is, however, plenty of free parking. Abundant low traffic jogging areas, a grocery store, deli, fish market and everything else you need is about a five minute walk. There is a shuttle to Lahaina. The pool is small. I would describe the age group as 45+. There were well minded children. The whales in February were outstanding. Unit 708 is fantastic. (All units have ceiling to floor windows) The unit has a full kitchen, king size bed, new washer and dryer and a full kitchen. Virtually every pot, pan utensil, blender, coffee pot, toaster and gadget you could imagine is there. I am a cook. Nothing is missing! Actually, I would call Unit 408 unbelievable. We will re-rent from Kathy Sheehan in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana was everything we hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: lovemaui08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ResortQuest Mahana Feb 3-8, 2008 and stayed in rm 912. The room was updated, well equipped and clean...but the ocean view was the spectacular part!! There was some construction going on in the pool area, but it was not a problem. The Mahana is in the perfect location to explore, we walked everywhere (but we did have a rented car for longer distance excursions!) and found great restaurants and shops. We are planning to return next year. We would book an extra day next time to avoid the noon checkout, with the only flight to Vancouver being at 945pm. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the carpeted units at all costs”
Reviews.Author: dlcuster
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you what we loved: the incredible views (you could see whales from the bathroom sink, and just about everywhere from the condo); the location of the property, extremely quiet, the lanai, kitchen was fully stocked and roomy, the sheets and pillow cases were very nice. You truly are ocean front and that makes up for a lot--doesn't quite make up for the carpeting, but almost. Let me tell you what we hated: the carpeting in our unit was disgusting. No one should have carpeting in a tropical setting. We were told we were "upgraded" to a unit with two bathrooms, but one of the bathroom doors was locked because the bathroom needed repair. That is not an upgrade to two bathrooms, that's an upgrade to a locked bathroom door. The bedspread was old, ugly and faded. Very dated design. Neutral: not thrilled with the size of the pool area, but it was okay. The brand new hot tub needs some serious adjustments on the jets. We have a hot tub at home and were surprised at the force of the jets, and not in a good way. The spray would go into your ears, eyes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views”
Reviews.Author: infineon2004
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 bedroom unit directly from the owner, and the condo had everything we needed for a wonderful vacation. We spent 9 days watching the whales from our lanai, and even had a pod of dolphins swim by one morning. Snorkeling just south of the condo can be excellent, and if it's the right time of the year you can actually hear the whales sing. The front office staff were very helpful, and the new jacuzzi was a welcome break after a day full of snorkeling and hiking. Renting directly from the owners seems the way to go, our condo was recently remodeled with granite countertops and new floor coverings. If you are looking for all the amenities and crowds that go with a mega-resort, go elsewhere. If you want a truly oceanfront condo, a quiet resort and a very relaxing vacation, the Mahana might be perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: ktstravels
Reviews.Content: The Mahana far exceeded our expectations. We booked a studio through ResortQuest and received #812. The condo was beautiful- nice tile work, granite countertops and the best view ever. We got in late the first evening. I was so full of anticipation that I couldnâ€™t sleep the first nightâ€¦kept waking up every half hour to look out the window, but couldnâ€™t see anything. Boy was I impressed around 6:30am when I could finally see the water and just how close we were to it. Our lanai was wonderful- the perfect place to relax, have a drink and watch the whales splashing around. We found the front desk staff and concierge very helpful- always willing to make suggestions for restaurants and give directions.
