The pool area was nice and the hot tub construction was finished the day we arrived. There was a great coffee/snack stand near the pool- I had lattes several mornings. The condo was in a great location- only 10 minutes from Lahaina and close to great beaches. If you arrive at night, hereâ€™s a tip- when you see the Star Market, youâ€™ll be making the next immediate left. Our favorite restaurants were Aloha Mixed Plate and the Gazebo Restaurant at Napili Shores. We ate at both of them twice. The Gazebo Restaurant has the best white chocolate macadamia nut pancakes. The only con about the Mahana is not really their fault- there is a new condo complex going in just south of it. None of the noise bothered us, but when weâ€™d go to wait for the elevators you could hear and see itâ€¦I could see how this might annoy more sensitive travelers. With that said, the Mahana is not the only resort/condo with construction going on near it. Might be hard to escape it completely. We certainly hope to stay at the Mahana again in the future. We would not hesitate to recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views at the Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: bingo3
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband (50/52) and my parents (69) were at the Mahana January 12-19 and stayed in unit 1109, rented through owner. I went that route because I wanted to make sure I could see the room online that I was getting and also, their rates were very reasonable for a peak time. Some other 2 bedrooms were much more. Some of those may have granite counters and plasma TV's, but that is not important enough to me, for a week of vacation, to pay a lot extra. Our room was VERY spacious, approximately 1400 Sq. feet (don't know exact measurements). The master bedroom had a king bed, two bedside tables, closet, dresser and TV. There was a large picture window/sliding door to the lanai. The bathroom had a separate toilet and shower. The water pressure was excellent. There was a washer/dryer combo between the bathroom and bedroom with a linen closet. There was another large closet with iron, board, vacumn and other items. We also left a styrofoam cooler. Hopefully, others will use it and leave it as well. There was a hairdryer, but I always take my own. We could hear the ocean waves every night, even though we were all the way up to the 11th floor. Very soothing! The second bedroom had two twin beds and faced the mountains, also an awesome view. There was a TV in there and dresser, bedside tables. The bathroom had a tub/shower combo. The shower and toilet were also separate from the sink area. There was a linen closet and another closet. It also held beach chairs, boogie board, tennis racket and balls, fins, beach umbrella, and some other things. There was an ample supply of towels in each linen closet and they left 6 large beach towels for the 4 of us. There was pretty much any needed item in the kitchen for cooking. We cooked all breakfasts there and a couple evening meals. Made sandwiches, etc. There was dishwasher powder provided, as well as liquid hand soap in the kitchen and baths. Bar soap as well. You will need to bring shampoos. We took laundry detergent, but I saw small sized boxes at the ABC store, which is right up the same Rd. as the Mahana (Lower H.) on the left, just a few blocks. There is a nice table and chairs in the dining area. The living area is very spacious and has a sofa bed. We did not use that, so I cannot comment on it. The best feature of this room was the large picture window of course. You looked right out at the ocean, it was awesome! There was also a door to the lanai. There was a round table and 5 chairs on the lanai. Nice to eat out there and watch the whales blow! There was a TV/VCR/DVD in there as well as CD player. We did not use any of those items. In the drawers are books, several travel guides on Maui, games, cassette tapes, videos, etc. We were able to watch the whales daily. They actually came up pretty close one day and we could watch with the naked eye. Most days, we could see them blow, but needed binoculars to actually see the whale good. We also had surfers out almost daily, fun to watch. One day, there were about 7 wind kite surfers. We did not swim, because for us personally, the water was too cool this time of year. We are from the south and the winter Maui temps, were about like our spring temps. here, water a little too cold for us. A wetsuit probably would alleviate the issue. Other people were in the water down to the right and left of us, especially kids! As has been mentioned in many reviews, so should not be a complaint, swimming right in front of the condo is not advisable because of coral, however, better areas are only a few steps away in either direction. There is a pool and jacuzzi (which is new, I have picture but for some reason, can't find it for this review and don't want to start all over. I can email to anyone who asks). I didn't see too many using the pool while there. Probably used more in the true summer months. It was also windy many of our days (also a product of Maui winters) which kept things cool. people were using the jacuzzi the days it was open. There were plenty of lounge chairs at the pool area and down on the lawn near the beach. It was nice to lie out in the sun, not too hot, though the sun would burn (sunscreen!). You could find shady spots too. After you leave the condo lot & pass two other condo entrances, the shopping center is right across the street. There is a Star market (expensive), pizza/ice cream place, subway, Maui Dive Shop, and other shops. Travel down that road to the left for ABC and other restaurants, shops. You don't have to go too far. If you go back out to the main road, HWY 30 and go right, about 5 minutes away is Whalers Village, turn right on Kaanapali Parkway (I think is the name??), village is on the left, with shopping. Many resorts down here as well. If you stay on HWY 30, about 10 minutes away is Lahaina Cannery Mall with ABC and Safeway, a less expensive grocery alternative. You can fill out a safeway card at the customer service desk in less than 5 minutes. We found them much cheaper than Star. We did not go to wal-mart until we were headed back to the airport (mother wanted pillow for flight). We noticed some of their items, such as the macadamia candies, were more expensive. It was also a madhouse of people in there. We waited in line about 30 minutes. We drove from the Mahana up to Kapalua Bay, awesome waves and the surfers were really putting on a show for us. This bay is calm in the summer months for snorkeling, swimming, etc. Not this time of year!! We also drove the road to Hana. Took bonine first and thankful of that. It is a hairy road and can be stressful to drive, but the views are incredible and worth it at least one time. We also stopped at the Garden of Eden. It was nice, but not as many flowers as we expected to see, maybe because it is winter. Nice peacocks though! We also did the Pacific Whale Foundation Discovery Whale watch and it was awesome! Whales came right up to and under the boat. I wish I had taken a video camera. It was more than worth the money and I wish now we had gone a second time. Lahaina was nice. We found the most reasonable parking down Dickenson St. The first day, we parked in a lot next to PWF shop and it was $15.00 no matter how short/long you were there. The Dickenson lot was based on the hours you were parking. All were self-service lots. You put money/card in machine and then put ticket in your window. We did hear (and saw police out one day) that anyone parked too long in free spots got a $75.00 ticket. The most free parking we saw was for 3 hours. Also attended the Old Lahaina Luau, also incredible. Much more professional and much nicer setting than the one we attended elsewhere several years ago. They do not give discounts & sell out every night, so that tells you something. It was well worth it. We were disappointed with the ReefDancer, saw absolutely nothing. Now that I have come home and read reviews, this seems to be a common occurance. There's no indication in their advertising that visibility may be too poor and only rainchecks are given. May be better in summer, I don't know. They should close down in winter I personally think. Unless they just like taking people's money. The Mahana was a great condo. We did not experience any problems with the front desk staff at check-in or check-out, even though we were not ResortQuest guests, so to speak. We could not use their pool towels (had our own in room) and there was no daily maid service, which did not concern me. I prefer privacy and not worrying about getting out of the room, etc. The owners were very easy to deal with, answered all emails promptly and answered any questions. I would not hesitate to stay here again. For those who book, please realize this is a smaller condo complex, not a hotel resort, large condo complex, etc. There is no restaurant. There is someone in the lobby area with a cart (alcoholic drinks, drinks, breakfast foods, snakcs, etc.). This condo does have something many others do not and that is direct ocean front rooms and awesome ocean views. I did not see too many places that had ALL oceanfront views like this one. The condo complex two doors down was large, had nice pool area with slide and falls, but only a few rooms actually front the beach and many don't even have a view of it. Most have view of that nice pool or garden areas. I'll take the beach view over that nice pool any day, but I realize everyone has their own preferences. Just realize, if that is what you enjoy, and you also enjoy nightlife, pampering, restaurants, etc., the Mahana is not the best choice for you. If you do want peace and quiet, relaxation, awesome ocean views, cocktails on your own lanai, in private, watching that beautiful sunset or the whales, then the Mahana is for you! Feel free to email with questions, Aloha! Debbie

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...Still Felt At Home”
Reviews.Author: stlsportsgirl
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui for a week and getting married on the island. So we needed a lot of room to put things and we wanted a kitchen so we didn't have to eat out every meal. The condo was nice and clean and the people were very helpful. We even had a mishap and all they could do was apologize. My husband loved that they had grills to use. The beach was small but well kept. The ocean directly in front of the condos were a snorklers paradise, but you had to hike about 100 yards to get to a beach where you could swim at with your bare feet due to the reef.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT place!”
Reviews.Author: mgdriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Jan. 12-19 and couldn't have been happier! Beautiful view (beach, whales, surfers, sunset) and a beautiful room--full kitchen, living room, bedroom. A little noisy during the day--construction going on directly across from it on the land side, but everything else here was just great. Not a full-service hotel (no restaurant or bar) but the fact that it is right on the beach and was a good-sized condo made up for it (stores just a minute away). Excellent place to stay for a week-long trip. And sitting on the lanai whale-watching--WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean view”
Reviews.Author: katandkel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana from Jan.2nd to the 8th. Husband, me and two 20 year old daughters. We asked for a higher level condo, but Malia wouldn't budge on changing our room. After looking at our room we were very happy. She gave us room 406, which was a one bedroom, one bath. There was also a pull out couch and murphy bed in the wall. We did not get the marble countertops or high grade improvements in our room, but we were satisfied with everything. The view and sound of ocean waves was to die for. The pool was finshed, but the jacuzzi was still under construction on Tues. They were also still making alot of noise on the pool deck, on some side areas. The Mahana has incredible close ocean views, but we had to walk about 200 yards south to get to a nice swimming area where there was no coral. This condo would of got 5 stars from my family ,except for the inability to swim out front. This condo is about a 20 min walk to Black Rock, so we could not walk over with our beach chairs and snorkeling equipment. There are about 15 parking spaces by the Sheraton , so forget about getting one. To end this, we got an excellent price on an amazing ocean front condo, but next time we will stay at the Royal Lahaina again, which is within walking distance to all the shops at Whalers village, restaurants, and Black Rock.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous condo”
Reviews.Author: sigalachic
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Mahana, we were a little disappointed when we saw the lobby. The desk is pretty small, and the lobby itself is not particularly luxurious...a stone floor, a large somewhat dry Christmas tree....tape and some plastic partitions because there is evidently some construction going on, and they are also constructing a jacuzzi immediately outside by the pool. Some lights had been strung haphazardly around some poles outside. The grounds are pretty, with no lawn or grass but some really beautiful big trees. Our 2 bedroom condo was on the 12th floor.....1209. We walked in and it was like a palace...i couldn't believe it. Marble or some kind of stone floors throughout. Gorgeous furnishings, granite counters in kitchen and baths. Top of the line kitchen and bath, 2 plasma TVs....and folks....you are RIGHT on the ocean. Some mornings I was able to see a few whales frolicking from the lanai. The beds were HEAVEN...like sleeping on a cloud. On the downside, it was extremely windy there. All night the wind literally whistled under the front door. The Maui mountains are outside one bedroom, and fog and rain constantly rolled in from that direction. The beach was usually too windy to walk, and the water had lots of whitecaps by afternoon. We asked around and discovered that that area has the worst weather at that time of year due to the location. (When we went into Lahaina the weather was great.) To be fair, I heard they had been having very weird weather.....they had had heavy rains and flooding the week before we arrived. We couldn't really use the pool because workmen were all over, working on the jacuzzi. In spite of the lovely condo, I don't know if i would stay there again.....the wind was a deal breaker for me. Maybe earlier in the season would be a better time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: JTPCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We booked this thru an agent and we were a little concerned once reading some of the reviews about the condtion of some of the units. We were extremely pleased when we walked into unit # 218. this unit was completely remodeled and upgraded. All new appliances, tile throughout, beautiful furniture and a view that would be hard to beat! We would recommend to anyone, if you could get a unit equal to this one. Sitting on the lanai watching the whales was great! The staff could use some attention. They just didn't seem to want to be here. The Girls at the travel desk were helpful and friendly. We will make this a must place to stay when in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo Bad Weather”
Reviews.Author: lobsta1
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Mahana during that terrible week of rain and wind. During the storm we did lose power for a while off and on. We booked with resort quest which was a blessing because the condo got flooded during the storm and our rental car was hit by a falling tree in the parking lot. Resort quest was able to take care of our needs. We spoke to another couple that had booked through a private owner and the condo got flooded and the toilet overflowed and they went down to the front desk and was told that they could not help them. Yes the pool renovations were not relaxing but they offered us a fruit basket for the inconvience. that they did not have to do. Over all the Week was a disaster relating to weather, but The Mahana was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: DaisyPa
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Mahana from Dec 14-23,2007. We were very satisfied with the room (408)--service was great--views awesome. Booked several tours through the girls with Expedia and were NOT disappointed. I'd recommend this place to anyone who wants the laid back atmosphere. We didn't feel rushed or crowded in any way. Most of the time we had our choice of lounge chairs and space on the beach. The pool was available to use but they were still working on the spa (only disappointment). Having a rental car we could get wherever we wanted to go relatively easy. We would definately return to the Mahana again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Condo”
Reviews.Author: NKona
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 506 12/19 - 12/31. This unit is very nice, all tile floors, top notch applainces and very recently updated. If unobstructed ocean view are important to you, I'd suggest trying for a room above the 6th floor as there is a row of palm trees betwenn the building and the beach. The pool area is small and was a bit of a disappointment to our 12yr old ( especailly by comparison to some of the other properties we saw ) . The hot tub and saunas remain under construction as of 12/31 but looks like they might be done in the next two to three weeks. The 'by Christmas' estimate for completion for this project left here by managemnet on the 19th was, IMO, wildly optimistic. We tried the breakfast buffed two doors north at the Ka'anapali Beach Club and would advise to avoid the place at all cost unless you like cold sausage and bacon, undercooked eggs and long lines.

Reviews.Title: “We love The Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: lagirl55
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Mahana over Xmas 2007 and thoroughly enjoyed it. Our unit was beautifully updated with marble floors, granite counters and stainless appliances. Maid service was outstanding, even on Xmas Day! Even better--the maid knew our names and greeted us by name every day. We were very impressed. If there was a big storm and water damage in November, we saw no evidence of it. We ate breakfast on the lanai every day and watched the whales out in the bay. I would recommend The Mahana to anyone looking for a pleasant, relaxing vacation on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising treat!”
Reviews.Author: AvonTravler
Reviews.Content: We booked only a few months before the Christmas Crush and the Mahana was the best we could do on such short notice. We usually stay in Wailea (which we still prefer), but both the Mahana and West Maui in general were both pleasant surprises. With respect to the Mahana, and frankly any condo rental on the islands, you MUST work through a reputable condo agent or unit owner directly so that you'll know exactly what you are getting. As a previous reviewer pointed out, if you book through the management company that runs the resort, you take the luck of the draw. Our unit was a one bedroom which was clean. The furnishings and bath/kitchen were not stellar, but frankly who really cares. I believe all of the units at the Mahana are oceanfront and have simply amazing views. The pool is rather small for a two building 12 story complex, but just walk another 10 feet and you'll be on the beach. The beach itself isn't the best - not very wide / fair amount of debris (rocks, branches, etc.), but the snorkeling just south of Mahana was VERY good - you can explore there for days. Overall we enjoyed our time at the Mahana and from a price / value perspective, you really can't beat it - a 1 bedroom oceanfront unit ran around $280 a night. The oceanfront condos in Wailea will run you twice that (at least).

Reviews.Title: “Great View @ Inflated Prices”
Reviews.Author: PDXreviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed nine nights ($455 per night) in #301 at Mahana in mid-December. Here are the highights and lowlights: Pros: Excellent views from our corner unit of the ocean. We saw whales from our lanai! Free wireless internet access Easy free parking Walking distance to grocery store Delightful hula show in lobby on Sunday afternoon Nicely updated showers in the unit AC Stackable washer/dryer Cons: Unit distinctly smelled like cat urine Unit backs up to the elevators which can be heard through the wall of the second bedroom Outdated Easy Bake oven in kitchen Pool area construction noise was unavoidable in this unit because they were drilling through concrete and brick two floors down directly below second bedroom--this was a daily ongoing issue Construction crew used a tile cutter and other equipment poolside--noisy! Tools and supplies for the various construction projects (fence-building, hot tub tiling, bathroom construction ) were left out in orange-coned areas We asked at the front desk about getting permission to use their sister hotel pool facilities down the beach and were told that since there was water in the pool, we had to use the Mahana for "liability reasons." We found that ironic because the real liability seemed to be the tile cutter, screw drivers, and debris left out on the pool deck 24 hours a day. The pool area is and continues to be a working construction zone, not a place to relax, enjoy the pool, and listen to the sounds of the ocean. We had read other tripadvisor reviews since booking this accommodation through Chasin' Rainbows Realty back in August and thought surely the pool rennovations would be complete by Christmas. From the looks of it, they are nowhere near done. We realize that we planned our trip during the most expensive time of the year to visit Maui, but at $455 per night, we were really hoping for a classier unit and a peaceful pool setting. The chances of us staying at Mahana on a future trip to Maui are slim. One last comment: because we booked our unit through a travel agent/rental agency, the front desk staff told us we were technically not Resort Quest guests and were not able to partake in the daily activities such as lei-making, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Two Ways to Book at the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: Howareya
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mahana Dec 2-9, 2007 during what is described in the last management response as "once every 30 years rain". The last review was very negative, so I felt compelled to share my experience. There are two ways to book at the Mahana and one is better than the other in my opinion. The Mahana is comprised of two towers of privately owned condos, all oceanfront. ResortQuest operates the property, but the rooms are all individually owned (I believe), so that leads to drastically different styles and renovations in each unit. Some units are awesome, with stainless steel appliances and granite kitchens/bathrooms, while other units sound old, outdated and in need of an upgrade. So how do you get around this? Well, if you book through ResortQuest directly, you get the luck of the draw. Whatever happens to be open, you get. It could be a nice newly renovated unit or it could be a terrible old unit (see last review). My recommendation is to go around ResortQuest and book directly through the owner. When you go this route, you typically get to see photos of that exact unit and you can be sure that it meets your satisfaction before you book. I booked a unit through [-]. There are a number of websites like this and any of them work. This way I knew I was getting room 814 and it was newly renovated. The room was great! Sparkling clean, new appliances and great views. Avoid disapointment and book direct! ResortQuest probably won't like me making this recommendation, but it's there own fault for offering a product that leaves so many people unhappy. The property is great. Right on the beach, but far enough away from Kaanapali's main hotels, so it isn't overly busy. The pool renovations are definitely still ongoing, but the pool is open and can be used. The showers and the hot tub are still under construction. There are nice new Weber BBQs for guests to use in the garden and lots of free parking. DO NOT think of this property as a hotel though, as I think the last reviewer did and was disapointed. There are no bell hops or room service, just your own condo for the week. If that is ok by you, you'll have a great time! If not, you are better off looking at the Sheraton, Westin or Hyatt. The Mahana is great, just do it right and make sure you have realistic expectations. You'll have an awesome time!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: MadisonMaizie
Reviews.Content: The Mahana is our favorite. We have stayed there twice and are returning in July. We have always rented from an owner and have had very nice, well maintained, and updated units for a great price. There is nothing like the view and being lulled to sleep at night by the waves. This is not a resort, its a condo, and the pool area is just okay, although the hot tub will be a great addition. We just love it.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana not very good.”
Reviews.Author: 230North
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana based on a lot of the reviews on this site. I would NOT recommend this place to anyone. Other than being beachfront with nice views, this place has nothing else going for it. We stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of December. First day we were given a choice of 2 rooms to look at. Neither were what we expected, but that was all they had. We went through a lot of hassle to change rooms the next day and got a bit better, but still not very good room. All 3 we checked out smelled of mildew. They had flooding in most units from "the storm". Virtually every unit with carpet had multiple fans in them trying to dry things out. There were many other people we spoke to as well trying to change their rooms. Some are apparently very nice. We booked 7 months in advance only to be told that it doesn't matter when you book, you get what ever is available when you check in. Pool area under construction, crappy rooms, no other amenities on the property. Spend a little more money and book somewhere else. I will never return to the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “great views! good price and location”
Reviews.Author: willy91342
Reviews.Content: Well the rooms you stay in are different as they are decorated by the owners. The first day we got there we were put on the lower level 1st floor next to a automatic sliding door!! NO! We had no view of the ocean and we had to hear the door slide whenever someone passed by. The staff are great, we asked them if we can change rooms and they checked the availability and they said the next day they have 3 rooms free that I can take a look at. Awesome! I chose my room being on one of the top floors and stayed the remaining 5 nights and what a sight and room it was.. Thanks Mahana for the Service!! I ended up buying a timeshare next door at the Kanaapali beach club!! I love maui

Reviews.Title: “Love the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: Kapika
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana from Nov.10-16th and had a wonderful stay. We had stayed at the Mahana on our trip last August as well and loved the room views etc. so much had to return to this property! We were in unit #407 and it was great! Last year we had stayed in a Studio and this time a one bedroom and the extra room makes such a difference! This unit was really unique and had a lot of artistic flair to it. There were some dolphins on the walls (Paint and plaster), birds on the ceiling, lots of mirrors, nice furnishings, koa and wicker furniture and a beautiful stained glass window/door in the bedroom going out to the Lanai. The bed even had a mirror over top of the bed! The unit had alot of room or at least compared to the studio we had last time which we loved but it was a little small. The lanai's are huge and the views are breathtaking, you can't get a better view and it's so nice to go to sleep at night listening to the crashing of the waves. Our check in went smoothly and the lady that checked us in (Not sure what her name was) but she was very nice and very helpful through out our trip, all the staff we encountered there was. The pool at that time was under renovations and we hadn't knowen about that so they gave us a nice gift basket. No big deal about the pool though as the ocean is right there and if you want to just lounge in the sun they have the lounge chair/beds right out front which we used alot just like last time. It's so handy to have in the rooms a washer/dryer and a kitchen as well. The TV and Stereo were both good and the unit was clean. The beach/ocean in front of the property is so beautiful and there was some excellant snorkeling to be had if you walk for a few minutes to get away from the rocky part etc. We even seen a honu! So as always our stay at the Mahana was great and if someone is looking for an all-inclusive type spot with stores and restaurants etc. on site this wouldn't be the spot for you but if you are looking for a relaxing and beautiful spot it definitely is! We liked having the kitchen and there are stores and restaurants really close by, if you are in Maui most likely you will have rented a vehicle anyways (If you are going and wondering if you should or not, you definitely should rent one) So next time we come back to Maui more than likely will be back at the Mahana, you just can't stay away from a view etc. like that and the two times now we have been there have been great!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and View”
Reviews.Author: rdshah
Reviews.Content: Ok website first is [--] We loved this place. It was a condo with 2 b and 2b....nice kitchen etc...best was the view...one side ocean and one side mountain ...we were on 8th floor ...anything above 5th floor is best... I loved my stay and would definately recommend. Also on both view we saw rainbows on different days...that was best too...It seems in dec till apr one can see whales too ... Its little pricy but since we were 2 couples and we shared and also got 4th night free it was not too expensive Definately recommend

Reviews.Title: “Mahana is O.K”
Reviews.Author: SunnySkiesToronto
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Mahana, Nov 10-17, 2007. The hotel was booked as a package with Air Canada Vacations. After reading all of the rave reviews, I picked this property. We were pretty disappointed once we checked in. I think if you know of a good unit first hand and are able to secure that specific room, then the Mahana may be a 5-star experience for you. If you leave it to luck of the draw, you may be extremely disappointed with the unit that you get stuck with. We stayed in a studio on the 5th floor that had a murphy bed. The bed was extremely uncomfortable - no support. The calming sounds of the ocean were definitely not enough to cure our sleepless nights and sore backs. The unit also had some mold in the laundry closet which made the unit smell musty and feel dirty. Thanks to the helpful front desk staff, we were able to switch to a unit on the 9th floor which had a real bed and was much cleaner. But the actual unit itself was fairly outdated and not nearly as nice as some of the pictures posted of other units. The ocean view aside, I would rate the room itself as a 2.5 star hotel. I would agree with everyone else about the view - it is amazing. But it's not enough to make you forget about cleanliness and being comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful choice!”
Reviews.Author: skoc50
Reviews.Content: What a great place to call home away from home! We stayed for 5 nights in Oct. 2007 (5th night free) in a studio while my brother, sister & their spouses stayed in a 2-bedroom 2 bath suite. Their's was beautifully updated which made me a little dissapointed since mine wasn't. Mine was clean, just was in need of some updates. I requested a room change & was given an updated studio the next day. Then I felt on even keel with the rest of my family. The views from the rooms (all of them, since all are beachfront) was to die for. I am not a beach person but I just couldn't get enough of sitting out on the lanai & enjoying the views. Being lulled to sleep at night by the crashing waves was truly enjoyable. The pool was being renovated while we were there. I thought about changing to a different resort but was glad I didn't. They gave us a 10% discount for our troubles + a goody basket upon arrival, which I felt was fair compensation. We still had access to the pool at their sister property, the RQ Kaanapali Shores, which was within walking distance just a couple of doors down. When the pool is finished, I'm sure it will be fine. Nothing fancy, but fine for most people who aren't going to be in the pool that much while in Maui anyway. If you're looking for a "resort feel" this is not the place. It is too small for that & lacking in resort amenities. But if you want a quiet "home away from home feel", book the RQ Mahana. If you don't like the unit you get, you can always ask for a change which the friendly people at the front desk will gladly do for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amsab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married in Maui in November. We stayed at the Mahana in room 515 for five nights. The condo was beautifully decorated, was very clean, and had a breathtaking view of the ocean. It truly was our home away from home. The washer and dryer in the unit and the fully functioning kitchen were very handy. The only draw back to the property is that there is coral reef directly in front of the hotel for about 150 yards in either direction, so we couldn't just step out of the hotel to go swimming. Not a big deal, though, as we had a car and just drove a few miles down to Kanapali Beach. I will stay here again the next time I am in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: OmahagirlOmaha
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the awesome view that the Mahana had to offer. On the flip side, however, our suite was somewhat of a disappointment. Although it was fairly clean, the bathroom and kitchen, especially, needed updating. The wallpaper was in sad shape and the tub was disgusting. The bedroom wasn't bad although the ceiling fan had a cord running on the ceiling and down the wall to be plugged in. The dresser had a handle missing and the drawers were hard to open. The mirror was not on the wall but inside the closet on the floor. Also a disappointment was the fact that the swimming pool was closed during our stay although we were warned about that before we arrived so we appreciated the notice. If we return to Maui, we won't be staying at the Mahana. Perhaps it was just our unit that wasn't up to par as other people have spoke highly of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana does not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: genderella
Reviews.Content: What can I say that I haven't said before? We returned to The Mahana the last week of September. This was our first time to visit Maui in the fall and it was beautiful! We last visited in June 2005. The hotel pool was closed for renovation but seriously now, who goes to Maui to swim in a pool?! We have decided that when we return to Maui, The Mahana is our place. It's affordable, provides the comforts from home, has spectacular mountain and ocean views! When you hear "oceanfront" this IS oceanfront. It was a plus to see that smoking within so many feet of an open window or door is now prohibited - it allowed many wonderful nights of keeping the doors open and listening to the sound of the crashing waves. We love The Mahana and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Poolgirl36
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous vacation at the Mahana! I booked a 1 bedroom/ 1 bath condo last February to make sure I was able to get what I wanted. A few weeks before we were scheduled to arrive, I received a phone call from the Mahana about the pool closing. I was very disappointed, but Georgina ended up giving us a discount that made up for it. I was able to use a pool a few resorts down the beach and that was fine. I was also surprised at how warm the ocean was. It looks like the Mahana pool will be lovely when they are finished with the re-tiling in November. We had wonderful weather and good rates, which is a good reason to vacation in October. However, it may also be a bad time for encountering construction problems. We were given condo # 916 at first. It is a lovely condo with granite counters and a comfy king size bed. We were happy there until the neighbor upstairs began a construction project and we could not take the pounding. We requested a move and were given # 1005. This condo is absolutely wonderful; even better than 916. It has granite counters, stainless steel appliances, two bathrooms, and a great king sized bed. The bathroom off of the bedroom has a large two person shower and big showerheads. The views from both condos were breathtaking. We loved sitting on the lanai until around noon when it would get a bit hot. We appreciated the air conditioning in the afternoon. Then, after watching a beautiful sunset, it cools down and we would open the doors and sleep listening to the waves. The Mahana is a clean, quiet place with a pleasant staff and plenty of free parking. I loved having a washer and dryer too, that was so convenient! We walked down to the neighboring resorts for a drink by the pool, to play in the waves, and once for dinner. We checked out the area by the Whalers Village as well. The resorts there look nice, the walkway by the ocean is lovely, and there are plenty of restaurants, but.....it is soooo congested!! My husband and I were happy to get back to the Mahana. We ate some of our meals in the condo and this made our trip much less expensive. We did a little shopping at the Star market nearby (which is a full size grocery store), and some at the Safeway in Lahaina (we applied for a card there which only took a few minutes). Safeway is a little less expensive I think. We also rented DVD's for some nights at the place near the Star market. I guess you can shop for groceries at the Costco near the airport, but we didn't have a membership and that would have been $52. We want to return to the Mahana soon, we miss it! Restaurants: We ate at Bubba Gumps, Kimo's and Pioneer Inn in Lahaina. Breakfast was good at Pioneer Inn. Bubba Gumps was fun, but we really liked the outdoor seating at Kimo's. We liked the food at both places. Tried Lelani's in the Whalers Village. I liked my dinner (fish) but my husband didn't care for his prime rib at all. We watched the cliff diving ceremony at the Sheraton from the Lagoon Bar. That was nice but you could get an even better view down at the beach. Keep in mind that restaurants validate the parking slips but it is for 3 hours only. We also ate at Charley's in Paia a few times. I liked the breakfast, and my husband just loved the tuna sandwich (lunch menu only). We visited the Maui Ocean Center and enjoyed that, especially the walk-through tank with the sharks and the jellyfish tank. We ate lunch at the restaurant there, but can't recommend it because the flies drove us crazy. Shopping/ dress: Lahaina is a fun little town to visit, but if you see the cruise ship on the water it will be crowded! The ship was there on a Thursday. Lahaina has a great selection of sun dresses ("island dresses")!. Most of them were $20 - $30. Hilo Hattie's has a selection that the other stores don't have. I bought one and wore it to the Old Lahaina Luau. You can wear shorts there, but it was fun to wear the dress and many of the women did so (I suggest packing a strapless bra in case you find a dress that needs one). Women also wear island dresses out shopping and at many of the restaurants we went to. I picked up some dresses for gifts too. Luau: The Old Lahaina Luau was great (including the food). You get a beautiful lei, a great selection of food, and an open bar (try the "lava flow"!), in addition to the show. A couple at our table was in Maui visiting friends who lived there and the friends recommended this luau. Other places of interest: Iao Valley is beautiful, easy to get to, and free (we did not end up needing bug spray), and we did the "road to Hana". About this - we are from the midwest and are not used to driving in mountains. The scenery was gorgeous, but the driving was hideous. I don't usually get car sick, but I was feeling sick only 10 miles into the drive when we stopped at the Garden of Eden. The garden is lovely, and I grabbed a diet 7up from the cooler that I was glad we brought. There are so many turns and one lane bridges! It is slow going, but the locals drive like crazy people. A teenager came around a corner in our lane and almost hit us head on. Later, a local in a pick up truck did almost the same thing. We wanted to stop at the Pua'a Ka'a State Park for the waterfalls and the restrooms, but it was all fenced off when we got there. I don't know why. The Ke' anae Peninsula is an amazing sight. The banana bread at the stand there is very good too! We pushed on to the black sand beach at Wai'anapanapa State Park. Fabulous scenery and a wonderful park. We were glad that we had sandwiches and drinks in our cooler to eat at the picnic tables. I wanted so much to go to Ohe'o Gulch (7 Sacred Pools), but we couldn't take any more of that road! I really wished we didn't have to drive it back again. We encountered a big truck on the drive back and my husband, along with two cars behind us, had to back up along a stretch of that curving road with only a short stone wall at the edge of the cliff to allow the truck through. We were so happy to reach Ho'opika Beach on the way back. The waves were huge and we sat watching the expert windsurfers for two hours to de-stress. We would recommend doing this if the windsufers are out! Also, if you can handle the road it would be nice to take your time for stops and not worry about driving back the same day. When I looked into it, a lot of places in Hana had a two night minimum and no air conditioning so I didn't book them. We did see lots of Roberts Hawaii vans around. Maybe taking the tour or booking a room in Hana would have been better than driving it ourselves in one day.

Reviews.Title: “What great place to stay in West Maui”
Reviews.Author: bgraboski
Reviews.Content: What a great place the Mahana is for a weeklong stay in West Maui. We had done our research before booking this property...and we not disappointed in our selection at all. The condo's are tucked in off the main road on a quite cul-de-sac. Check in was simple and we were given a welcome basket due to the pool constuction (which ResortQuest had let us know about ahead of time). Our studio condo was in Lanai wing on the 7th floor. Our unit was very nice and recently upgraded. Nothing "high end" but most everything was new we had everything you could need. The oceanfront views from the lanai are amazing. The grounds, although small, are well kept. The community grills are brand new big Weber grills and there are a few picnic tables if you want to eat outside. The pool area was under renovation when we were there but we are not there for the pool (in two weeks we never stepped foot in a pool). The other common areas are nicely decorated and not tacky in the least. As most people know, the area directly in front of the condos are not suitable for swimming, a three minute walk in either direction gets you away from the rocks. There are multiple free wireless networks available and there are pay networks and pay computers in the lobby for those needing their internet fix. The people at the front desk were always pleasant and helpful. The location is great as there is a grocery store across the street with a few restuarnats mixed in. There is also a fish market just up the road. Whalers village is a 5 mintue drive and Lahaina maybe 8 minutes away. We booked the condo using the Enterainment Book 50% off rate (yes you have to show a valid card) and got a tremendous deal. I would book at this property again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon at the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: heather1ee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana for our honeymoon upon the recommendation of a friend who had gone in July. We were SO happy with our decision. Nothing beats the ocean view and the sounds of the waves crashing against the shore. We were in room 712...nicely upgraded unit with white cabinets and granite in the kitchen. Although you can't go in the water right in front of the hotel a short stroll down the beach brings you to an area good for swimming. We were close to everything, (sorry for anything I misspell!!) such as Kanapalli and Lahaina. There is a Star Market, Subway, a few shops, a pizza place and Nachos Grande (which had good food) right before you reach the hotel, which was nice. I definitely recommend the Mahana, as well as kayaking/snorkling with Maui Eco Tours, horseback riding with Ironwood Ranch, lunch at Hula Grill (Whaler's Village), parasailing with UFO Parasails, the luau at the Sheraton, lunch at Fred's in Kihea as well as shopping at the little open air market. Seeing the crater was amazing, too...we drove to the top, amazing sight, but cold, so bring long sleeves and wear jeans! I would suggest passing on the winery...very small, but the drive out there was pretty. Maui was amazing! :)

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: kfio
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here! We booked a studio room and it was perfect for just the two of us. The entire condo was updated and the washer/dryer were a big plus - there is nothing like fresh beach towels! We really didn't use the pool or beach area since we were exploring the island during the day but loved our lanai for the sunsets and cool evenings. The hotel is close to Kaanapali and Lahaina but also convenient to Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “Magical experience at the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: soulmateLA
Reviews.Content: We booked an anniversary vacation through David at Royal Hawaiian Condos. He was very professional and took note of our special requests; bed size, preferred floor levels, etc. We were very impressed with the online pictures of the condo, especially the floor to ceiling, wall-to-wall windows overlooking the ocean, but very seldom find do we find reality exceeding our wildest expectations. When we walked in the door it was like walking into an upscale island paradise. Everything, from the furniture to the bed linen to the granite counters in the kitchen, was tastefully but richly done. Falling asleep and waking up to the sound of the ocean was heaven on earth and the sunsets on the Lanai were so magical that we still go online to watch them on the Mahana webcam at least twice a week. There are no hotel ameneties at the Mahana but that made it much more like home to us and nearby hotels are a short beach stroll away for breakfast or drinks. Speaking of beaches, we found a nice quiet one another short walk from our hotel and snorkeled the morning away. We took advantage of the two-for-one lua coupon and chose the one at the Hyatt. It was wonderful, as was the Ulalena show in Lahaina. You must chek it out if you are in Maui. We rented a car and explored Maui at our leisure but whatever we did we always found ourselves anxious to return "home" at the end of the day to enjoy our sunset and the beautiful grounds. Having kona coffee(thoughtfully provided to us each morning.........the full kitchen was amazing), relaxing on the lanai, star-filled nigths, feeling rich in spirit, and grateful for having found the Mahana. We can't wait to return. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: tnshsms
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just last week and it was great! The room was updated and comfy. I was unsure about the pull down bed, but it was easy to sleep on. The oceanfront view was amazing! I plan to stay here and to tell all my friends to stay here when we return. The pool is out of service until Nov of 07 but they gave us a nice food basket for the troubles. The hotel was close to a supermarket which was nice for breakfast and the pizza place down from the supermarket was good. All and all this was a great place to stay. As far as the problem with getting a reservation, I made mine thru Blue Hawaii vacations, however, I know several other people who have done it over the phone and on the internet without problems. I am not sure what happened with the previous poster.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SBLbs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I called the Mahana home for 10 wonderful days. The grounds were beautiful as was our unit. While I donâ€™t recommend the Mahana for young active adults looking for a restaurant and pool bar, I was great for us to come back to the quiet serenity each night after our busy day of checking out the island. They greeted us with a gift basket and a 10% discount to offset the lack of using the pool while it was down for upgrades. They also arranged for us to use the pool down 3 doors which we did on several occasions. As everyone talks of the view was to die for, each unit is right on the oceans edge. We loved having our morning coffee and island fresh fruit each morning on our balcony. The help was very good to us, especially Larisa. Thanks for a once in a life time vacation. We will definitely try and get back ASAP. If you need snorkel gear try the Maui Dive Shop right across the street, they too were great to us.

Reviews.Title: “Can't take reservations?”
Reviews.Author: carmodygal
Reviews.Content: Tried to call and make a reservation from all these great reviews only to be yelled at told i could not get any rates until check in and the room I reserved may not be the room i get......then she hung up on me. Guess I wont be staying here. Next........

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: dburgess5
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, very helpfull staff, and very friendly. would stay with them again...

Reviews.Title: “The Best experience you could hope for”
Reviews.Author: DEIDRE07
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from Maui where we had a 3 nights stay at the Mahana, Sept 11th, 12th, & 13 th. This was a special occassion for for us as we travelled from Adelaide / Australia to join our friends , who came from Henderson Nevada. From the moment we arrived at the Mahana , everything was wonderful. Karen on the front reception was so polite and welcoming . We had booked a 2bed, 2 bath condo, and we were given one one the 15th floor,in a corner room. The view was spectacular, as was the entire appartement. Both bedrooms had wonderful ammenities, and the entire decore was top class. Granite kitchen, and both bathrooms as well. Appliances were stainless steel. 3 flat screen t.v.'s,huge lanai , which was accessible from bedroom and living room also. All furnishings, inside and on the lanai were excellent. Internet access, was great, and sound equipment also. The view from the Mahana is as wonderful as you could find anywhere. We used the barbecue , and pool areas , and had a lovely walk on the beach. There were nearby restaurants, and shops, and a market to buy some supplies. Lahaina was only a 10 min drive away. I can not say enough good things about the condo, view , service , and overall experience at the Mahana. Our stay there will be one of my most memorable experiences of Maui. My husband, and our friends also feel this way. I would recommend this to anyone who may be considering staying there, however , put in a request for an updated room when booking. ADELAIDE AUSTRALIA Sept 30th 2007

Reviews.Title: “best vacation ever ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: mahola
Reviews.Content: My husband and I choose to stay at the mahana at Kaanepali for our 25th Wedding anniversary and it was awesome1 The view was breathtaking and the condo was beautiful! Everything it in was up to date and it was very clean. It was soo relaxing falling asleep to the sound of the ocean waves. The staff at the Mahana was very helpful . Your should try the mixed plate restaurant in Lahaina the prices were less than $10 per person and the food was very good plus you sit outside with a ocean view you can only imagine at sunset. Kimo's is more upscale but very romantic and the food is delicious. The only bad thing about our vacation was having to come back home, I miss Maui !

Reviews.Title: “Better than good!”
Reviews.Author: Ladygriff
Reviews.Content: Before booking the Mahana, we read the many reviews and were leary of getting an outdated room. Not the case, we were on the third floor and were happy with the room. The only negative was a slight musty odor in the flivingroom furniture. We attributed this to the location, i.e. being on the oceanfront. The condo was beautifully decorated with a pull down bed from a huge wall unit, unusual but it worked. The location gives an air of private because it is set back quite a bit from the main road, very quite, and all oceanfront. The sound of the waves was mesmerizing. Supermarket close by, and fully equipped kitchen allowed for breakfast in the room. Bubba Gumps In neighboring Lahaina was very good, Kimo's was delicious and the shopping choices on Front Street in Lahaina was extraordinary, especially if jewelry is your passion. Lots of selection which means you can make deals. Don't be shy about suggesting a counterprice, it's expected due to the competition. Shop and eat, enjoy going back to your condo for the roar of the waves in the evening. Truly, our stay at the Mahana was paradise. We would recommend the Manaha, just be careful to get an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana is the best”
Reviews.Author: cocoabear01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple, recently traveled to Maui to celebrate our first anniversary. We chose the Mahana after reading several reviews from various sites. I must admit that pictures don't do justice for the beauty and location of the Mahana. We had a two bedroom, two bathroom condo for our week stay. I would highly recommend calling ahead of time and requesting a newly remolded condo and placement on a higher floor(although all of the rooms are ocean front) Not sure how the other condos looked, but ours was more than we expected. Spacious living room, flat screen television, full kitchen with supplies, washer/dryer, dishwasher, balcony, etc. All of this for the same price of a hotel room! The hotel staff was average, and housekeeping services are provided. Be sure to ask for extra towels however as they seem to provide the bare minimal. As for the condition of the condo, no complaints here. But as I said before, this may be due to my request of a newly remolded condo. There are a few cons however to the Mahana. There are no on-site restaurants. This isn't a big problem however because mostly everyone rents a car and there are a couple of restaurants located in the hotels next door if you chose to dine there. I would recommend going to a grocery store and purchasing a few breakfast items to save money. There is a grocery store Star Market located across the street, but be warned that prices in Hawaii are much higher. Also, the crowd at the Mahana is a little bit "older" so don't expect a party scene at night. This was perfect for us however since we were celebrating our anniversary. We simply took a 15 minute drive to Lahania's Front Street at night for the bar scene. Also, the beach in front of the Mahana is not suitable for swimming(it's very rocky). This also was not a problem because we simply walked 3 yards down Kaanapali Beach to a strip in front of the next hotel that was perfect. There is one pool at the Mahana also that was average. It never appeared crowded, as I believe everyone opted for swimming in the ocean. The Mahana also had a couple of activities during the week which is why some people chose a big hotel chain. There was "Learning to Hula" and a movie showing poolside. Overall I would highly recommend the Mahana if you are traveling for romance or with a group/family. The quality of the Mahana is well worth the price, as my husband and I plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my gosh”
Reviews.Author: brumleyr
Reviews.Content: This is a half of a lime throw away from hitting the ocean from your lanai. First thing you need to realize is that this will be by far the best place you will stay. Other resorts offer nice pools, bars and shops. But that garden/ocean view no good, Quick walk down the beach, you are there using all those pools, not once where we asked "who are you?" my 7 year old was loving it. My list to you: 10 days would have been nice, did 7, 1: Reserve a mid siz car online, I paid $98 to upgrade at Alamo ($18 more online) all wheel drive mid SUV.(all the off roads we found have gates). 2: Stop at Costco or Kmart on the way. Mortonâ€™s tri tip, water, beer... get enough food and drinks for the fridge in the room 3: Check in, if not satisfied with room, ask nicely to see another. (All rooms are owned by someone, some rooms are very very nice, same room next door to you just plain.) 4: Go out and talk to one of the many activity booths, to get deep discount on snorkel trips, hana trip, heli trips... they sign you up to do a 90 min time share, donâ€™t worry, Just do not ask questions, we spent 60 min at one, had a nice lunch, and my daughter swam in their pool. Saved about $120 on snorkel day trip for 4 (Pride of Maui was a nice boat) 5: Get snorkel gear in the town of Lahaina ($9 week at snorkel bobs) just south of Mahana, we snorkeled every evening right out in front of resort. 6: We used BBQ most days itâ€™s nice. 7: Tour to hana then heli back. 8: Get underwater case for your digital camera before you go. Have Fun room 1007 is the best

Reviews.Title: “Great view but lousy room”
Reviews.Author: aknm62
Reviews.Content: There was only 1 person at the front desk to help guests. They needed at least one other person. They gave us the wrong type of room that we had previously booked. They gave us a 1 bd, 1 ba and we should have had the 1 bd, 2 bath. When we got the new room it was really like a downgrade from the original room. Our room was not updated at all. Our friends had a really nice room. They were not organized as far as the activities were concerned. we signed up for a lei making class and when we showed up we were told that the instructor did not come in. The best thing about the timeshare was the view! when we sat on the lanai, it felt like we were on a cruise. We were that close to the ocean!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana!!!”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoLishie
Reviews.Content: The Mahana surpassed our expectations from the moment we stepped foot into our room. The views were unbeatable, true "oceanfront" lodging. The private balcony is a plus for private sunsets, sunrises and meals. You can do lots of private things on the balcony! The service at the front desk was great. Great location on the island, easy parking. market, shaved ice, snorkel renting is 5 min walk away. The full kitchen was a great way to save money on food and have more intimate meals without having to worry about getting ready to go out. Easy drive to Lahaina for dining/bars. the beach/ocean right infront of resort isn't the best, but better beaches are a short drive away. Loved our stay and the Mahana and will definitly stay there again when we go back!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: maui_lovers_07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana August 22nd to September 1st. Our first impression was great...the grounds are neat and the lobby is pretty, especially with the pool and ocean view in the background. We were treated very nicely by all the staff. Our travel agent did specify however, that we wanted a newly renovated room. We weren't given one and didn't like the condo we were shown. We checked another one, which wasn't renovated either and were turned off (we were spending 10 days at the Mahana and wanted to love it). Third time is the charm, as they say. The third and final condo we looked at was lovely and we grabbed it before they changed their minds (814). The staff were very good about letting us look at other condos, so don't settle for something you are uncomfortable in. The beach wasn't the greatest, but we drove to several different ones. The Mahana is an excellent base to come back to. Great location, good pool for the kids and nice and quiet with incredible views. We looked at other oceanfront condos before booking, but the ocean views included views of surrounding condos which we didn't want...at the Mahana everyone gets an 'ocean only view ' with a very private lanai...that's the biggest reason we chose the Mahana. Having a pretty condo to stay in was icing on the cake!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at the Mahana!!”
Reviews.Author: cmingee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for 6 nights and 7 days. We had a most wonderful experience for our stay. It was the best of both worlds in that you had maid service like a hotel along with a full kitchen and washer & dryer like a condo. We stayed in a room on the 3rd floor that had a newer kitchen, and a fantastic view of the water. The sunsets were awesome!! We took advantage of the BBQ in the pool area and swam in the pool daily. Although the beach directly in front of the property wasn't good for swimming, just about 100 yards on either side of the Mahana had great swimming. The staff was extremely welcoming and accomodating to our towel requests, and the house keeping staff was professional and accomodating as well. We took advantage of the Expedia activities desk to book out excursions and Luau. The staff was knowledgeble and helpful and guided us toward the activities that were appropriate for our family. I highly recommend the parasailing at 800', my kids loved it. There is a shopping center a short walk away from the Mahana, and there you can but your groceries, T-shirts, rent a movie, or have a margarita. I honestly can't say anything negative about the Mahana, and if I am ever to travel to Maui in the future, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ZeusMonster
Reviews.Content: My DH and I stayed at the Mahana from Aug. 24th thru the 30th for the second leg of our honeymoon. Due to an early flight, arriving at 9:00 am, we decided to head on over to the Mahana just to find out where it was and see if there was a possibility the room was available - and it was! The front desk was very nice (as they always were throughout our visit) about letting us check in early. The lobby was very cozy looking with a view straight out to the pool & ocean - oh how breathtaking! We stayed on the 5th floor in a comfy studio condo. The condo living quarters were a bit dated, carpet looked old and worn, furniture & pictures were very old as well - but, the kitchen & bathroom all had updated cabinetry, countertops, faucets, etc. Then, there was the view....oh how magnificent! DH was in heaven listening to the ocean waves every night (I would prefer silence, but hey, we're at the beach)! There's a couple of minor issues: first, our dishwasher didn't work, but a morning visit to the front desk had it repaired when we returned that afternoon - no problem! Secondly, the lighting in the bathroom was not great - the sink is quite small & the counterspace is very deep (long distance to the mirror). So, if you decided to apply makeup, you'd practically have to sit on the sink & lean on in there to make sure you don't come out looking like a clown. Oh, and something else the Mahana can't be faulted for....I despise those oh so nasty critters - cockroaches (I lived in the South for 20 years, so I'm quite familiar with them!). And they do have them at the Mahana (a dead one in the sliding glass door frame definitely proved that!) So, I had a little tension sometimes, worrying about if they were going to come visit us, but they never did - thank goodness! So, needless to say, that was something I needlessly stressed about.! The Mahana is in a great location, close to stores (Star Market just down the road), coffee (Java Jazz down the road as well), restaurants (you're offered a dining "card" to go to neighboring condo restaurants & charge it to your room, which we didn't partake & downtown Lahaina is about a 10 min. drive), etc. A fun thing we liked to do every night was walk thru the main lobby entrance & lobby itself and look for geckos. One night we even saw about 4 or 5 on the entrance ceiling! Plus, many more inside on the ceilings. I felt better that they were there, dining on my dreadful enemies - insects :) All in all, it was a great stay. Our condo was very comfy, offered everything an apartment would, was close to everything in West Maui and had good customer service. We would definitely stay here again (maybe in a more updated place tho!) Mahalo to the Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: vinnychase
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 6th floor at the ResortQuest Mahana in mid August for 7 nights. Our room was decent, but was in need of some renovations. The pluses to the Mahana are its right off the beach, (you can hear the waves crashing outside your room at night) & its relatively close (with a car) to shopping & restaurants. One of the BIG negatives I had with the place was I could hear the people staying in the ROOM ABOVE ME. Not good if you are a light sleeper or want to relax in quiet. Also, the condo's are right off the beach, but you must walk about 5min in either direction of the hotel to get somewhere swim-able because of rocks in the water in front of the hotel. Pool is pretty small. Front desk is hit & miss. One time I had to call 3 times for a wake up call because no one answered. In all, my stay there was just ok, I expected more for the money, or at least concrete floors in between units. Tip - If you decide to do the road to Hana, do it yourself. The tour guides & hotel people want you to take their $130 tours & make it out to be a harder drive than it is. The hardest part is the one lane bridges. Itâ€™s an experience, if you can handle a 2hr drive up a mountain one way, you'll be able to do this.

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana is Great!”
Reviews.Author: alaminvancouver
Reviews.Content: Dear fellow travellers, We just returned from 9 days at this beautiful resort. Every room faces the ocean so don't be concerned about getting a great view: You Will! The front desk was very friendly and helpful The rooms vary in decor and finish so do as we did and ask to see different rooms if the one you're in does not hit the mark. Some of the rooms are in need of updating whilst others are just great. Rent a car to really enjoy Maui. The drive to Hana is amazing but a very difficult trip so be wary if anyone is prone to car sickness. You will always have your hotel as a place to look forward to coming back Beware some of the reviews posted in the local magazines about the restaurants as some of them were certainly hyped up. The beach right in front of the hotel is so so, but all you have to do is go 50 feet past the hotel on the left for the real thing. If there was any negative (minor) it would be the fairly strong tradewinds but don't let this deter you!

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: babs6987
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 6 night stay at the Mahana, unit 817 in the Lanai building. Nothing but good things to say. Check in was a snap. There's handy luggage carts by the elevators to use to haul your stuff up. The condo we were in was just fine. Furnishings and decor were a little on the "hotelish" style, but that's ok. Plenty of storage space and dressers, armoires. Having the full kitchen and laundry was great. There's free high speed wireless internet in the units, although the signal could get a little flaky at times. Parking at Mahana is also free. Be sure to stock up on food at the Costco in Kahului. The Star Market across the street is fine to pick up small items and condiments, but be prepared for sticker shock. The view, I can't say enough about. We sat on our lanai alot and just soaked in the view and the sound of the waves. They have a breakfast orientation for those wanting help scheduling activities. We are pretty self directed so if you're like that, just pick up the latest copy of Maui Revealed and book your trips on-line, usually you get a discount that way. The grounds are very well kept. There are plenty of lounges either by the pool or on the grassy area in front of both towers. Be sure to bring or buy a beach towel, there is not a towel service by the pool. Two barbecues are available for grilling on. My only real complaint about the Mahana is that I wish they had more afternoon shade - we are pretty fair skinned, so we had to constantly move around to find some shade. It would be nice if they had some palapas or umbrellas around for those seeking shade. The beach in front of the Mahana is extremely rocky which makes for great sound of pounding waves, but no one went in the water there. There's excellent swimming about 100 yards south and pretty darn good snorkeling about 100 yards further. It's a bit of a hike to Black Rock. My husband hiked down one morning to snorkel there and he said it took about 20 minutes each way, but the snorkeling is fantastic there. There's a Maui Dive Shop in the little shopping center across the street from the Mahana's driveway. You can rent snorkel gear and boogie boards there. This was our second trip to Maui and we didn't schedule as many activities as we did on our first trip. This part of Kaanapali is much more relaxed than when we stayed south of Black Rock on our first trip. Still its handy to go down to Whaler's Village for shopping and dining. For activities, I do highly recommend the Four Winds II snorkel trip to Molokini which leaves from Ma'alea Harbor. This trip was fantastic, and if you're prone to getting sea-sick, this is probably one of the better boats to be on because its bigger than alot of the other catamarans. And they do a good bbq lunch instead of the cold deli lunches that you get on some of the smaller boats. Just be sure you take some bonine or dramamine before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Overall it was OK”
Reviews.Author: Alexbytes
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights in a one bedroom oceanfront condo on the 10th floor. The view was not of coastline but of full frontal ocean. Waves breaking on the shore: very nice. The unit we stayed in hadn't been remodeled in a long time (if ever). It was clean and everything was in good working order but it wasn't first class by any means. The property doesn't have a restaurant or food service of any kind. The pool is average size (not heated) and there was no jacuzzi. The beach right in front of the hotel, although beautiful to look at was not swimmer friendly, as a matter of fact you couldn't swim right in front of the resort except by walking about 150 yards or more to either side, there was coral that made walking in impossible (they said you could do it with water shoes but we didn't try it). Quite an inconvenience. The elevators gave out once during our stay and we had to go up and down 10 flights of stairs, the staff didn't seem very concerned when it happened: I wondered if they had any disabled guests staying there that had to use the stairs that evening. The elevators were running when we got up the next morning. We used the activities desk to book all our activities (luau, helicopter flight, magic/dinner show, etc.), the lady was very nice and I think we got a good deal on our purchases: the desk is owned by Expedia (as are a lot of activities desks in Lahaina). Overall our experience was OK. We were a family of four (son aged 6 and daughter aged 2) and we had a marvelous time on our vacation, but it was the things we did away from the Mahana that made it wonderful, not the property itself. I would not stay there again nor recommend it, I think for the money we spent we could have stayed at the Whaler (near Whaler's Village) and have been on a better beach and closer to the action (restaurants, shops, etc). If you get a good deal on the room, go for it: but definitely shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ltdmcc
Reviews.Content: This was absolutly heaven! on the beach, nice pool - views of Lanai and Moloki - beautiful sunsets - room comfortable, clean and very nice! had a 1 bedroom unit. we hated to leave - front desk always helpful for any requests. check in/check out quick and easy! Would recommend for anyone wanting a wonderful place to stay on Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great condo but......”
Reviews.Author: Capucine7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for 2 weeks at the end of February. The condo which we had rented once before was great and the view from the 10th floor is outstanding. However, there was banging and drilling from construction on the sea side of the building (2 lanais being retiled and repairs to the facade of the building) for most of the 2 weeks we were there. It should be noted that in 2005, during our first visit, workers were repairing the mountain side of the building. I truly fail to understand why they choose to do this work during high season, considering that this is when the rates are the highest. In addition, the pool was mostly occupied by 5 or 6 noisy children (belonging to one family) jumping and splashing around with no adult supervision thus making it impossible for us to use. . We complained to the people in charge but to no avail. Although it is clearly indicated that children are not allowed in the pool without adult supervision, no one seemed to care. Good all around condo but the building is very poorly managed. It is very disapointing to travel 12 to 14 hours from the east coast for a vacation where you cannot relax and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo46
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Hawaiian vacation. This property (ResortQuest Mahana at Kaanapali) was definately NOT what we expected. 1) After we checked in and went to our room, our door would not open. We contacted the front desk and were told how to jiggle the door to get it to open. 2) Kitchen floor and linai floor were flithy. Called housekeeping who immediately came and mopped the floor. 3) Garbage disposal did not work. Called maintenance and they immediately came and fixed it. 4) Bugs in the bathroom. 5) Alarm clock in the bedroom did not work. Tried to get wake-up call with automated program on the hotel phone system. Also was broken. Had to directly call the front desk to get a wake-up call. 6) Things were missing from the kitchen unit (small measuring cups, top to broiler pan, plates from dish set). 7) Large stains all over the carpet in both bedroom and living room. All of these units are privately owned so some have been renovated and some have not. Different decor in each unit depending upon owner taste/budget. On the upside, these condos are RIGHT on the beach. Couldn't build it any closer. Hotel staff was helpful and did attend to our issues in a timely manner. Other units may be beautiful, but our room definately needed some work. Rooms are expensive for what you get. We bought an Entertainment Book to get a discount at this hotel. We would not stay at this condo unit again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely mahvelous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Imelda L
Reviews.Content: I have been lurking behind these Trip Advisor reviews for the last few years for world travel advice but have never written a review until now. Our group of 11 family members stayed here in late July for a week. We had stayed at this property 12 years ago as part of a package and loved the Mahana then. Imagine our surprise when we arrived---remodeled lobby which was beautifully done. Check in was fast, friendly and efficient. Larissa at the front desk has to be commended --- she's the epitome of service. And upon arrival in to our units (4 ), we were all delighted at how nice and tasteful all the units have been remodeled --- granite countertops, travertine floors. The views are breathtaking and hearing the lapping of the ocean waves from the lanai and bedroom is wonderful---the very same reasons we chose to stay at this property again. The secluded location of the hotel is also a plus unlike the nearby properties ---somewhat noisy and boisterous. The surroundings were well kept and maintained. The proximity to the supermarket and local eateries was also a plus. On our first day, everyone agreed we shouldn't wait another 12 years to come back to this hotel. And sure enough just last night on our post vacation family dinner, we decided to go back next year. Also decided not to post the unit # we stayed in as we're afraid of the possible competition in securing same units, although I have heard from the housekeeping staff that almost all the units have been remodeled. Can't wait to go back to see those rainbows (quite a number of them ---mountain and ocean side), hear the lapping of the waves, watch the sunsets, get mesmerized by the blue vastness of the ocean and simply just relax, enjoy and soak in the true Hawaiian feeling. Mahalo and Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “This really is paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: sunnycalifgirl
Reviews.Content: Initially we were placed in a condo on the bottom floor #108 when we had asked for a condo higher with a queen or king bed. We walked in and I was disappointed, the decor was really dated and the room smelled really musty. The front desk gave me several other condo's to look at but they all smelled the same to me. I guess I have a very sensitive nose cause my husband and son didn't smell anything but it was enough of a smell to be really distracting to me. The bed although a full ended up being quite comfortable. The next morning we woke up and went outside and noticed they were cleaning the condo next door #107, I went in there and noticed that there was no smell. Realized it has a tile floor and figured out that the musty smell was most likely from water that had seeped into the carpet over the years. The kitchen was great and the furniture while similar in style to 108 was newer and smelled fresher. The bedroom also had a nice sized king. We went to the front and they changed us to that condo, no hassle at all. Ended up loving being on the bottom floor. The other condo did not have a lock on the screen door and one of the things I was looking forward to was being lulled to sleep by the ocean. 107 had a lock and really it seems to be generally safe anyways. Loved this condo!!! Would stay here again in a heartbeat. I personally don't need all the hoopla off a over priced resort . Worth the money. Very relaxing. My boys loved the snorkling in the front. Bring water shoes, they came in handy. We did the snorkling at Molokini, we did the 2 hour one and frankly that was more than enough for us. I don't know how anyone does the 5 hour one but everyone is different. My boys thought the snorkling in front of our condo was better. We had a very relaxing time and recommend this condo 110% . If you are unhappy they do their best to make your experience a happy one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Condo with a beautiful ocean view”
Reviews.Author: Justmyexperience
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights during our 11 day trip to Maui. This was the first leg of our vacation. We also stayed in Hana and Makawao. We had a studio. All rooms are ocean front thus we had an ocean view. The room was nicely decorated and we had a queen size bed. The unit was well maintained and updated. I believe we were in 710. The bed was adequate but not as comfortable as I would like. There was no restaurant in the Mahana. The ocean view was amazing. The waves got so loud that we had to close our windows at night.
