Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommended to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of paradise”
Reviews.Author: Frbill92
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at this beautiful condo--property in the heart of Kaanapali. The room was beautiful and tastefully decorated and the lanai looked out on the ocean. Both the living room and the bedroom had sliding door access to the lanai. The condo was clean and beautifully decorated. The pool area was average and the ocean in the area did not lend itself for any water sports. But it was just beautiful to sit and experience the scenery and the fabulous sunsets. There are no restaurants on property. That wasn't a problem since I cooked in the condo and a grocery store was just across the road. There were also small restaurants in that complex. The location was great. The biggest problem is trying to find it. The location is not clearly marked and I drove around for more than 30 minutes trying to find it. In general it was one of the best places I have stayed in my many visits to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent is an understatement”
Reviews.Author: DPOZ
Reviews.Content: The Mahana more then exceeded our expectations. We spent 10 days vacationing and visiting relatives in Oahu. My wife and I snuck off to Maui for three days and stayed at the Mahana. We arrived early and were told that our room wasn't ready yet so we went shopping at the nearby Star market for groceries. Upon our return we were told we were being given another room that had been recently upgraded. We went up to the room and were stunned by it's beauty. New cabinets,counters, appliances, floors. Nicely decorated!! To top it off we were given a 1 bedroom 2 bath condo instead of a studio like I had reserved. Thats hard to beat folks. Thank you again to Larissa at the front desk for the wonderful surprise and the fantastic service. All of the employees were friendly, courteous, and helpful. I have never felt the need to write a letter to management or a review unless the experience was so bad that I couldn't help myself. In this case the experience was soo excellent that i can't help myself. Stay at the Mahana!!!!! Thanks again Mahana

Reviews.Title: “mahana has aloha”
Reviews.Author: CaTrippin
Reviews.Content: the mahana was a nice surprise. after my wife checked all the places in maui online, she chose this as the best value. we weren't too sure what to expect, but when we got there, our stay was great. of all the hotels, this is one of the closest to the beach. according to one representative, because it's older, they didn't have restrictions on how close the hotel can be on the beach. from the balcony, the beach is right in front of you, and the views are awesome. sand, sea, air, as far as the eye can see. most of the units are being renovated, and have washer/dryers, dishwashers, microwaves, balcony seating, tv, dvd, stereo. we ended up going to costco, and buying tuna poke, sashimi and having a dinner while watching the sunset. nice! other hotel amenities: pool (small but nice), two bbq grills (get there early or you have to salivate and smell what others are cooking while waiting for your turn to grill your steaks), tennis court (weird finish but functional), towel service for the pool, shuffleboard, 20 ft walk from pool to beach, walking distance (1.5 miles) to black rock swimming and snorkeling. things it doesn't have: restaurant, gym. we walked up to the next hotel (really close) and used their gym, and there's a restaurant there too. i heard they didn't mind mahana guests using the gym, but didn't bother to ask either. heck, it's hawaii, everyone has aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cruland
Reviews.Content: It was a little difficult to find because there were so many ResortQuests all in a row, but once we got there it was great. There was a good kitchen with all the utensils we needed as well as washer and dryer, and the entire place was clean and well put together. The patio was perfect for having a drink and watching the sunset, or just relaxing. There is also a perfect view of molakai and lanai. It had a decent pool that was never really crowded and there is a huge beach that has a nice big coral reef right in front of the hotel for snorkeling and is also great for swimming if you don't mind walking a few hundred yards.

Reviews.Title: “I did not want to leave. Was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: kathismom
Reviews.Content: Wow. What a great place! I stayed in 803 which is a studio and it was just wonderful. King size bed with tons of pillows, flat screen tv, coffee maker, blender, washer and dryer (I didn't take very many clothes but didn't wear all of them even!). The first thing I heard in the morning was the ocean and I feel asleep listening to them too. The owner was very great to work with and we had great communication before and after my stay. I would stay here again. Grocery store (Star) and coffee house (Jumping Java) within walking distance, video place. Airport beach towards Lahina (south) about 10 minutes walk away, great snorkeling - saw an octopus! Easy check in, check out, very attentive and polite desk workers. Owner provided towels, beach chairs, umbrella, boogie boards, cooler. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Looooooooved the Manaha!”
Reviews.Author: qbert81a
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our Maui honeymoon with a fantastic stay at the Mahana! What a tremendous condo we had. We stayed in room 614 which was extremely elegant, had upgraded amenities and a wonderful ocean view. We took a peek at some other rooms when housekeeping had the doors propped open and our room was much better than others! Ocean views right when you walk in the door were breathtaking. Rarely has a hotel lived up to expectations like this one did! The pool was nicely groomed, very clean and offered a nice way to cool off. The grounds were constantly being maintained and kept very clean as well. The only drawback was that the staff seemed to enjoy chatting it up on the phone or taking extra long to talk to other patrons about non-work related activities rather than helping us when needing towels or assistance with something. The exception to this was the concierge desk where the lady there hooked us up with some fantastic things such as massages on our patio, tickets to Warren and Annabelle's magic show and a helicopter tour of West Maui. She didn't even need to be tipped! Very friendly and while events were expensive, she did a great job in doing the legwork for us in a short 10 minute session. I can't say that the rest of Maui lived up to the hype as our stay was riddled with some bad dining experiences and the fire that shutdown HWY 30 on and off for a couple days. That was no fault of the Mahana and we just decided to spend our last day or two around the condo and enjoyed the beach, activities and sunset walks right at the Mahana. Please make sure to read the signs as to where this is good swimming. They make no bones about that fact that there is coral right outside the Mahana and that you either need to go slightly North or South to find good swimming and snorkeling water! We couldn't have asked for more and if we do indeed return to Maui we will be booking to stay at the Mahana no doubt! Worth every penny in this travelers eyes!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana!!”
Reviews.Author: ashleydavis02
Reviews.Content: May 21-27, 2007 I traveled with my husband, sister-n-law, and brother-n-law from Louisiana. It was a long ride but worth the wait. Maui is beautiful. We loved the Mahana. My husband and I's room was a little outdated, but very clean. We had a 1 bedroom, with 2 baths. The extra bath was nice and unexpect and were great!! We loved the small pool which was never crowded. We loved at times being the only people on the beach. We did have to walk a little ways to play in the water, but it was not a big deal. We also got smoothies and sandwiches which were sold by the pool. The guy who worked the cart was very nice and gave us a lot of information on things to do. We also liked that a supermarket was across the street for groceries. We also bought watershoes there at the supermarket for $10. We took the Triliogy snorkeling tour to the island of Lanai. It was beautiful there I loved the tour. We also did a day excursion to Oahu to see Pearl Harbor. It was nice but we had to wake up very early to catch the flight. I am glad we went, however I don't that I would go back. We did not care for Oahu, kind of reminded us of New Orleans. Our tour guide was very good. We booked with Polynesian Tours and Nappy was our driver. We also drove ourselves to Hana. Hana is beautiful going up, but not going down. Pretty much everyone was sick but the boys on your trip. It is definitely worth going once, but I don't know if I would repeat the road to Hana. We drank coconut milk straight from the coconut from a guy on the side of the road on the way to Hana. The banana nut bread he has is delicious. We will definitely be going back to Maui. There is so many other things to see and do. I will say that the majority of people that lived there were extremely friendly. I felt like I was back home in Louisiana. We also loved the Old Lahaina Luau and recommend booking early. We booked about 6 months in advance and had the best seat in the house. That luau is definitely worth a repeat when we go back! I hope this helps. I know before our trip we looked on tripadvisor a lot and the information really helped!

Reviews.Title: “Lov'IN Mahana”
Reviews.Author: MNBRE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in Maui and stayed at the Mahana. Before we left, we spent numerous hours checking up on hotels in the area. These were the reasons we chose to stay at the Mahana: 5. It is in a good area, close to Kaanapali Beach and Lahaina. 4. The reviews we read on TripAdvisor. 3. Reasonable prices. 2. All rooms are ocean front. 1. The view of the ocean we saw in pictures. The pictures and most of the reviews we read built up the excitement for us and the Mahana did not disappoint. We had actually booked a studio room, but they had run out so instead, we were put in a one bedroom on the second floor and it was gorgeous! We got there on a cloudy night, so we couldn't see the ocean, but we could hear the waves crashing against the shore. The first night we just sat out on the lanai and enjoyed the sound! The next morning we woke early to a beautiful view of Lanai and Molokai. It was incredible. We never got tired of the view from both the lanai and the huge floor to celing window. Every night we watched the sunset from either the lanai or the lawn chairs infront of the Mahana. The beach in front is a great beach to take a walk on early in the morning. We did this every morning we could. The beach in front of the condo is not great to swim or snorkel, but we just went down the beach to the south about half a mile and it was great. We pretty much had this part of the beach to ourselves most days. It's definitely worth the short walk. The snorkeling is great there, and we even saw a group of dolphins swimming nearby. Here are some places we went: 1. Teralani cocktail cruise-great 2. Napili Bay-nice in the morning, but got crowded 3. Feast at Lele- awesome luau! a real cultural experience, great service 4. Sunrise at Haleakala- very beautiful, but a nauseating drive, we left at 2 am! 5. Road to Hana- we loved it, road was good up until Hamoa Bay, there were too many people at 7 pools-get there early, road was closed past 7 pools due to earthquake damage 6. Four WInds II snorkel cruise- molokini was only stop, got to stay there longer, good lunch, saw turtles on the way back 7. Iao Vally- very beautiful, we went here on our last day, well worth it 8. Big Beach- very beautiful beach, golden sand, clear, blue water 9. Kaanapali Beach- pretty crowded when we were here 10. Kahekili Beach- on other side of Black Rock from Kaanapali, less crowded, nice beach, right next to Mahana We had an awesome time and it was always nice to go back to the Mahana every night. We will definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. Great Location, Views, Rooms”
Reviews.Author: fivefrys
Reviews.Content: We spent our 25th Wedding Anniversary here. Reviewed all nearby hotels through trip advisor and this one came out the best. Now I see why. All rooms have great views of not only the nearby (75 feet away) ocean from the floor to ceiling glass walls, but also have great views of Lanai and Molakai. We had a chance to view 3 different rooms at checkin and chose 504 for the view, although the other 2 rooms were newly remodeled. 807 is fantastic with all new interior and very modern. The pool was fine, never crowded (which we like) and there were chairs set up along the ocean in front of the place to get out of the wind in the afternoon. No restaurant, but a nice little snack stand that would add pina colada (non alcoholic) to our island rum for an afternoon drink. 2 nice restaurants at other places to the north-both within walking distance from the Mahana on the beach. We will return to Maui--this was our first time here--and we will stay at Mahana. P.S. The Extended Horizons Dive shop was very good to dive with as well. They leave daily out of Mala Wharf--about 10 minutes from the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Vacation Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kimber40
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Maui for my birthday this year because I turned 40 on May 31st. We vacationed in Maui from May 26th through June 2nd. We selected the Mahana because it looked good on the website and we liked the price. Our package included airfare, accomodations, and a Jeep Wrangler. I read impressive reviews on trip advisor before we made our final decision on accomodations. I have to say that this was the best vacation of my entire life. I LOVE Mahana. We stayed in unit 608. Our condo was gorgeous! The view from our balcony was incredible. Since the condo is right on the ocean, we heard the sound of the surf all night long. The employees were friendly and helpful. We had daily maid service and the the decor was very tasteful. I had a problem with the bathtub within the first two days of our vacation. I reported the problem to the front desk and it was repaired when I arrived back at the condo that evening. I have to say something about the swimming pool. In other trip advisor reviews that I have seen, visitors have complained about the swimming pool at Mahana. I read from previous reviews that many people walk up the beach to the Kannapali Beach Club to utilize their swimming pool. That is exaclty what we did. It worked out perfectly for us. The problem was solved. I already knew that the beach in front of the Mahana had a lot of corral because of previous reviews. We walked down the beach a short distance and had a beautiful swim beach. I liked it because this beach was practically empty. There were about five or six people using the beach. For visitors that have traveled a lot, you know that going to a beach with about five or six people doesn't happen very often. There are usually about 100 people on the beach. Other people on the beach were snorkeling so I walked back to the condo and got my snorkel gear. I saw some beautiful fish, lots of corral and sea urchins. I do have one negative thing to say about the concierge desk. I utilized a book called Maui Revealed so that we could get the best of the best on all of our activities. That included a laua for my birthday, helicoptor ride, road to Hana tips, snorkel trip and dinner cruise. The person that we spoke with at the conciege desk talked us out of going with the Maui Princess for our dinner cruise and into going with the Pacific Whale Foundation dinner cruise instead. That was a very poor decision because the food quality was very bad on that dinner cruise. In spite of the issue with the level of food quality, we still enjoyed ourselves and the sunset from the deck was wonderful. However, we received first class service on all of our excursions, except for the dinner cruise that this employee persuaded us to take. We met and spoke with many people during our vacation. Everyone said that the Pacific Whale Foundation dinner cruise does not compare to the Maui Princess dinner cruise. Keep that in mind when you are talking to the staff at the concierge desk. I loved our excursions. The Old Lahaina Laua was fantastic. I went to the laua for my birthday. A few of the staff greeted me with happy birthday upon arrival. Every employee was friendly, and energetic. The dancers were beautiful and very talented. We had several portraits taken by professional photographers and we were able to purhcase them for about $5 each after the show. The helicoptor ride was spectacular. I saw many beautiful waterfalls that are only accessible by air. It was outstanding. Our pilot was very polite and informative. He told us lots of interesting facts about Maui and Molakai during the entire flight. We took out helicoptor ride on day two of our vacation and it was fun to get an aerial view of our island paradise. I will be coming back to Maui and I will be booking the Mahana for my next trip! If I elect to go to another island the next time I return, I will be looking for a ResortQuest property since I was so happy with Mahana. Thank you to the Mahana for the perfect vacation! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ljthumper
Reviews.Content: Let me first say WOW! about this property. We stayed here from May 28 - June 4 and everything was perfect. It felt like home and not a couple of rooms. There were four of us in our party so we had reserved a 2B/2B condo. I had researched extensively on where to stay and this certainly did not disappoint at all. We were in the Molokai Wing #701. Words can't express how wonderful this unit was. Updated everything with marble counter-tops, a flat screen tv, a 2 person shower in the master and a stocked kitchen that even included a spice rack. Something that I wasn't expecting at all. We rented this directly with the property so it also included daily maid service. We used the Entertainment Book to get a discount of 50% and that just made this place even better. We had breakfast most mornings on the lanai and walks on the beach afterwards. As has been mentioned before, the beach directly in front is not a swimming beach. However, that didn't detract from it's beauty at all. We just walked south about 150 yards and there was a nice sandy entry. We also snorkeled out there and saw lots of fish. Since this property is all oceanfront, going to sleep with the sound of the waves was wonderful. The other bedroom faces the mountains and also had a wonderful view. We often saw rainbows out the back windows in the late afternoon. All of the staff that we encountered were very pleasant and they called a couple of times during our stay to make sure everything was going well. We weren't looking for a big resort with lots of activites. This is a nice quiet place with a nice pool and BBQ grills to prepare dinner with, should you want to. The whole area this condo is in is very convenient. The Star Market across the street had everything you would need in the way of groceries. There are also lots of places close by for dining and shopping and Lahaina is only 10 minutes away. We had a wonderfully relaxing family vacation that included hitting the highlights of Maui with enough down time at the condo to really relax. Seeing Maui in one week just isn't enough time, so we do plan to return and the Mahana will be the place again. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: rynoSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We didn't know what to expect, but my girlfriend and I were VERY pleasantly surprised by this place. It's off the beaten path from the busyness of the other Kannapali resorts, so it's more low key and intimate. It's not glitzy like the Ritz Carlton, but they make up for it in customer service and setting. The view from our lanai (little deck) was outstanding. Very close to the ocean. I highly doubt there is a better value in Kaanapali than the Mahana. Quiet, clean, stunning view, good room, great customer service, great snorkeling, nicely manicured grass lawn with lounge-chairs right in front of the ocean. I really don't have any complaints about this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rocknrunner
Reviews.Content: This was a big trip (May 2007) for my wife and me, and my search for accommodations was pretty intense to make sure we got just what we were looking for. Mahana unit 307 exceeded our expectations! From location, to design of the unit, to the furnishings, it was absolutely wonderful. I dealt directly with the owner, Jan Buckmaster ([--]). Jan was great to deal with, and really made us feel like welcomed guests. (She even added a muffin pan to the unit when I had inquired as to whether or not it had one.) While dealing directly with the owner kept the cost lower, the reason I ended up going that route was because I wanted to know the particulars about the unit we were renting. (When attempting to book through a management service or an agent for this or other properties, I had difficulty finding out how the unit was furnished). This unit has a king-size bed, with both the bedroom and the living room ocean-front, with a connecting private balcony (lanai) with table and chairs. Most properties other than the Mahana seem to have the bedroom away from the ocean, which would not have allowed me to enjoy the sound of the surf from bed. The view was amazing, with palm trees just out the window (off of the balcony) and two sister islands in the background. Although we didnâ€™t catch the best possible sunsets (because of cloud cover on the horizon), the sunsets were still quite enjoyable. The unit was well furnished, including 2 beach chairs (although they could use upgrading) and coolers. The building complex was very nice as well. The biggest negative (other than the fact that we had to leave) was that the beach is not a good swimming beach, because of rock and coral. But, we were aware of this upfront. And, there is probably a plus side to this in that there were no crowds and there really wasnâ€™t any noise. Although not good for swimming, it is a sandy beach that I found okay for some barefoot runs. (Not an extremely long beach - I estimate that the running / walking beach is about 1 Â½ miles long, or 3 miles for a round trip). We found the location to be very convenient. We really liked the Old Lahania Luau (lots of good food, and first-class treatment), only about 10 minutes away. We also enjoyed the trip to Hana and beyond. We thought the sunrise bike tour down Haleakala was overrated. If we were to do it again, weâ€™d drive up to see the sunrise, but skip the biking down. When planning this vacation, we viewed it as a once-in-a-lifetime trip. Now, weâ€™re not so sure. But, weâ€™re pretty certain that if we do return to Maui, weâ€™ll be looking to stay at Mahana 307. We definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: jillmill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana from May 18 - May 25 and had the time of our lives! We booked our trip nearly a year ago and I have been reading the reviews thru Trip Advisor the entire time. We were in unit 1216 and I can't imagine there was a unit any nicer. What a beautiful 1 bedroom condo. It was so comfortable and felt like a home rather than a room. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. The pool area was never crowded and the pool was crystal clear. We booked the Road to Hana tour and also did an inter-island day trip to Oahu. The rest of the time we drove around Maui, shopped on Front Street in Lahaina, made several visits to Whalers Village, and relaxed on the beach. This was our first trip to Hawaii and we will most definitely be making plans to return. We just can't express enough how gorgeous the island is and what a great place the Mahana is.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with an excellent view!”
Reviews.Author: hulagirlca
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Mahana. The place is great! Really nice room that we stayed in and the people there are so friendly and very helpful. The view at this place cannot be beat! It was amazing waking up every morning and just sitting on the lanai and watching and listening to the waves. I definitely plan to stay there again each and every time I go to Maui from now on. I really can't say enough good things about my stay at the Mahana. I would recommend it to anyone. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “10 days in paradise”
Reviews.Author: crunch413
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana 14 Apr - 23 Apr 2007. I found it to be a great place to stay. Although you can't swim right in front of the hotel, you can go either right or left for a 100 yards or so and swim there. Our room on the 4th floor was clean. I had no complaints at all. This is the perfect place if you want to get away from all of the crowds at the bigger resorts. I will come back. We went to the Feast at Lele which was wonderful. We snorkled Molokini crater which was a disappointment. We saw more sea life at Black Rock than we did at Molokini crater. We took a cruise with Triology to Lana'i which I would recommend. We saw several dolphins and whales. We didn't see any whales from our hotel room until the last day though. It was very difficult coming back to our home after living in paradise. I'm planning our return trip now. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view, older building”
Reviews.Author: zoe92
Reviews.Content: I'm rating this condo as above average because of the view, otherwise, it was average. I had higher hopes for this place after reading the reviews. I saw that the condos varied so after booking, I called and requested a room on a higher floor, with a king bed, and updated. We got a room on the 12th floor and the view was stunning however we weren't happy with the condo. The furniture and bedding looked somewhat new but the rest of the place was really outdated. The king bed was actually 2 twin beds put together. I hate that!!! So we requested a different room with a true king bed and updated. We were given room 414. This was better but still not what we hoped for. The kitchen, shower, and bathroom sink all looked newly updated and very nice however for some reason they didn't finish updating the rest of the place. The tile throughout was an old baby blue and did not look good. The furniture was older with a big tear in the couch and the bedspread looked to be at least 20 years old. I'm not one to typically complain so we just decided it was good enough. The view really was amazing. There were floor to ceiling windows in the bedroom and living room and as others have said I don't think there is another place this close the water. The only other problem we had were with some bugs in the kitchen. They had a note on the counter that warned of this and said to keep all food tightly closed. We thought we did but came home one day to find a ton of bugs all over the counter. We cleaned it all up and threw out some of the food and only had few more bugs throughout the rest of our stay. The beach is not swimmable but they have lounge chairs in the grass along the beach to relax. We saw a few whales from there. The pool was nothing special but it was nice to be able to cool off in there. It was very windy. The pool is between the two towers of the condos and it seems to create a wind tunnel. There is a beach 150 yards on each side of the condos. My husband said the snorkeling was pretty good there. There is also shuffleboard by the pool which we enjoyed. I was disappointed by our condo but I would stay there again if I was guaranteed a renovated condo. The Mahana can't guarantee anything but I think you can book directly through the owner that way you can see pictures of exactly what you're getting. The rate was very reasonable compared to other places in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Unit #701--Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: morgoth3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for a week, celebrating our 10th Anniversary and loved every minute of it. All units there are privately owned, so I can't speak for the other rooms, but #701 was fantastic. The condo was spotlessly clean, nicely furnished, with incredible views of the Pacific Ocean. The common areas at the Mahana were beautiful and the pool was very nice. The staff was very friendly. The location on the Kaanapali Coast is near the town of Lahaina (shopping, restaurants, etc.). There is good snorkeling a short walk down the beach, and even better snorkeling a short drive north. For steaks, go to Ruth's Chris Steak House in Lahaina, for great food in general, try Roy's, which is just a little North on the main road from Mahana. We will definitely be back to the Mahana again. Rob and Susan Stauffer, Highland Mills NY

Reviews.Title: “Loved the View!”
Reviews.Author: kampertj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mahana, from 1st may to may 8, 2007, After a 12 hour flight, was hoping that check-in condo was going to go smooth. After a 50 min drive, that was really awesome ,I was glad to see the Mahana, pictures just don't serve this place justice ... Checked in, no problem, staff were real nice and pleasant. Lobby was nice and grounds too, alot of beautiful flowers/plants at entrance.. Was orginally given room 213, asked for a higher floor room, and was given Studio room 513, wanted a higher view then 213. Room was nice, standard room, except for alot more extas, fridge wash/dryer, stove, microwave, ect... The carpet was a little worn, with some stains, defenitly needed replaced, however this didn't bother us, we come to expect this from alot of Beach ocean front rooms, kind of hard to keep carpet like new.. Maid service everyday kept the room nice and clean..Now the best part of the room, "THE VIEW", Words can't describe the view from this room, it was picture perfect! Palm trees, ocean, and beach, just great view, at fraction of the cost you would pay for at the resorts just a little up the beach.. All rooms are OCEAN FRONT, not view or partical, but right on the Ocean! We checked out most of the resorts in this area, by far the best views out of all the reorts and hotels, the only one that had a closer one was the Maui kai, but hotel, looked out dated to us, plus alot of the rooms there did not have the lanais. The pool was ok, didn't use it, too busy at the beach, would have like to have a hot tub though... The beach infront of the mahana has alot of rocks/coral in the water, not good to swim in, but great for snorkal, however if you don't like to snorkal, if you walk either way a few minutes, you'll find better swim areas. This beach is a great walking beach, about a 15-20 min walk to black rock, saw alot of sea life just walking the beach, water is really clear and warm.. There was very few people out on this beach, which was perfect for us, very romatic, and peaceful. Wife an I tried to conquer the road to Hana, Unfortunally, it conquered us, wife got really sick, alot of turns on this road/narrow, got to mile 18 and turned around, the water falls/sceenery we saw were really beautiful though, especially the 200 ft water fall(forget what mile marker/ see maui reveal book). Defenitly worth the trip, if you have a strong stomach, for the drive. Ate at several restaurants, Aloha Mixed Plate(local food(alot for $, decent taste/price), Bubba Gump,(same as all bubba gumps only better view), Hula Grill ( seafood was ok , nice location, price was adverage for location), Kool Cats( great Hamburger, best I ever had, decent $, worth the stop), Kimo's( seafood good food, great location, decent $$), PIONEER INN (only ate breakfast here, good decent $), Rusty Harpoon, (nice location, got the prime rib specials, good decent $) Ruths steakhouse(excellent steak, too much money though, went on our anniversary 6th may). MOOSE MCGILLYCUDDY'S(nasty hamburgers, wife liked the pork tacos, I loved there onion rings), soup kitchen by Mahana(over priced, food was ok, no view at all, decor was intersting though). Sunrise Cafe(breakfast only, little place, food was ok good $) also ate at the Embassy and K. shores next to Mahana, both were good, K shores, has some killer seafood linguine. Of course we had to drink our Lava flows. Also had to go to the grocery store right across the street from the Mahana and get some POG, great drink, really good! All in all, I really enjoyed the Mahana, and recondmend it to anyone that wants a nice loacation/decent price for Maui, close to most activities, don't like to be around alot of crowds, romance, and Outstanding views/best in area, we hope to be back soon.. Will post pics...

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: jpl88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a high-floor 1 bedroom / 2 bath unit booked through ResortQuest for the first half of our stay on Maui. The location of the buildings is simply amazing, as close as feasible to the sea. The views of the ocean and islands is breathtaking from the floor to ceiling windows and lanai. The area infront of the condos is always calm and quiet as the swimmable areas are steps away at the side. The condo we stayed in handily beat the high expectations I had from reading the reviews here. Wonderfully decorated, and the appliances (including dishwasher, washer and dryer) were all in excellent condition. Everything was clean and immaculate with a nice Hawaiian theme throughout. The sofa bed is reasonably comfortable. Complementary wireless internet access was a bonus. Lahaina town and the Kaanapali airport is only a 10 minute drive away. I would also add that we preferred the Lahaina area to the Kihei area, which felt older and a little run down. Lahaina town is worth a visit and has quite a few shopping and dining options. There is a grocery store not far (walking distance for some) but other than that you will need to drive around. Overall a perfect place for rest and relaxation. Property: 4/5 - Service: 4/5 - Cleanliness: 5/5 - Location: 4/5 Room: 5/5 - Amenities: 5/5 - Views: 5/5 Overall: 5/5

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana Is The Best Value In Maui”
Reviews.Author: LovMaui
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Mahana. We stayed in #418. It was fairly clean and nicely decorated. The view from the Lanai is the best in Maui. We saw spinner dolphins, a humpback whale breech and awesome sunsets. The condo is spacious and has everything you need to prepare meals. The staff is nice and helpful. It was another good experience. Only a few complaints. The shower water would only get warm, not hot. The furniture on the Lanai was old and smelly. The carpet was dirty and the floors could use a good scubbing. Finding a parking space at the condo after 6:00 PM is difficult, you may have to walk a ways. If you compare to other condo's, The Mahana is still leaps ahead. The Mahana a good value. Advice: Don't over buy food for the condo. Try Cheese Burger in Paradise. Don't buy pearls in Maui, they are very low quality. Check your gas tank before you venture up to Haleakala. Big Beach has great waves and a fantastic sunset. The snokeling at Molokini Crater is a disappointment, not much to see. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: crock
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Mahana this past April and it was everything we expected from reading other Tripadvisor reviews. Our 1 bedroom condo (1005) was recently renovated with travertine floors, new kitchen GE monogram appliances and Granite counter tops. The two bathrooms were also redone with all new fixtures, travertine floors and walls. The bedroom's bath was a walk in shower with two large shower heads. Wonderful! We did find the bed too firm for our backs. The views were great and it was fun to spot the few remaining whales of season splashing their tails and sounding. Breakfast on the Lanai became a morning ritual and a Honolulu Star newspaper is delivered to your room every morning as well. We did have an opportunity to inspect some other rooms and it should be noted that not all the rooms at the Mahana have been renovated by their owners. You might want to see the room before checking in. The staff was very friendly and our housekeeper always had our room done before 10:00am. The bath towels were large and soft and the lotions/shampoo/soaps were high quality. It was extremely windy for the 1st part of our stay and the Monkey Pod trees did shower down their pods in the parking lot and were sticky but this is Hawaii. We did see the grounds keeper sweeping and hosing things down. We had booked the 2 for 1 Luau package and went to the Hyatt Regency Luau down the road. We had been to several Luaus over the years and this one was sure not worth the $91 we paid. Save your money and go to Kimos for a sunset dinner and set your radio to 102fm for a great radio station in Molokai that plays non stop Hawaiian music. It was a memorable week and we are already planning for another stay at the Mahana next year

Reviews.Title: “We really liked the ResortQuest Mahana”
Reviews.Author: TexasCone
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 11th floor at the ResortQuest Mahana for a week for our first trip to Maui. It was great. The view was unbeatable - a whole wall in our living room and another wall in our bedroom were windows, and we had a great balcony with a table and chairs. On our first morning there, we woke up to the sound of the waves, and saw a seal, spinner dolphins and whales within 20 minutes of each other. That alone made our stay there more than worthwhile. If we'd have known what to expect, we might have packed a little differently. We knew we'd have a kitchen and that Maui is expensive, so we brought a few things to eat (bagels, snacks, etc.). We also brought a lot of clothes, and found that we had a washer and dryer in our suite. If we'd have realized we'd have free, convenient laundry and that the groceries at the Star Market across the street literally cost four times what we pay at home, we probably would have packed fewer clothes, a small box of laundry detergent and more groceries. I definitely recommend staying someplace with a little kitchen if you are in Maui on a budget and/or don't want to have to eat out every time you're hungry (I am pregnant though, so not only do I eat a lot, I'm very concerned about where my next meal's coming from and don't want to scout something out and wait for it every time I'm hungry!). We had a lot of exhausting days in the water and sun, so it was nice to be able to come home, throw together a sandwich and hit the sack. Also, it made packing a lunch to take to the beach or on the Road to Hana drive easier than having to stop to pick up sandwiches somewhere. For what we paid for the room, we thought the Mahana was great. Honestly, I wouldn't have wanted to stay in the more upscale, more corporate hotels/areas (like around Whaler's Village). I thought the Mahana had character and the people who worked there were very nice. It is very windy in that area, but it wasn't a problem for us. On a side note, we worked with our jet lag and got up very early in the morning. It was a good move. We wanted to do a lot of snorkeling and because of the wind, it's better to do it early in the day anyway. The only thing we didn't love at the Mahana was that the pool area is small and kind of boring (it is clean and perfectly fine for a quick dip though), so we went to the pool at the hotel next door. The shuffleboard at the Mahana is fun. The other thing I'll do differently if I go back to Maui again is I will spend a night over in Hana to break up the Road to Hana drive, have more time to check out more of that side of the island, do one of the longer hikes at Oheo Gulch and get a break from touristy West Maui.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation we have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Michien
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana from March 24 through March 30, 2007. It was the best experience we could have had. We were in room #106 on the ground floor and it was wonderful to walk from the living room or bedroom out to the patio and watch the whales and the ocean. We are from Western New York south of Buffalo so to see sunshine every day was so uplifting. I would highly recommend the Mahana for anyone who wants to relax and enjoy Maui. There is no restaurant on the property but you have signing privilege at the restaurants in the resort next door. If you want to do the zipline you need to book this before coming to Maui. We thought we could book it that week but we were told it books up weeks in advance. My husband was very disappointed. If you are going to any luau go the the Old Lahaina it is the best. We also rented a jeep for the week. That is the only way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break from Arizona to Maui with Teenage boys”
Reviews.Author: AnnaAZ
Reviews.Content: I typicially conduct research for our family vacations and include Trip Advisor as a resource and the positive comments and the fact the location is on the beach made our choice to stay at Mahana. We are pleased to say that the trip was wonderful and that the Mahana was ideal for our needs. First and foremost my husband wanted to say on-the-beach and not simply with an ocean view. Well, if he had gotten closer he would have slept in a literal water-bed. The views were spectacular and the accomodations were stunning. Floor to ceiling windows from our bedroom as well as the living room where the two boys slept confortably. We enjoyed coffee each moring on the patio watching rainbows and whales. Our condo had teakwood patio furniture, stunning furnishings and lovely art on the walls. An updated kitchen, granite counters in the bathroom and tub/shower. Enough room for all four of us in a one-bedroom condo. Fully furnished kitchen and great customer service and maid requests were responded to immediately. We requested a late check-out and they were able to move reservations around that morning to accomodate our request. Although there is no restaurant on-site the island is easy to get around on and we enjoyed renting a jeep for travel during the week. Whalers Village is just minutes away with lovely restaurants and grand shopping. The boys snorkled, swam, girl-watched (haha) so the other comments regarding not a place for teens did not apply here. Our boys are 16 & 19 and had a grand time. We highly recommend Mahana which more than met our needs and desires and my husband and I look forward to returning in the near future -- without the kids this time!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience and Condo!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbee123
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending 10 days at the Mahana! We absolutely loved it! We came across it by accident and it was the best thing that ever happened. We are hoping to book the same unit next year for 3 weeks! The condo unit we had was #216 on the Lanai side. It has granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, a breathtaking view (they all have ocean front views) and it was very clean and well kept! I can't say enough great things about the place. The one down-side, if you call it that, is that it doesn't have a big, flashy resort pool, but it does have a pool with lots of lounge chairs and we never had to fight to get a spot at the pool. Also, you can't swim directly in front of the hotel/condo, as there is a dangerous coral reef, but you walk 100 yards up the beach and no problem at all. I kinda liked this because then you don't have the noise of people around your hotel. Meanwhile, the beach is just steps away and we spent many mornings watching the whales and dolphins jump around in the ocean. Anyway, fantastic vacation and we can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TXShanahan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 7 - 16th. We had read the reviews prior to our arrival and were expecting good things. But I feel that the postings do not fully explain how wonderful the views are at this property. The one bedroom we stayed in had floor to ceiling windows, so the couple of days the weather was bad we were able to comfortably sit in the living room watching the whales play. The room we had was very comfortable and clean. We were concerned about the posting of noise from the nearby construction, but that was not a problem, it is really behind the building and not next to it. There was some maintenance to the building going on for a couple of days, but it did not bother us either. I am already working out plans to revisit this place and I would recommend it to my family and friends for a great couples retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation at the Mahana Condos!”
Reviews.Author: mll0506
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our condo on March 6 and left on the 13th. We had a beautiful studio on the 3rd floor. Very clean and recently remodeled. Just perfect for the two of us. The view was awesome and we had a fabulous time whale watching from our lanai, and being lulled to sleep by the surf. All rooms are oceanfront. Complimentary daily newspaper was a plus too. Housekeeping was great! Highly recommend this facility if you don't want to be where there is a lot of activity. It's secluded and quiet. No complaints here, only compliments!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service- Unclear policies”
Reviews.Author: hibariSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel, unless you want to pay hidden fees and deal with terrible customer service. I called the hotel the day before my stay to confirm my reservation, only to find out that a six month old baby counted as a third guest. This is not stated on their website. They told me that I then needed to upgrade to a one bedroom for an extra $600. What a scam!!! Since when does a six month old baby count as a third hotel guest?? The customer service was horrible, and completely unacommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation at Mahana”
Reviews.Author: azazaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for 9 nights beginning Feb. 24th. The only disappointing thing that happened was are fight between HNL and Maui. We always have flown Island Air into the West Maui (JHM) airport because of convenience. Our flight was cancelled two hours after it was supposed to depart. The agents kept giving us conflicting information "it's in the air", it's in the hanger", "it's landing shortly", etc. After two hours we decided we'd book through GO Airlines ($29 ea) and cancel Island Air. When we told them to retrieve our luggage they announced we were being transferred to Aloha Airlines that would land in Kahului (OGG). They supposedly gave everyone shuttle vouchers but we declined and said we'd make our own arrangements. Then came the next problem, our car was scheduled for pickup in Kaanapali and Budget refused to transfer the rental agreement to Kahului at the same price. They wanted to charge us $600 for a week! So, we took our chances and booked through Alamo upon arrival. On to better parts of the trip.... We have been to Maui and the other Hawaiian Islands many, many times but this was our first attempt at renting a condo directly through the owner ([--]). Our unit was on the 10th floor and the views were fabulous. The owner was a joy to work with and everything in the condo was exacty as pictured on the website and as promised. The unit was a little on the small side..more like a large hotel room, but this was a studio so it's what we expected. Next time I think I'd like the extra elbow room and go for a 1-bedroom. We loved watching the whales from dawn to dusk and sometimes we didn't even need binoculars to view them as they were just that close. We watched two kayaks get within 20 feet of a a mom and baby whale, then they got out of the boat and tried to swim with them. That was amazing! We loved going to The Fish Market which is about a half mile away. We bought fresh fish which they seasoned for us, put it in the pan and all we had to do was bake it. It was the best ever. And, they have great Ono Burgers there too which we ate twice during our stay. They're large enough for two. Between whale watching cruises and going to The Feast at Lele, we had a wonderful, relaxing time. I wouldn't recommend the Mahana units to young adults, teenagers or those who must have constant activity because it's very, very quiet there with practically no activities. I did miss hearing Hawaiian music and some of the flair you get from staying at the resorts, but overall, it was a different vacation and we'll repeat it again someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: kristykfox
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Mahana yesterday, we were there from the 8-11. It was a short trip as a surprise b-day present to my sister. I booked the Mahana because the reviews were great and we were NOT disappointed at all. We booked a two bedroom two bath unit and ended up with #409 and it was perfect! The view could not have been any better. We were able to watch the whales every morning during breakfast and every evening when we sat out on the lanai just to relax. The pool was smaller but still nice and heated, my daughter loved it. Over all we would recommend this condo to anyone who asked and will most likely be back in the next year or so ourselves. The staff was great and was helpful with any and all question we had and even called us to make sure everything in our room was perfect shortly after we checked in. Thanks to all of the helpful and lovely staff at the Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Affordable Condo!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HillbillyCounty
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip/honeymoon to Maui. We stayed at the Mahana from Jan 16 - Jan 26. 10 glorious nights! The mahana is beautiful. We stayed in studio suite 313. It was newly renovated and the views from the balcony were absolutely amazing. We watched whales every morning and every evening from the lanai and the waves put us to sleep at night. The sister resort down the beach was also very nice with a bigger pool area which we used occasionally. We were close to a grocery store which was good however there weren't any restaurants nearby other than the resorts which were fairly pricey. One night we ordered from pizza hut down the street which was cheap and was enough for that day and the next. We also had rented a car which is highly recommended for this area as you pretty much have to drive to get anywhere and to take a taxi is exremely expensive. Plus with a car you are able to explore the entire island which is what we did. I would definitely recommend the mahana to anyone. The service was great and our room was cleaned everyday. What a vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dated and Overrated”
Reviews.Author: steve the greek
Reviews.Content: After going through dozens of properties and reviews we booked at the Mahana, largely because the reviews were so positive and because it was in "Kaanapali" where there would be lots for our teenagers to do. Unfortunately, suite 1001 turned out to be dated looking and shabby, looking like Hawaiian rococo from the late '70's. The suite was spacious, but the paper thin curtains meant bright sun streaming in at 7 am and annoyed teens bouncing around the suite. Staff had no alternatives, and even took down the bedspreads we hung over the bright windows. The building is a featureless brick high rise with no restaurant, landscaping, or swimmable beach, and no local activities. And it is not even in Kaanapali. If you want to go to Kaanapali you have to walk south along the beach for 45 minutes, or get in your car and drive there. If you are retired or a honeymooner and want a quiet place to look out at the sea, this place will be fine for you. If you want a place with warmth, charm, or easy access to activities for families, I would look elsewhere. On a positive note, as we were departing, the carpenters were arriving in the suite to tear everything out and redo it. I understand most of the other suites are quite attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Best view ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Leesh5578
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Mahana. Personally, I think that we landed the best room at the whole place! We were lucky enough to be guests in room 507. Each room at the Mahana has a floor to ceiling view of the ocean. There is just nothing better than to fall asleep each night listening to the sound of the crashing waves just outside your sliding door. Our room had recently been updated in both the kitchen and bathroom. We particularly found it handy to have a full size kitchen and even our own washer and dryer in our room. The lanai had access from the bedroom or living room and there isn't a better spot to have your morning coffee and watch the whales. We saw so many that we almost couldn't keep up!! :) We would highly recommend the Mahana!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: amshadow1
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband just got back from our stay at the Mahana for our 2nd anniversary 1/9/07-1/14/07 and loved it! We were in #1008 which was a 1 bedroom, 1 bath unit. It was a little outdated as far as furnishings go, but was very well kept up otherwise. The only complaint we had with the unit was the very hard/uncomfortable bed. The staff was extremely helpful and nice, especially Larissa at the front desk. And as everyone else has already stated, the views are absolutely incredible! We loved falling asleep to the sound of the waves crashing, being able to cook some of our own meals and snacks, eating out on the lanai, whale watching from the living room, and having a DVD player in the condo when we just felt like staying in. I know a few people have complained about not having a swimming beach right in front of the property, but we found this to be an advantage. It was nice and quiet and the beach was never crowded because people have to go farther down to swim or snorkel. To us it was perfect! We loved the location of the Mahana as well. Very close to Whalers Village & Front Street in Lahaina. It was nice not having to drive very far to do the things we wanted. Also had the Star Market grocery store right across the street to stock up on food and supplies. Overall a wonderful stay and we would definitely stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place”
Reviews.Author: blondie223
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here the first week in December for our honeymoon. And we were very happy with our choice. We were most interested in oceanfront and affordable. The view from the room on the 10th floor was spectacular. And hearing the waves crashing at night, made it peaceful sleeping. The front desk was always very helpful and nice. We had no complaints the whole time we were there. We hated to leave. Front Street in Lahahina town was a neat place to shop and grab something to eat. The Old Lahahina Luau is something to see, but book it before you leave. The Road to Hana was incredible. If you get the cd for the Road to Hana, it is very helpful on finding things to see and the waterfalls. Wear good shoes. I was not warned of this and only had flip flops with me, which as we were climbing to a waterfall, I slipped and fell. The next time we go to Maui, which will be next year, we are doing the Road to Hana again, but this time staying in Hana, so we don't feel rushed in having to see everything quickly. There are lots and lots of turns and curves, so if you get carsick, i would recommend taking some kind of medicine. We also did snuba while we were there on a boat called Maui Magic and this was a ton of fun. We saw a ton of dolphins, whales and sea turtles. We were in Oahu in February 2006 and loved it, but we loved Maui even more and could relax and enjoy ourselves as it wasn't as fast paced. It was nice coming back to the Mahana in the late afternoon and being able to relax by the pool or just going back to our room and enjoying the view from our lanai. I would definitely recommend this hotel/condo to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana was Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: mahmom
Reviews.Content: We're a family of 5 (3 children in their 20's) who stayed at the Mahana the week before Christmas. Since the condo units are individually owned, we didn't really know what to expect, even though I had read the reviews on TripAdvisor. We were taken aback with our unit (#709): a corner unit with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, and it was absolutely gorgeous! Marble flooring, granite counters, cherry cabinets, tastefully decorated, etc. There was plenty of room for the 5 of us and we felt very comfortable there. The oceanfront view was breathtaking, and it was so relaxing to enjoy the view from the lanai that spanned the width of both the living room and the master bedroom. The lanai had a table and chairs, loveseat and armchair, with plenty of space leftover. We cooked several meals in the condo, and the kitchen was roomy enough and very well stocked. I'm very picky about the cleanliness of hotel rooms, etc. and our unit was spotless. The daily maid service to make beds and provide fresh towels was greatly appreciated. We also enjoyed the tennis courts. Walking 10 minutes took you to a little strip shopping center that housed Java Jazz -- a cozy little coffe shop with eclectic decor -- a great place to have a cup of coffee and maybe a baked good. I bought some cookies that the counter clerk said were baked that morning by her mother -- you can't find that at franchise coffee shops! The location of the Mahana was great: just a 10 minute drive to downtown Lahaina. We had a rental car for the week, and took day trips to Haleakala and Makawao. We also did the Road to Hana, but spent the nite (our last nite in Maui) in Hana -- which we would highly recommend. It would've been too much time in the car doing the round trip in one day. We loved our week in Maui and would definitely stay at the Mahana again. (By the way, after researching online rates, I booked our stay at the Mahana thru a travel agent, who was able to get us a much better price than any I found online -- we even got the 6th nite free!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: wendie477
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit #1213, rented from owner, during Jan. 2-8. It was amazing! We couldn't be any closer to the ocean, the view was spectacular! I loved sitting out on the lanai, watching for whales. We even snorkeled down the beach a little ways and saw a sea turtle! Everything you need is within walking distance, food, groceries, snorkel gear. Kaanapali Beach and Lahaina are just a short drive away. The washer and dryer came in very useful as we were on vacation for 2 weeks, so we didn't have to pack so many clothes. I highly recommend the Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “Great View!”
Reviews.Author: BaileySue
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a pretty good experience at the Mahana. The problem with using a company that manages condos is that the room decor and upkeep differs on the owners of the condo. The condo we stayed at was on the 8th floor and was just the right size for my husband and I. The decor and upkeep of the condo itself was not great. The decor was dated and the maintenance wasn't the best. One of the kitchen cabinet doors kept falling off, the shower stall had some mold growth and a sheet was covering one of the windows. The view was hard to beat, though. We were right on the ocean and could listen to the waves at night. We could see Lanai and Molokai from our room. The beach area in front of the hotel is nice, but you have to walk about 100 yds in either direction to be able to avoid the reefs. While the restaurants were very easy to get in and out of in December, there were some strong trade winds. It was windy all but one out of 6 days that we were there. We lost power one day to the wind gusts and were not able to take a snorkeling trip. We did get to go ziplining, which was fun and drove the road to Hana which we would also recommend. Some great restaurants to try were Kimono's and Roy's. My husband and I have been to Maui, Oahu and Kauai and Kauai wins hands down. For anyone heading to Hawaii, we would recommend going to Kauai versus any other island. The island is quiet, not a lot of traffic and tons of things to do. If you enjoy nature, there are tons of things to see and do, without wearing yourself out sightseeing. While Maui was nice, it just did not come close to the beauty and serenity of Kauai.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Option for West Maui”
Reviews.Author: VitalyM
Reviews.Content: Mahana is a great place if you're on a budget. It's a very well kept condominium managed by ResortQuest. Mahana is right on the beach and if sleeping to the sound of the surf is something you enjoy then this is a place for you. We stayed in the room on the 8th floor and you can hear the ocean even with closed lanai doors. The views from the lanai are incredible. You can see both Molokai and Lanai. The hotel has complimentary wi fi so I was really glad I brought my laptop. Parking was not a problem at all and there is a shopping center nearby so you can stock up on groceries or grab a sandwich. Unfortunately the beach in front of a hotel is not swimmable, but a five minute walk south there is one of the best beaches on Maui--Airport beach. It has great snorkeling and relatively calm waters.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Get Away!”
Reviews.Author: alexsmom
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the Mahana in 3 years. Again our visit was complete relaxation and we will definately be back! The Mahana is an older complex but the buildings are maintained very well. Each and every unit is ocean front. On this particular visit we were in unit 816 which is a one bedroom unit. Among the many benefits were floor to ceiling windows with a view of the ocean, fully equipped kitchen, new appliances, granite countertops, 2 flat screen TV's, a sleep number bed, a marvelous lanai perfect, free wireless internet access and washer and dryer! While the beach in front of the Mahana is rocky, you can walk a short distance in either direction for beaches that are more suitable for snorkeling, etc. There is a Star Market and ABC nearby for easy grocery shopping, etc. For those that haven't been to Maui before, the Iao Needle is a must. I would highly recommend skipping the Road to Hana, unless you are planning on spending the night in Hana. My spouse and I go to Maui for pure rest and relaxation and have found the Mahana to be perfect for that. If you are looking for all the amenities of a full service hotel/resort like on site restaraunts, room service, bar services, etc. this may not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: friscocat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana for our honeymoon in March. The views from our window and balcony were indeed wonderful. We requested a 1BR/1BA and were given a 1BR/2BA. It was nice to have the extra bathroom and space. The location was convenient, yet it was surprisingly quiet at the hotel and on the beach. We had discussed going to Kauai rather than Maui, thinking that Maui might be too crowded and busy. However, Maui and the Mahana offered the best of both worlds -- lots of activities, yet very quiet and private without lots of crowds. Having the condo with the kitchen was nice, but it was even better to have housekeeping services like a hotel. The decor was a little outdated, but the room was clean and spacious. I would definitely recommend staying West Maui. We drove down to South Maui, and it was much hotter. With all the condos and fast food restaurants, South Maui felt a little like Southern California. It also seemed more crowded. We loved our stay at the Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Taralm10
Reviews.Content: The condo at Mahana is a great find - both location and price. We stayed in a 1 bedroom with 2 bath condo on the 10th floor. I do not think we could have been any closer to the water...the condo is steps from the water. Our room was in great shape, spacious, with a feeling of home. The lanai is huge and the floor to ceiling windows were awesome. As for location, the grocery store with other smaller stores is a quick walk from the condo. You are also a 5-10 minute drive to the town of Lahania, which is great for the Luau, eating and shopping. The people working at the desk at the condo we also so friendly and helpful. I especially appreciated that the property had free wireless internet service from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Maui, Great Condo”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by this place. When I opened the door to my condo, I couldnt' believe how upscale it was. The family who owned it had obviously done a lot of work to it and it showed! Everything was spotless and high quality. It had everything I needed for my stay. And the view, amazing! Floor-to-ceiling windows with the most amazing view of the ocean. The staff was so friendly, checking in with me to see how my stay was going. They were so accomodating and I was sooo sad to leave. I can't wait for my next stay at the Mahana, I would love to own one of these one day! Highly recommended for families and couples who want a luxurious place to stay with all the amenities and coziness of home. I've been to many properties on Maui and this is one I'll always come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the luxury and homey feeling”
Reviews.Author: zx212
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice for any vacationers. What impressed us the most was the location. It is RIGHT on the water. We had a view of ocean in the living room and bedroom. It was magnificent. We also love the kitchen and washer/tryer. It was very convenient! After few days, we were tied of dinning out, we went across the street to get groceries and cooked couple of nights, with friends, on the balcany. It was very enjoyable. Overall, we would recommed to any of my friends and readers like you!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: papa342
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at the Mahana on our 14th Anniversary trip to Maui. Ocean front was important to us, as my wife likes to hear the sound of the surf as we sleep. We planned to cook most of our meals to save money, so we didn't need a resort with restaurants and tons of services. The Mahana was perfect for us. Our one-bedroom/one-bath unit was on the 8th floor, it was decorated very nicely, and was very comfortable. The kitchen was well equiped with granite counter tops, stainless appliances, flat cooktop stove, microwave, coffee maker, dishwasher, blender, toaster, & fridge with filtered water and ice maker. Coffee was provided for us for our first morning. The dining area provided a round table with four chairs. The living area boasted a sofa and loveseat, coffee table and end tables, and an entertainment center with flat-screen TV, DVD player, and a bookshelf stereo system with cd changer. Not to mention floor-to-ceiling windows with a unbelievable view. The bathroom was roomy, with large shower (no tub), commode, and a separate vanity/dressing area with utility closet containing a compact washer/dryer combo. We really loved the tile mosaic gecko on the shower floor. The bedroom was spacious, included a TV and DVD player, dresser, two night stands and a very comfortable bed. The bedroom and living room shared access to the lanai, with a lounge chair, and a table with two chairs. We ate all of our breakfasts and most dinners on the lanai, and we viewed most of the sunsets as well. I miss that lanai! The air conditioner struggled to cool the place, but we spent most of the time with the sliders open listening to the ocean, and the two ceiling fans cooled the unit off quickly once the sun went down. We weren't in the room much during the day, so A/C wasn't that much of an issue for us. Our incoming flight was delayed, and we didn't get in until after midnight. We appreciated the fact that the front desk was manned 24 hours a day, allowing us to experience a friendly check-in. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. We used the gas barbecue grills, the pool, and the shuffleboard court. We walked the beach, and enjoyed lounging in the chairs on the seaside lawn. My wife enjoyed a Sunday lesson on making a ti leaf lei. An added bonus was complimentary WiFi Internet access, which we used to brag to the folks back home via email about our lovely island home. We really enjoyed our stay, and we hope to return some time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: 1daphne1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon in Maui. We stayed at The Mahana. It was amazing from beginning to end! The front desk staff was so friendly, they offered several suggestions for restaurants that had wonderful food. Our condo was beautiful, we had booked a studio and were very pleased to find it immaculate and spacious. They even provided detergent for the washer/ dryer in the unit, which was very convenient. Next time we will pack less clothes!! The view was stunning, absolutely amazing. When they say "ocean view", they really mean it! We enjoyed mai-tai's on our balcony every night to watch the spectacular sunsets. The grounds are very well maintained, lots of pretty flowers and palm trees. We found it to be very quiet and peaceful, perfect for a little romance!!! We will definetely be returning to the Mahana next year for our anniversary!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: P.J.2
Reviews.Content: We were at the Mahana from 11th Sept to the 20th Sept. I cannot say enough good things about the hotel and staff. The grounds are kept clean and tidy and the staff were always friendly and helpful. Some people have criticized the fact that the beach in front of the Mahana is not a swimming beach, but I think this is an advantage for the Mahana as it assures peace and quiet whilst relaxing around the pool and the grass in front of the beach. If you ever feel like you need to be around more people or fancy a change of scenery you can always walk over to the Embassy and sit around their pool as we did on a couple of occasions. On the evening you have the option to take the pleasant walk over to the Embassy and Kaanapali Shores for a meal or a few drinks and Whalers village is only a 5 minute car journey away and Lahaina 10 minutes away. This makes the location perfect if you a couple on honeymoon or just there to relax and you are only a short distance away if you wish to be amongst the crowds. I would recommend taking the short drive into Lahaina to the Safeway supermarket rather than using the Star supermarket for your groceries. I don't know if we will be returning to the Mahana as we are expecting our first child, however I would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a quiet haven to recharge their batteries or couples seeking a romantic get away. p.s. Bring your camera's for the spectacular sunsets !!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Yip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana Sept 16-23. We were initially put into Unit 502. My husband found the murphy bed uncomfortable and it made the living area a cramped when we left it down. The beachfront view is beautiful and the bathroom is terrific as it appears to have been recently renovated. A few days into our stay we heard a jackhammer, and there was incessant hammering during the day. It turned out there was being construction being done in the unit below us. We asked to be moved and we ended up in a larger Unit 216. The carpets are stained and the white walls looked liked they needed to be washed. The view is spectacular with floor to ceiling windows. The kitchen in this unit has marble countertop and all the kitchen applicances are stainless steel. We will not stay at the Mahana again. The highlight of our first trip to Hawaii was our snorkeling and hiking adventure! Take a snorkel trip with "Captain Steve", and hike excursions with "Maui Eco-Adventures".

Reviews.Title: “A Honeymoon we will never forget”
Reviews.Author: NIBeato
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana on our honeymoon in August 2005. We absolutely loved it. We stayed in room 709 and it was amazing, from the minute we walked in the door we felt at home. It was a two bedroom suit (we only used half) but it had granite counter tops and very beautiful decor, we defintely recommend this room. We ate breakfast on the lanai and could see the sea turtles from where we were. Each morning we awoke to a beautiful rainbow and a serene view. The staff at the Mahana were so accomodating and helpful, they recommended places for dinner and answered all our questions. You must try the Hula Grill, we ate there and it was amazing. The fresh fish on the Island was so good, their dipping sauce is worth bringing back with you. We can't wait to return to Hawaii and when we do we are definetly staying at the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “shhhh...........dont tell anyone!!!”
Reviews.Author: onyxkeeper
Reviews.Content: this place is spectacular!!!!!! the view, the staff, the property, the rooms all fabulous!!!!!!!! at the time of this writing im am sitting on the lanai with my coffee trying to figure out how i can stay many more days :) all of the other positive reviews about the mahana are indeed correct. dont listen to any of the negative as i cant see how any of it could be true. the mahana is clean, pretty and righto n the beach. sure, theres a coral bed right in front, but if all you want to do is get wet then its perfect. if you need to swim or snorkle you con go a few feet in either direction and get in the water. you might want to snorkle right in front, cuz every morning i look down from the 12th floor and i can see a large school of large fish feeding in the coral. true, the beach all but dissappears at high tide, but there are lounges on the grass right behind the beach. the advantage is that you dont get sandy :) the pool is great, its smaller than say the embassy, but how much pool do you really need? no dining on premises, but if your on a big budget you can go to the embassy and if your on a small budget you can go to star or safeway and buy groceries. dont make the same mistake as i and go out to buy liq. dish soap. i didnt realize it was provided in the form of pre soaped pads by dawn. opps:) do bring a baggie of laundry soap so you dont have to buy a large quantity :) the only thing i could possible think of that could be changed is the lack of lighting on MY lanai (some units have them, i think), but that could have easily been solved my moving one of the tables and lamps out here. i never bothered :) as for things to do here, i went to the nancy emerson surf school and had a lesson. mahalo sharky!!!!!! it was a blast!!!! advice: if youre thinking of learning to surf, start doing push ups and lat work RIGHT NOW!!!! my arms didnt work for the rest of the day :) also went on the atlantis submarine. not that great. fun to do cuz ive never done it, but we saw wayyyyyyy better fish at the maui ocean center. now that waws COOL!!! last night we took the teralani sunset dinner cruise. best!!!!!!! the food was good and the staff was EXTREMELY helpful. i have my grandmother with me and they were the BEST!!!!!!!!!! with helping her. soooooo worth the money. i looked at all the other hotes along the beaches and i really can see any one id rather stay in (unless i won the lottery, then id buy a house on the beach :)). i will stay here again in a year and a half :):):) dont hesitate to come here, you wont be sorry!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: endOfPath
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mohana for 5 nights. We were not planning on staying there but chose to leave our pre-booked hotel because it was extremely overpriced and dirty. The Mohana on the other hand was beautiful. We stayed in a 1 bedroom condo on the 12th floor. Every condo at the resort is ocean front and has floor to ceiling windows. The condo had everything you'd need (and much more). There was a full kitchen, a living room, a bedroom, a washer and dryer, etc, etc. The staf was extremely friendly and helpful. Even though we had strange booking circumstances (our travel agent called and made arrangements) there were no errors made on our bill. The only thing this resort doesn't have going for it is location. The beach that it is on is not swimable due to coral and there isn't much sand either. That's not really a problem because you can walk to other beaches pretty easily. For the one day that we spent on the beach we walked to the beach in front of the Sheraton. There are closer beaches but the beach by the Sheraton is the best in the area. We were very busy and didn't spend time at the resort so the sub-optimal location didn't bother us. This is a fantastic resort especially for a busy family. You can buy groceries almost across the street and save money by cooking inside the condo. As long as you aren't looking to spend most of your time on the beach this is a fantastic resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo to stay at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheetah101
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Maui for our honeymoon. And while everything else on our trip went wrong, our condo at the Mahana was awesome!! It was comfortable and clean and had everything in it a person could need. The staff were very helpful and curteous. All the condo's have floor to ceiling windows (all ocean view) and your own lanai. It also included a washer and dryer, and maid service (which some condo's don't have) and parking was also included which I hear is a rare thing in Maui. THe ownly downfall I can see about this place is basically you need to drive everywhere. There is a market and a couple of restaurants fairly close, but we weren't used to the heat and just drove. While we loved the Mahana, I do have to say that the Road to Hana is a waste of time unless you like driving 5 MPH for 8 hours (if you have a weak stomach this is not for you), the scenery is hardly comparable to British Columbia where we are from , and the hikes into the waterfalls were a joke. Then there was the night we went to the Royal Lahaina Luau. Also another very big money waster. Had to stand in line for over and hour, and they to be seated at huge tables and then have to stand right up again and stand in line for the grossest food you will ever eat. We did eat at a couple of great restaurants that I would recommend, one being Longhi's in Lahaina, and Cilantro's in Lahaina (mexican fast food - but very good) and Lelaini's in Whaler's VIllage. We also did a snorkeling tour out to Molokini - I highly recommend this. Hopefully this review will help someone save their money for something more exciting!! The Luau cost us $170 and we were in line most of the night. The dancers were amazing but they only danced for about 20 mins half and hour. They have free shows around so watch for them if you just want to see the dancing. Dwayne & Laura, British Columbia Canada

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found!”
Reviews.Author: SheldonBranford
Reviews.Content: I did a ton of research here on TA and other websites planning my familyâ€™s trip to Maui to celebrate our daughterâ€™s 30th birthday. After reading more reviews than I care to remember, the one place that kept popping up to the top of the deck was the Mahana. As others have said, the Mahana is not a fancy five-star resort like the Westin, Maui Prince or the Grand Wailea, and all I can say is thank goodness for that! If thatâ€™s what youâ€™re looking for, keep looking, because this place is probably not for you.
