However, if youâ€™re looking for a relaxing condo with all the amenities of home and a view to die for, keep reading. It doesnâ€™t have a fancy pool with waterfall jacuzzis and water slides or any on site restaurants. For swimming laps or just jumping in to cool off, the Mahanaâ€™s gets the job done. And it does have a tennis court, but none of ever tried it out. We booked two rooms; one for us geezers, one for our three kids, all over 21. But looking back, Iâ€™m confident a two bedroom would have handled all of us with no trouble. I called the facility about a week before our trip and asked them if they could put us on one of the higher floors, and they delivered; booking us in rooms 1116 and 1118 in the Lanai tower. The places were unbelievable. I had read some reviews about some condos having funky outdated furniture, but 1116 is amazing â€“ it has granite counter tops, an entertainment center with a great selection of music -- from Hawaiian to jazz, (OK it was on cassette instead of CD, but big deal), updated appliances, including a stackable washer and dryer, dishwasher, coffee maker, blender, new fridge and even a George Foreman Grill. The king size bed was big enough to get lost in, and the free wi-fi worked without a problem. The first thing you see in every room is the ocean. There are floor to ceiling windows in the living room and bedroom and sliding doors from either room that lead out to the lanai, and make for outstanding views. The island of Lanai is on your left, Molokai to the right. I dare you to find anyplace closer to the ocean on Maui than the Mahana, short of camping on the beach. Other people have mentioned the lack of swimming directly in front of the facility, but there are places to the north and south. The snorkeling is amazing. The water is clear and the fish are plentiful. We even followed a couple of huge sea turtles. From our rooms we could see fish playing in the coral directly below us. And the sunsets were out of this world. I probably took at least 100 pictures of them â€“ all from the comfort of the lanai. Since the wind blows A LOT on Maui, keeping the sliding doors open gives you a nice breeze that helps cool things down, especially in the morning and after sunset. We slept with the sliding doors open every night and the soothing sounds of the waves crashing on the beach helped put us to sleep. The A/C shuts down automatically whenever the sliding doors are open. Just remember not to have the sliding doors and front door open at the same time. The result is a nasty wind tunnel effect that can blow things off the wall and wreak other havoc in the condo. The concierge is staffed by an outside company, so the people behind the desk rotate between the various hotels on the island. We dealt with a very nice and helpful woman, who set us up with good deals for parasailing with UFO and kayak rentals at Dig Me Beach. For renting snorkel gear, Snorkel Bobâ€™s canâ€™t be beat. We stocked up on groceries at the Star Market across the street and had breakfast and at least one other meal every day in the condo during our stay. We also found a cooler in the front closet, and filled it with beverages, fruit, sandwiches and ice from the ice maker for the Road to Hana drive. Thatâ€™s definitely the way to go. Thereâ€™s also an ABC Store just a couple of blocks north. I think they sell gas, too, but I could be mistaken. If you donâ€™t make it all the way around the southern end of the island, stop at Charleyâ€™s in Paia on the way back for dinner. Speaking of restaurants, the one place I would not recommend is the Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina. I hate slamming anything in Maui, because we had a truly magnificent time. But the place is understaffed, the service is slow, and the food, while some of it was tasty, was cold and stringy by the time it arrived. The cheap plastic utensils have a tendency to snap while youâ€™re trying to cut your meat, too.

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo Mahana”
Reviews.Author: Leiya
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 311. It was absolutely great. Corner unit with beautiful decor, lots of antiques and very well maintained. The staff was superb. We used the BBQ's by the pool. Very convenient but they could probably use a couple more during the busy season. We didn't actually use the pool but it was beautiful. Well maintained and kept very clean. The best feature of the Mahana is the location. Killer sunsets and it was fabulous to listen to the waves crashing all night long. We ate at Kimos which was really good. Cheeseburger in Paradise is a place I could have skipped. Overall it was a great place that we would definitely revisit and recommend to our friends. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit-Still Great”
Reviews.Author: worthington
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second visit to Maui and stayed again at the Mahana. It continues to be a great choice for a Maui stay. The location is excellent and facilities very well maintained. Best features are the units with great views, the property's proximity to a quiet beach and close proximity to a grocery store (right across the street) to stock up. This is a great condo choice.

Reviews.Title: “Sunsets at the Mahana can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: txag85
Reviews.Content: We loved the Mahana. It was in a great location and the views and breezes were really wonderful! It never had a crowded feel and it was quiet at night. The beach area is small and the entrance is rocky, but we wanted to snorkel at different places anyway. Many people said the snokeling was great right in front of the Mahana. We mainly ate at restaurants, but many of the guests grilled together in the evenings. We also stayed at a resort on Oahu, but we liked the Mahana better!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: pdxjoanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Condo 717 at the Mahana in June and rented directly from the owners thru vrbo.com. It was everything we could've asked for and more. Very good price, gorgeous location directly on the beach, beautiful view of sunsets from the lanai, and prompt & friendly service. Although we never cooked, I appreciated that the kitchen was FULLY stocked with every item you could need. It was well located away from the hustle & bustle of Ka'anapli but only a few minutes away by car. Used both of the restaurants at the neighboring Embassy Suites and were satisfied both times. The beach just a few steps south of the complex is gorgeous, uncrowded, and great for both swimming & snorkeling. Also, having a washer/dryer in the unit is a godsend. We used it every day for rinsing out & drying beach towels & swimsuits. I HIGHLY recommend this unit & this property.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome View!”
Reviews.Author: Bunky13
Reviews.Content: Aloha! Just got back from Maui and couldn't wait to write a review of the Mahana. We were originally booked in a suite, but, after a day, we decided to ask for a 1 bedroom. They were able to let us see 2 rooms. One was pretty funky with alot of dolphin tiles, etc so opted not to use that one. However, when we opened the door to the second one, WOW, that was it. It was unbelievable. One of the newer renovated condo's. The owners have incredible taste in furnishings and decor. Beautiful granite countertops in the kitchen that complimented the cherry wood. It was supplied with everthing you needed. I loved cooking in there and serving breakfast/dinner out on the lani. The bed was so soft and comfortable and it was so nice to wake up to the view and the waves of the ocean. We saw lots of rainbow's from the lani and fed the birds bread. Watch out, they are not shy. The condo was wonderful to come home to after a full day. The pool was quiet and nice, the beach not good for swimming, but walk in either direction and it was fine. We took advantage of the Embassy buffet a couple of times. Great omlettes and POG juice. The staff was friendly enough but didn't really go out of their way. We had to ask to have our room cleaned one day as it had not been cleaned and here it was 4:30 in the afternoon. I would recommend the Mahana for those looking for relaxation and quiet. If you are looking for entertanment, crowds, etc. you can drive to Whaler's Village where all the resorts/resaturants are or Lahania. Go to Kapalua Bay for great snorkleing and less crowded beaches. There is even a free parking lot if you get there early enough. We rented snorkel gear and boogie boards from Boss Frog's. Lahania best for shopping and eating. Cheeseburger in Paradise has great breakfast and views. Other restaurant's recommended would be Kimo's, Leilani's, and Pacific O's. Ate fish as much as we could while we were there. Up the street from the Mahana is a little farmer's market. This lady there is very nice and her fruits and veggies are so sweet. Worth taking alittle walk. I would say stay away from the Star Market across the street as the prices are extremely high. Go to Safeway or Long's. Definitely take the Road to Hana. Start out early in the morning. CD was worth purchasing as it described everything as you drove along. Yes, it is a long day, but the views are incredible and waterfalls were all over. I took dramimine as I had read there were alot of turns and people getting sick, but really, it was not as bad as I thought. You go slow, stop when you want so not bad. We took a turn on some road and wound up at a beautiful beach with a handful of people and a local selling fruits and she had just make banana bread which was still warm - it was delicious. We had an 11:00PM flight back and were not able to book a late check out so we booked ourselves into the Pioneer Inn in Lahania for the day. We checked in at noon, went to the beach, shopped, rested, showered, had some dinner and left for the airport around 8:30. It was perfect. I would definitely recommend doing that. Didn't have to worry about luggage and it was a great beach day. Had a beautiful full moon driving to the airport. All in in all a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “WOW !!! mahalo mahalo mahalo !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW - from the first moment we stepped into our room we both had to take second, third & fourth looks at the room and pinch ourselves just to make sure we weren't dreaming. The views from any part of the room are breathtaking (except bathroom :) and sounds from the waves crashing below is so comforting and calming to fall asleep to. I'll try to do justice to the decor of the room we are in (807 - You guys did a great remodel and will borrow the shower floor & bench seat design for our master bath when we get back home) - this is a 13 on a scale of 1 to 10 - granite kitchen counters with quiet close cabinet drawers - upgraded appliances - tile floors throughout (it looks similar to desert cream travertine) - the bedroom furniture modern island feel - not a corner cut here the owners take pride in this unit (or frequently use it) - honestly I was expecting much less & planned accordingly jic our unit wasn't up to our standards - this is our wedding/honeymoon and I wanted to start our new life on a positive note. We've already decided that based on the 24 hours thusfar we'll be coming back each year for our anniversary (kids included - when they arrive :) I would recommend the Mahana to everyone that comes to Maui - just leave me the same room each year please :) Mahalo again for making us feel at home here in Maui P.S. After we got over our initial shock of the room/view - I called the front desk to thank them personally while looking out the window - a dolphin was leaping out of the water - I must've sounded like a 5 year old screaming "look at the dolphin..look at the dolphin" - things happen for a reason ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: mom2one1973
Reviews.Content: We went to the Mahana for our honeymoon from June 18-23. My main attraction to this hotel was that it was all ocean front and you didn't have to pay extra for this like all the other hotels I found (garden view was complimentary). When we arrived in room 903, it looked like it was from the set of Golden Girls...very 80's, white washed wicker, etc. The problem was it had a double bed. For our honeymoon? I asked if we could have a king size unit instead. The front desk quickly gave me 2 room keys so I could make my choice (very nice of them). I opted for room 703 (granite countertops in kitchen, updated throughout, tiled shower, new toilet, mirrored side wall) It was perfect. I thought being at the end of the elevators was going to be noisy, but the doors are thick or something. Never heard any noises( which is a plus for me). I liked having the kitchen in there because we made breakfast in the morning and sat out on the balcony listening to the waves, feeding the birds bread, and watching the sailboats. We did a few loads of laundry in the stackable washer/dryer. If you want to snorkel, go rent some gear at Kaanapali Shores Resort and snorkel by Black Rock ( can get crowded there though). Be careful walking in the sand..I was stung by a bee who was buried in the sand. I have to say, waking up to the sound of the waves crashing is the best way to wake up. Our view was spectacular! This place is great for quiet people. If you want a crowded beach with a bunch of kids, don't go here. But this place is perfect for honeymooners. I will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God and The Mahana too!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mahana June 11 - June 17. I have visited Maui at least 15 times. During each visit I have stayed at the formely Aston Kaanapali Shores (2 resorts from the Mahana). During my scheduled trip to Maui, Kaanapali Shore had no two bedrooms oceanfront room. After calling and researching other hotels for a two bedroom oceanfront, my wife and I nearly gave up. We found another hotel that we wanted to look into, but they had no number listed on the internet, so we decided to call 411 to get the number. The hotel that we were trying to find was not the Mahana, but that's is the number the operator gave us. Thank God the operator gave us the wrong number!!! We never knew about the Mahana. This is an AWESOME hotel! The service is great. The room is incredible (Room 709)! New furniture, new appliances from the stove, diswasher, washer & dryer, hidden fridge, microwave. New kitchen cabinets. New flooring. It is totally remodeled to a 5-star quality. Room was clean. The room is simply remarkable. The sound of the ocean was music to my ears. My wife loved the room, as well as our 3-year old son. He had plenty of room to play. The only bad thing that I can say about the Mahana is..................I can't think of anything bad to say. Kaanapali Shores has lost a customer and the Mahana has gained one. I look forward to returning to Maui and staying at the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay at the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: NASA60
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the Mahana was in October 2001 with my wife and two teen-age children. We were in a 2 BR/2Bath condo, 1001. We absolutely loved it and vowed to come back. Well, this year marked mine and my wife's 25th anniversary so what better way to celebrate than to return to our favorite vacation paradise. We booked a 1 BR this time since the kids weren't with us. When we arrived, we were placed in 1005. We were pleasantly surprised to find it was a 2 bath condo. The condo was beautifully decorated. The cabinets and carpet both looked like they had recently been replaced. The kingsize bed had a fantastic mattress, even better than ours at home. Of course, the view was spectacular. That was the primary reason we returned. Everything worked as it should and the only two times I went to the front desk was to check in and check out. I can't imagine there being a better place to stay on Maui. We drove down to Walea but much prefer the Ka'anapali area. If you walk down the beach towards Black Rock from the Mahana, there is one of the most beautiful, uncrowded beaches on the island. If you are interested in a quiet, tropical atmosphere and amazing views from your room, the Mahana is the place to be. Who cares that it doesn't have a bar or restaurant. There are so many wonderful places to eat within a 10 minute drive from the Mahana. As for alcohol, we purchase a bottle of rum and mixers and blend up our own daiquiris and mai tai's. A typical day for us would be to have breakfast in the condo, go find a beach to enjoy in the morning, come back and have lunch in the condo, then lay out in the grassy area between the buildings and the beach and drink frozen drinks, read, etc.... For dinner, we always went out to a restaurant and never had a disappointing meal. Our favorite meals though were Mama's Fish House (most amazing atmosphere and best fish preparation), Canoes (I can't understand why more people don't eat here!), Ruth's Chris Steak House (best Filet Mignon I have ever put in my mouth), and Leilani's on the Beach. We also enjoyed Bubba Gump and Lahaina Fish Co... Of course, in addition to hitting the beaches, we also drove to Hana and visited the Io State Park. We love staying in a condo versus motel because of the full kitchen and washer/dryer. It really cuts down on packing when you can wash your clothes. It also saves some cash and calories since you don't have to eat at a restaurant for every meal. I have no complaints about our stay whatsover. The grounds were beautiful, entrance was beautiful, condo was perfect, pool was nice, weather was perfectly sunny every day. We had a wonderful time and will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a score!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana for 5 nights 6 days. My first trip to Maui and what a trip it was. I had done so much internet research on what to do where to stay and I was bound and determined to get the best deal for my money. At the same time we are picky travelers and would not want to stay in anything REMOTELY trashy or run down. It paid off! The Mahana was beautiful our room was fantastic, nice furniture, stereo, dvd player ect. Unblievable views and with two sliding glass doors were great. You can "open" up your room and it's almost like your room becomes part of the beach. Everyone is super friendly, and will help you with anything you need. I can't wait to come back and spend more time, we absolutely would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view!”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover742
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 812 and it was beautiful. It was just a studio but not small feeling at all, perfect for a couple. I cannot say enought good things about the Mahana, the location was great, it was beautiful, the view was fantastic. The pool was a little small but I didn't care, I came to swim in the ocean. Yes you can't swim in front of the hotel but I wanted to visit other beaches anyway so it didn't mattered. One of my best memories there is eating a steak on our lanai at sunset, that my husband grilled downstairs. The sunsets are amazing, right in front of the hotel it fells. The Mahana is about 5-10 minutes to kaanapali and maybe 15-20 to Old Lahaina. Request room 812 if you want a studio, I could tell from the lanai furniture of all the other units, compared to ours that we got the best unit. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mahana is one of the main reasons we loved our first trip to Hawaii as much as we did. When we first opened the door to our unit, we were a little freaked out by the 80's "wicker" decor, but after an hour or two, it became our home away from home. We can't wait to go back. - The Unit: Like I said, the decor is a bit out of date, but other than that, the unit was fantastic. Huge shower, stackable washer/dryer, huge lanai overlooking the ocean, living room with entertainment center, sofa, and dining table, and best of all, the BEST VIEW ON THE ISLAND. This property literally backs to the beach. - The Property: High speed wireless internet made emailing pictures super convenient. The pool is kind of small, but there are beach chairs all around the building, so there's always somewhere to get some sun. Because of it's proximity to the western high country, the tradewinds can be very strong, so keep this in mind when planning on laying out at their pool. It can get very windy. - The Beach: Very rocky and mostly reef. The beach itself is great for putting on your mask and fins for snorkeling, but that's about it. The snorkeling in front of the Mahana is fantastic though...don't skip it for some of the others up north. If you want a beach with easy (swimming) ocean access, go north or south 1/2 mile. - The Location: There's a Star Market, dive shop, and a handful of restaurants directly across the street. It's also close to Old Lahaina and Kapalua Beach, which are must visits. Great location, if you're the "touristy" type, or more the "off-the-beaten-path" type. There are spots around for both types of travelers - The Service: We were greeted and lei'd on arrival and given keys to our unit. The front desk folks were always very accommodating and friendly. No complaints at all. - Our Complaints We're non-smokers, and the Mahana rooms are all non-smoking. (They even make you sign a waiver saying you won't smoke in the room) However, people go onto their lanai to smoke, and the smoke drifts over to your lanai and through your screen door. All of a sudden, the inside of your unit smells like smoke. Not a fan of that. Other than that, the Mahana was fantastic. We would definitely recommend it to friends and family, and will stay there again, ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “upscale condo's”
Reviews.Author: skimomkl
Reviews.Content: We planned for 6 month's and were sure we made a good choice with the Kaanapali shores, but were disappointed when we arrived. With 4 couples in our group we knew we wanted to stay elsewhere as we were there 2 weeks. We talked to Georgina at the Mahanna and she put us in 2 gold units,2-bedroom condo's (711 and 911). Both condo's had upscale furnishings, granite, limestone and marble everywhere. The views were panaramic! All the rooms are oceanfront! We got all of this with our entertaiment card at $300 with tax. No parking fees. This complex has a smaller pool, grills for cooking and is not the resort atmosphere. If that is what you are looking for stay here and walk 2 buildings down to the Kaanapali shores. They allow you to eat there and use their facilities, so you can have the best of both worlds. I can not say enough about the staff at Mahanna. They really are all about customer service with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “The best views on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: jackstryker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mahana, room 301 in March of 2006 and can't say enough about the place. We have always stayed on the South side in Kihei and wanted to try the other side of the island with an ocean front property. The view is absolutely spectacular. We spent hours watching the whales from the lanai. There is a grocery store 1/2 mile from the condo as is a fresh fish shop about 3/4 of a mile away. The Mahana has a nice pool, bbq grills and friendly service. Room 301 in excellent condition and is decorated nicely. The only complaint about the place I would have would be the stove inside, which we found to be difficult to work (if you can believe that). Otherwise this condo was spectacular. The Mahana is a bit out of the way, so if you want to have cocktails in Lahaina and take a cab back and forth expect to pay about $30 plus a tip, but if you aren't going to partake and don't mind an easy drive it really is no problem. All in all, the Mahana is worth the money and if you want ocean front, it does NOT get any better than this. P.S. you MUST have a burger at Cheeseburger in Paradise, they are excellent, try Blue Hawaii helicopter rides and for no money, put the top down in your car and keep driving past Kapalua....the views are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Condo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Mahana was wonderful. The Condo was absolutely beautiful. I will definitely recommend this Resort to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, would go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We loved everything about it. The room was huge (1 bedroom) and the views were amazing. We were able to see dolphins swim by every day and the patios are large. We loved that each room had a large deck with table/chairs. The room was clean, and had everything we could possibly need. The decorations were a little cheesy but your on vacation, who cares. It had a nice television, CD/DVD player, etc. Before checking in, we went to the grocery store across the street to stock up. It's nice to have a fridge/kitchen and we would make blended drinks (another plus, they had a blender) while relaxing on the patio. We never used the pool, but did see many famlies down in that area. The beach isnt great, but it was nice to walk down and we mainly went into town, even walked once. Any room with the views we had would cost a fortune at a hotel! Oh and I would recommend "aloha mixed plate". Had the best food & drinks and super cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: Andy Greenwald
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location and has well sized rooms. The view from your room will be right on the ocean and the sunsets are gorgeous. Please be warned that the beach near the hotel is below par and the area is extremely windy. The service was above average, but not as friendly as the ResortQuest we stayed at in Oahu. They are still good. The bathroom was not designed well and needed to be cleaned better. My wife is obsessive about this, but I agreed with her and I am your typical guy. For some reason, we did not sleep as well in this hotel. We think it was related to the pillows, but this is probably different for everybody. Good hotel, good value, and good location adds up to a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved The Mahana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana in March and were there with over thirty-five of us altogether. After a disasterous trip over (missing luggage at the airport,cars sold out at the airport, getting lost for hours trying to find the place! etc.) When you are looking for the place look for The Mahana not Resort Quest Mahana, which is what we were looking for. We were happy to see oceanfront rooms for everyone. Front desk staff, Karen was very friendly and accomodating when I arrived. I wished we'd have known ahead of time that beach towels are provided. We were impressed with the service from the concierge, Jennifer. The next morning, she was a huge help in retrieving lost luggage from the airport as well as organizing all of us on our excursions etc. We had a big group with a lot of demands and some unhappy people, but Jennifer was very patient, calm and organized. She gave us great tips and saved us some money. We went to the Luau at the Hyatt - alot more people that we thought but the food and show was pretty good. The Mahana has no restaurant but there are a few nearby - good dinners within a five minute drive at Seahouse, The Plantation Restaurant and WM, a restaurant across the street. Do: Whalewatch from your balcony - don't need to pay for a trip. Molokini Four Winds snorkel in the morning not in the afternoon - our two and three-year olds had fun with lots of other kids on the boat and enjoyed the glass bottom area. Lanai Sunset Day with Trilogy, the best experience - lots of room on the boat, whales, dolphins and great food! Breakfast at Grandmaâ€™s In Kula on the way to the Tedeshi Winery. CJâ€™s Deli nearby for inexpensive great home cooking and burgers! Horseback Riding at Piiholo Ranch. Sushi at Sensei Restaurant in Kapalua. Save shopping for a day in Paiâ€™a or Makawao - colorful little artists towns. Overall a great experience and weâ€™d definitely come back to the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All of the good things that you've read on previous reviews are accurate. I consider myself a well-traveled individual and I would grade the condo as pretty nice. The staff gave me a great feeling about my choice of lodging...Extremely friendly and interested in making your stay as enjoyable as possible. We ended up staying here for our honeymoon due to the flooding on the island of Kauai and I couldn't have been more pleased. It helped that they heavily discounted the rate. Can't say that that will happen to everyone, but it's nice that they did that for us since we already lost out on $1,300 for our accommodations in Kauai. Some have discounted the quality of restaurants in the area...don't be discouraged. Check out David Paul's and Mala's in Lahaina, the Pineapple Grill in Kapalua Bay and Mama's Fish House in Aina. All of them are a bit spendy except Mala's but they're worth it. If you're up for fish tacos, check out Leilani's in Whaler's village. I'm no connoiseur of fish tacos but these are the best I've had. Not fried.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While in Maui we stayed one week in Kihei and one week at the Mahana and when we go back we will spend our entire time at the Mahana. There was no comparison in condos and not much more money. The view is beautiful and to watch the whales everyday was something I will never forget. We stayed in 409 - 2br - and way bigger than our house and way nicer. The kingsize bed was so comfy and to listen to the ocean while in bed was great. We also looked at a 1 br - 1006 which was beautiful - we will definately ask for those rooms next time. The staff were great and we even played night tennis. The pool was nice, the beach was great - nice to go for walks. We brought our 7 month old and she loved it. We would definately recommend the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Booking Here”
Reviews.Author: Out_I_Go
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at the Mahana from 30 Dec - 2 Jan as part of our honeymoon. The hotel had a policy that reservations during this time must be cancelled by the 23rd. Unfortunately, my husband was hospitalized and it was determined on the 23rd that he could not take the trip. I alerted the Mahana's booking agent by 9:30 a.m. on the 23rd that we need to cancel. They wanted the hospital's verification, which I sent. In spite of these circumstances, they still charged us almost $400, and it took them this long to make that determination. I asked them to reconsider, or at least offer a credit for a future stay, but they refused. Please think twice about a place that does business like this.

Reviews.Title: “An excellant quiet codo.”
Reviews.Author: CraigMI
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor I used Tripadvisor.com extensively to make my decision as to where I would stay during my vacation in Maui. What the majority of people have said about the Mahana is very true. The building is very clean and the employees are very pleasant. My wife and I stayed in Studio #1202. This is the top floor and has a spectacular view. The room was very clean and modern looking. Wireless internet access is available to all rooms. The antennas overhang from the roof, so the best reception is from your balcony. Sitting on the balcony with a cup of Maui coffee surfing the net and checking email suited me just fine. Parking is free and they even have a spot with a hose to spray off your rental vehicle before you return it. Everything was awesome. I can't think of any cons. Of course there is a reef in front of the building which prevents you from swimming, but about 120 yards to the left is an awesome sandy beach. Keep walking (to the left)about 1/2 mile until you are in front of the public beach park and you'll find an awesome snorkeling spot. Buy the book Maui Revealed...it is a great tour guide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to watch whales if Feb, this is the place. Units have large windows. Located a few feet from the water. We sat and watched the whales many mornings, midday and evenings during our stay. The 2br unit was well equipped and clean. Was not cheap furniture. Had plenty of towels but had a problem get enough wash cloths. Seems like four people should get along with 2! Went to desk and got an arm load tho... There isn't any eating facilities on the property, but if you have a rental car, many places to eat are near.. Grounds Maintenance people are washing down the area before daylite each morning. Beach is rocky in water, not a good swimming beach but great for walking in the sand. There are swimming beachs within a short walk.. Nice pool on property. Great place to watch sunset and moon set each day as they go down over the nearby islands. Got really great pictures right from the room.. Problem is, there is so much to do in Maui that you have a hard time being in the condo for a sunset . We would be very happy to stay here again.., But if you need other services on the grounds, better find a hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: JenniferLV
Reviews.Content: I have used TripAdvisor several times for different trips and researched a lot when we booked at the Mahana for our honeymoon. We stayed at the Mahana in October 2005, but wanted to add my experience to this site. We stayed for 5 nights mid October in a one bedroom on the 12th floor. I read many great things from other people about the Mahana and almost everything is true. I would recommend to rent from a private owner to save money and to know in advance the accommodations you are receiving. We paid $150 a night for a well kept, clean and nicely decorated condo. All Mahana condos guarantee an ocean view and beach front(no partial view, beachfront, etc.) I don't believe any other condo in the area offers floor to ceiling windows in the rooms offering a spectacular view. We actually felt like we were on a cruise ship when looking out the window, seeing nothing by blue ocean. Both the bedroom and living room offer a full sliding glass door accessing the lanai. The floorplans are smart (over 900 square feet for the one bedroom). It is true the beach immediately in front is rocky, but if you walk a couple of hundred yards you have sandy beach. We walked both north and south of the Mahana on the beach each morning. There were not many children during our stay which was great for us for a romantic honeymoon. We only used the pool once, but it was clean and just large enough. There is a mini mall within walking distance with a market, great pizza and mexican food. We actually got take out twice and ate on our lanai. Our kitchen was fully stocked with cookware, plates, glasses and dishwashing supplies. The building and the grounds were clean and well kept. We saw facility crews actually cleaning and maintaining the grounds every day. The parking lot was quite full, but not too far to walk to the elevators. The location is right next to the Maui Kai and Embassy Suites. Just a short drive to the other large resorts and restaurants. We enjoyed the fact that we could enjoy the shopping, restaurants and amenities nearby, but not pay the resort price. We had a rental car and would recommend it if you are planning to do a lot of activies in other cities (golf, dining or the road to Hana). We would definately return to the Mahana for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana is great....for what it is”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mahana in a 1 br unit for about a week. Have been to Maui about a dozen times, but this was first time in a condo. Nice, but.... Place was nice enough, but don't expect much in the way of facilities. No restaurant (yes, others mention walking to nearby places, but they aren't REAL restaurants -- more like pizza shops and fast food), you can't swim at the beach (must walk a distance and still have no facilities like chairs), and the pool is tiny for the number of units there and it's mostly in shade for the better part of the day. Parking (as others have mentioned)can be a real pain, especially when you come home in the evening. We also were hassled when we asked for 2 beach towels per person. We were told at the front desk that their policy is "1 towel per person". I guess they never heard of anyone wanting 1 for the chair and 1 for their body! With all that said, yes, the unit was very nice (furniture looked nice, but not the most comfortable) and the views were terrific. Pricing was certainly competitive. Be aware, though, if this is your first trip to Maui and you're looking for something very special, you might want to reconsider the Mahana, or a condo for that matter. You certainly do not get that same "tropical resort" experience as when you stay at a hotel. Hotels have restaurants, lounge areas to sit and listen to music or have a drink or even just listen to the ocean. Hotels (most of them anyway) have beaches you can actually swim in and pools that aren't nestled in between buildings and shaded most of the day. At a hotel, (unlike a condo) you also can treat yourself to a Mai Tai or Blue Hawaii poolside. It's also nice to be able to treat yourself to breakfast on the property if you're so inclined. If, on the other hand, you're just looking for an inexpensive option to a resort/hotel and aren't too concerned about the lack of facilities or extras, the Mahana is certainly fine and probably better than many.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: soxgal78
Reviews.Content: I agree wholeheartedly with the other reviewers who described the Mahana as a great base for your Hawaiian vacation. True, it's not as glamorous or resort-like as some of the hotels along Kaanapali Beach or Wailea, but it was perfect for what we needed -- a comfortable place to sleep, eat some meals, lounge at the pool, and watch the sunset. We weren't bothered by the construction, even though it was being done in our building (the Molokai tower) - probably because we were up and out early most days. If you like sleeping in, I could see how it might be disturbing. We were in room #203 -- a recently renovated studio with a murphy bed. Not tons of room, but plenty for the two of us, and all new appliances and counters in the kitchen made it a little more fun to eat in (which we did, often -- we used the grills downstairs too). The pool is smaller than the resort-like one next door at the Embassy Suites, but it suited us just fine -- there was hardly anyone ever in it! We spent some time at it, or in it, almost every afternoon. (Though the palm trees tend to shade it as the day goes on.) The beach in front of the Mahana is great for walks, and just a 10-minute walk toward Black Rock brings you to a good swimming/snorkeling beach. It's about a 5-10 minute drive to Kaanapali and Lahaina, and another 10 minutes or so north to Napili/Kapalua, which made it a great location. A couple other pluses: Star Market and a Maui Dive Shop in the shopping center across the street, ABC store a 5-minute walk away, and a couple of farmers' markets nearby on Lower Honopiilani Road. By far, the best thing about the Mahana was the view, though....breathtaking sunsets, and we could see the whales playing from our lanai! Even better was the privacy offered by the walls of the lanai -- we could sit outside for hours. We'll be back to Maui, and I'd definitely stay at the Mahana again.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana "No Ka Oi" (is the best)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in unit 415 for 8 nights Jan. 25-Feb.2, 2006. Our second stay at the Mahana, first time was a studio, this is a 1 BR. Excellent view, great furnishings and lots of room. All new appliances with ice maker in fridge. Bed in br. was rather "hard" and murphy bed, while convenient, was rather "soft". The park just south of the resort is great for swimming, snorkeling, and people watching. Had perfect weather all week. I will not stay any where else on Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Management is an issue.”
Reviews.Author: Yokod
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mahana January 26-29, paying $210 (tax included) for a studio on the fourth floor. Absolutely standard for the area, but with no beach, no restaurant and difficult parking after about 8 p.m. On Friday afternoon (Jan 27) I asked the front desk to extend for six days. If a problem, Georgina (Reservations Manager) or Dawn (General Manager) would call. No call. I repeated the sequence on Saturday and Sunday, and there was never a call from management advising that there would be a problem extending our stay. On Monday at 0930, Georgina called to advise that we had to vacate the room by 1100. No recourse and Dawn was unavailable for a higher ruling. As we were hurredly packing to leave, jackhammers and grinders started at ear-shattering levels, so leaving worked out for the best. I suggest to owners that they get management that is considerably more responsive and accessible. I further suggest that owners get management that has some background in hotel operations, e.g., how to walk an incoming guest. If you are considering staying at the place, ask over the PHONE where you will be relative to the construction project and get it in writing and even then be skeptical. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable place with a great view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 7 night stay at the Mahana. The room was very comfortable and homey. The views are incredible. We stayed on the 10th floor, room 1008 and watched whales jump for hours on end. The beach in front of the hotel isn't inviting for swimming even the sides around it aren't. Go to Kaanapali for that. No restuarant or lounge, very disappointing. Grocery store and fish market close by though. The conceirge (sp) was nice enough, but recommended the Trilogy for whale watching. DO NOT DO THIS. They --. Food is terrible, and they are not knowledgeable. They all talk at the same time and don't take you out very far, just circle around in front of the hotels. Recommend Four Winds for snorkeling trip, great food, fun, fun, fun, and you get to see whales and turtles. Overall, the Mahana is a good place if you like quiet activities and stay in the room mostly. Beach bums not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Resortquest Mahana”
Reviews.Author: fartha
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to Clifton Park, NY (Jan.'06)after two beautiful and wonderful weeks at the Mahana. Our rooms were spacious with updated furniture. From the living room you could look out at the islands of Lanai and Molokai and see the whales do their stuff. It was really great. Our bedroom was large and spacious with a king size bed with a lanai that we could sit out on and eat dinner. It is big enough for at least 5 people and more. The pool was warm and also clean. The grounds were always being kept up. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The only problem with this condo is there is no beach that you can walk into. There are other nearby beaches available that are great. We look forward to returning to Mahana and hope to once again get number 1118. What a view.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana for our Honeymoon. We were very pleased with the Mahana. The staff were especially helpful and friendly, the rooms were clean and well maintained. We loved the pool when there weren't too many people in it (usually in the evening) The beach was wonderful, be sure to walk down to the Black Rock. (Slather on the sunscreen) The only down side that we found was the concierge, we talked to her the second day of our vacation. We told her some of the activities that we wanted to sign up for, she insisted on one excursion by Trilogy. She told us it had wonderful food, it had the best snorkeling, great trip etc. We were looking at other ones that were less expensive, but as I said she insisted. Well it was nothing like she promised, the food which was supposed to be a buffet, was bread, cold cuts and chips. There was no fruit as promised, but they did have cinnamon buns...not a great option for those that eat healthy. We had better snorkeling off the beach at the Mahana than on the Island of Lana'i. We felt like we had been duped by someone who I had hoped would direct us to the BEST trip, for the BEST price. All in all you will love the Mahana for it's affordability, friendly staff and easy access to groceries and fine dining. One note though, the Mahana is not luxurious, but it is warm and inviting...perfect for a Honeymoon. We look forward to future visits!

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana was just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana (room 205) in August 2005 for our honeymoon and loved it there! The Mahana was perfect for what it is... make no mistake, this is not a Four Seasons or a Ritz-Carlton, but it's perfect for a place to sleep between days spent out and about. The Mahana is all condos (we had a 1 bed/2 bath unit) and every unit has a full frontal ocean view (the ocean is maybe 100 feet away) with the neighboring islands of Molokai and Lanai easily visible from the lanai or the huge wall of windows in the living room. Every sunset we saw from the lanai was different and breathtakingly beautiful! The unit has a full kitchen with a fridge, stove, and microwave as well as dishes, cookware, and silverware. At the start of our visit we went across the street to the grocery store, stocked up on items for breakfasts and prepared our breakfast in the kitchen every morning and ate on the lanai. Be sure to eat as much pineapple while in Maui - it's incredibly fresh and creamy and sweet! The Mahana isn't a resort and doesn't have a restaurant, but it was a perfect place for us to sleep, and get ready in the morning for whatever activities we had planned that day. The swimming isn't that great right in front of the hotel, but if you walk 75 to 100 feet to the left there is a nice, sandy (and secluded) area for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Maha Mahana!”
Reviews.Author: gowpande
Reviews.Content: I had read and heard a lot about Mahana and it was with considerable excitement that we unlocked the door and entered our room in the 10th floor. And lo behold, the view from the living room and the balcony beat our lofty expectations slam dunk! Just the right place for family and honeymooners alike, without beling too hotelish nor motelish. The front lobby staff were friendly, service was quick, appliances worked without a hitch, maids serviced the room daily- everything as advertised. The only regrettable part of the vacation (it is not Mahana's fault) was the return ticket that would take us away from the paradise back to the grind in California.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for West Maui”
Reviews.Author: Robert_N_SF
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Mahana and I was very pleased. We rented a 2 bedroom and it was very comfortable. I'd highly recommend it. Our unit was clean and well furnished. My only complaint would be that the kitchen was poorly stocked. The staff was very nice and there is a great concierge there daily to help with packages, dinner reservations etc. The property is literally on the beach but the beach has alot of coral. However, if you walk a few yards in either direction there is great swimming and boogie boarding. We had a rental car so we were very happy about free parking. A car would be useful here otherwise your dining and shopping choices will be limited. There is a good grocery within walking distance. This is a condo so units will vary but I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Oceanfront property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mahana Kaanapali from Dec 1 to 5. As we were on our honeymoon, they upgraded us from a studio to a one bedroom. It made a huge difference for us. It had great views of the ocean. As the unit had two bathrooms, getting ready early for activities like bike down the volcano was easier! Having a full kitchen and washer/dryer in the unit was a bonus. We were on the 6th floor and could still access the 'free' wireless internet connection from the room. I am not giving it 5 stars because there was still some construction going on outside the unit which was loud at times. The construction hardly bothered us, except one day, because we were out of the unit before it started on most of the days!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean view is an understatement!”
Reviews.Author: sharima
Reviews.Content: We stayed in our one bed, two bath (even though we only paid for a one bath) #1105 condo in Dec. The first thing that strikes you when you walk in is the windows with floor to ceiling ocean views in the living room and bedroom. And I mean total OCEAN view. You have to walk right up to the window to even see the beach! We could lay on our bed and look out at the ocean, and of course hear the waves all night (though it got a little loud for my husband and he used earplugs some of the time because we couldn't bear to shut the door, the weather was so beautiful!) Most of our unit had been updated and was very comfortable. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana in April 2005 (I know, a little late for a review). We choose the Mahana based on the reviews. Let me start off by saying, this is a wondeful place to stay...very quiet, exactly what we were looking for. If/when we go back to Maui we will stay there agin. When we first arrived we were disappointed, our first room was in great need of a makeover...dreary bathroom, stained carpet, etc...The wonderful staff was very nice in response, letting us view other units that were available. We choose unit #102. What a relief, the unit was wonderful and we could literally walk out our door to the lawn and beach. So the lesson is, if you are picky about the style of unit you stay in (like us), we would suggest booking directly through the owner, rather than the hotel, that way you know the exact unit you are going to get.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ocean view”
Reviews.Author: z4017
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Mahana (unit 418, to be more precise) simlpy because of solid recommendations on tripadvisor.com, it is definitely a good decision!! The building itself ia a bit old (compared with the Embassy nearby), but the exterior and interior has been renovated and therefore looks good. The ocean view from the condo is simply gorgeous, I even spotted a humpback whale once from the lanai. The beach is also steps away, and this makes another good part as my kids were fond of playing sand on the beach. However, if kids travel with you, then the one bed room unit will be a little bit crowded (though kids can sleep on the sofa bed).

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: justme13
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from Maui, and the Mahana, and hated to leave. The Mahana is an extremely well kept, beautiful resort within a stone's throw from the ocean. Our room, 812, was a recently renovated (late 2004) room with granite countertops, ceramic tiles, new appliances and a great queen sized bed. We were a little more than 1/2 way up, and it was perfect. Quick elevators. Nothing obstructed our view, plus we could hear the ocean every night without any problem. (With or without the patio door open) You can sit on the balcony and stare at the ocean all day and night. We saw beautiful sunsets and watched the moon set every morning at well. And the stars - it seemed like you could reach out and grab them. Though you can't swim in the water directly in front of the hotel due to some large rocks in the ocean, go a few hundred feet either direction and you're all set. The beaches are very clean. The Mahana is very quiet and not "busy" like some of the other beach area hotel areas. The pool is nice, and warm and was not crowded. BBQ's allow you to cook out right near the pool. There is a market across the street (about a 10 minute walk), or there is a Safeway up the street toward Lahaina. I guess I would sum this place up as affordable,quaint, and convenient (10 min ride to Lahaina, 5 min to Whaler's Village, about 45 min to the airport when the road's aren't busy). We traveled all around the whole island, and if we were to return, we would stay here again among all the choices we saw. It was perfect for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for first Maui visit”
Reviews.Author: mauibabe
Reviews.Content: Our very first visit to Maui was booked through travel agent and was booked into Mahana. We had 1 bedroom in the Lanai bldg. Room 817. Like everyone else, the views were awesome. Sounds of the ocean were very soothing. We were so excited to finally be in Maui, that we could have overlooked alot of negatives. It was clean and spacious, but needed updated, that is for sure. If you want a beach for swimming, you have to walk about 100 yds to left at airport beach. Too many reef like rocks in front of Mahana. You do get great views of both Molokai and Lanai. We did have a pleasant stay, but we weren't in our room much. Since then, we've been to Maui twice, and have booked our next visit. From all that I've been hearing, there is alot of updating going on. That can only be a plus when it is completed. If you want a a swimming beach and ocean front views, try Kahana beach. There are two condo resorts there that are very affordable and well worth the stay. Valley Isle Resort and Hololani. If you want a 2bdrm unit, you've got to try the Hololani. We are repeat visitors there and highly recommend it. Just look at the reviews on this web page.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Princess-Gadabout
Reviews.Content: I was worried sick about checking into the Mahana, after hearing horror stories of other condos on Maui. I read every review on TripAdvisor before making my reservation, and was almost sick in my stomach when my charge card was charged immediately for our full stay. Imagine my relief when we entered our one bedroom studio (513). It was spotless and tastefully decorated, but what truly wowed me were the amenities and view. We had unlimited ice, laundry detergent, dish detergent, dishwasher detergent, plates, soap, shampoo, lotions, etc. all provided. We immediately did a load of clothes and turned off the AC to sit outside on the lanai. Every night was a different sunset - pinks and golds, clouds and rainbows. I never heard one sound from the surrounding units or from outside. The staff were the most friendly and accommodating I've ever encountered. One of them actually took the time to get a map and show us a restaurant he takes his family to for breakfast (the Gazebo -- and it was wonderful, also -- topped off the only sea turtle I've ever seen in the wild!!). The maid was thorough and sweet. Our room was spacious and we did not see any bugs (another fear I had). The bed was a queen with the softest sheets and nice, fluffy pillows, and we ate every meal on the lanai. The trip was to celebrate my Mother's 75th birthday, and I can truly say the condo was so nice and cozy, that we often chose to stay in our room and watch the sunsets rather than eat out. We shopped at the Star Market and recommend the Old Lahaina Luau. Lahaina means "cruel sun," and I must say I hated every second spent shopping there. At night we left the patio door open and slept to the sounds of the ocean crashing below. I would definitely stay in this resort again and recommend it highly. After driving around Maui, I can honestly say this was the best location off Honoapiilani Highway. The resort is on a dead end and parking was always available. We hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views”
Reviews.Author: sywhitlock
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Mahana after reading countless reviews on several hotels/resorts. This is my third trip to Maui; we previously stayed at the Westin and the Grand Wailea, respectively. This trip was for my 50th Birthday and we were travelling with another couple. I was so afraid that it might not live up to some of the reviews, but as soon as we walked into the door of unit 415; we were just delighted and awed by the gorgeous view of the ocean and beach. The unit itself looked like it had been recently renovated and was just beautifully decorated. We had a one-bedroom unit and it ended up having 2 full baths! We were only expecting one, so this was a very pleasant surprise! For the money, I just don't think you could find a nicer place. The pool is not great, but is okay. Not as fancy as some of the other resorts, but remember that these are private residences. We stayed on the go a lot sightseeing, so really didn't matter a lot to me. A word of warning: if you smoke and think that you will smoke "outside on the balcony" forget it! It is not emphasized that this is a mostly no smoking property and you can be charged $250.00 if you are caught smoking on the premises except for a couple of designated areas! The other couple that we were with ran into a problem with this. Overall, this was a great property and I would definitely recommend it to anyone, especially non-smokers!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Kaanapali beachfront..The Mahana”
Reviews.Author: Firkins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in room 413 at the Mahana for 15 nights from October 4 to October 19, 2005. We are a retired couple married 42 years. Owners had only recently renovated and upgraded the studio aparment. It appeared that only about 4 or 5 previous guests/families had occupied this unit since it was renovated. Everything was very nice! It had everything we needed from the range/oven, dishwasher, refrigerator (ice maker too!), washer/dryer, television, VCR, AC, King size bed, etc. etc. Just like a real home. Daily maid service was great too providing fresh towels and guest supplies like a regular hotel. Only difference was that complete changing of bedsheets was done only every 4 days...no big deal. The unit/room was perfect. The outside hallways, lobby, gardens, pool area etal were excellently maintained. Everyday someone was picking weeds, trimming bushes, etc. And then comes the beach.. Short wading distance on this beach due to low underwater rocks about 30-40 feet out. But it looks just like all of Kaanapali beaches...lovely! Walk 100 yards right or left and you'll find plenty of fine places to walk, sit, swim the surf without those rocks. Watching those sunsets nightly from the lanai got us some great pictures. I even got "moonlight" (it was full moon on several nights) on the water pictures. Get ready for the sound of crashing surf..all night long! As many other reviewers have pointed out...you are 10 minutes walking distance from a major large grocery store (Star Market) and a 10 minute or less walk to restaurants at either the Embassy Vacation Suites (a timeshare and a BIG one!) or ResortQuests Kaanapali Shores. The entire area is condominium after condominium and all seem in good repair. Some construction re-facing the Mahana oceanside walls is continuing. We were in the building which was not being done during our visit. Be sure to ask for a unit not near the construction. They could be a little noisy. All in all this is a great place to stay during a visit to Maui. Prices are reasonable based on a really "overpriced" Island of Maui. I guess you've got to pay for paradise, huh? Just a quick footnote...you might wonder just what one of these units at the Mahana might sell for. I am a retired Realtor. During our stay one Mahana 2 bedroom unit was having an open house. We made the visit. Asking price for 1300 sq. ft.= $1,950,000. I asked the Realtor how much a one room studio would sell for (if one were available...Not!) . Answer: Approximately $650,000. Remember this is a 100% beachfront condominium. I think we'll just rent through ResortQuest Thank You! I could ramble on more but I think it best that YOU go and find out for yourself knowing that The Mahana has this couples' 5 star rating. Oh!...One more thing!....Thank you TripAdvisor for providing the BEST accomodation research website on the net! Really! It has helped us repeatedly pick the best places for our travels. Absolutely great! You deserve these accolades. Oh yeh...visit Pizza Paradiso near the Star Supermarket for the best pizza ever!!!!!!! Now I'm gone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the condo”
Reviews.Author: looceejane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 5 day trip to Maui. We loved the Mahana. Next time we will plan on staying much longer. Our one bedroom oceanfront suite was incredible. It felt like a real home. The kitchen was outfitted with all you'd ever need. There was a grocery store and shops within walking distance and a Safeway within easy driving distance. We did our own cooking and meals except for a couple of special nights out. Maid service was great, air conditioner worked really well, and we loved the sound of the ocean lapping on the beach as we fell asleep each night. The staff was always courteous and very helpful. The pool water was a little chillier than we were used to, since we are from Texas and the wind really blew a lot. Some renovations were in progress on the units on the far end of the resort, but this did not cause us any problems or inconvenience. We would certainly consider returning to this resort in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth my time or money (or yours)”
Reviews.Author: dgs146
Reviews.Content: I gave it one dot only because I couldn't give it a 0. First off, the management does read and respond to these reviews, as we found out. I've read a few reviews from unhappy vacationers that the management responded to, so I thought the vacationers were a rare exception to a usually nice stay. Well, I found out I was way wrong. My wife and I came here for part of our honeymoon - 4 beautiful nights in Maui. Maui was great, but this hotel was horrible - from the rooms, to the management. The management even lied to us. Let's start with our first night there. They knew we were on our honeymoon, yet the management decided to put us in a room where they pushed 2 twin beds together to make a king size. My wife slept about 2 hours that night because she kept falling in the crack. This crack was in addition to the horrible creaking from the headboard that maintence said "there's nothing that they can do to fix". So, the next morning, we switched rooms. Don't get me worng, the views from these rooms were amazing...but not worth this hastle. When we went to the front desk, they blamed our travel agent on them giving us this room because "they can't guarantee a certain room". They knew we were on our honeymoon. Why would you push 2 twin beds together for honeymooners? Our next room, was the same room type (a studio) and it was enough. The rooms had everything we needed, but....they were remodeling the room next to us. It wasn't the noise...we went snorkeling in the morning of our last full day there and we were going to a luau that night. We wanted to come back to the room to relax between the events. That must of been our mistake. They were painting the room next to us and the fumes were coming right into our room. Right into it. I called down to the front desk and they simply told me to open the door on the lanai. Brilliant solution as the odor got worse. My wife and I got raging headaches from the fumes. I called the front desk again - keep in mind that their only solution to this was to open our patio door. This time, they told us they would call up tp the next room. 20 minutes later, I call the front desk again. What's going on? Well, nobody in that room answered - SO THEY DID NOTHING ELSE. We wanted to take a nap and relax but we couldn't because the paint fumes were so bad that they guy doing the painting had to leave the room every 5 minutes. We went to the front desk and they told us that there was nothing they could do because they can't stop people from remodeling their condos. How can there be nothing for them to do? Finally, after arguing with the front desk for 15 more minutes, they finally got the manager to call back. My wife talked to the manager and they finally reached an agreement - they would move us - into our 3rd room in 3 nights so far - and comp us the room on our last night if we stayed there our last night. So that's what we did because we didn't have much more time to relax before our luau. Well, half an hour into our relaxing, the manager calls up to our room and asks us if we've found a new hotel yet. What about our agreement? She also blamed us for opening the door to the lanai to air out the room as her front desk attendant told us to do. Well, she refused to comp us the room or do anything else for us. We were both furious. They lied to us. My favorite thing about the place was when we left. If you're remodeling every single room in the place, why not do it a floor at a time? Oh, and by the way, the reason the paint fumes were so bad in our room (I found this out on the way up to our next room) is because they were painting right outside our air intake for the AC. In short, don't read the management responses - they lie. We gave them the benefit of the doubt, and they ruined 2 nights and a day of our honeymoon. Their front desk staff was horrible with customer service. They call to the room that is being remodeled because my wife is high on paint fumes and do nothing else? We have 3 rooms on our 4 night stay and they don't offer to comp us. Oh, and we had to fill out more paperwork with them when we checked in than we did when we got our marriage license. They lie, their customer service is horrible, and I feel sorry for any person that has to stay there. There's much better on Maui - don't waste your time or your money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: Potari
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on this site and driving myself nuts, we chose the Mahana and were not disappointed. The views are unbelievable and the price was very good. We rented a 1 BR 2 BA direct from owners. The unit is completely remodeled very tastefully done with granite kitchen and bathrooms. Looked brand new. We woke up looking at the ocean in bed (unit 1017). If I was looking for a condo again, would definitely rent this one but we had such a great time, we ended up purchasing a timeshare! The only negative about the condo for the kids is the pool is just ok, but they had the beautiful ocean so who needed a pool!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect suite for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over a week for our honeymoon in November '04 and LOVED it! It was affordable, had a spectacular view and the staff was great. We awoke each morning to a beautiful view from our lanai. It's in a convenient location too, and there's a fabulous restaurant across the street (Java Jazz) for breakfast, Lunch or Dinner. Don't stay anywhere else- can't beat this view for the money.

Reviews.Title: “3rd trip,can't Imagine staying anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: rangermax
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room#1116 for 15nights and had a wonderful time. The unit we had on this trip was fantastic. I have read many posts referring to the construction and I can say that in our case it was not an issue whatsoever. We did hear noise 1 time for about 30 minutes, but think about it.....we are in Maui,things could be worse. I look at it in that if they don't continue to make improvements/mtce then we would find somewhere else to stay. We were also told they plan to tile the pool area and add a hottub so to the owners/boardmembers & all the staff THANK YOU for keeping the place nice. We went to the beaches,snorkeled,went to the Iao needle,blow hole, Warren & Annabelle's,Olivine Pools ,Haleakala as well as many other things and had a great time!! The only negatives we had is that several restuarants service was terrible but again it's Maui so we have no complaints. Take care and be safe.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana was great”
Reviews.Author: skopi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 512 of the Mahana in Kaanapali from 9/30 to 10/6. We were impressed with the condo and would stay there again when we return to Maui. Our room was one of the small studio condos. Nothing glamorous but it fit my wife and I just fine. The condo is right on the beach and you are treated to daily sunsets and occasional rainbows. The pool is small but adequate. The beach immediately behind the condo is not swimmable but you can walk either north a couple of minutes to get to the Embassy Suites' beach or south a few minutes to have your own. We had quite a few meals from the Star Market across the street. Everything was more expensive than at home, but cheaper than eating out all the time. There are no restaurants at the Mahana but you can walk to the Embassy and use theirs if needed. We had drinks over there. I'd recommend the Lava Flow but not the mai tai. As noted by others, there is no easy path to the Embassy so we walked on the beach to get there. Nearby we ate at Pizza Paradiso which was good and Java Jazz which was not that exciting. (slow service and the Thai chicken was bland). We felt it is in the perfect location because it is not too crowded but still only 10 minutes from Lahaina. It is a longer drive to get to the road to Hana or Haleakela but worth it to us. We were near the action but also in a quiet location. The staff was friendly. We had cable tv in our room (okay, mostly just important for Sunday morning NFL games). Overall, a very nice experience and we would recommend The Mahana to others...

Reviews.Title: “Even construction couldn't ruin this magic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana #305 for 10 days for our honeymoon. The views are unbelievable. There is no hotel/condo complex closer to the water then the Mahana. We stayed in room 305 which is quite nicely furnished. I usually like a more contemporary look but the old hawiian furnishing is very nice. Most pictures don't do it justice. If you need A/C you may be a little dissappointed. I am a very warm sleeper that usaully needs A/C but the ocean breeze kept me plenty cool. Lahaina town has the best restauraunts. Do not eat in the Whalers Villiage! Expensive..touristy...crappy food. Our favorite restauraunt was Cafe o"Lei next to Kimo's. It was an unbeleivable trip. If your looking for relaxation and great weather.. Go to Maui. I have to mention that there was some construction which we were not informed about prior to our trip. They were re-facing the concrete on the front of the building. Make sure to ask about possible constrution during your trip. If you don't ask they won't tell you. It ruined my cofee/morning paper on the lanai for about 3 days. The good things far outweighed the bad and most everyplace in Maui is under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We cant' say enough good about this condo! Daily maid service, beautiful view of Molokai and Lanai, all suites ocean front complete with ocean sounds to lull us to sleep every night. And privacy--very important on a honeymoon. We could sit out on the balcony and not see a single fellow guest. Our studio came with a California King bed and was plenty large for two people. We were so enamored of the Mahana we have seriously considered purchasing a unit in the near future. At the very least, we will be back. And soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned (9/1/05) from our stay at the Aston Mahana condo resort. This is not a hotel, per se. Theyâ€™re individually owned condos - the decor varies. Our unit was a 2 br - very nice with all amenities provided. great views. Five of us slept easily. The building is not new by any means but is very clean and well located near Kaanapalli beach. The staff at the front desk is very helpful. Maid service daily will help tidy up and make the beds. As noted previously, the beach in front of the property is not suitable for swimming; however, there are great beaches within 10 min drive. Plenty of restaurants in the area - expect to spend $$$ on Maui. We had no problems at all and would recommend this property to anyone. Itâ€™s a more affordable alternative to the many expensive hotels on Maui. The extra room that a condo provides will be appreciated if your travelling with kids

Reviews.Title: “This place spoiled me! I'll never be able to stay in a hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: lillycoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana from 8/28 to 9/3 and loved it! We started out in a one bedroom condo on the seventh floor of the south building. It was lovely and confortable, with a wonderful view. When my husband found a centipede near our washing machine, he informed the desk and they upgraded us to a larger two bedroom condo on the fourth floor of the north building for no additional charge. It was equally well-equipped (it even had a pastry roller and numerous other kitchen gadgets, in case I wanted to make a pie!), and very spacious. I've read other folks reports of construction noise and I did see workmen, but honestly we never heard a thing. Once we saw a workman go by our window on a scaffold, which my young daughter thought was very comical. While I loved staying here, I really wished for the following: - A hot tub. I would have LOVED to be in a hot tub. I thought that they were standard issue with swimming pools, but not a this place. - Better pathways between the Mahana and the Embassy. The Mahana doesn't have a restaurant, but you can go to the Embassy (two buildings down) restaurants and have your bill charged to your room at the Mahana. When we walked to the Embassy the first night, we found ourselves weaving through the dark parking lots to get there. There is no obvious path and the parking lots are not connected. We walked back via the beach (romantic, but with a four year old child our main concern was getting her back to the room safely, and not having her hit by a wave in the dark). When we asked the safest way to get to the Embassy, we were told to walk on the beach. (Driving is silly too - it is way to close). All in all, we did find the staff there to be very accommodating - we arrived before checkin time, and they gave us a couple of keys so we could choose which room we went in, which was great. Also, both condos we stayed in were non-smoking, another plus.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: haidz
Reviews.Content: Our anniversary wouldn't be as much fun if my husband & I didn't stay at The Mahana! We stayed in a studio room for 6 nights and the view was just incredible! All rooms are oceanfront! I could hear the ocean, see the hawaiian rainbow from our lanai almost every morning and the amenities in our room for the price that we've paid for is just worth every penny. However, despite of all the luxuries that I've had there are a few downsides: the beach is not a swimming beach (what the heck! kaanapali & kapalua is just a few minutes away :), no restaurant onsite (although, the closest is just right next to the hotel which is located at the Embassy Suites). Overall, this hotel is amazing and to justify my posting we'll back on November '05!

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy with construction noise - Vacationers beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The ocean view is great; quality of room furnishings varied from so-so (3-star) to impressive (5-star) - we happened to be in a so-so room. The main thing that we were unhappy about was the construction noise that we found out about halfway through our 6-day stay, when we had to check in to our room early afternoon for a quick break from our hectic schedule. The front desk did offer to find us another room on our 4th day but given our hectic schedule and the fact that we were already well settled in, it was not practical. I feel that the management/reservations staff could have been forthcoming and warned us about this well ahead of time since it turns out this is not an emergency repair but a planned construction. The front desk later informed us that the construction was on the 4th floor but where we were on the 2nd floor, the banging, drilling, hammering seemed to be right next door to us and didn't help us when we were trying to get a few minutes' rest.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Beware of Construction”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mahana is quite lovely and is situated oceanfront (every room does have a full ocean view). For those that like to see a bit of beach and palm trees with the ocean fronting these, than get a room on the lower floors; otherwise, it feels like you have a room that is basically sitting right on the ocean, with just water from your lanai out to as far as you can see (unless you look directly down). It is quite beautiful to sit on your lanai each evening and watch sunsets. The rooms are each different, thus some rooms are very nice and some need refurbishment. In general though, the rooms are quite comfortable and with a tropical feel. Beware of ONGOING DAILY (except weekends) CONSTRUCTION in the south building. We originally had a studio in this building that was very, very lovely (view of the tops of palm trees, the beach, and ocean; with granite countertops, new appliances, ice maker, comfortable queen bed, and lovely rock-tiled shower)---yet beginning on Monday morning, hammering and saw-sounding shrieks began. The staff will tell you this will only last in the morning. However, the workers arrive at 8 a.m. and get on the several scaffolds attached to the building and for the first hour, do quiet work (e.g., painting) and then beginning at 9 a.m. very loud construction noises may reverberate through your condo (depending on your location---reverberated through ours to the point that we left our condo early). If you privately rent a condo, then you have to deal with the owner, to see if you can make other arrangements (and I'm not sure the outcome; a guy was at the front desk trying to figure this out, since he was in the middle of construction too). If you make arrangements not through a private owner, you may be able to switch to the north building (which is very quiet). We had to wait two days until we could switch and therefore, spent two days of our vacation avoiding our condo from early morning until late afternoon. The workers are on the scaffolding from 8am-3pm or so; don't believe otherwise---we watched this for a week. And it looks like renovation/refurbishment work on the outside of that building will last for quite some time (months). Check before you make reservations!!! When we were finally able to get a studio in the north building (move), we could get up in the morning, enjoy the lanai and a slow breakfast, read the paper, watch the ocean, and then leisurely leave the room---rather than *have* to clear out of the room early, to avoid such disturbing noise on vacation. It was lovely from then on.....and we can then recommend this property. Otherwise, it's a lovely, lovely place. Great staff (very friendly and helpful, in general). Great location. Wonderful beach for swimming and snorkeling. Wonderful accomodations, if you get a place that is not too in need of inside refurbishment nor near construction. Very well maintained property.
