Reviews.Title: “A Spacious and Relaxing Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler111Stamford
Reviews.Content: Great spot with incredible views. We had a one bedroom that also had 2 Murphy beds that were a big hit with my daughter. The hotel also has free, wireless high speed internet which worked fine in our room on the 10th floor. Overall, most people at the Mahana were friendly. The woman at the activities desk was very helpful and honest in her evaluations. While the hotel lacks a beautiful beach for swimming in front with beach chairs, there is enough public beach around to satisfy most people. Breakfast on the private balcony is worth it alone. I would definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more..”
Reviews.Author: Hellykitto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana for our honeymoon and we could not have asked for a better place to stay for our first trip to Maui. Our unit was spotless and wonderfully furnished. It had all the comforts of home and the maid service did an excellect job keeping the condo immaculate. We had wonderul access to the beach and there is a shopping center a block away that came in very handy. There was some construction going on which only became bothersome on one of the 6 days we were there but the staff was very accomadating and offered us another room. We loved our condo too much to switch and decided to stick it out. The noise only lasted a little while and it was back to peace and quiet again. My husband and I are already planning are next stay at the Mahana! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: tk07080
Reviews.Content: What a view...every condo faces the ocean, with a sunset view. Our condo was a spacious 1 BR with king bed and a sectional with pullout sofa in the living room. A full kitchen, full laundry, 1 bath. Very Clean. The fastest elevator we've ever encountered. Nice lanai with table and chairs. No restaurant, not even coffee. Friendly staff. Swimming is not permitted in front of the premises, but is allowed 100 yards away. No hot tub...a little dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and stay”
Reviews.Author: jts430
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Manhana for five nights and would highly recommend this property. This was our sixth trip to the islands and have always stayed in very nice hotels (Sheartons, Hyatts) and was a little leary about staying somewhere else but we have found our new home. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and our room (1214) was on the top floor and we enjoyed listening to waking up to the waves each morning. The view was unforgettable and our two teenagers enjoyed the spacious living room. I tend to be pretty critical but my only negative comment was that the shower head was about a foot to low for an average person, otherwise perfect. Even though we only enjoyed breakfast in the room, the kitchen had everything you would have at home. There was even 20-30 paperback novels in the livingroom that we enjoyed while taking in the sun. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this property. We definitely will attempt to book again the next time we visit Maui,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oceanside Condo/Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahanna for 5 nights in July. We had a small studio room but it was perfect for the two of us. The kitchen was well equipped for all our cooking needs. We enjoyed having our meals on the lanai overlooking the ocean. We saw many beautiful sunsets and rainbows from our lanai. Our only complaint was that the Murphy bed was so low to the floor and the mattress was a bit hard to our liking. We got use to it though and really enjoyed listening to the ocean sounds at night. This resort is great for couples young or old or families who would like a quiet retreat and who are not looking for alot of action. If you want action, you can just walk down the beach a little to the Embassy Suites. There is a small shopping area nearby for groceries and an ABC store not too far down the road. We would definitely recommend snorkeling from Lahaina to Molikini. There is also a great spot for snorkeling about a hundred yards south of the resort. You can't swim right in front of the resort because of the coral but you can walk just a few yards in either direction and find a good spot for swimming. Twilight golf at the Kaanapali Golf Course is also a great buy. We would definitely return to this resort and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana is Terrific”
Reviews.Author: nascar_fan24
Reviews.Content: Mahana was everything we hoped it would be. My husband, son and parents went. We have never been to Maui. So our hopes were high. We arrived late in the evening. Our first impression of our Room 1009 was that it was terrific. Full kitchen new stainless appliances granite countertops beautiful furnishings in every room. Fancy bathrooms. But our best impression was first thing the next morning. When you looked out the front window there was a double rainbow and when you walked into the living room you had the most beautiful view of the ocean you could imagine. You can see both islands from your windows. THIS VIEW IS DEFINITELY A WOW FACTOR. We spent every day out and about touring the island. We found some fabulous beaches to check out. Tried some of the restuarants. Since we had a rental car it was very easy to get around. Travelled quite a bit between Lahania and Kaanapoli. We liked to eat breakfast on the porch and enjoy the view. We also grilled dinner a time or two at the pool area and ate on the porch watching the sunset. Absolutely breathtaking. There is a Star Market a little ways from condo and there is a huge Safeway about 10/15 minutes up the road. Made one trip and had everything we needed for the week. Make sure you get some of the Maui gold pineapple, delicious. Drive to Hana, definitely an all day trip, but nice scenery, my parents really enjoyed this part of the trip. If you don't want to use a whole day - this trip is probably not for you. Went to the Old Lahania Luau. It was nice. You must book this WEEKS/MONTHS in advance. Saw the Warren & Annabelle Magic show. This is worth every penny and more. Everyone in our group had a great time and it is one of the things in our trip that we tell everyone about. Also checked out the aquarium on the last day on the way back to the airport. This was nice. The pool is small, but it is nice. We didn't really spend alot of time there. We were to busy checking out beaches and sightseeing. We did not see any bugs and yes there appears to be ongoing maintenance, but they must do this to keep everything nice. Maid service was fine, I have no clue what time she came and it didn't matter because it was always done by the time we got back in the evening. The entire staff was always friendly. Hope this helps with your planning

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Maui, what a wonderful place to stay. The Aston Mahana made our trip very enjoyable. We were well pleased with the two bed room condo. The view was perfect. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The locaton was perfect. We did have a minor problem with the air-condition but the problem was corrected on the day we reported it. There was construction work outside the building but it did not cause us any problems. I think for the price paid we were well pleased. Would we do it again? YES

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, good location, clean, pleasant service”
Reviews.Author: olallaalum
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Mahana during our honeymoon at the recommendation of a friend and after reading glowing reviews on this site. It did not disappoint. What it lacks as far as the glamour and chicness of a Sheraton or Fairmont it makes up for in comfort and coziness, kind of like staying in the apartment of your favorite aunt who decorates with lots of soothing white wicker and happens to have an incredible beach view. We opted for the bottom floor so we could open our door and walk out onto the grassy strip of lawn and then the beach. Beautiful sunsets. Our unit had a kitchen which came in handy for breakfast and a little washer and dryer. Look forward to our next stay at the Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “great views, bad AC”
Reviews.Author: crutch
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at Mahana and I had been there several years ago and wanted to stay because of the great parking, tremendous views and able to have breakfast on lanai. However, it was hot while we were there and the ac could not cool the unit. Called maintenance and that was a joke. Told us to keep it half way and "it would run us out". It ran us out alright, but from the heat. Then when we checked out, girl at desk said units were out. Odd maintenance wouldn't know that. We pulled the blinds everyday and all but it was hot, so I would check on that if you like to be cool at night and there during the day. We were on top floor in the building farther north renting from an individual so you can't ask for a change but others were having same problem. Construction was going on in the other building so guess need to be glad we weren't in that one as well. I would check on the construction as well. Perfect for couples wanting quiet if all is working well.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, clean, peaceful, great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want somewhere close to the Kaanapali Beach Resorts, Whaler's Village, and Lahaina.........this is a nice choice. Very quiet and clean, with the added bonus of a kitchen and washer/dryer and a great ocean view. The pool is pretty basic and the beach is just ok, but you can walk or drive to some nice swimming beaches nearby. It does lack the convenience of a restaurant, but there are a few fast food places and market only a block away. And after the feeling of being nickeled and dimed in the nearby resort hotels (i.e. Sheraton, where some friends were staying), this is a nice alternative.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: golfchoker
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at the Mahana. Had two different rooms, went to Kauai for a couple of days. The entire place is kept very clean, the staff was wonderful and both the condos were excellent. The view is incredible. The beach in front is not the greatest but there are so many beaches on Maui, it takes only a few minutes to get to them. There is plenty of good dining nereby. Was close enough to Lahina, Kaanapali that we enjoyed the location. Most fun entertainment was Warren's magic show in Lahina, it is a must see. Greatest show I have ever seen. Haleakala is wonderful, Hana is overrated. The north shore drive is well worth the time.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana at the recommendation of our travel agent and after much internet research. We were looking for beach access, privacy. peace and quite and comfort, the Mahana filled the bill on all counts, we loved it!! Awaken every morning to the crashing waves on the beach, breakfast on your own Lanai. We stayed in 817 and it was great..everything you need right down to the filter for the coffee maker!! Only draw back was some construction while we were there..understandable and commendable (place looks great) but hammering can get a little beat when you are on vacation This will be done eventually,.. but you may want to request not to be near any ongoing contstruction. Sunsets are unbelievable and I am told during the season the whale watching is as well ( we were a little late for them and didn't get to see any during our stay May 3-13). Great restaurants nearby if you don't feel like cooking..hitting Costco just outside the airport is a great idea for stocking up but there's a Star Market within walking distance from the Mahana that was good too ( a little pricey but then everything on Maui is!!) We snorkeled every day and the absolute best spot was 200 yards south of the Mahana toward Black Rock..beautiful Blue coral reef, tons of fish and the Green Sea turtles start feeding about 10 or 11 am every day.. If you find my watch there enjoy it!! Remember don't touch the coral and leave the turtles alone they'll come to you, if they are curious and they often are! Did the Hana trip..be sure to eat at Polli's Mexican rest. on the way Yum!..long but worth it for the views..the driver doesn't get to see as much because you have to pay such attention every secong to your driving!, Haleakala is a must see..will do the horse trip next visit....We drove the west end/north shore all the way and found it absolutely stunning..many guides say to avoid it do to the hazardous roads etc...think they are just trying to keep us tourists out of there though!! ( don't blame them) Highly recommend the Hula Grill$$$( Whalers Village) at least one night for the sunset..great food and great staff . Just strolling Lahaina is great,..tons of places to eat etc, and the Warren and Annabelle show is a must..the guy is riot!! Its so popular you will need a reservation before you travel just to get in.they have a web site! ( brush up on your Andy of Mayberry trivia before going and you may win a prize!!) The Trilogy Lana'i Experience trip is fantastic and well worth the $.. we did the Molokini trip with them as well but frankly the Molokini site is too crowded for our tastes..you see more people than fish! More fun to find your own special snorkel spot for free!! This is our third trip to Hawaii, second to Maui ( stayed in Wailea 17 years ago) and we will definately be back and will be staying at the Mahana when we do!! Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided on the Mahana for our 25th Anniversary in April 2005. We researched the internet for a month reading numerous reviews. We decided on the Mahana for its privacy and quietness. We were very pleased with our decision. We had a room on the first floor. At first I thought it would be a little noisy but it never was. You could touch the beach from our lanai. We hardly every used our A/C. The doors were almost always open listening to the waves and birds. As the other reviews have mention, the beach directly in front is not the best but a two minute walk brought us to a very nice beach which we used for swimming and snorkling. The kitchen was large and well equipped with everything a kitchen needs. The bathroom area large and always spotlessly cleaned. We always felt like we were home while at the Mahana. All-in-all, we were very happy with our unit and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Mahana- for quiet, private vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family owns two condos at the Mahana and put them in the rental pool when we are not there. We place them in the rental pool when we are not using them. I have been to the mahana too many times to count from the time I was a toddler up through a adult, and I only appreciate it more each time I go! It is not a loud resort with pool slides or organized activities- so if you are looking for that, try somewhere else. There is however excellent sunset views, and you can't get any closer to beachfront without getting in a boat :) The beach is not as large as the one down by the sheraton and black rock, but you can take nice long walks all the way down and at times you may be the only ones on your stretch of sand which is nice if you are looking for privacy. We like going for walks down to black rock and then you can hike around black rock to the sheraton beach... around black roc we have had some great snorkeling expereinces- sea turtles,,,but it can get a little crowded there sometimes. The staff at the Mahana are excellent - some of the staff has been there since I was little. They are very accomodating. One time my fiance and I ran out of gas down the road and walked back to the mahana to ask them to call us to cab to take us to get gas...the front desk person had her husband and kids bring us some gas and drive us to our car! Talk about hospitable!! We thanked them over and over and before we left we got them a card and gift certificate for a nice dinner in Lahaina. As far as things to do... Trilogy has a great all day excursion to Lanai, a nearby island - you get to snorkel in crystal clear water, then have a huge bbq lunch- then they gave you your own jeep wrangler and you caravan through some fun trails up into the mountains for some amazing panoramic views...one tip- don't wear white- the red dirt will stain it!!! ON the way back we followed a pod of dolphins and had champagne. That's my favorite tour. Another favorite we've done a few times is a kayak/snorkel from makena landing- TONS of sea turtles to swim with all times we've gone. When my fiance and I last went in september, we were the only two with our guide since that is the off season- it was amazing!! I think that one is by Ecoadventures or something. We thought the Trilogy sunset champagne sail was overrated and not worth it... We also did a horseback ride through Haleakala crater and that was definitely one of our highlights- to me that was better than the times I have gotten up at 3am to wac h the sunset on Haleakaa but you gotta do that once in your life :) Also, at least once you need to experience the road to hana - if at all possible, get a guidebook and drive yourself rather than going on a bus. My favorite guide book is Maui Revealed- it has some great tips- even for the seasoned visitor. The pool at the mahana is nothing special, but it is warm and rarely very crowded which is nice. If you are dreaming of huge resort style pool and hot tubs- Embassy suites is next door and we have used their pool several times- you can't use their waterslides unless you are a guest though... Also, we have walked down past black rock to the hyatts pool several times and swam there with the caves andd waterfalls... very cool pool- and then we caught a cab back after. My fiance and I stopped at Costco on our way to the mahana form the airport and got a ton of food - so we didn't eat out a ton- to save money- but there are some fabulous restaurants in LAhaina and right around the mahana as well at the embassy and kaanapali shores. Towards Kahana there was a really good little takeout place- Okahana Grill or something- EXCELLENT mahi mahi- we'd get takeout and then go home and put it on real plates and watch the sunset on the lanai. The mahana also has a couple of poolside bbq's which they will clan and stuff so we did that alot too. If you are looking for a luau- the best one hands down (and I've been to most of them over the years) is the Old Lahaina Luau - it's alittle pricy but well worth it- book early because it's always full- even in the off season. You can sit in chairs or traditional style on mats. It's all you can eat and all you can drink and it's all good! Be adventurous and let the bartenders mix you up some different tropical concoctions. Take a cab back to the mahana or get a designated driver :) As far as the rooms you will get and their condition- I'm really not sure- since most of them are owned by someone- decor is left to them and how they care for their unit- but all theones I've seen have looked great. Ours has a very tropical motif and many others do too. If you are considering booking the mahana- you will not regreat it. There are not a ton of kids here, probably due to the lack of kid activities and waterslides and stuff- but that is great for adults :) Families may be interested in more of a resort type property. Partiers will be disapointed too- there are places nearby- but no party mood at this property. Very quiet, peaceful, lots of couples and retirees too. This is a great place for a romantic vacation, honeymooners, getting "mauied", etc. Have fun, I don't know how you couldn't! :)

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my family and i spent 6 nights here in march /05. We had spent 3 nights in honolulu at a hotel and thought a less busy condo would be a nice change. Unfortunately we did not do enough research and did not realize how WINDY it is a kannapali . There was a small storm when we were there however we were told it is always windy where we were and we could drive up the road about 20 minutes and not have any wind. Because the pool was almost on the beach with no barrier you could not even sit by the pool. The beach itself was absolutely beautiful and we took long walks along it but you could not sunbathe or go in the water. Our room was very nice it had been renovated and was top of the line. Granite counters beautiful jaccuzi tub large walk in shower and of course the views are incredible. the suite beside us and i think above us were being renovated when we were there and workers would start hammering in the morning I suppose we could have asked to move but our suite was so nice we just put up with it but no apology or even mention of it from the desk. We have never been to hawaii and expected maui to be less busy than honolulu but that was not the case perhaps because it was just after easter but it was wall to wall people and traffic all the time. I would not return to maui if i was looking for a busy holiday i prefer honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return to the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, kids, and I loved the the Mahana. The staff were the most pleasant group of people I have ever dealt with....very accomodating and caring. The view from the all-oceanfront suites were absolutely fantastic. We saw whales from our balcony everyday. The sunsets were the best on the island, setting right between views of Lanai and Molokai. The location was also ideal....close to a grocery store and strip mall that had everything from restaurants and a rental store for all our boogie boards and snorkeling gear. With all the choices we have for places to stay in Maui, we will definetely consider the Mahana again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful condo with amazing ocean views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a spacious 2-bedroom oceanfront suite (#509) with unbelievable ocean views. We could hear the waves crashing against the shore and really enjoyed the wonderful lanai off the master bedroom and main living area. The modern ammenities were above and beyond our expectations, and we loved the excellent Ka'anapali Beach location near so many wonderful beaches and restaurants. There was even free internet access in the lobby. This was certainly Hawaiian living at its best!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to do better than the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: andyu
Reviews.Content: Very often, reviews of condominium properties will include some type of disclaimer. They caution you to consider the differences between hotels and condos, warning you that condos usually donâ€™t have the amenities of a hotel, like daily maid service, on-site restaurants, shopping, room service, and the like. The implication is that hotels are better than condos, and recommendations are typically qualified by stating something like â€œThis plaice might be a good choice if youâ€™re willing to suffer with fewer amenities.â€� Iâ€™d like to turn that warning around. Yes, hotel properties usually have more on-site amenities for dining and shopping, but that just means more people, noise and traffic. Yes, hotel properties virtually always have daily maid service, but many condo properties (like the Mahana) do as well. And the typical hotel room is just that â€“ a room. Condos units are almost always much larger and more comfortable, have more in-room amenities (like a fully-equipped kitchen), and are much cheaper. So, if you want to pay much more money, if youâ€™re going to Maui for â€œhustle and bustleâ€� rather than peace and quiet, if you prefer less space and comfort, if youâ€™re not willing to leave your property to shop or dine out (and therefore miss the variety that Maui has to offer), then by all means, choose a hotel. There are many good ones. Personally, I prefer the space, comfort, quiet, and cost of a condo. And you canâ€™t do better than the Mahana. The Mahana is located in a quiet corner of a group of properties at the north end of Kaanapali. When arriving for the first time, the access almost seems hidden â€“ you bear left from the entrance to several properties (The Embassy, the Kaanapali Shores, etc), onto an almost hidden driveway. A short distance down that drive is the Mahana parking lot. We always found ample parking available. The location is ideal, situated on the edge a complex of condos, hotels and a shopping plaza. All are in easy walking distance. There are restaurants and shops in the hotels. The shopping plaza has a number of touristy-type shops, some restaurants, and a grocery store. While all of this is not technically â€œon site,â€� most can be reached by a short walk along the beach or through the parking areas (with sidewalks in most places). The walk is typically no longer than the walk from your room to a restaurant in most large Vegas hotels. The lobby area is not gargantuan, but is spacious and attractive, with lots of wood and stone. As you enter, the reception desk is to your left, a window wall overlooking the pool and ocean is straight ahead, and an open area with couches and tables is on your right. There is wireless internet service available in the lobby, and I never had trouble getting access or finding a comfortable place to sit. There is also a tour desk off of the lobby, in the Molokai wing. Access to the two towers (Molokai to the right and Lanai to your left) is through automatic doors flanking the pool area. Like much of the architecture in Hawaii, inside flows into outside with little distinction. The pool area is between the two towers, with the lobby behind and the beach and ocean literally a few steps away. The feeling is like being in a quiet cove, right on the ocean. To one side of the pool is a sauna, and on the other side there are restrooms and very nice gas-fired grills. Between the towers and the beach are stretches of lawn, sprinkled with lounge chairs. These come together at the pool, where open-air showers and faucets are conveniently located to rinse off sand before entering the lobby or pool. The lawn areas provide a very nice place to lie in the sun â€“ the ocean is just a few yards away, and itâ€™s like being on the beach but without the sand. The grounds and facilities were beautiful and well maintained. The lobby floors and windows were always spotless, and the landscaping was well manicured. There were some pockets of renovation work going on around the property (mostly painting and stucco repairs) when we were there, but it was being done as unobtrusively as possible. Since there are no restaurants or shopping on-site, there isnâ€™t a lot of staff, but the staff we met were all friendly and nice. The daily housekeeping may not have been perfect, but it was adequate and it was done every day. The beds were made (if a bit sloppily at times), the floors vacuumed, the bathroom cleaned and towels replaced, the kitchen was cleaned and the trash removed. The air-conditioned units are roomy and well laid-out. A one-bedroom unit totals over 900 square feet, with a full master bedroom, bathroom, living room, kitchen/dining, and lanai. The floor plan is awesome. The living room has floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the ocean, with a sliding patio door leading to the lanai to one side. The bedroom is â€œbehindâ€� the lanai, also with a patio door access. This makes for a continuous field of view along the ocean side, but maintains the privacy of the bedroom from the living room. On the other side of the unit, when you walk out the entry door, you are greeted with a beautiful mountain view â€“ pretty enough to be the â€œdrawâ€� in other places, and itâ€™s just an afterthought here! Decor and furnishings are another area where the condo-vs-hotel debate heats up. Reviewers will warn you that condos are individually owned, so the individual units are furnished by the owners and therefore unpredictable. True. But thatâ€™s not necessarily bad. McDonaldâ€™s burgers are predictable wherever you may go, but the local burger joint, while unpredictable, is usually much better. My compliments to the owners of unit 408. It was beautifully decorated with sturdy, attractive, bamboo and wicker styles. The kitchen had beautiful countertops, nice cabinets and modern appliances, and was well stocked with cooking implements, dishes and cutlery. There was a nice bamboo-and-glass dining table with four swivel chairs. The living area had a comfortable couch, and two comfortable high-backed â€œbasketâ€� chairs along the windows, which swiveled to either face the windows or into the room. There was a good TV with cable, a stereo, and even a nice selection of paperbacks on the bookshelves. The bathroom was great, featuring a large walk-in tile shower with a fantastic multi-adjustable/hand-held fixture. The bedroom was nice, with a TV and a good-sized closet. My only complaint was the bed â€“ I expected a king size bed and this was a queen. I am tall and prefer a larger bed. We were traveling with another couple, who also had a 1-bedroom unit in the other tower. They had a king bed, but their shower was a standard tub with a shower curtain. The rest of the unit was comparable -- the Mahana clearly has good standards and guidelines for furnishings. We loved having the space to sprawl out. If one of us was sleepy before the other, one could go to bed and the other could watch TV, or sit on the Lanai and watch the stars. The lanai itself is the unitâ€™s best feature. It is roomy enough for a table and six chairs, and has a fantastic 180-degree view of the ocean. You can clearly see Molokai to the north and Lanai to the south, with wide-open ocean straight ahead. The water is just below you, with the soothing sounds of the waves lapping up on the shore. And best of all, we were able to watch the whales every day, in the morning and in the evening, playing in the waters nearby. The sunsets were awesome, and the nighttime stars were magnificent. These views are one way the Mahana distinguishes itself. In other condos and hotels, â€œocean-viewâ€� means that the ocean is visible from your room â€“ but how good that view is, is just the luck of the draw. No such problem at the Mahana. The architecture is such that every unit has an identical 180-degree view. I've included some pictures from the lanai with this review, but they don't do it justice. If I sound enthusiastic about the Mahana, itâ€™s only because, well, I am! Weâ€™ve stayed at resort hotels in other places, and we own a timeshare condo at Disney World, so Iâ€™m familiar with both. I also know people whoâ€™ve stayed at other condo properties in Maui, in Kaanapali, Napili and Wailea. All were good, but all things considered (especially the location and the views), I can enthusiastically recommend the Mahana. The key question in evaluating accommodations is â€œwould you stay there again?â€� For us, the question is not â€œif,â€� itâ€™s â€œwhen.â€� And the answer is â€œnot soon enough.â€�

Reviews.Title: “Sounds of the Surf.....and Whales”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Feb 6 2005 we arrived to room 303 in the Mahana. We stayed a week, each day was than the one before. the accomodations were as advertised. The staff was pleasant and efficient. A real sense of Aloha. The sound of the surf every night was great and we had no need to use the A/C. Whales could be seen from the lanai everyday. This was our 6th trip to Maui and we will stay at the Mahana again. We recommend to anyone wanting comfort,great views ,pleasant people and no need to empty your wallet. Try the Mahana ! Diane & Jim Staten Island NY Feb.2005

Reviews.Title: “Could NOT have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Haleiwagirl
Reviews.Content: I actually don't know where to start. We rented our one bedroom condo unit 117 through a private owner (--------------------). Like everyone else, I was really quite nervous about the mahana. We ususally stay in resorts, so this was a new experience. We went to the islands this time with "different eyes" as we are going to move to the islands, although we didnot end up chosing Maui. I spoke to the owner, Evie, several times, especially after reading the concerns about he noise of the construction. I always felt reassured by her. As soon as we drove up, I knew it was going to be unique and it was...the condo itself was on the first floor, which I LOVED as no matter if it was 7 in the morning or 2:00 in the morning, we just opened the french doors and walked out to walk on the beach. The condo itself had everything we needed, from foil, coffee, spices, etc. etc. All we did was purchase the food we wanted. The pool was delightful! it was always the right temperature, and quiet. I ususally started out there in the morning reading and having my coffee and then moved to the lounge chairs on the lawn. We did not have maid service, but didn't need it. I was able to wash all of our clothes and pack them, no hassle when we got home. I hesitiated about writing this, due to the fact that the unit 117 will probably be unavailable 265 days a year now. Luckily for us, we wer able to purchase a 12 week a year timeshare at Sands of Kahana.....but IF mahana had been available, wewould have chosen that. PLEASE dont be afraid to rent at the mahana. Everyone from the front desk to the landkeepers were wonderful. the lobby should be done by now and it will be beautiful. We expecially enjoyed purchasing our fish up the road and BBQing at night, sitting on our wonderful lanaim with our glass of wine eattng dinner and watching the sun go down....I can't wait till we " go to hawaii and don't look back"!

Reviews.Title: “Would Return to Mahana..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aston Mahana from November 27th to December 4th. After an 8 hour plane ride and a 45 minute ride from the airport, I was happy and pleasantly suprised that our studio condo was so nice. We weren't expecting the Ritz. We just wanted a comfortable, clean room for our 7 day stay. We got so much more - a dishwasher, a washer and dryer, a DVD player, a CD player, a great view of the ocean and 2 other islands and pleasant staff. We didn't need any more than that. The reviews made me very nervous about the condo. I really don't know what people were complaining about. We really only needed a comfortable place to lay our head which is what we got in the Mahana. If you are extremely particular about your surroundings, if you plan to stay on the property the majority of your time on the island, if you want glitz and glamour, and if you want to be in the heart of the action, then the Mahana may not be for you. If you want a quiet, comfortable place to lay your head, then definitely stay at the Mahana. The person who complained about the lack of restaurants, the lack of houskeeping and the location of the condo is so wrong. There were many restaurants in the surrounding area and 1 or 2 in walking distance. Most of the restaurants and activities were only a few minutes drive away. My husband and I saw the housekeepers a few times during our visit. We didn't really care whether our beds were made or not because "we were on vacation." We were usually gone most of the day and our room was cleaned by the time we returned. My only complaint would be that the dining table and patio table did need to be wiped more often. We never saw a roach or any other bugs in our room. We didn't hear much noise from the construction. The hotel doesn't have a nice beach, but we didn't really care because we wanted to check out as many beaches as possible while on the island. We found 2-3 other much nicer beaches only a short distance from the Mahana.I kept my swimwear on at all times just in case we bumped into a nice beach. If you don't feel like driving, there is a decent beach a short walking distance to the right of the condo. A few other suggestions: Definitely check out the Old Lahaina Luau. Reserve well in advance. We went to the Drums of the Pacific Luau. I wasn't too crazy about it. It was too packed and we missed a lot of the activities because we were the last table to eat. Don't miss the "Warren and Annabelle's" show. It was a delight. Make sure you arrive on time. The "Road to Hana" wasn't as difficult as we thought, but it is really taxing and it definitely requires the whole day. We did the back road back and though it was beautiful, I wouldn't do it again. It was a super bumpy ride with much more sharp, narrow turns than the regular road. Lastly, if you plan to cook, bring your own seasonings and foil, plastic wrap, etc. for picnic lunches. Maui is beautiful, but well overpriced!! We would definitely return to Maui and would stay at the Mahana again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon and stayed at the Mahana. After doing months of research on where to stay and reading reviews on this site, we decided we wanted a condo and a place that wasn't chaotic, so we thought this sounded like a good fit. When we got there, I was EXTREMELY impressed after reading some negative reviews that were completely inaccurate. Knowing that some of the condos were outdated, I made a point to ask if we could have an updated room. She obliged and put us in rm 712. We bought a vacation package online and paid for a studio, so I was worried about the room, but she definitely put us in an updated room! It was VERY nice with granite countertops and ceramic tile floors. We had a king bed and not that this is a priority to folks, but had high tech dvd player and radio, etc... the table and chairs were updated yet hawaiian style as it should be. The appliances and paint looked brand new (not sure if it was updated recently or what, but it looked great! Not a single bug or dirt problem whatsoever. We had shampoo/conditioner and the amenities. Yes, maid service came throughout the 8 hour day, but it didn't bother us at all as we were gone all days but one and that's why we know they came late. Falling asleep to the ocean waves was terrific! We weren't into swimming in the beaches but were more about walking along the beach. The Mahana's extremely convenient for midnight strolls. As everyone else has said, the beach is only down a ways toward the Embassy. The construction didn't affect us at all. We left every day to explore the island so we had no idea if it was noisy or not. Those who stay in and don't explore are the ones who probably get most annoyed. The lobby looks like it's going to be nice! We spent most of our time in Lahaina shopping, dining, doing sunset cruises and whale cruises. We took the road to Hana and went to the Haleakala Crater as well as took a day trip to the Island of Lanaii snorkeling and dolphin watching. We saw three pods of dolphins on that trip! They just swam with the boat! The spinner dolphins would jump out of the water a lot and it was very neat to see. We also saw a whale breach itself twice right in front of our eyes on a whale watching cruise. It was great! So, overall the Mahana was fabulous. My recommendation is to ask for an updated room right away and then you have no hassles in case you get an outdated room and want to switch. It's better to be proactive than reactive:) In addition, a side note... there really are a lot of restaurants around that area. We didn't eat at any of them as we went to Lahaina for dinner almost every night, but if you don't go out, there are several close by. I don't know where that review came from! If we go back to Maui someday, Mahana would be my first choice without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “The WOW Factor”
Reviews.Author: marcus8
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Mahana for a 10 night stay over Thanksgiving week mostly. I've studied so many of these reviews on this place so was expecting a lot. We were not dissapointed. The WOW factor of walking into the room for the first time was sensational, better than we could have imagined. It's simply beautiful as we arrived just before sunset on our first day. We had room 1004, a one bedroom condo with one bathroom. It wasn't the most modern room but very clean, pleasantly decorated and had all the amenities we could have expected plus a few more. I'll throw out a few nits that were minor annoyances overall, but worth mentioning. I had requested two separate rooms in order of preference a week prior to arriving as the agent told us to do. We arrived and they had no record of my requests nor were we given either of the two rooms I had requested despite an encouraging conversation with them over the phone. I had requested either room 1015 or 715 based upon reviews here. Nonetheless, our room was quite nice so we got over that one. Then there is the maid service. You never know when they are going to come. They would knock on our door at 9am some days, then not get there til 4pm on others. That is a bit annoying when you come back from a day at the beach and still have no towells. They even asked us what time would be a good time for them to clean the room. I told them 10 or 11am. It virutally never happened during that window. Minor nit, but again, worth noting since THEY ASKED US. The sofa bed also broke on my son one night and sloped down at the head. He just dealt with it since there apparently was nothing anyone could do with it. He slept like a rock anyways so no biggee overall. Hey, we loved this place so don't get me wrong. You just can't believe how nice it is to have the sound of those waves every night in bed. Slept like a baby. Our king bed was extremely comfy. The bedroom was a good size. We never felt cramped. We cooked up some marvelous meals in the well stocked kitchen. The lanai was large enough for meals out there over the ocean. Saw whales while eating (and other activities) on several occasions. WE loved the fact that it's removed from the hustle of Whaler's Village in Kaanipaali but still within walking distance when the woman needed to shop. I've stayed in the Whaler before and really like that as well, but this place has the advantage of having the washer dryer right in your room. What an enormous convenience! The walk between Mahana and Black Rock is gorgeous with some nice trees along the way with plenty of birds and natural life to take in. Imagine, no monster hotels along the beach walk for a change. We awoke at dawn several mornings and snorkelled black rock before breakfast. It doesn't get any better than that! We spent several days just hanging out at the hotel as it was pleasant enough to boogy board by the Embassy, snorkel and scuba dive at a couple different spots within easy walking distance, or just hang out on the beach and read a book. It's an awesome place to just relax. The construction was never an issue for us. Other days, we explored up country, did the bike trip down the volcano, scuba dove Molokini and Lanai with Ed Robinson, checked out Paia, and drove to Hana. The Mahana was a fine launching point for all our activities while secluded just enough to give us the peace we desired. We loved the Mahana and will go back in a heartbeat. I knocked off one star on the rating system just because of the minor complaints I mentioned. To me, they were all avoidable with a little effort. But they were far outweighed by the WOW factor of first walking in the room to that fab ocean vew, and the total relaxation we left the island with. Thanks Mahana!!!!

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: u114193
Reviews.Content: The place is being renovated and it needs it. The location is remote in the sense that you must drive to restaurants and any nice beaches. True, it is a condo and the idea is to save a few bucks by cooking some of your own meals, but the lack of restaurants within walkin distance was a negative for us. The daily maid service wasn't completed until 4:30 or later on 4 of the 7 days we were there. I can live with an unmade bed or make it myself, but after spending the day at the beach and in the water (remember you have to drive a nice sandy beach) you kind of look forward to clean towels to take a shower. Luckily we brought soap and shampoo as the maids never replenished these. I think the units are individually owned and ours was at the southern end of the entire complex on the second floor (219) and it did have a nice view (they all do) but it was a bit dated. The carpet looked to be 10+ years old and the refrigerator had rust on front where paint should have been. The air conditioning for the master suit and living room are shared by the same vent which means that one room is either too cold or too warm. We have traveled extensively and would not recommend the Mahana to anyone who is expecting to stay on the beach in a nice place. True, every room is ocean front, but that is the only redeeming quality.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean views at reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: TerBear
Reviews.Content: Is everyone who checks in here given the first floor room next to the elevator? Reading the reviews, that seems to be the case. We asked for another room, and were given one on the 6th floor. As others have mentioned, the rooms vary in condition and comfort. But there is a lot to be said for staying so close to the water. In addition to the whales others mentioned, we enjoyed watching the surfers/parasailers in front of the condo. Overall, I was disappointed in Maui. It was too overdeveloped and crowded. I had been to Kuaui about 5 years ago, and mistakenly thought Maui would be similar. But the Mahana made a nice base of operations, and I enjoy falling asleep to the sounds of the ocean, and waking up to the beautiful views of the same.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: Member008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mahana November 6th thru the 12th in unit 1109 with our 3 year old. We rented directly from the the owners of the unit so it was cheaper than renting directly from Aston itself. The unit is a two bedroom corner unit on the 11th floor with breathtaking views of Molokai and Lani from the master bedroom and living room and the West Maui Mountains from the other bedroom. The unit was clean, nicely decorated and had all the amenities. Even though the Mahana itself was undergoing renovations in the lobby, we weren't bothered by any noise while we were in the unit. It was a little noisy when we were using the pool in the afternoon, after returning from the beach, however we didn't let it bother us. There was only one working elevator also, but the only time we ever had to wait was the day we checked out, because the luggage cart couldn't fit with the other elevator passengers. We knew the renovations were going to take place before we went so it was expected. Everybody was right about the beach not being a swimming beach, but if you like to snorkel or boogie board, it was fine. Just about 100 yards to the right (in front of the Embassy Suites) there is a very nice beach for swimming and sunbathing (and a bar for some tropical drinks). Our daughter loved the place so much she started to call it our Maui home (I could only wish). We would recommend the Mahana to anyone who wants to avoid the expensive hotels and wants a laid back homey feeling. We wouldn't discourage anyone from going because of the renovations, it will be over soon and the lobby will look great after it is completed. Just a few suggestions: Go to Kapalua Beach Park for a day at the beach. It was our favorite beach on Maui. It is crescent shaped with some shade trees and is perfect for swimming, snorkeling and boogie boarding especially if you are going with kids. Also, take a snorkeling trip on the Four Winds II to Molokini. Even though it was very early in the season, we did get to see a humpback whale with her calf and a school of dolphins. The crew was great with all the kids on board and made sure everyone had a good time. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Aston Mahana has an incredible location, amazing views, and comfortable rooms. The location is close to shops (driving) but far enough away from any traffic that it feels a little more remote. Rooms are furnished comfortably, if a little "campy" For the money, (and we stayed in 4 different locations on 2 islands during our 2 week trip) you simply can't beat the Mahana. My wife and I are hoping to buy a unit in the Mahana should one become available that works with our budget. Of all of the places we stayed in Hawaii, we compared them all to the Mahana, and found them lacking in some way. Staff friendly, pool nice, amenities just enough. This isn't a 5 star room service kind of place. Stay elsewhere if you are looking for that. But it is like having your own apartment in Hawaii. Except, unlike other condos we stayed in, this place had DAILY maid service, that made up the place, and left more coffee for the coffee maker, more detergent and fabric softener for the washer and dryer, etc... We WILL be back, with friends, and we aren't even considering staying anywhere else this time!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views”
Reviews.Author: GiantsFan2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahana September 26-October 1, 2004. The weather was windy but still warm. We stayed in Unit 1201 - the top floor - what a gorgeous view we had--the islands of Molokai and Lanai, the beautiful ocean, a huge manta ray! The sunsets are like nowhere else! The condo was in excellent condition and was kept clean daily. Even though they were renovating the lobby, our inconvenience was minimal. One time we had to climb up 12 flights of stairs because both elevators were inoperable. But that was only a short period of time. Never happened again! The view on one side is the ocean and the bedroom view on the other is towards the mountains - both are equally fantastic! You can't go wrong with this unit!

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded our expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading every comment on this site, we stuck with our plans to go to the Mahana. It was our first time to Hawaii and we were nervous about the whole experience. The Mahana turned out to be a wonderful place. First off, it's easy to find, perfectly located, close to everything we wanted to do and see. The grounds were lush and beautiful and we never had to search for a parking spot. They were busy with the remodeling of the office but we were never bothered by any noise. The use of only one elevator in our tower made it a little slow and full but no real trouble. Our condo was a one bedroom, #307. It was updated, clean and had every comfort of home. The view was breathtaking and every morning we had coffee on the lanai and every evening we made some tropical drink to enjoy out there also. The advantage of having an icemaking refridgerator and a blender made it a breeze. The beach is as most have stated, pretty lacking unless you go up or down the beach a few hundred feet from in front of the Mahana. The staff were very friendly and informative, all went out of their way to say hello. We shopped at the Star Market across the street, the prices weren't as awful as we expected, pretty close to our not-so-big-name markets where we live. Some stuff was outrageous but overall it wasn't bad. After all, you are in paradise. We also shopped at Safeway in the Lahaina Cannery Mall, which was convenient and a little cheaper than the Star Market. We did a great deal of shopping in the ABC Stores that are everywhere. They were reasonable and nicely airconditioned..lol.. Before we were halfway through with our vacation we were planning our next vacation and planning it for the Mahana. We looked at a few of the other resorts including the ones on Kaanapali beach, none were as quiet or comfortable as the Mahana. Not once did we hear any other guests. Nor did we have any bug problems or anything else we've read negatively about the Mahana. We loved the place and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely return to the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, two sons (aged 26 and 20), and my older son's fiance just returned from our 13 day vacation in Hawaii. After visiting Oahu and the Big Island, we ended our trip by staying at the Mahana from October 22nd through November 2nd. I had made reservations at the Mahana back in January, and after doing so became somewhat uneasy after reading many unfavorable reviews. I am happy to say that we were all pleasantly surprised. One factor may have been that we rented our 2 bedroom/2 bath condo from a private owner and not from the property. It was well appointed, recently updated with tasteful decor, and very clean. Our 6th floor view was beautiful and we took advantage by drinking our morning coffee and watching sunsets on the double lanai. Since our bedroom had double sliding doors to the lanai, we fell asleep and woke up each morning to the sounds of the ocean! As stated in nearly all of the reviews, the beach is NOT a swimming beach. But, that was perfect for my family who snorkled the coral reef nearly every day! As far as the renovations, we were not told that there would be construction during our stay, but it never bothered us. I was happy to see that they were updating and making the resort more appealing. The pool, as other reviews have stated, is neither large nor elaborate......but, it was never crowded either. (There were more than enough lounges around the pool and privately arranged in the grassy area overlooking the ocean.) We spent much of our time beach hopping to other parts of the island so the size of the pool did not concern us either. The staff was very friendly and helpful to us...a concierge was also provided to help make arrangements. After pricing ocean front condos at other resorts, the Mahana is a true bargain. We vacation to escape the hustle and bustle of every day life. The Mahana truly measured up. It was uncrowded, quiet, and very relaxing. We are beginning to make plans for our return....and it will definitely include a stay at the Mahana. Only the next time, we will stay between December and April as the the Mahana would be the perfect place to whale watch from the lanai. PS if you prefer a resort with alot of extras, alot of activities, and alot of people.....you will not enjoy the Mahana.

Reviews.Title: “mahana review”
Reviews.Author: soINInTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights on 9th floor week of Oct 10th. We were warned at least 2 months in advance by travel agent they would be renovating hotel lobby. there were a few times where the noise was a bit objectionable but only during the day when most people are gone. parking was a bit tight there as well. Our room was well appointed, fairly well updated and very clean. Staff was friendly but not exceptionally so. Yes the beach in front of the hotel has lots of coral but walk 100 feet in either direction and it gets good so that is of little concern, secluded beaches are 250' to the left, a beach near as nice as kaanapali is just 125' to the right by the embassy. I felt like the room was an excellent value as they had a 1 night free deal. I dont believe we could have been right on the waters edge in a 1 bedroom condo for less money and have it be that nice. Just don't go in thinking your staying at the fairmont

Reviews.Title: “wonderful 10 days”
Reviews.Author: letramp
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Mahana at Kaanapali and can't say enough good about it. There were 6 women and we stayed in a 2/2 with a fold out. It was so roomy and comfortable for all. The afternoon sun heated up our living area, so the office staff gave us their oscillating fan for the entire time plus had someone up to service the AC within an hour. They would have let us change rooms if we had wanted. The lobby was under renoavation so by Dec "04 it should be beautiful. Just so you'll know what we found out..Snorkle at the Sheraton, use Trilogy Sail for a day trip to Lana'i(saw a pod of 300 dolphin), book a sunset cruise at the Sheraton, have dinner at the Hula Grill and attend the Old Lahaina Luau. It is expensive, but well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our visit to Hawaii visiting 3 different islands. The Mahana was a BIG disappointment. When we arrived, we were greeted with the sound and mess of construction going on. The lobby and entrance was completely torn up. Then when we checked in we were told we were not allowed to swim at the beach there because of the coral. When I booked--nooone told us that construction would be going on and I was also told that it had a swimmable beach. When we went up to our room we found it to be clean but very dated. I called the lobby and asked if there was a more updated unit and they said that there was not one available. I have to say though that the view was great and that saved our visit there. We spent early mornings and evenings on the deck watching and listening to the water and the view of Lanai and Molokai was very beautiful. We did not stick around there at all during the day as the noise from the construction was very disturbing. Also--there were two elevators and only one worked the entire time we were there. I felt that most of the staff was less than friendly or helpful with questions we had. Along with the construction happening in the lobby they must have been remodeling the unit above us and that was noisy also. It worked out ok for us as we left every day to explore the beautiful island of Maui and spent very little time there. It was nice to have a washer and dryer in the unit and the unit was a good size(we had a one bedroom). Would I stay there again----probably not!

Reviews.Title: “Aston is dated and not very clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maui. We had a great time, luckily we had friends staying at the Westin, so we were able to enjoy their hotel, as ours was dated and not very clean. good points: The The rooms were very large and included a full kitchen and laundry. bad ponts: The bed was VERY uncomfortable. the sheets, towels and blankets were scratchy and old. The bathtub had visible mildew. The couch was uncomfortable and small. The furnishings and decor very old and dated. I told my boyfrined that maybe it was not as mice as the Westin because it was so much older --- ha ha, they were built around the same time. It just goes to show you what continuous care and rennovation can do to a property.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was perfect!!! we didn't want to pay $300 a night else where so we picked the MAHANA. perfect!! we stayed last dec and we are going back thanksgiving day for 9 nights. the beach is nice you cant swim there but !!!! your on a island and ever where theres a beach so not a big deal. it was close to every thing accept my home in minnesota i will stay here every time i come to maui because its right in the middle of the road with the price and value so here u will get your moneys worth and a PERFECT VIEW FROM INSIDE THE ROOM. p.s cat lovers !!! they have cats on the grounds that are wild if your home sick for yours and there is a white and gray and we called him the big kahuna and he is very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana-we're going back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 9 day vacation trip to Maui. We stayed at the Mahana and loved it! The view is the best on the island. Every condo has an ocean front view- an entire 180 degrees of the beautiful ocean, Maui sun and neighboring islands. If you want a true vacation in paradise, your best bet is at the Mahana!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW!!!! We have never been to Maui before and this was the best experience ever. My husband and myself went there for our anniversary and I would have to say it was ten times better than our honeymoon!! We loved the Mahana. We stayed in room 409. What a beautiful room! Everything was updated. We loved how the room had all the windows from ceiling to floor. We felt like we were on a ship in the middle of the ocean. We liked the fact that all the rooms are ocean front and not ocean view which is usually all we can afford at the big name resorts. We flew almost 6,000 miles away and the last thing we wanted was ocean side view or garden view. We liked the Mahana because it was nice and quiet and it's a great place for couples or honeymooners. It's very romantic. The beach is not big and you can't really swim in the water in front of the hotel, but you can go down several yards and swim. We snorkeled everywhere. There are so many places to snorkel all over Maui. The lanai was nice and big and we had sunset dinners there. Oh yeah, we highly reccommend the Haleakala bike ride downhill for the adventurous and unscared and snorkel to Molokini crater. We also took a sunset cocktail cruise and what a difference it made on the water!!!! Also, if you have lots of money, go to Mama's Fish House in Paia. It was expensive, but worth it!! Go get some macdamia nut pancakes at the Gazebo restaurant in Napili at the Outrigger....awesome!!! We will be back to Maui and we will stay at the Mahana!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place with Awsome view!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a LOVELY trip at the Aston Mahana. This was my first time renting a condo on Maui and not staying in an actual hotel ( my other trip to Maui I stayed at the Hyatt Kaanapalli- which is absolutely amazing and left pretty high expectations for the next stay). The first night we were there they put us in a newly remodeled studio room with breath taking views, good size room and kitchen (room702). I was absolutely amazed at the view, when they say oceanview boy do they mean it! The condo's are right on the water with a couple of feet of grass leading to the sand. The balcony had a lounge chair along with table and chairs to watch the sunset from or just relax and have a nice glass of wine... You can see the island of Lani to the left and the island of Molokai to the right from any of the rooms. The second night I asked to be put on the bottom floor studio where we would then be able to just walk out the sliding door and onto the sand..( keep in mind that there in not enough room in front of the condo's to actually lay out in the sand, since the water breaks so far up, but a beach area can be accessed by walking about 300 ft in either direction). This room wasnt nearly as nice as the first room... It seemed smaller in size and was in need of some interior updating, none the less it was still nice, espically being able to just open the sliding door and walk outside. On the 5th night we were moved once again to room 305 a 1/1 (for the same price as the studio) and once again was amazed at how nice the room was as well as the views. We initally were only supposed to stay for 4 nights and extended the stay to 7 nights since it was such an awsome place. Never went to the pool area so cant really comment on it only that I've seen better and was told that there is currently no spa but there was construction going on and that a spa was being added as well as a remodeled enterance area/ check in . I hate to keep rambling so bottom line is I was very pleased with the condos and would definately stay there again! A nice quiet place with AWSOME views!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, if I go back to Maui, I'll definitely go back to Mahana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I first entered our condo at Mahana, I became speechless by the VIEW. It's as if you are on the ocean. Every room at Mahana faces the ocean. I never closed the blinds through out our stay. You can always hear the sea and the birds singing. it's wonderful. The condo we stayed in (#712) was beautifully furnished. It had been remodeled recently.Full kitchen, beautiful kitchen counters,..., everything was great. The staff at Mahana are friendly too. One other thing I loved about Mahana is that the beach right in front of it is not good for swimming, therefore it doesn't get crowded and you can enjoy the peace and quiet. If you walk for about 10 minutes alongside the beach to the south, you'll reach one of the best snorkling areas, and a few meters further down one of the best beaches and waters for swimming. If you don't want to take the walk along the beach(which is great, some times dolphins perform for you) you can take a three minute drive and park right in front of Kahekili beach park. Anyway, to cut the story short, my husband and I loved our stay at Mahana and we'll definitely go back. Oh, and before I forget, watching the sunset from your patio at Mahana is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “ROMANTIC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the greatest vacation, since my honeymoon!! In Florida. The ASTON MAHANA is very accommodating. We had a nice room 404, more like a condo, on the ocean. At night we could open the blinds and see the waves from the ocean, and also hear them. The kitchen is a full kitchen, with dishes, pots & pans, & utensils, dishcloth, and towels. There is also a dishwasher, with detergent. We went on a submarine, that was a lot of fun, to look at life deep in the ocean. The Royal Lahaina luau was great!! Hawaii is so beautiful. We are already trying to plan our next trip. There was childcare available at Kaanapali shores next door, that helped a lot, so my husband and I could have some alone time.

Reviews.Title: “Literally right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Totally loved the Mahana. Awesome views, awesome room, friendly staff. Room deco is a bit dated, but rooms were clean and well equipped. Family of four stayed in a one bedroom (#1018), had a pullout so it worked great. Pool on the smaller side, but never seemed to be crowded. At night, you can find a family of wild cats (not supposed to be fed by guests, but they're just so dang cute) and toads everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “We were not disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: Numbersdiva
Reviews.Content: The Mahana was a great value in Maui, and we were very pleased with the property. After reading so many reviews of so many condo properties before booking, I was nervous about what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was a large one bedroom, fully equipped kitchen, lots of space and well kept. While it did have seafoam green carpet and some dated looking florals for decor, all was in great condition. The appliances were newer, we had everything we needed right there. The other thing you cannot beat is that all rooms are ocean front. You can sit on your patio every morning, have a cup of coffee, and enjoy the ocean. Since there is a coral reef directly in front of the hotel, you have to go down the beach a little to play in the ocean (not very far). This keeps it very quiet outside your patio door. I would stay here again, without a doubt. The pool is small (as mentioned), BUT, we never got crowded out. We always found a patio chair and there was always room to swim and play in the pool. We noticed at the large resorts (Hyatt, etc) that the pools were very crowded with people and that the patio chairs were three deep around the pool. That was not a problem here. The trade winds are nice right in this area of the beach as well, as soon as you go south to Lahaina they are almost non-existent. The breeze keeps things very nice. The location is good, it's only about ten minutes to the main beach activities near The Whaler and a bit further to Lahaina. There is a market, an ABC Market (this is your best value for anything) and some small eating establishments right at the hotel driveway entrance. Eat at Java Jazz, the food is wonderful, and very reasonable. The service is questionable, but that seems to be consistent in Maui unless you are in a chain restaurant. The pizza place is also good (Pizza Paradiso I think), you can buy a slice or a whole pizza. Loved the Mahana though. Don't expect luxary and high end amenities, but well worth the money. Also, the Embassy Suites is right up the beach, you can eat there, get sodas, etc there for your time on the beach, and also rent boogie boards, etc. One comment, the tourists are not too friendly, at least not when we were there. The hotel staff was very friendly though, so just ignore the not so nice tourists!!!:) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Views!”
Reviews.Author: trvlmaven
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Maui and 5 great nights at the Mahana. Had a superb time. Rented the condo from a private party and saved a little bit rather than going through Aston. Condo was beautiful- one bedroom, great kitchen, and a lovely lanai- covered patio, with a ceiling fan and a shade that goes down to block out the afternoon sun. The views from the condo was unbelievable- saw a huge rainbow the first morning we were there. The beach in front was not great, but we didn't mind and we drove about 10 minutes up the road to a great beach with hardly any people. Best part of the Mahana- it was very private- hardly saw anyone else, even though the place was full. Look forward to staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “No Regrets - Mahana was the perfect place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Mahana (aug 9-17) was absolutely fabulous. The Mahana has a great location near Kaanapali but not on it. It is just north of all the crowded (and expensive) Kaanapali beach resorts, in an area called Honokowai. Being from San Diego, we wanted to get away from it all yet still be within reach of some activity. At the Mahana you are closer to Lahaina than Kahana, Kapalua or Napili. A grocery store is conveniently located nearby along with a strip mall including a video rental. The Mahana was the place for us. Peaceful, quiet, smack dab RIGHT ON THE BEACH, amazing views and ocean waves to lull you off into dreamland. We stayed in unit 1015 which was tastefully decorated and comfortable. The bedroom has a decent king size bed and the living room has a sofa/sleeper. There are two full baths and the master bath has a tiled tub. We (my boyfriend, myself and his 10 year old daughter) appreciated having 2 bathrooms All the appliances work, the AC works, the washer/dryer are great, and there is a CD player, a DVD and VCR along with a few books. The view is outstanding! We closed our drapes whenever we left for the day (the unit gets hot in the afternoon sun) and kept the doors shut with the AC on and always came back to a cool place. We used the safe every day so we didn't have to worry about hiding money or jewelry. They even have maid service! A few notes about the island and whatnot: Get the book Maui Revealed. It will become your bible while driving around and will assist you in your plans for the time you are there. We went snorkeling every day and went in the ocean 2-5 times a day. We went to all the recommended snorkeling places but right in front of the Mahana ended up being our favorite place because it wasn't crowded with tourists and you could just cruise around, looking up every now and then to keep track of where you were. Getting out there could be a problem for some, but we just walked a few yards south to airport beach (where the sand begins) and got in the water there. When we wanted to come in, we usually swam in on the north side of the Mahana because the current tends to pull you north. You just have to be careful, look where you are going and head for the Embassy (the big pink resort just north of the Mahana). They have a sandy beach also. We liked snorkeling at Black Rock in front of the Sheraton because we saw a turtle there, but it was crowded with alot of tourists. The snorkeling at Honolua Bay is good but conditional, depending upon what the wind is doing and how the weather is. The rental car is not a good place for anything valuable. We talked to people who had a vehicle break-in while they were at the beach. We were careful not to carry anything we couldn't part with and left everything else in the safe worth stealing. Going to Lahaina is a must because there are the local botiques, shave ice and the banyan tree. We went to Whaler's Village to park when we went to the Sheraton (where Black Rock is). We didn't like the shops in there - too expensive with high end shops like Tommy Bahamas which is on the mainland anyway. We liked Paia which has some of the local flavor of Maui. Kind of a trippy artsy place in a hippie kind of way. We liked the beach south of the Mahana called Kahekili Park (sp ?) with it's sandy shore, showers and grass area for a picnic. We packed lunches and cool beverages in our colapsing coolers we brought from SD. Good idea if you want to save money. We also brought our beach towels - you can dry them in the dryer at the condo. The drive through Kapalua is beautiful - check out the course if you want to play some golf. Worth the price! Windy and challenging. Go to the Nakalele blowhole up north on your way to Honolua Bay for snorkeling/sightseeing. Good day trip. The park called DT Fleming isn't worth swimming at but has a fair picnic area. Another must is the drive to Hana. Read the book Maui Revealed. You could get car sick. Just stop alot. I sure have blabbed away. Hope the info helped. We have no regrets whatsoever with this place. Yes, the other people who wrote those good reviews are really telling the truth.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mahana”
Reviews.Author: Jvord77
Reviews.Content: My two kids and I stayed 12 nights in the Mahana in room 416. It was great!! The room had a great view and was very comfortable for the three of us. The hotel staff was very pleasant and quickly solved a problem we had when the first room assigned to us did not work out. A great beach to walk on - especially going south. A highly recommended vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and unwind”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a 12 night stay in room 917 and we had a great time. The Mahana was just what we were looking for: quiet, oceanfront with a great view and a friendly, helpful staff. Our unit was one bedroom with a king-size bed and was quite nice. The kitchen was stocked with everything we needed. The washer/dryer was a huge benefit. The only minor complaint was that the couch wasn't very comfortable. But we'd stay here again with no problem or questions asked. Having the large deck and the fabulous view was just what the doctor ordered. I'd recommend the Mahana for those looking for a relaxing, quiet place to stay on this beautiful island.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: PickyTravelerWI
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 10th floor and the view was spectacular. You enter most of the rooms on the island side, and the picture windows on the opposite side give a beautiful view of the ocean. The rooms were very clean and very well equipped, including just about anything you would need in the kitchen. We didn't realize each room had its own washer/dryer and that really came in handy. The suites were spacious and we were really pleased there were 2 bathrooms! There were only two things we would have wished for improvement--some of the furniture seemed a bit dated, but still in good shape. Also, we chose this hotel because it was on the beach. It WAS on the beach; however it is not a swimming beach--too much coral--no one swam there. So don't plan to go outside the hotel and swim. However, the pool was wonderful and like being on the beach without the sand. Another nice aspect of this hotel was that even though there was no restaurant in the hotel, it was very close (driving) to a strip mall with good restaurants, grocery store, etc.

Reviews.Title: “great views, quiet ambience, we liked it..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel is that all rooms are facing the ocean....so you don't have to worry about the room location for good ocean view....secondly, we found the hotel very quiet and peaceful...there are no bar, deli etc at the entrance...hence you don't waste money there...it's an ideal place if you are ready to cook or get food from outside....

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding Ocean View / Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and 3 daughters stayed there from July 10 through July 14, in suite 319, after noticing the ac wasn't working in our 11th floor suite. The move was easily facilitated by the front desk staff. WHAT A FANTASTIC VIEW! You can go to sleep with your windows closed, AC ON, and STILL HEAR THE OCEAN WAVES! The inhouse kitchen allowed us to purchase breakfast and lunch necessities and keep our costs down to 1 big dining out meal per day! While the beach was narrow, there was great snorkeling to be had there and down the road in mckenna (please excuse the mispell and check out this snorkeling site listed in Hawaii for dummies) I recommend the hawaii Entertainment books which can be purchased for $10 a piece this time of year, since they are only good through November 1.(2 if you have a family of 4 or more) for discounts on parasailing with UFO (I saved $135), and helicopter tours of maui ( here i saved 20% on a full tour with Alex Air (best deal around) by just mentioning I had a 25% off coupon for a minitour, although, for a family of 5 it was still around $1100 but the once in a lifetime views of the falls and valleys could never be seen by road or by foot) I recommend Snorkel Bob's for snorkel gear and they even had RX masks for those with corrected vision requirements. All in all a great hotel at a great location. (If I had it to do over again, I would probably book it through Entertainment for the 50% off rack room rate of $645, rather than the unknown package rate through AAA)

Reviews.Title: “Very Quiet setting, disappointing pool but incredible view...7/8/04-7/11/04”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: These condos are perched right at the edge of the ocean! so the views were stunning!!! A sunset here is like no other! The beach is narrow and rocky directly in front of the hotel and so is devoid of people. The grounds were well maintained but not very elaborate. The pool was small and disappointing. The beach was not useable here either. This seemed like a place for an older couple not a place for us with our 2 teenage girls. The girls were disappointed that there wasn't a hot tub and that shuffleboard was their only entertainment- ha! We thought the front desk staff was great! Really helpful and friendly. We had our travel agent move us from an unsatisfactory condo to the Mahana. The front desk allowed us to pick from 4 different units. We looked at all 4. The difference between these units was HUGE! We stayed in unit 709 a 2BR/2BA corner unit which was amazing! This was the creme de la creme of these condos and looked to be recently redone. The kitchen had all the tools necessary to cook up just about anything. The master suite was great with a stackable w/d and the lanai!
