Our only complaint about this unit was the lack of good A/C and the broken dvd player. We also looked at unit 1006 and would highly recommend it! This was a 1BR/1BA so too small for us but just as nice as 709. We peeked in other units and most were really dated. I would be careful which unit you stayed in at this complex. There were several units here that I wouldn't have wanted to stay in. I'm grateful that Royal Hawaii Condos allowed us to look at the different units. They were really great to work with! We'll use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maui...what a beautiful place...went to the Mahana for our honeymoon and first trip to Hawaii...definitely all it is cracked up to be...I read all the reviews for about 9 months before we traveled to the Mahana on June 7 and almost all reviews are right on...beautiful, secluded, laid back...we stayed in rm. 213, a studio on the lanai side...room a little dated but very clean and I agree with everyone else that has posted...WHAT A VIEW...appliances new, friendly staff... the only thing that we would change about the Mahana is it is very laid back (which is good) but a little too laid back for two 23 year olds on their honeymoon...if you are going to hawaii to do some serious "chillin", then this is the place...my wife and I would have absolutely loved the mahana if it had been in the middle of kaanapali... things to do...definitely rent a car...no doubt about it...there really is too much to see and do...if you are under 25 and want to rent a car but dont want to pay the extra $25 a day (all of the big rental companies), call rainbow rentals in kahului...there cars are older but casey will set you up right...as fare as restaurants...bubba gumps-overpriced (obviously) and food not that great....dont get the shrimp pasta or the bucket o' seafood (not sure what it is called)...fun atmosphere, though...basil tomatoes...good italian food...wouldn't go there again, though...also overpriced (but what isn't in hawaii)....plantation house at kapalua bay...went for lunch one day...very good...go for lunch b/c dinner is extremely expensive....unbelievable view as well...pizza hut...got to have your pizza... we were very pleased with our trip and the mahana...would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “WaaHoo.....just what we needed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Oregon_coastal
Reviews.Content: It was everything that we were told it would be. We have been going to Maui for 28 years. We've stayed at all the "in" resorts. This one's a keeper. We are putting together a "good condo room number" list for the Mahana. And we are looking for people to write us with their reports on the Mahana condos, please include condo number and if it's a studio. one bedroom or two and the condition they/it are in. That way, when people ask, we can say if they've been upgraded or are in reasonable condition or not. We were thrilled with our room, the service, convenience, location and price. Can't go wrong with the Mahana. We will be returning in November. Can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was right! Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: belletherese
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just went to Maui on May 4th through the 9th and stayed at the Mahana the entire time. Our condo was wonderful! We stayed in 811...beautiful view every morning and evening and we even saw a whale! It was more than I expected truly. Certainly not a 5 star hotel but neat, clean and helpful staff. We decided to stay an extra night and they accomodated us beautifully! Overall, a wonderful experience. Perfect for those in search of the quiet, secluded vacation with your loved ones.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mahana May 9 to 14 and had high expectations going in because it seems every trip advisor who rates this condo gives it 5 stars. Upon arrival we were assigned a first floor room with no view and sunbathers right outside our patio. We asked to be switched to a higher floor and were told this was not possible. When we said we would just go to another hotel, a room suddenly became available. The room we got on the 5th floor was not attractive at all. Worn, broken cupboards, worn carpets and dreary wallpaper. Driving back from touring all day we both dreaded going into the room the next evening. The 2nd night when we got to our room the place was infested with bettles so we had to move at 11pm to a 12th floor room. They were actually spaying for bugs the next day so we had to vacate our room for a couple of hours then too. The 12th floor room was even more poorly furnished that the last but we tried to remain positive. The sound of the waves was nice but we found it so dark outside our patio at night we wished our room viewed the Embassy pool grounds next door instead. The final night when we came back from dinner in Kaanipali, there were 40 to 50 little bugs on our ceiling and on our bedspread, several dead from the spraying. There was no way we could sleep in there (by the way, no windows or doors were left open) but the front desk told us again there was nothing we could do but get bug spray at the store! They told us they had already moved a family because of bugs an hour before. My dear wife finally convinced the front desk that sleeping in the room was not an option so they somehow found another room for us on the 5th floor again - so we moved once more at 10pm and finally found the nicely furnished condo several trip advisor users must have stayed in. 4 days too late for us though. I've been long, but to sum up - I expect bugs in Maui but not what I saw at the Mahana. You are also taking a big chance on the quality of the rooms there. Maybe we just had bad luck but we saw 4 rooms, 1 nice, 1 ok and 2 poor. On the positive side, the pool area is nice, the place is quite tropical and the location is pretty good. However, we've seen the last of the Mahana for our lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful vacation we had. My Wife and our 6 year old son stayed hear May 6th-13th 2004. Room 1018. When we opened the door and seen the view, We were very suprised that all the reviews were correct. It was just like everyone had said BEAUTIFUL. Tastefully decorated, clean and newer appliances. We went with two of our freinds that stayed in another hotel so when it came to swimming we just went to their beach. Highly recommend this one. We are planning to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CAvwfreak
Reviews.Content: OH MY!!!! What a wonderful vacation we had. My husband and our two children stayed hear May 2nd-7th. Room 1208 is the bomb. Tastefully decorated, clean and newer appliances. The view, just as everyone has said WOW.... maybe 40ft from the water. No the swimming isn't good right off the beach there, but all you have to do is walk a few yards and there is great swimming and snorkling. Highly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Ocean Front View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I first started plannning our first trip to Maui, it started with hotel recommendations from our travel agent. The Mahana was not one of her choices. I went online myself to check out her recommendations. I found the Aston Mahana myself and the description of the hotel from Expedia sounded like just what we were looking for. I was a little nervous because I asked my travel agent about the Mahana and she had never heard of it. And she was the expert, right? I then stumbled onto the Tripadvisor website, and all of your comments confirmed that this was the place for us. If you want an ocean front room on Maui, this is the place. Our room was literally feet from the ocean. You can hear the waves from the room and the sunsets were spectacular. We did see some whales from our room as well. The staff was very accomodating. When we first checked in, they assigned us a room on the 1st floor. I told them I wanted a higher room for the view, so they told us to check out the room on the 1st floor and also gave us another room key to go check out. We decided on room 516. The views were to die for and it was a very, very nice 1 bedroom condo. Very modern. We will without a doubt be back at the Mahana. You cannot beat it for the price. It's quiet and does not have a crowded resort feel. If this is not for you, then you should stay at some overpriced resort hotel and expect to pay through the nose for a room with ocean front views. Thank you Tripadvisor and for everyone's positive comments on the Mahana!!

Reviews.Title: “Mahana: Magnificence on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Mahana. I relied on this site when choosing this place, and I'm sure glad we stayed there. All the reviews are correct. We started off in room 208 which was beautifully decorated (1 bedroom suite) but we wanted a higher up floor to see the whales better, so we moved to 1214 (top floor 1 bedroom) This suite was still nice but not nearly as nice as 208. 208 was newer, all tile floors, new appliances, dreamy comfortable big bed! 1214 had kind of dingy carpet, the wallpaper was peeling off at the bottom in several places. The bed wasn't quite as comfortable, but not bad. But all in all, we totally enjoyed the suite. We overlooked the "small imperfections". The view is amazing. We enjoyed the cable TV with all the mainland shows, satellite delayed for Hawaii time zone. You WILL see whales. Be sure and take binoculars. We were there April 17-22 which is late in the whale season and it wasn't unusual to look out and see a group of 4 at a time. Look for their blows along the water surface (kind of hard to see when there are white caps) but they will come up, maybe even a jump every now and then. We saw lots of whales. Several per day. The safeway grocery is cheaper, you sign up for a card when you check out and save a little. Expect to pay over 6 bucks for a gallon of milk! Wow! We were happy to find an Outback steakhouse in Kahana up the road a couple miles towards Kapalua. Played golf at Kapalua and it was the windiest round of golf but worth it! Beautiful! Great shape! Saw a great evening show/magic/comedy show at Warren and Annabelle's in Lahaina! Got this advice from the "Maui Revealed" book and tremendously enjoyed it! Amazing sleight of hand and comedy, along with tasty drinks and fancy appetizers! Great place, you should check it out. Drove up to Haleakala to see the crater. Amazing views of the valley between East and West Maui from up there. Just amazing! Have to do it! Didn't drive to Hana because it was too long. Did drive up the northeast side of the island past Kapalua and towards the Kahakuloa (sp?) point. Amazing photo ops. Also the nakelele blow hole. Windy here but so amazing! You can walk right down to the blowhole but be careful not to fall in! There's no sign but it's 1/2 mile past the 38 mile marker, you'll see some rounded boulders at the pull off parking area on the left side of the road. You must walk down and see it! Snorkeling at Molokini I think is over-rated. We didn't see that many fish. But it is still a fun trip. We took the morning trip from Ma'alea harbor with Pride of Maui. Great breakfast on board, BBQ lunch and open bar. approx $70 per person. I've seen more interesting snorkeling in Jamaica and Cancun. Did see some cool turtles at "turtle town", one of the stops on the snorkel trip. We chose not to swim with them though. But you could. It was fun to watch the huge sea turtles swimming around by the snorkelers. Well, I've given a lot of info. Overall, the Mahana is an amazing value for all the space you have. The grounds are beautiful, it is conveniently located. Only 15 min drive up to Kapalua and down to Lahaina town. No problem at all with parking. We came back at all times of the day, even later at night around 10 and never had a hard time finding parking. Great accomodations, wonderful views, pool is great (even heated for cool nights) some condos in better cosmetic condition than others, but still great! Accomodating, friendly staff! We will be back! I can never stay in a hotel again! This was TOO wonderful! Thank you Trip Advisor for telling me about the Mahana! I am hooked!

HotelInfo.Name: Aston Mahana at Kaanapali
HotelInfo.Address: 110 Kaanapali Shores Place, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
